review:
we need chinese. 我们需要中文。we need cloud save. 我们需要云存档。

202304，steam，steam掉卡抵扣，t a o宝，支付宝红包，humble，indie gala，daily indie game，fanatical，杉果，它处自定义包入的本体约4元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198321103770', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 12393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9012, 'last_played': 1706989041}
review:
Un 2 en 1, deux parties distinctes :
-> "Space Program" où vous gérez un centre spatial pour envoyer des landers et des rovers sur Mars. Assemblage des engins dans un lab, gestion d'un arbre de recherche... A noter une excellente encyclopédie précise de Mars (données NASA) qui se remplie au fur et à mesure de la réussite des missions (prise de photos, mesure atmosphère, analyse roches, etc...).
-> "Manned Program" où vous êtes un astronaute sur Mars, la Lune ou Europa. Gestion de récupération de ressources par minage, crafting d'éléments pour la construction d'une base. La patience est de rigueur, c un peu long à mettre en place, mais le réalisme est bien présent, difficulté de mouvement avec les combinaisons (déplacements lents), gestion de la nourriture, de la soif et surtout des tempêtes solaires (radiations) ou tempêtes de sable.
Un tuto est jouable et bien fait. On s'y croirait vraiment !... Possibilité de jouer des scénarios. A noter un excellent Editeur de missions où tout est paramétrable et ainsi décider de la difficulté de la partie.
Je vous conseille de jouer en anglais (la traduction en français pose des problèmes).
Le jeu souffre de bugs (raillés par certains sur YT) mais qui n'empêchent pas d'apprécier le jeu, surtout si on respecte les véritables conditions de mise en situation (vide spatial, apesanteur, etc...). 
Je recommande ce jeu, immersif et très réaliste, ancien et laissé à l'abandon mais qui est le "père" d' Occupy Mars" en plus simulation.
Live Long and Prosper.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982077743', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1696817753}
review:
Ah, Mars, the red planet – do you like it? Do you ever dream of exploring it like a Martian marauder? Well, buckle up, space cadets, because "Take on Mars" is here to make your Martian dreams come true!

Now, don't expect to hop in a flashy spaceship and jet off into the cosmos like a sci-fi hero. Oh no, you're in for a dose of reality here. You'll be channeling your inner NASA scientist, sending in probes and rovers like you're organizing a Martian pizza delivery. It's less "one giant leap for mankind" and more like a "one small step for your virtual career as a cosmic researcher."

Some might argue that "Take on Mars" is less of a game and more of an educational platform. It's like a digital classroom with an obsession for scientific accuracy. But hey, if dissecting the intricacies of Mars' geology and atmosphere is your jam, then this game is your personal red carpet to the stars. So, strap on your virtual space boots and prepare to "Take on Mars" like a true Martian scholar – because you're about to be the brains behind the Martian operation!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016478096', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6606, 'last_played': 1574184629}
review:
The multiplayer was a flop, but the single-player campaign is where I spent all my time. There are many hours to be found configuring (not really "building") Mars rovers/landers/probes, and piloting them on/around the red planet. Plus the atmosphere of Mars (pun intended) is great.

With the passage of 5 years and a "mixed" rating on Steam, you're sure to find it at a deep discount and it's certainly worth a look at those prices... just don't get it for the multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999072711', 'num_games_owned': 1193, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1681274421}
review:
At first I was really excited for the level of complexity and detail that this game seemed to have. Unfortunately, I quickly realized that the devs forgot to include the fun in this game.

The documentation is poor on how to progress, and I was especially frustrated by the mission indicator that just said "new technology required." Great, thank you for that...WHICH techs are required to run the mission? No idea...

And the last nail in the coffin for me was the base building. It is very frustrating when you have a base wall that you know goes in a certain place, but because you have it rotated slightly off level, it will not snap into place. I am sure I could have practiced with the clunky-as-hell controls and eventually mastered them, but that did not seem like a good time, so I quit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138344994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1693630192}
review:
ATENÇÃO: Gostar de astronomia e exploração espacial não significa que irá gostar do game!

A pegada do game é diferenciada, lenta, complexa e muitas vezes monótona. É voltada para um publico específico, que quer explorar e desvendar os mistérios de alguns locais de nosso sistema solar de uma maneira mais cientifica e lenta. Isso não o torna um game perfeito, porém, nada nesse universo é. Eu jogo diversos games com essa temática, desde Empyrion, Space Engineers até Elite Dangerous, onde a ação e exploração em um ritmo acelerado e variado é um dos elementos que movem esses títulos. Take On Mars tem uma proposta voltada para a exploração, porem de maneira lenta e fiel á nossa realidade, e acho que isso é o maior acerto do game. Ele é do tipo ame ou odeie. E eu amei esse ritmo dele, a representação fiel dos ambientes baseados em dados reais, com procedimentos e métodos reais. A exploração com Rover, vista através de suas câmeras te passa a sensação de estar controlando um Rover na superfície de Marte. Alguns reviews apontam coisas que realmente poderiam ter sido melhorados, alguns erros corrigidos, e coisas novas implementadas, porem a maioria da reviews negativas soam um pouco injustas dada a proposta dos desenvolvedores,  é como uma pessoa acostumada a Jogar Need For Speed dando uma review negativa em um simulador de corrida só porque ele não consegue fazer uma curva fechada a mais de 300 Km/h. Tenha isso em mente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048940251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1576864033}
review: Clunky with stategic game mechanics that are game breaking. I would have loved this but it's sadly just trash. You never even get so far as to put your first people on mars unless you play strictly buy FAQs and hand holding guides as you have to do exactly what is required, and in the right order, to progress correctly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116578823', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1651766865}
review: Ну что могу сказать. Обратил внимание на этот проект, так как я большой фанат всяких космосимов и плюс игра от bohemia interactive, что не могло не радовать. В целом-на любителя, но с большими оговорками. Неплохая задумка, очень классно сделано взаимодействие с объектами в мире, атмосфера выживания на марсе,тоже сделана неплохо, но все же минусов и игры много. Управление в стиле Bohemia Interactive-топорное, ощущение будто я управляю утюгом, а не человеком. Я конечно понимаю, что скафандр - достаточно тяжелая штука, но проблему усугубляет еще не самое удобное управление, в котором черт ногу сломит и очень сомнительная оптимизация. Прибавьте к этому-крайне медленный геймплей и получится достаточно душная игра, с задатками на что-то интересное. Если вы - фанат космосимов, неспешного геймплея и вам просто нравится атмосфера одиночества на безлюдной планете - то эта игра вам может и понравится, ну а так - не советую все же играть в нее, есть и куда более интересные проекты.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996336996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7451, 'last_played': 1706349616}
review:
Très déçu que le jeu soit axé encore une fois sur la survie.
Perso je préfère largement le mode robotic mais le jeu à fait un plantage et j'ai perdu mes sauvegardes. J'ai recommencé, mais faire de l'argent pour pouvoir améliorer et construire de nouveaux robots est une vraie galère, d'où mon abandon.

Sinon oui, le mode robotic est vraiment magnifique, j'adore parcourir Mars, même à vitesse très lente, analyser, photographier, sonder, c'est vraiment agréable comme jeu.

Dernier bémol : pas de traduction française.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059607766', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1879, 'last_played': 1669583499}
review:
Je to Bohemia Interactive hra z roku 2013.. konec..
Né teď vážně.. pokud máte rádi "Moonbase Alpha" s tím, že jste tu hajzlovinu opustily protože to byla míň jak Alpha verze hry.. tak se vám tohle bude líbit. Osobně už hraji přes 20 hodin svůj scenario který jsem si vytvořil, a jsem spokojený (ve smyslu.. baví mě to dost na to, abych u toho vydržel přes 20 hodin). Do budoucnosti bych chtěl vytvořit ještě lepší scenarios, a uvidím jestli to budu hrát i s přátely. Sice bugy bugy, glitche, nedodělávky, a performace issues zde přítomny.. Bohemka no.. Ale i tak.. po takřka 10-ti letech, nejlepší (spíš nejzábavnější) hra v tomto žánru (pro mě).. což je sakra smutný vzhledem k tomu, v jakém stavu hra je.. I tak.. dokážu to doporučit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240353992', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 14437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6602, 'last_played': 1701753120}
review:
LETS DIVE DEEP INTO WHAT THIS GAME IS GOOD FOR AND WHY YOU SHOULD GET IT
=====================================================================
((scroll for the section that is most important to you))

In 2022, going into 2023, waiting for Occupy Mars: The Game to arrive, I discovered this oldie but honestly, goodie.
This is game resembles EVE ONLINE, in complexity only. Yet, when you figure out what you need to figure out ( HIGHLY RECOMMEND GOING THROUGH THE TRAINING MISSIONS FIRST BEFORE ALL OTHER MISSIONS OR MP), then this game literally becomes easy and you realize there is only one main objective to this game. Resource Gathering. 2nd objective, build a bigger and better 3D printer until you cant print everything which, spoiler alert, you have to do in reasonable stages and multiple reconstructs.

PRICE
=====
So with that said, let's first talk about price. @ $27, for a 2017 game, isn't bad, and for what this game is.. BUT, I truly would wait for the steam sale for $5.50. Unless you actually love challenging your brain, and having to perform calculations in your head for success. This comes down to resource management and planning your next effective step of survival.

CONCEPT
========
What Microsoft Flight *(piloting)SIMULATOR* is to Aircraft, Take On Mars *(survival)SIMULATOR* is to Space.
All tools available are real world NASA/SPACEX/OTHERCOUNTRY technology. Their performance, again is based off realistic numbers. THE REAL world MMRTG produces only a few hundred watts of power. 

IMMERSION
==========

PHYSICS. THIS GAME HAS AWESOME PHYSICS AND LOWER GRAVITY HANDLING!!
And yes, if you drag that power cable behind you but are looking forward, as some people complain about, you can get slung several feet in front of you and slip and slide and break something you'd rather not want to break.  SOLUTION?? Just walk carefully.. you get a speed boost that is more controllable. Might be a bug, but... if you enjoy challenging your brain, this is a work around and or exploit of the physic. Whatever. Your character will auto hop over cables laying on the ground though. 

THE BAD IMMERSION
Well, for the life of me, i couldnt figure out WHY in the hell o2 would get sucked up in a POPTENT and the MAV Lander would come with 3500 units of o2 and after 1 day of going in and out of the lander, pressurizing and depressurizing the airlocks, that i'd still have my lovely 3500 units of o2 and yet when i turn the facet on to drink water i consume it directly, effectively reducing my 3500 units of water. lol. IMMERSION KILLERRRRR.

THE LANDING FOR MP
Bad IMMERSION HERE. First two times I started. I died at least 3 times, as it spawns you inside the Ascent Rocket, which has a control panel for itself, but doesn't do much for the lander except transfer of fuels, and you really dont know what is going on. UNTIL YOU FIND THE CRACK IN THE BAY. I usually get up outta the seat, and smash my helmet, and I'm like, well WTFF here guys. Well, you don't HEAR IT, but you're landing, literally, through the atmosphere. You can actually SEE this through the crack. Just wait for the little jolt of the screen. Then get up. Or about 40-60 seconds from spawn in.



PERFORMANCE
=============
This is a 2017 game, and people complain about the lag of it. THIS GAME ISN'T REALLY LAGGY.
But because it simulates the physics heavily, it somehow creates its own lag by doing so.
I usually game on my 55' LG C1, with 120hz and 4k hdr, at 1440p for the auto kick-in of HDR as playing at 4k somehow turns it off (prob because RTX 2060 SUPER is HDMI 2.0 and not 2.1 so I'm limited on bandwidth).
The LIGHTING definitely HITS the performance. 
I RECOMMEND Putting all setting to low, and bumping up certain ones individually.
GEOMETRY - You can max out easy to right.
TEXTURE DETAIL - You can put a quarter or midway depending.
LIGHTING - LEAVE THIS ALL THE WAY LEFT. Don't EVEN. 2060 super can't even handle this up.  Maybe with a 3000 series RTX.  OR 1080P resolution. Depending on your screen size.

LAST Most IMPORTANT Setting
PHYSICS SIMULATION
FOR THE LIFE OF ME, LOL, AUTO SUCKS, AND SO DOES ANYOTHER SETTING OTHER THAN 60 HZ. THIS is the 2nd biggest lag inputter setting. Unless maybe you have that ryzen  threadripper (im guessing more cpu is better for physics?).
I bought this game for some friends at the $5 price, and they noticed substantial playability improvement with this turned to 60 hz. 

PATIENCE
========
This game IS a SPACE SIM.
Nothing is supposed to be easy. Resource Management will be key to your survival. But above all, nothing can happen IN SPACE without POWER. You basically build an effective refinery operation. And then the fun begins. 
But also, you have to relocate yourself to different sectors to mine effectively. 
And in order to see how effective you are, you DO have to sample the area.

SOLO VS TEAM
============
SOLO HEAVEN, lonely but effective. 
TEAM PLAY, you'll always be limited based on power consumption, so most people will run out of things to do. But it definitely makes things easier. But overall, this game is alot of fun with team mates.
MP -- Barely any servers or players, just run your own server and invite your friends,
WHAT YOUR FRIENDS WILL THINK --- BORRRRINNG (unless you got those like minded individuals whom love a challenge)

That's all i got for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021430965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2033, 'last_played': 1669232780}
review:
Extremely buggy, needed to try to create multiplayer server 11 times before I was happy.
Landers vehicle bay ramp would not open or had a rock under it...
Lander passing through radiation so I got sick and died before doing anything.

This should never have been released as V1, its unfinished and it feels like it, I gave it a good try.   The shower and kitchen are obvious half baked ideas.  The shower should at least take some radiation off, radiation pills or the like.  All machines take kW to run, but power generators are woefully under powered.  Space suits get damaged for no reason, vehicles are way to easy to flip.  The power cables....... dont get me started on the F-king power cables.

This is worth maybe €3, not over €20!  The game is no longer being updated and the developers have gone silent.  So apart from the mods made by the community there is no hope of the game being finished.

So played for a fair few more hours and I can say that mining is terribly painful.  I am sure there are mods out there that address many issues.  I found myself constantly scrounging for aluminium which you can only get from rock, then you get 3 canisters of rock and barely get 1.5 canisters of aluminium.   Factoring the time it takes to get the rock its very frustrating.  Also, fuel in vehicles consumes very very fast, like the cargo truck.  Its range is terrible 3.8km or something and its painfully slow.  Bits break off and you can't re-attach them.  There is no way to store canisters full of resources, so they just roll all over the place.  There should be holders for them or at least be able to print a box to put them in (I know there is a mod for this).  Power is silly too.  Large rock drill takes something like 3.5kW and the MMRTG produces 300W.  Thats a stupid number of RTGs needed.  So you are constantly waiting on charge to accumulate.   Suits are way to delicate, I smashed my helmet just waling between the buggy and my 3D printer.  Many items that you print require mind numbing resources.

I would like to have been able to review this to positive, but sadly I cant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066288187', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 33210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33210, 'last_played': 1655500332}
review: Take on Mars é um maravilhoso simulador de como seria a ida e sobrevivência em Marte, o problema é que a Bohemia (desenvolvedora do jogo) abandono o mesmo, antes da equipe de desenvolvimento ter terminado a programação que deixa estável o multiplayer, ou seja é um jogo MP mas que deve ser jogado como SinglePlayer, se vc aceitar isso e jogar Solo então esta tudo bem vc terá uma ótima experiência, alguns mods podem ser necessários, como o mod em que quando vc deita e acorda amanhece o dia (minecraft style) e outro mod é para fazer os recursos serem mais abundantes, a parte de mineração do jogo para quem vai jogar solo é pesada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391856094', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1664733402}
review:
TAKE ON BUG
Tak tu máme opět další počin od českých vývojářů bez originálního českého překladu na který se z vysoka vysrali a nechali tak pěkný survival na pospas moderům. Já se ptám proč? 
Jak můžu doporučit hru která není ani po 5 letech opravená?! Vše bych tak nějak překousl - např. zvedání věcí které mají tendenci se bugovat do země a poskakovat, bugování skrz stan kdy Vám hlava projde vrchem a Vy se udusíte, jízda náklaďákem je jako by Vám 20 lidí bušelo kladivy do auta. Bugy jsem s velkým sebezapřením překousl u DayZ který se také drží nad vodou jenom díky moderům ale ty crashe u TKOM při ukládání hry jsou ABSOLUTNĚ FLUSTRUJÍCÍ(ano píšu capslockem poněvadž jsem neuvěřitelně nasranej) když ztratíte 3 hodiny hledání, nošení, ježdění a kompletování zásob a přístrojů nemůžete být nic jiného než NEUVĚŘITELNĚ NASRANEJ!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198391605862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1686259740}
review: I got this game a while back on sale but never really played it as I had a huge backlog of games already that I was playing, I recently got into this game after playing countless hours of KSP, and after almost 24 hours of playtime I have to say i'm really enjoying this game, the Robotics part of the game I haven't played too much with cause I got bored of launching probes onto Mars and ran out of money quickly, however the Manned mission part is really fun and the fact they have other locations not just Mars makes the story more interesting. Actually can't wait to play Multiplayer with friends, if we can eventually learn all the basics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155658651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 892, 'playtime_at_review': 14153, 'last_played': 1710756589}

author: {'steamid': '76561199223051104', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1662945409}
review:
Sometimes you find a hidden gem of a game in Early Access. Take On Mars is NOT one of those. There's no game here! Just a partial tutorial, a non-savable multiplayer option where there are no players, and a few limited scenarios that are barely playable.

I pushed through 6 hours to see if there was something I was missing, but it's a big NOTHING burger! Don't waste your money. Luckily I got it on sale.

I accept a certain level of responsibility for buying an "Early Access" game, but this isn't even a game.

Enough is enough! Steam, STOP allowing developers to release "Early Access" games with any price tag above $0.00  

We as a community of gamers are NO BETTER! We need to STOP supporting ALL "Early Access" game sales! All we are doing is rewarding and encouraging more half complete and unplayable games, with developers pocketing our cash and never looking back.

review: I really want to like this game but I just can't, whether it be the poorly introduced controls or the extremely repetative missions which have to be done one by one manually going in and out of the probes using the space station. This game could use so many quality of life upgrades that would hardly impact realism and make it a great simulation game, but right now I am just not having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194008506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7878, 'last_played': 1656165636}
review:
(Перевод данного обзора на русский язык смотри после английского текста)

One of the most realistic Mars exploration simulators I have ever seen. There is no fantastic technique or technology here that boggles the imagination with its extraordinary capabilities. But on the other hand, almost all the equipment in the game resembles the one that we saw in real life and which is familiar to us. For example, a four-wheeled rover, on which you can move around the surface of Mars, is very similar to the lunar car, on which American astronauts surfed the surface of the Moon. And this attention of the developers to the details, to the realism of what is happening and to the reliability from a scientific point of view, in my opinion is very important if we are talking about what a real Mars exploration simulator should be like. And in this game, all these moments are on top. It is also worth noting the accuracy in the transfer of the real Martian landscape. In the sandy soil, for example, relief inclusions of stones are visible, and the edges of known craters destroyed by erosion look almost like in a photograph. Of course, the graphics in the game are already outdated in relation to 2022, but this does not greatly affect the feeling of the game, since in my opinion there are much more pluses in it. Thanks to the developers for a quality and wholeheartedly made game that can give you an extraordinary experience and a sense of space travel!

Один из наиболее реалистичных и приближенных к реальности симуляторов освоения Марса из всех, которые мне приходилось видеть. Здесь нет какой-либо фантастической техники или технологий, поражающих воображение своими необычайными возможностями. Но зато почти вся техника в игре напоминает ту, которую мы видели в реальной жизни и которая нам хорошо знакома. Например четырёхколёсный марсоход, на котором вы можете передвигаться по поверхности Марса очень напоминает лунный автомобиль, на котором американские астронавты бороздили поверхность Луны. И это внимание разработчиков к деталям, к реалистичности происходящего и к достоверности с научной точки зрения, на мой взгляд очень важно, если мы говорим о том, каким должен быть настоящий симулятор освоения Марса. И в этой игре все эти моменты на высоте. Стоит также отметить точность в передаче настоящего марсианского ландшафта. В песчаном грунте например видны рельефные вкрапления камней, а разрушенные эрозией края известных кратеров выглядят почти как на фотографии. Конечно графика в игре по отношению к 2022 году уже устарела, но это сильно не влияет на ощущение от игры, так как плюсов на мой взгляд в ней намного больше. Спасибо разработчикам за качественную и от всей души сделанную игру, которая может подарить вам необыкновенный опыт и ощущение космических путешествий!

author: {'steamid': '76561198172334479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2709, 'last_played': 1703540635}
review: Mir gefällt das Spiel eigentlich sehr gut, wobei mich hauptsächlich die Manned Missions angezogen haben. Der Support für das Spiel wurde allerdings eingestellt und bei der letzten Mission der Kampagne stürzt das Spiel ab einem gewissen Zeitpunkt in immer kürzeren Abständen ab. Der einzig bekannte "Fix" ist, nach einer ÄLTEREN funktionierenden Version der Grafiktreiber zu suchen. Das ist schon bei älteren Grafikkarten eine sehr unerfreuliche Aufgabe, bei neuen Grafikkarten die erst nach dem letzten Spielupdate rauskamen aber natürlich so gut wie unmöglich. Deshalb kann ich das Spiel leider nicht empfehlen.

review:
Gra jest toporna, niedokończona, bardzo krótka fabuła. Możliwość zrobienia jakichś scenariuszy, ale to nie to samo, co możliwość stworzenia własnej bazy na marsie. Do tego dochodzi ciągłe bieganie od punktu A do punktu B - jeśli komuś podoba się trzymanie wcisniętych dwóch klawiszy przez 5 minut, żeby biec w jakimś kierunku za przesyłką, to ok, ale dla mnie to bardzo monotonna gra. NIE POLECAM!

Po kolejnych 10 godzinach gry stwierdzam, że gra jest jeszcze bardziej beznadziejna. Żałuję wydanych pieniędzy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866615216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1648879664}
review: I recommend this game with a condition included.  If you're a hardcore crafting type gamer that enjoys the challenges of a "as close to real life as possible" type grinding.  I enjoy the detail of the game and all the crafting of items but I also have limited time so typically I'm looking more for something that is a faster gather/craft type game saving more time for exploring and adventuring.  I've only gone through the tutorials and played for about 30 or so minutes more so it requires some patience and strong desire to the details of what tools you'd need to build and use if you were really on mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049243982', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 13141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13141, 'last_played': 1511273565}
review:
this game makes me sad.

initially, i had high hopes for this game. the dev seemed competent, but got overambitious.
you see, in the beginning this was just a mars rover simulator, but after a while, the devs tried to add a manned colony aspect to the game. and at first it was GREAT! fun building system, good survival aspects, great usage of the physics engine and totally immersive with how you interact with everything, a truly groundbreaking survival experience!

heck, you even FELT wearing a suit!

combine that with an awesome modding comunity with some really talented modders, and this used to be my favourite game!

sadly, this game was riddled with bugs, especially in the physics department, and the performance was total crap. and since those problems were due to engine limitations, the devs couldn't fix them, and in the end, they abandoned this gem of a game due to lack of funding.

you see, the devs were a subset of bohemia interactive, the guys behind ArmA, and as such the dev team received funding from their corporate bosses, not the profits from this game. and at some point some manager above said "aight, this game is now bleeding money. we just cut funding and move on to the next.", which is a shame, since the original devs of this game were REALLY enthusiastic about this game!

so now it sits in development hell, a shadow of what it once could have been, and i still long for a survival game wit hthe exact same mechanics as this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199085241414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1639721618}
review:
A very fun and relaxing game full of planning and most importantly being efficient. If you like planning games or games where you really have to take some time to think rather than just go for it, you will like this. It can get a little repetitive at some points but not too much. 
The game has 2 ways to play, human exploration and robotic exploration. 
Human exploration is pretty simple... kinda, you go on a mars mission as a human. This mode was modeled after the book The Martian. You take the role as an astronaut named Mark Willis and well basically lose communication with earth...

Overall would recommend to players who like simulators.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972655885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7963, 'last_played': 1644567631}
review:
Лучший космический симулятор, из всех что есть даже на 2022 год, хоть и прошло 5 лет с релиза.
Стать мега популярной ей не дала плохая оптимизация, фпс проседает, но что более важно это сетевой код в коопе.
Выживач в этой игре в коопе, это лучшее что я видел в сетевой игре, особенно если напарник(и) не идиоты.
Очень жаль что игру, не совсем додела Богемия, да и продолжение игры не приходится ждать, что очень огорчает. Ocupy Mars отдыхает.

author: {'steamid': '76561199170846476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2764, 'last_played': 1641137687}
review: Задумка была очень хорошая. Хорошая физика в игре, графика тоже на высоте. Если бы игру доделали - то это был бы шедевр ! Но ! Игру не доделали, сплошные глюки , можно пройти первую миссию компании без особых глюков и пролагов. Но вторая миссия (продолжение первой) сплошной глюк , играть невозможно. Дополнительные миссии - сплошное разочарование . И некоторые из них "багуют" комп в целом - приходится перезагружать комп ... Как всегда -  хорошо начали и хреново закончили . Игра стоит своих пары сотен рублей - первая миссия - хорошая выживалочка !!! Только ради нее можно купить эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198430487400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1701528072}
review:
Dies ist ein sehr gutes Spiel, welches dem Spieler sehr viele Möglichkeiten gibt, seine Phantasie umzusetzen. Man darf das Spiel nicht als Spiel sehen, sondern viel mehr als realitätsnahe Simulation in einer gut gemachten Sandbox. Sehr interessant finde ich die reale Zeit unterschiede zwischen Erde und Mars. (Im Spiel kann es so spät sein wie in echt und auf der Marsoberfläche spielt man dann zur der jetzigen echten Tageszeit wie sie gegenwärtig auf  dem Mars ist.) Desweiteren gibt es mehrere Maps mit echten Schauplätzen (z.B. dem "Gesicht auf dem Mars" :), einige echte Landeplätze diverser realer Rover (sowohl auf dem Mars wie auch auf dem Mond) ) . Die beinhalteten Missionen sind eigentlich eher nur um zu zeigen, was möglich ist. Durch eigene Szenarien, kann man selber viele Situationen durch simulieren oder nach"spielen".
Sowohl auf dem Mars, dem Mond wie auch auf der ISS. Und dann kommen noch die ganzen Addons und so dazu.

This is a very good game, which gives the player a lot of possibilities to implement his imagination. You shouldn't see the game as a game, but much more as a realistic simulation in a well-made sandbox. I find the real time differences between Earth and Mars very interesting. (In the game it can be as late as in real life and on the surface of Mars you play at the current real time of day as it is currently on Mars.) There are also several maps with real locations (e.g. the "face on Mars": ), some real landing sites of various real rovers (both on Mars and on the moon)). The missions included are actually just to show what's possible. With your own scenarios you can simulate or "play" many situations yourself.
Both on Mars, the moon and on the ISS. And then there are all the addons and such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063808309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21193, 'last_played': 1541040824}
review:
I agree with those negative reviews that expressed hope but, ultimately, disappointment. Its' been years now since this game received any attention from the developers so I have no expectation it will ever reach a finished state.

I played this game a lot and had a good time but was never able to finish it due to crashing bugs that I experienced when I reached a certain point in the campaign. I no longer have the desire to keep trying.

This is a very relaxed game. The rovers don't move very fast so you have to be the kind of person that doesn't mind waiting possibly several minutes for the rover to reach its destination to perform the next task of the mission. You get paid for completing missions which gives you the funds necessary to advance in the tech tree. Those advances give you better equipment and functionality to take on more complex, and thus higher-paying, missions.

It's currently on sale, 80% off. At that price point, it's probably worth it, even in its unfinished state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030236846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 45566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3530, 'last_played': 1697043828}
review:
Great game. Beautiful graphics, story and interaction.
Played through a great part of the robotics campaign and the entire manned missions.
The manned campaign is really good. I liked the buildup, atmosphere, voice acting and the level of guidance.
This game has much of what i like in survival games. Mars, resources, power, oxygen, etc.
It was much better than what I expected after reading some bad publicity. Apart from a few crashes - from which i could easily reload - i found no bugs. 
Some of the work in the game could be found tedious for players than want fast action. Long rover travels and lots of mining, transport and construction.
As for me, I don't mind to do some 'work' in order to fully immerse in a game. 
Now I will continue playing and try some of the custom scenarios on Steam.

Update: started modding and created a PHEV buggy and a new way of mining resources. Totally addicted to this beautiful game. I like the grind and the scarcity of resources and power, as well as optimizing the UI and modding. Also the scenario Editor is a beautiful item to set up a right type of game.

Update2: Added new resource,s tools and scenario. SETL Cydonia Mensae SP is a balanced scenario with all the new stuff. Gusev Antenna is another scenario with new content for mining and repair.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155561067', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1623274032}
review:
This game is like a well-planned cruel joke. Time management is pathetic and you can find yourself without any autosaves after playing for 10 hours. Do you know what goes great with ridiculous autosaving system? I do; constant crashes or unavoidable freezing, resulting in a forced shut down, with no reason at all. Anything can be a reason to lose your progress.

This game, pathetically, does not keep running on background even if it's windowed. I've seen many posts asking for a fix but it's still not happening and it's obvious that it won't happen ever. I know that it won't happen because the game is abandoned by devs for good.

I have 6 hours officially and over 15 hours unofficially and I haven't got past the small rover stage because the game will freeze to death for no reason and my entire save is gone if I hadn't saved manually, due to the ludicrous autosave system. The worst part: I've spent so many hours restarting from the very beginning that I won't be able to refund this unfinished joke of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058955004', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1650925838}
review:
decent early-access game, not ready to be released (full of bugs)
1. the tasks sometimes say RAD or EAS, but even if you have RAD you cannot complete it.
2. if you are landing a rover near edge of the map hope to land in the map or have a safe file not too long ago :) 
3. the rover with solar panel doesn't charge when you're skipping time aka. leaving it on the sun for two days
3b. it would be nice if you can have the game opened with another window (let the rover recharge while you're browsing what to get for dinner
4. the manned part is unplayable... 20kg things just fly around when you touch them with anything, buggy loaded with four 20kg containers is behaving as it would weight nothing (100kg should be stable even on moon)
now for positives:
-when on sale it doesn't cost much
-game you don't need too much brain activity
-it's a cool concept, just need work

author: {'steamid': '76561197992208140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1622293380}
review:
However much I like simulation games, I've given this a good shot, but this is not a game, it's torture. Somehow the developers have completely lost the idea that a game should be fun along the way. 

Examples of bad design:
1. Rovers are _extremely_ slow, time warp does not exist, and waypoints etc. cannot be set automated.
2. Grind! You'll have to do _several_ 'repeat' missions to save up enough money for the next step in the tech tree (and see #1)

Once you've had your fill of the rover-grind, you 'restart' the game into human exploration mode and you enter into a save-scumming scenario in which you'll _guaranteed_ be frustrated as hell having to save-load 10+ times to find stuff in time etc. Horrible design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028652622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1703238932}

author: {'steamid': '76561198297005260', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1565194264}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998718478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 77169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6258, 'last_played': 1701070693}
review:
I am really torn on this game. On the one hand, it is a buggy mess. The physics in use is not uned well at all making things explode without warning. Hitting a Cargo truck ladder, for instance tears the retractable side stairs off and can't be repaired. Turning fast while holding a spare space suit can send everything not tied down flying in random directions. The game does however have some incredible game systems, that would have made gameplay absolutely incredible. 

The game looks like the crafting experience was intended to be modular. Habitat building and the 3D printer are the core of it.  You gat a 3D printer that can print items from raw elements, but only small items. What is unique and incredible is you can then use it to make a modular 3D printer able to print items at any scale. The largest item is the giagantic Mobile Labratory Rover.  Had this modular concept been carried through to include designing, saving, and publishing the printable items themselves, it would have offered limitless varied emergent gameplay.  For example, the resource processing refineries could have been player designed and built using combinations of modules impacting the performance of the refinery as well as the look, size and output characteristics. 

It can be confounding to get the game into a sandbox for single Player. The game auto saves on objective completion in scenarios only. A timed autosave is nowhere to be found resulting in hours of work lost after a physics glitch sends you supermaning  helmet glass first into the rocky ground.  !!!!Warning!!!! :  Don't run while holding electrical cables!!! 
Death leaves you seemingly stuck waiting for a respawn or load from previous save option. There is no instruction and you have to manually load a previous save from the ESC menu. 

QoL UI options are non-existant. Most games will implement the ESC key contextually, meaning if you have a open secondary window like the map or Inventory, ESC will close them successively before bringing up the game menu.  ESC is the only key that can close the 3D printer menu, but you have to exit other UI sub-menus with E or I. Making muscle memory for efficent gameplay, very frustrating.  

The research and tech trees only apply to campaigns and scenarios. in a sandbox start they have no function. You start with the basic (2 massive cargo containers) items to build everything and have no progressive tech or science progression. 
If the game hadn't been abandoned, the Modding community wouldn't also be a ghost town. 

If this were my project, I would have implemented a voxel based terrain system with better resource collection (different types of rock, water extraction through permafrost and Ice...), science and tech progression, reparable vehicles and items, cargo tie downs, scrap and recycling systems, waste management and processing, economy through a reachable Mars orbital station, and a full ECS allowing player created items to have capabilities and stats based on the source elements and components used in production. For example, having a materials choice in making a refinery could allow lighter carbon composite materials at the cost of being able to refine only low temperature non metal resources.  Adding some Factory game elements would result in the players creating various mining and production facilities tailored to making large constructions. 

None of this will come to pass however. Playing the game makes me feel sad that it will never reach its potential. I don't recommend this game for anything more than casual play for the average gamer. However, any indie developers should definitely spend at least 30 hours playing. It is a great example of brilliant and bad design rolled up into a single unfinished package.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973598382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 12689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6984, 'last_played': 1621901396}
review:
I would avoid this one.

It was never finished for a start, the technical and performance issues are a significant problem regardless of your computer specs, the recommended requirements are meaningless when an RTX and 8 core CPU struggles with 10FPS, it clearly never has and never will get any optimisation patches, the fact its still on sale in this state is pretty shocking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008179871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1884, 'last_played': 1537888378}

author: {'steamid': '76561199109276032', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1620676306}
review:
非常棒的一款游戏。适合喜欢星球探索的朋友。游戏的节奏非常慢，因为做得非常真实，不管是时间的设计还是各种物体的速度。缺点就是着陆的时候好像火焰喷射的效果有点bug。推荐给喜欢宇宙的朋友！
不建议喜欢快节奏的玩家购买，你会觉得非！常！无！聊！
===========================================
Very good game! Best for space nerds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061982501', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 53371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53371, 'last_played': 1565681409}
review:
This game is not for everyone, IMHO it has a limited audience but would really benefit from going VR (/shrug).

The "missions" in the game feel like they were written for the types of persons who would sit down at a party and sort the chex-mix into different bowls.  There are no pointers or hints for some goals, and when you can figure them out in most cases  they are not worth attempting.

I put the game in DEV mode (sandbox) and actually started having fun - there are certainly some mods you must have (as I've never figured out the stock cable stuff to make things work).  You will also still die (last time I attempted it) if you setup a single habitat and a plant room with an air-lock (instead of exchanging the air types, it pulls a vacuum and kills you (even if you leave the door's open (bugged)).
Item placement is horrible and will take you forever to figure out; but once you have it down its not as bad.
making everything work is also not that clear, and  you will have to experiment with a lot (keep backup saves).

author: {'steamid': '76561198116653389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1384, 'last_played': 1617426543}
review:
Люди хотят бомбить алтис в арме, по этому богемия перенаправила бюджет в другие проекты.

Плюсы:
+Идея
+Можно строить свои дома как в майнкрафте
+Модификации сообщества

Минусы:
-Можно было добавить миссии за людей на орбите.
-Будете играть, пока вас не застанет нехватка 1-го миллиарда на большой ровер, который может окупить себя и прибавить ещё 10 миллиардов. А назад уже не повернуть, если начать сначала, то снова будете страдать катаясь на маленьком ровере 2 часа на задание патамушто посадочная пирамидка укатилась в кратер, а из него не выедешь за 5-6 падений. А затем вы увидите, что забыли сохраниться и начнёте играть во вторую главу где немножко подохнете раза два в начале.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057458824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2230, 'last_played': 1673301606}
review:
NOTE: Reviewing the manned gameplay, not the robotics (although I could be convinced to try it)

+ Great Survival Potential, Immersive & Atmospheric (not literally though lul), Co-op is fun.
- Not good enough tutorials, tough to learn, will not consistently run smoothly unless turning down physics simulation (which is a nice-to-have)

Survival & Building: It's got a really good foundation and now I'm searching for games similar to this because I want that itch to be scratched more fully. It's just a shame that it took so much time to really adequately learn all the ins and outs. Because of the meh-quality tutorials that are there and the plentiful that aren't there but should be, it took me a good 8+ hrs to really start to get the hang of it and even then I thought it was buggy in places where I simply didn't understand how everything works. If there's any major gameplay complaint (after learning how the game works), it's that there's not enough to do after you've done the campaign for the manned missions.

Immersion: This game is one of the most immersive games I've played in recent years. I don't entirely know if it's because of the graphics/sound, first person, or something about the gameplay but it's easy to just RP as your character surviving on Mars for hours (...again, once you learn the game and aren't dying or getting frustrated every couple minutes).

Co-op: The co-op is pretty fun once you get done with the campaign but there's not really any direction in it and there doesn't seem to be much more that you can do in co-op that you didn't already do in the campaign.

Graphics & performance: The graphics are fine. Nothing spectacular but perfectly good and nothing really wrong with it. Strangely the higher physics simulation setting causes a crazy amount of lag in certain places. This sort of sucks though because it seems like the physics go way more crazy than they should when set lower and there's no way to make it smooth when it's at its highest settings near certain objects. Also the lighting detail option causes inexplicable lag even though visually I can't tell a difference even in the most lit areas.

It's really a shame to me that this was only ever really a side project, with Bohemia knowing it wouldn't sell that much and knowing where their bread & butter truly is (DayZ/Arma). I think this game could go from "good game that's difficult to learn but ultimately has a great foundation" to "incredible immersive sandbox with and without friends" if enough attention was put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 1899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1899, 'last_played': 1612386056}
review:
[h1]Mars, Mars, Ja, Ja! [/h1]

Wenn einem keine Überschrift einfällt, kann man ja immernoch eine kleine Referenz zu [url= https://store.steampowered.com/app/288570/Wolfenstein_The_New_Order/]Wolfenstein[/url] bringen. Allerdings geht es hier wesentlich weniger actionreich zu.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
In “Take On Mars” erkunden wir unseren roten Nachbarn mit dem heutigen Stand der Technik. Es handelt sich mehr oder weniger um eine Simulation, dementsprechend muss man aufgrund der langsamen Mechaniken wie z.B. Mars Roover manchmal ganz schön Geduld mitbringen. Das Spiel bietet Szenarien oder auch eine Kampagne, wobei wir jedoch grundlegend zwischen zwei Spieltypen unterscheiden: Robotik und bemannte Missionen. Erstere waren zuerst im Spiel und sind sehr nah an der Realität. Leider wird man trotz Tutorial sehr ins kalte Wasser geworfen, wenn man sich nicht ohnehin schon mit der Raumfahrt auskennt. Für die ersten Schritte hat mir aber [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=601637978] dieser Guide[/url] geholfen. Aber auch die [url=https://mars.nasa.gov/msl/spacecraft/rover/summary/]offizielle Seite der NASA[/url] war in dem Zusammenhang sehr interessant und hat mir geholfen, die Instrumente zu verstehen. Während wir zu Beginn eher Sonden landen, gehen wir dann zu mobilen Landeplattformen und später auch den bekannten Roovern über. Jedoch fühlt sich die Kampagne teils recht gestreckt an und Fahrzeuge bewegen sich eher langsam. Die robotische Kampagne hat mir viel Spaß gemacht, da man durchaus auch Fahrzeuge durch Lande- oder Manövrierfehler beschädigen und dauerhaft verlieren kann. Man kann zudem auch nicht nur auf dem Mars fahren, sondern auch auf der Erde, dem Mond, Europa, Deimos und dem Asteroidengürtel. Gerade mit einer Drohne in Zero-G herumzufliegen, dass hat mir richtig viel Spaß gemacht. In meinem ersten Durchlauf habe ich zuviel Geld in Forschung gesteckt und war leider schnell bankrott. Nach knapp 18 Stunden hatte ich nach einer vierstündigen Spielesession dann einen Spielabsturz, der auch mein letztes Savegame zerlegt hat. Da die Aufgaben sich sehr wiederholen, hatte ich dann keine Lust mehr auf diesen Teil des Spiels…
Die bemannten Missionen machen viel mehr Spaß. Wir müssen nicht nur auf Essen, Trinken und Sauerstoff achten, sondern können Produktionsketten zur Rohstoffgewinnung aufbauen. Übrigens kann man die bemannten Missionen auch im Multiplayer spielen. Es gibt Fahrzeuge, Aufgaben und man kann mithilfe von 3D-Druckern sich richtige Behausungen bauen. Gelegentlich musste ich zwar auch hier mal knobeln, wie die eine oder andere Mechanik funktioniert, insgesamt war es aber sehr angenehm und man wurde weniger in den kalten Wasserstoff geworfen. Das Tutorial und die Kampagne waren besser, die Gameplaymechaniken sind vielseitiger und es hat mir viel mehr Spaß als die Robotik gemacht. Wenn man sich das Spiel kaufen sollte, dann wegen den bemannten Missionen!
Der Titel ist von Bohemia Interactive und dabei war ich leider irgendwo darauf vorbereitet, Bugs und teilsweise Spielabstürze zu erleiden. Leider ist auch dieses Spiel nicht davon befreit. 

[b]Story[/b]
In beiden Kapiteln sind wir ein Angestellter von Mars-X. An was das wohl angelehnt ist? Während die Robotikkampagne sehr realistisch wirkt, ist die bemannte Mission im Jahr 2028 ein wenig fiktiv, aber durchaus realistisch gestaltet. Als Astronaut namens Mark stürzen wir auf dem roten Planeten ab und müssen um unser Überleben kämpfen und einen Weg zurück zur Erde finden. Wer vielleicht gerade an den Film [url=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Der_Marsianer_%E2%80%93_Rettet_Mark_Watney]Der Marsianer[/url] denkt, der liegt hier ziemlich richtig. Aber die Geschichte ist für ein Spiel von Bohemia Interactive sehr schön erzählt. 

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Was will man auf dem roten Planeten schon groß darstellen? Trotzdem ist die Grafisch recht hübsch und gerade die bemannten Missionen wirken, abseits ein paar Glitches, schon eindrucksvoll. Generell wirken die bemannten Missionen wesentlich lieblicher und aufwendiger umgesetzt. 
Soundtechnisch könnte es allerdings teilweise langweilig werden. Die Melodien sind zwar in Ordnung, aber wiederholen sich zu stark und passen manchmal auch gar nicht zur aktuellen Lage wie z.B. schnelle Beats während Alles in Ordnung ist. Ich muss übrigens sagen, dass ich das Spiel auf Englisch gespielt habe. Ich wollte es zunächst umstellen, jedoch war bereits das Hauptmenü danach bei mir hochgradig verbuggt und mir wurden nur irgendwelche Programmiervariablen angezeigt…

[b]Mods[/b]
Das Spiel hat zwar keine DLCs, jedoch hat die Community viele schöne Mods entwickelt, welche das Basisspiel ganz schön aufwerten können. Gerade für Bugfixes könnte der [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197987851901/recommended/244030/]Mod von Knightsleeper[/url] interessant sein. Ein Blick in den Workshop lohnt sicher aber ganz klar. 

[b]Fazit[/b]
So toll ich das Prinzip von „Take On Mars“ auch finde, ich kann es nur sehr eingeschränkt empfehlen. Ein Käufer sollte sich Folgendes bewusst sein:
-Fehlende Erklärungen, man muss sich selber hineinarbeiten
-Bugs, die teilweise sehr schwerwiegend sind
-Das Spiel benötigt sehr viel Geduld, Aufgaben sind teils sehr repetetiv
-Englischkenntnisse
Das Spiel hätte besser sein können, aber es hat mir trotz manch genervter Momente auch schöne Momente gegeben. Es ist im Prinzip ja der feuchte Traum eines jeden Space-Nerds, allerdings leider mit erheblichen Einschränkungen. Die negativen Dinge lassen sich auf beide Bereiche des Spiels (Robotik & bemannte Missionen) beziehen, die bemannten Missionen sind aber einfach besser und weniger mit den oben genannten Punkten behaftet.
Ist das eigentlich nur Science oder auch Fiction? Keine Ahnung, aber Spaß hat es auf jeden Fall gemacht!  


Hat dir das nerdige Review gefallen? Dann schau doch mal in [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool] meiner Steamgruppe[/url] vorbei, in der ich noch viele weitere Spiele reviewt habe. Darunter sogar erstaunlich viele, die auf dem Mars oder zumindest im Weltraum spielen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198167016691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 15422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10697, 'last_played': 1617467536}
review:
Не смотря на отсутствие русского, что весьма раздражает, как я понял даже те кто говорит на английском, жёстко тупят в игре. Представляете как вам, не говорящим будет подогревать пукан!? Собственно говоря это я только про выживание говорю, что там говорить обо всём остальном. Правда есть группа фанатов, которая занимается переводом, возможно в скором времени появится и перевод, сейчас перевод почти не о чём. Даже Итальянский имеет просто какую-то х е р а б о р у вместо перевода, поскольку я говорю на итальянском, что собственно мне не помогло совсем.
    Собственно об игре, очень сильная выживалка без с р а н ы х монстров и всякой тупизны которая порядком надоела. По сути это научная фантастика. Суть выживания понятна и прозрачна, сюжет ясен и понятен. Больше нечего объяснять. Это нужно испытать. Оказаться в одиночестве на далёкой планете, совершенно один.
    Не смотря на то что игре уже прилично, по меркам игр, лет. Это мощнейшая игруля. Поэтому я был бы не против скатать по сетки в коопе на выживание. Не так одиноко =) и гораздо проще!


    В общем 9 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054324372', 'num_games_owned': 537, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1608477796}
review:
This has to have the worst user experience and interface I have ever seen in a game.

The sway and motion with every movement of the player character gives you motion sickness. Head bob can't be turned off and sprinting feels so bad. Difference between sprinting and walking is quite dramatic too so you kinda have to sprint.

Inventory is very poorly laid out:
Everything inside the object you are interacting with is on the left of the screen, your inventory on the right and the ground is at the top. Accidently miss any of the tiny boxes when handling something in the inventory and it is dropped to the ground. Shortcuts for picking up an object put it in the largest slot first rather than look for the smallest slot available too. 

I don't remember playing this game before but I tried it again today. Cannot  get into it because it's such an uncomfortable interface and experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198928461789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1593104922}

review:
Interesting game, been playing it since it came out. It has certainly come a long way.

Not action packed or anything, but I enjoy roaming the surface of Mars and just seeing what's out there.

Cool ambient music makes it a pretty atmospheric game. I enjoy upgrading the rovers and trying them out on the surface.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101711356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1632347597}
review: Lasst die Finger von dem Game, hört sich alles ganz toll an und sieht auch ganz interessant aus ist jedoch nur ein Fangnetz eurer Hoffnungen. Die Engine ist für das Coregamplay 0.0 geeignet oder optimiert. Wenn ihr ne neue map startet läuft maybe alles noch töfte, aber eben je mehr physikobjekte spawnen desto schlechter läuft das game. Jetz passiert das nicht wenn man ne kilometergroße Hütte da hinklatscht, dieses Apokalyptische Problem beginnt schon bei der kleinsten Basisähnlichen Ansammlung von Pixeln. Dabei sieht das Spiel übrigens aus wie ne alde Tomate. Support is non Existent. Hoffentlich gibts die Kohle von Steam wieder.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993503645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1604440539}
review:
Bon il pourrait être fabuleux, mais c'est d'un frustrant, rien que brancher un cable c'est tellement mal foutu. Ils auraient mieux fait de regarder la 7ieme compagnie ... le fil rouge sur le bouton rouge, le fil noir sur le bouton noir ... alors eux c'est le bout rouge sur le bout vert et vice versa ... c'est un truc qu'on voit au niveau bac, retournez à l'école !

Le contrôle des objets que l'on transporte est aussi mal foutu que le cablage ...

C'est bête car il a une très bonne ambiance, le poids et les mouvements sont plutôt bien retranscris.

Le support de GNU/Linux par Steam Play / Proton est plutôt bon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059361840', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 1030, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1603543536}
review:
Take on Mars is quite bad.

When starting the game, you get thrown into gameplay without having passed any tutorial. You will land on mars and get to play a small robot. This robot can’t do anything else than walk around. I was wondering if that was what I had to do, but the game showed me that it was my task to “analyse the soil”. It unfortunately never told me how to do it and I couldn’t find it in the key bindings (settings) either. I then started pressing every button on my keyboard until I somehow succeeding to do so. I don’t even know how I did it, to be honest.

After that horrible start, you get thrown into the mars station (for whatever reason). You will then get exposed to an absolutely vague tutorial that won’t help you at all. I have never felt this lost in a game.

After that disaster, I decided to try out the second chapter and god, it was way better. You will walk around in a rocket, which is already fun because of the missing gravitation, and repair/activated stuff. I guess this can be fun if you play it with friends. I nevertheless kept playing and I admit, that it started getting enjoyable. I understand why some people like this game, but I honestly wouldn’t recommend it.

The graphics are fine, but not amazing either (especially knowing that the game isn’t thaaat old – 2017).

author: {'steamid': '76561198073290131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1603677520}
review: Uno de los mejores simuladores espaciales que haya probado, muy realista. La ambientación tanto de Marte como de la Luna es espectacular. Dicho esto, no es un juego para todo el mundo, ya que tiene cierto grado de complejidad (supervivencia hardcore) y puede ser demasiado calmado por momentos. Además, los controles  son bastante mejorables.. Una lástima que no hayan incluido idioma español. Recomendable si se compra a precio muy reducido en las páginas de keys de turno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206331869', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1602767500}
review:
Quickfire
While the graphics aren't brilliant they have definitely nailed the light source making even the simple textures come alive. (You will have to micro your settings a little when you start to get it to look right.)

The small servers seem to run just fine and it's an amazing experience with friends. (Only if you all want to serious survival.)

The campaign mode feels like two different games.
Chapter one is an intricate development and advancement of unmanned missions to Mars.

Spoilers
chapter 2 though is a gruelling fight for survival out of the ashes of a failed mission (Well done on the voice acting)

The HUD and helmet aren't just straps to the edge of the screen and a lot of effort has gone in to letting you look around inside your helmet.

In my humble opinion Take On Mars is NOT a bad game. It has the indie game the rough around the edge feel and it definitely has a unique charm. The voice is surprisingly heartfelt and it has a beautiful empty feel. The elephant in the room no this game isn't perfect...I can easily look past it though it will keep you busy for hours and you need to take this game maybe too seriously. It really comes into its own if you can find a few friends to play to with. It's a very on-and-off game but it's definitely one I can come back to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015482127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1444900065}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973650142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7026, 'last_played': 1669508457}
review: Feels like an unfinished work, but nonetheless has a lot of good gameplay ideas. The robot missions are quietly rewarding in the same way that Kerbal is, and there are a bunch of good mods that add depth to the multiplayer. If you're interested, I'd recommend waiting until it's on sale, though, because it lacks polish and still carries a lot of bugs.

review:
Take On Mars est un jeu qui promet beaucoup mais qui est finalement assez vide et abandonné par ses développeurs.

Jeu en Anglais (la traduction française est abandonnée), des bugs, aucune info sur quoi que ce soit, j’ai l’impression que j’aurais mieux fait d’acheter 6 Whopper à la place, au moins, je me serais mieux régalé qu’en jouant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011467695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1599552121}
review:
I expected so much from this game, and have tried to persevere with it to the point of leaving it alone when I first got it due to bugs and returning two years later. That said, this is nearly unplayable in its current form, and the inability for Bohemia to have fixed it and make it enjoyable by now is frustrating.

This is the first review I have ever left on Steam, but I feel that strongly about what a missed opportunity this is. Avoid Take On Mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198998208126', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1697944129}
review:
Now this game has a lot of quirks. And I mean a LOT of quirks. The UI, player character movement, and controls are all very whacky, and it is easy to tell that this game was NOT ironed out prior to release. 
I am able to look over all these obvious shortcomings simply because it is a Mars Survival Sim. And a pretty darn realistic one at that. Overall, 6/10, its a fun and sometimes infuriating game, but I guess that comes with the realistic simulation territory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198379312711', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 38404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32853, 'last_played': 1676925984}
review:
Un jeu sympa et agréable. Il est vrais qu'il est un peut dommage que les devs n'est pas plus faite de choses pour la partie humaine du jeu, car oui il y a une partie humaine et une partie robotique. Et donc il est dommage que la partie humaine ne soit pas plus poussé mais bon, ont peut quand même passer de bon moment. 
- C'est un jeu très réaliste, surtout pour la parie robotique
-Les graphisme et paysages sont beaux et bien fait, ils sont directement tiré des images réel de Mars
-Pas de traduction fr mais comme il n'y a qu'une toute petite histoire et peut de dialogue sa n'est pas trop pénible. Si vous voulez un conseille, installer sur votre téléphone l'APPLI de traduction google et bien l'appli et comme sa vous pourrez soit écrire soit prendre en photo les texte à traduire pour pouvoir vous aider.
Comme vous pouvez le voir au nombre d'heure de jeu que j'ai, c'est un jeu qui a une bonne durée de vie.
-Le jeu possède un workshop. Donc il y a des mods et des missions supplémentaire.
-Il est possible de créer vos propre missions et maps
C'est un jeu que je vous recommande ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011491984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1598086494}
review: I payed $2 and that's about what this game is worth in the state it's in. It's an awesome idea and the game itself is amazing but the game has many bugs and for whatever reason the developers have given up in polishing this potential gem. The game used to run at a steady 75 fps when I first started the mission but now it's down to 18. It's getting to the point of being unplayable regardless of how much fun I was having.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112828117', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 33, 'playtime_at_review': 5150, 'last_played': 1710578009}
review:
Концепция интересная, но техническая реализация ужасна. Игра по сути так и осталась недопиленной бетой из 2013-го.
Космическую программу по изучению Марса мне не удалось пройти, так как в одной из самых последних миссий в последней неизученной локации игра категорически отказалась засчитывать забор грунта. Учитывая десятки часов "наиувлекательнейшего" геймплея предшествующих сему событию, было не очень приятно, когда всё закончилось абсолютно ничем.
Физика тоже весьма кривая(ну или локации, тут как посмотреть). На Европе как-то раз подошёл к иллюминатору, хотел глянуть, что там снаружи. И по всей видимости подошёл я слишком близко, ибо играбельный персонаж начал неистово сквиртить во все стороны тугими кровавыми струями и долбиться обо все плоскости, и не только, этой проклятой душевой кабины.
В общем, исходя из своего опыта, я не рекомендую эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030056846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1597010300}
review:
It’s fun. It’s really fun. I love these “what if you are stuck in the wilderness with two bits of string” kind of games. And this one doesn’t have zombies or any of that rubbish. Just you and the unforgiving surface of Mars. 

But. 

The hit boxes for the switches are terrible. I’ve suffocated myself a few times missing the airlock door button and cycling the thing instead. My cargo truck randomly rolled over in the night and all the sides fell off it and you can’t repair it. It’s the first manned mission to Mars and it’s all men. In this day and age. At least the lead is British which makes a nice change. And in the early stages you can’t go out at night or you freeze to death, but you can’t sleep through it either. You just have to sit and wait it out. The robotics chapter has no tutorial at all and is just confusing. The first probe was labelled in Russian which is nice for immersion but makes it impossible to work out if you can’t read Russian. 

But that said - I’m really enjoying it. The bugs and lack of instruction actually add to the drama of being alone on Mars. Yes, it’s buggy and not polished. But if you save often and you like a punishing survival game that’s something different to being nommed by zombies, this is a fun game.

/edit Just had an instadeath getting into my sleeping bag in a tent. How did this guy get selected to be an astronaut? LOL

author: {'steamid': '76561198000545835', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1596688227}
review:
To give you an idea of what playing this game is like. I started it up and launched the training section. There are two categories, Human and Robots. I chose Robots.

I started with an above ground down looking camera view of a probe of some kind approaching the ground. The probe landed automatically, and a narrator began telling me about what I was going to be doing. Right then, I heard a loud explosion and the wreckage of a large helicopter, presumably what had dropped my probe fell directly on my view screen. The wreckage despawned and there were two dead human bodies. 

LOL.. what the hell man.

Moving through some more of the tutorial, it was finally time to drive the rover. This rover was 6 wheeled and solar. But it spawned in this crumpled state where the wheels looked like someone had taken a bat to them. 4 of them were splayed out sideways so that the rotational force of them vertically on the surface would be the only thing that would propel them. The front 2 wheels were glitching with micro spasms and the arms for the wheels had my rover about 1 inch off the ground.

Somehow, when I pressed F12, the rover would rise from it's delapidated position like some kind of zombie climbing out of it's grave, but when I let go of F12, it sunk back to it's undead state. I tried to complete the survey tasks while constantly holding F12. No go. Certain key presses would not register while holding F12. I tried searching the keybinds in the configuration screen for F12, or anything that would equate to deploying this rover in some useable state. No luck.

This game is broke AF. So glad I paid $1 for it on Humble Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021747522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13926, 'last_played': 1596709570}

The game physics is so bad as to be completely unplayable. Frame rate problems, interface kludges. Parts randomly flying off, random space suit destruction.

review:
It was ambitious, but seriously EVERYTHING you do is a mini game. Even opening a door. I'm not ashamed to say that it took me like a minute just to operate a door because you have to pull three very specific levers for the airlock and your cursor has to be perfectly accurate all while the camera jiggles and shakes like you're having a seizure.
If you want realism with a side of parkinsons, maybe this game is for some hard core mars nerds

review: Lost potential, I had really high expectations on this game but it is not what it promises, it's a buggy, laggy, no-effort game and you can see that they didn't really care about the game design, some parts like cables are the buggiest part of the game, and all characters are literally the same model, and they wont even move their mouth when talking, I feel really sorry for bohemia, because they make nice games and this one I think dissapointed lots of people. author: {'steamid': '76561198001510507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1593974684}
review:
A cool game that has not received some love at the end,  the game is almost complete just that after some events the game is abandoned with plenty of issues to deal with,  if the devs/publisher would have taken care of it for a month more,  this would be a hit specially those who like this types of games.   The campaign and mission are worth it,  just the problems are a issue to deal with when you encounter a crash,  a bug,  or some random memory leak and this would have brought more people to it.

Hopefully one day this game sees a new day of light or something new,  for now,  this is just another lonely robot abandoned in the red planet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016293921', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1599589972}
review:
I played the game a bit more. It is quite fun if you can overlook some bugs and issues. It's complex and fun to play. You need to plan your actions in advance. If you get it cheap it's worth to try it out, but not for more than 2-3 EUR.
-----
You are dead simulator. You went to sleep in oxygen full environment, fed and hydrated? You are dead. You slightly missclicked? You are dead. You did nothing? You are dead. This is, at times, complete bullshit. It's buggy enough to be considered on par with Early Access games, but is somehow full game. Might be interesting to try experience for 10 EUR but if the price you see is anything higher AVOID! And at 10 EUR I'm not sure it's worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085301277', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6633, 'last_played': 1674418597}
review:
Moinsen,
Hier ist meine Review für Take on Mars.
Wer sich für die Raumfahrt und auch für die Bemannte Raumfahrt interessiert (würde) dieses Spiel mögen und es auch einen versuch geben....

und kurz etwas Persönliches: Es ist Richtig nervig und auch schade dass man Take On Mars nicht weiter entwickelt wird...vorallen jetzt wo wir solangsam in die Richtung gehen den Mars richtig zu erkunden (auch wenns noch dauert.)
Das spiel hat Soviel Potential dass nicht richtig genutzt wurde und was richtig abfu*kt ist, dass noch so verdammt viele Bugs in dem Game sind und ich !!!wünschte!!! mir, dass Bohemia zumindest es irgendwie hinkriegt, die bugs dort zu entfernen. Aber weil ich nur relativ gute erfahrungen mit Take On Mars habe und ich viel zu sehr in Raumfahrt interessiert bin, kann ich es Empfehlen,

Hier ein paar Pros und Cons 

+Man kann den Mars, Mond, die ISS, Europa (mond) und Asteroiden erkunden (die Asteroiden nur in der Rover kampagne)
+Man kann entweder die Rover kampagne spielen oder man spielt die laut spiel Erste bemannte Mission
+Es gibt verschiedene Scenarios, wo du dann z.B deine Eigene Marskolonie erbaust.
+Es ist Nicht zu futuristisch gehalten
+Multiplayer

-Die Grafikeinstellungen sind etwas komisch gehalten
-Nicht benutztes Potential
-Recht viele Bugs
-wenn man keinen guten Pc hat, kann es zu Laggs kommen
-25 euro ist echt zuviel geld (wenn dann sollte man bei einem Sale zuschlagen^^)

Ich würde mir halt Wünschen dass man entweder den Code zu Take on Mars veröffentlicht,sodass die Community weitermachen kann Oder (was leider nicht passieren wird) dass die Entwickler ein Kleines Team zusammenstellen die dann nur die Bugs fixen!!!.

Dann bedanke ich mich fürs Lesen und habt noch einen schönen tag.
JoJo10020
