author: {'steamid': '76561198058820700', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1590177258}
review:
Ich kann das nicht empfehlen.

Ich habe es ausprobiert und bin echt enttäuscht, wie kacke das Umgesetzt ist.
Erstmal ist das ganze Einstellungsmenü fehlerhaft. Grafikeinstellungen gelingen nur über die Preset Tasten "Low", "Middle", "High" and "Very High" oder so ähnlich. Die sich dadurch verstellenden Slider kann man gerne per Hand rum bewegen und eine eigene Feineinstellung zu machen, bringt aber nichts, da die Änderung nicht umgesetzt wird. Teils kann man den Slider nicht mal bewegen.
Die Sprache auf Deutsch umzustellen hatte ich dann wieder rückgängig gemacht, da nun sämtliche Schaltflächen nicht mehr einen englischen Begriff hatten, sondern eine kryptische Formel wie "t_kom_log_user_button_schließen" enthielten. Teils nicht mal lesbar, da die Formel nun über das Kästchen hinaus ging. Alle PopUp Hinweis-Fenster hatten nun den gleichen Formel Text, die im englischen aber eine Erklärung enthielten. Das meiste war dennoch in english, also bringt die Sprachumstellung eher nur Nachteile.
Im Spiel selbst habe ich erstmal n paar Probe-Bojen zum Mars geschickt. Wenn man alles erkundet hat, muss man für neue Missionen erstmal forschen. Was man aber wie erforschen muss, ist schlecht ersichtlich. Also habe ich das ganze Geld sinnlos für Forschung ausgegeben und konnte immernoch nichts wo hin schicken.
Dann habe ich im Hauptmenü das Training entdeckt. Nun Ja. Hier wird zwar Schritt für Schritt alles erklärt, aber es wird non-stop durch gelabert, natürlich in englisch, ohne Pause, in einem Top-Speed mit Mega undeutlichem Akzent, so das ich wirklich nicht mit kam. Man kann auch nicht nach einer Erklärung Pause machen. Hier fehlt die Funktion, nach einer Erklärung selbst auf weiter zu klicken, damit man den oder die Sätze, die ja auch viele Englische Fachbegriffe enthalten, erstmal verstehen und umsetzten muss. So wie es ist, nützt es wohl nur sehr gut englisch Sprechenden Leuten etwas. Einen schlechteren Sprecher hätte man dafür echt nicht nehmen können. Einer der langsam und deutlich spricht wäre schon besser gewesen.
An dem Punkt habe das dann aus gemacht und wieder gelöscht.

Tolle Idee, Grafik in Game so Lala, Umsetzung in meinen Augen sehr schlecht.
Und ich seh grad, das soll echt 25 Euro kosten. SO ist es nichtmal 5 Euro Wert. Selbst kostenlos erhalten bin ich enttäuscht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056934341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6276, 'last_played': 1589762371}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005420781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9962, 'last_played': 1604099463}
review:
I LOVE THIS!!!  It's Niche as fuck.  Broken as fuck. They're never going to fix it,  You're on your own.  By abandoning this game they've accidentally made the GREATEST and most realistic Mars simulator ever.  Not the coding obviously, that's fucking abominable, but when things don't work like they should because their coding is broken, that's mars as fuck, kinda.  I mean, you can't actually imagine what won't work when we get there, but by being unable to code a junction box or airlock door that works, the makers of this game made me creative.  And I thank them for it.

I love the idea of taming Mars,but in a game where there's a plan for you to succeed it'll never feel quite real.  This game isn't finished, The best parts of this game ar workshop.  You'll die, a lot, most of it not you're fault.  HOW MARS IS THAT?!!!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042689191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3441, 'last_played': 1693595647}
review:
Tato hra mě velice zaujala. Je vynikající dokud neodehrajete asi 20hodin herního času.
Maximální graf.nastavení z 150FPS pokles až na 15FPS i při minimálním nastavení.
Když už se dostanete do fáze kdy vyrábíte dostatek energie aby jste nemuseli pořád čekat a postavíte si větší  ale stále dost malou 3D tiskárnu (2x2x2m) tak se hra natolik seká že nelze hrát.

Psal jsem si přímo s těmi co tenhle podvod vytvořily Bohemia Interactive. Datum (9. 1. 2019)
Jejich odpověď:
Dobrý den,
problém přepošleme vývojářům.
S přáním pěkného dne,
Dominik Flandera
Bohemia Interactive

A nic se neděje.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381721603', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 59, 'playtime_at_review': 19122, 'last_played': 1709844902}
review:
Dit spel is zonder twijfel een aanrader. De single player verhaallijn is super en zet je vanaf het begin op het puntje van je stoel. Je hebt echt het gevoel dat je op mars bent. 
Het bouwen is makkelijk en niet zoals in de meeste spellen dat je ineens een muur hebt of een huis nadat je benodigde resources hebt, nee hier bouw je blok voor blok. Met de hand. Zeer realistisch opgezet. Ook het verfijnen van de resources is goed in elkaar gezet en visueel heel mooi.

min punt is dat nadat je campaign hebt gedaan en je eigenlijk multiplayer wilt doen of vaak gedaan hebt kom je erachter dat het steeds hetzelfde is en eigenlijk saai word. Je weet in je hoofd al hoelang het gaat duren om de benodigde spullen bijeen te krijgen. Wat werkt als een blok om het spel nog door te spelen.

1 van mijn favorieten en ik hoop dat ze over een tijd een goede sequel hiervan maken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084572529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1605472964}
review:
i cannot comment on the game as i never got the game to work past the main menu as it crashes with an un-handled error. after spending too many hours pouring over fix requests and bug reports and trying everything suggested by others, it still crashes whenever game play is involved.

the internet shows that this error hasnt been fixed for 5 years at least and the most i can divine from them is that it may be a nvidia incompatibility error but i cannot be sure.

stay away as it has been and probably always will be a buggy broken mess.

review: Donner un avis est compliqué. Il y a plein de bons points au jeu, mais aussi plein de mauvais points, Je le recommande à des joueurs capables de fermer les yeux sur certains bugs, et passionnés par le thème de ce jeu, l'exploration spatiale de Mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996624047', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3652, 'last_played': 1585499561}
review:
I would love to like this game.  God, I really would.  It's not like it lacks many merits with regards to realism and simulation - starting out is a lot of fun.  Advancing from probe, to landers and then finally to rovers is neat.  

Oh my god does this game love to waste your time though.  The amount of unique content in the drone section dries up about 5-10 hours through, when you have the entire tech tree researched, and you've experienced nearly every single terrain.  There are quite simply too many rover missions that take exceedingly too long to complete.  You have to do roughly 20-40 missions total - the first probe missions take about 5 minutes, but the final 10 rover missions take about 3 hours EACH, the majority of which is holding W.  

It's exceedingly apparent that the developers were so enamored by the procedural generated content that they arbitrarily cranked up the number of required missions.  

I really tried to grind through it.  The last 15 hours in particular have been mind-numbingly tedious.  This isn't to say anything of how poorly the UI and game direction are designed either.  I don't even want to get into that part - I tried to get into this game multiple times previously only to be turned off by how directionless and boring the first hour is.  Nor do I want to speak of the various game bugs and glitches you have to learn how to avoid - for example, how they spawn required missions on the edge of some of the maps, yet conversely only allow landing spot approximations meaning you can have your lander miss the edge of the map and go into the no-mans-zone where the terrain doesn't have physics and you just fall down indefinitely.  That was a lot of fun eventually figuring out what was happening.  Oh, and don't worry, there's still other occasional holes in the world to fall through.  

Fuck.  I just can't do it anymore.  Despite how excited I am for the concept, the execution is just...god, no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039477743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1699778870}
review:
Broken, unfinished, not just unpolished - bugs, bugs, bugs... and boxes. Tons of bugs and even more boxes, cannot get some simple things get done from time to time, crashes randomly and today 3 or 4 times I think one after another, misses textures when it decides - the terrain just go black, and ship goes black, and rooms are black, and tools are black, and printers are black, and all is black... Like the black blackness of the black soul of this game. And then the textures return and all the world shines with its glory again, just you do not know when they will do that returning to normal - you may have to play like that for eeeh a while - and it is hard when you have to fit your container in to the black hole of the black printer - and it is all one invisible thing from another dimmension called asphalt I guess... Maybe they go lunch with the aliens (the textures I mean)...  And it is SLOW. It is slow not because of something like the rules of the game - I mean this is not action game it is survival SOMETHING, it is slow because do not know it's rules - weight, object interactions, interactions between the objects - my favorite is open box filled with canisters goes down hill - by reason unknown, and the box is trembling in place because all the canisters are trembling inside... I think they are cold or something... (I like the canisters in the open boxes, or trying to get open boxes with something inside, or God forbid it to use the magnetic crane - spinning arround and then getting the most inproper object EVER. 
First missions in the tent got me - I got the sense of surviving and searching and all the world was in that tent... And then you go for it - gather this and that, make more stuff... It was cool (bad part was when it put me away on new set of missions with nothing of my stuff - no truck no tent no patches and a hole lot of things I got in store for the future). 
Flashbacks on the Moon are not bad also... And then I got to the point where I have to take soil and rock samples. And crashing begins, and you have to collect resourses (maybe on foot because the crane does not really want to take all the boxes, and sometimes takes the things from the boxes, and some times decide to take the large drop-container, well after all it is the largest metal thingie arround yes?  Nevermind that it is not really near the box you want to take and the crane is directly above that BOX? Then the moving laboratory in all it's glory, with all its missing textures, decide to start sliping around never staying in one stupid place (maybe Mars started rotating faster?) Then again it crashes. If you survive all this glory - you will need hours to get the resources and construct bigger printer from the smalller printer, dumping tons of canisters around like some sort of space junkie. Aaaah this one is empty... lets get another one... I will make it, just to get to Earth and tell those dudes and dudettes what I do think for their accomplishments in this space program... 
If this is colonizing Mars - you go! I stay here. PERIOD. I am starting to hate boxes because of this game...
I forgot to mention about sound - it is there and then it is not. And then it is there. And then it is not - the things from your surroundings are somtimes there in other not, not always you hear them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352363442', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3104, 'last_played': 1601467536}
review: 游戏节奏真的真的太慢了，苦苦肝了两天（以下所有时间都为现实时间）做好了打印机和设备，然后当地资源不足，咬牙一整天时间把打印机拆开，一个一个零件的搬家，然后重建。花了两天时间合成材料，几分钟用完，中途还一直有太阳风骚扰，还要回去睡觉吃东西。。。真的不值得费这么久时间，玩的太痛苦了，一周下来一个基地都没做成，复杂的合成表，过于昂贵的资源，不方便的资源转运，都是这个游戏致命的弱点。

author: {'steamid': '76561198191602547', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1584115734}
review: Primero que nada, que no te engañen mis horas en el juego, lo compre porque necesitaba un juego offline ligero que pudiese correr en mi laptop para mis guardias, lo considere junto con varios otros y este fue el que mas me desepciono. esta lleno de bugs, el tutorial es lento, te explica a detalle lo mas basico y no detalla lo suficiente lo mas complicado, esta en ingles muy tecnico, pero lo peor de todo es que esta incompleto y lleno de bugs, a veces simplemente te quedas atascado en alguna parte y no puedes salir, a veces simplemente crashea. lo peor es que no parece taaaan malo, asi que siempre terminas intentando darle otra oportunidad. la unica forma de recomendar este juego seria comprarlo a un dolar o menos, y aun asi lo recomiendo mas como curiosidad tecnica que como juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019195236', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3831, 'last_played': 1582484980}
review: Można pojeździć sobie po Marsie takimi łazikami jak Opportunity czy Spirit obsługując ich aparaturę. Symulacja wydaje się bardzo realistyczna, wręcz ma  się odczucie rzeczywistego uczestniczenia w kierowaniu łazikiem na Marsie. Pierwszy raz odczułam tak mocno klimat gry, poczucie bycia w tych ogromnych marsjańskich krajobrazach oraz osamotnienia w tamtych przestrzeniach. Jedynie za to mogę wystawić Pozytywną opinię, ale jest to naprawdę duży plus więc POZYTYW przeważył. Części fabularnej -załogowej nie byłam w stanie przejść ze względu na bugi (nieustająca trzęsawka kamery, nie wgrywanie części tekstur, zawieszanie się).

author: {'steamid': '76561198007597544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3087, 'last_played': 1614886046}
review:
petit resumé rapide de ce jeu : BUG!!!

ce jeu est un bug ambulant, parfois il crash sans raison, le multijoueur est instable. il est aussi très énervant lorsque l'on prend dans ses mains une bonbonne quelconque et que celle-ci vous fonce dessus a mach 1 ce qui endommage votre casque qui se mets a fuir. aussi autre détail sympathique, les traductions en français sont bugger, les développeurs semble avoir abandonné le jeu car les mises a jours sont inexistante.

Même le mode ''robotics'' est buggé (crash fréquent), malgré qu'il reste plus stable que le mode ''humain''

en bref n'achetez pas ce jeu (sauf si vous voulez défenestrer de l'argents ou que vous êtes génétiquement modifié pour être résistant à la rage que procure ce jeu lors de ces nombreux bug)

author: {'steamid': '76561198210443940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1563426379}
review:
KSP나 다른 우주 시뮬레이션 게임들을 좋아하신다고요?
이런 우주를 탐사하면서도 스페이스 오페라와는 다른, 현실적인 게임을 좋아한다 이말이시죠?

당신이 새디스트가 아닌 이상, 이 게임은 해답이 될 수 없습니다.

초보자들이 처음 시작했을때 직관적으로 어떻게 게임을 해야한다는 것을 알려주지 않아 안그래도 진입장벽이 높은 이런 류의 게임에서 한층 더 높은 벽을 쌓아주고, 설렁 이 벽을 넘어갔다 하더라도 시간과 자원, 연구해야할 목록들에 허덕이느라 공략 숙독이 강요됩니다.

거기다 연구가 다 끝나도 로버같은 것들을 설계해줘야하는데, 여러 상상력을 동원할 수 있는 다른 게임들과는 달리 이 게임은 그런것도 없습니다. 그냥 부품 뭐 달까 이정도 외에는 신경쓸 필요도 없는, 귀찮은 작업에 불가하죠.

그런 주제에 로버 조립하려고 하면 에어샤워같은 쓸때없이 현실적인 요소들을 집어넣어서 이런 사소한 것들로 사람 열받게 만듭니다.

결론: 3만원을 이런데 낭비할 필요는 없을거라 생각됩니다. 비록 전 이 게임을 사는데 돈을 낭비했지만, 여러분들은 더 가치있는 일에 그 돈을 쓸 수 있을거라 생각됩니다. 하다못해 빌딩 옥상에서 3만원 뿌리는게 이 게임을 하는 것보다 더 괜찮은 선택인거 같네요. 세상에 허공에 돈 뿌릴 기회가 얼마나 있겠어요?

author: {'steamid': '76561198123305975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3989, 'last_played': 1581890630}
review: To byłaby wspaniała gra, lecz, niestety  w 2019 i 2020 roku gra całkowicie opuszczona przez twórców nie radzi sobie z nieco nowszymi komputerami niż te z 2010 roku. Brak sensownych poprawek i brak pomocy na oficjalnym forum producenta Bohema. Jest to zadziwiające, że twórcy nie szlifują swoich świetnych pomysłów, tylko pozostawiają je niedopracowane i usuwają błędów. Niestety tak samo postępują z innymi grami. Pomysł świetny, ale niestety liczba błędów powoduje, że nie jesteśmy w stanie kontynuować gry. Jeden raz udało mi się przejść grę, bo się bardzo uparłem i grałem na 5 fps, pomimo, że komputer prawie wcale nie był obciążony. Gra często się crashuje, znika oświetlenie, trzęsie się kamera i tak można wymieniać w nieskończoność. NIEPOLECAM. Świetny pomysł, ale tylko w połowie zrealizowany.

review: Games ok, but really slow at times, If you like slow chilled gameplay thats somewhat realistic than this is for you, I played the Mars Scenario and some others, Kinda lost the love after about 18 hours playing it and a few crashes when saving. If you like Space Games, but don't want the annoying grind I would probably suggest Astroneer or No mans Sky. I do like the automation in this game though, but carrying and moving every resource is annoying as hell. I am not sure if there is much late game in this but it's just better to play something else until they do some big usabilty and ease of use items.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988429536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3355, 'last_played': 1634126794}
review:
Eine Super Spiel.
Nur leider könnte der Support von Steam zu Bohemia besser sein. Man wird nur auf die Seite von Bohemia verwiesen. Da ist man gezwungen gut Englisch zu können. Da habe ich keine Lust drauf, wenn ich das Spiel schon bei Steam kaufe, dann sollte sich Steam auch um seine Kunden kümmern.
Momentan ist das Spiel nicht spielbar, da die Grafikeinstellungen total verbuged sind wie es auch bei Arma 3 war. Da konnte man im Launcher vieles umstellen damit die FPS etwas nach oben gingen. An der Hardware liegt es nicht, denn bei Anderen Spielen habe ich dieses Problem auch nicht.
Selbst wenn ich alles auf niedrig stelle habe ich höchstens 15 FPS und das Spiel scheint eine Raster zu haben, auch wenn die Grafik aussieht wie 1995 bei den ersten Spielen (Kästchengrafik) die FPS bleiben so schlecht. Hier ist der Support gefragt. Das würde ich mir von Steam wünschen, dass Sich da mal jemand mit Bohemia in Verbindung setzt. Ich habe keine Lust mir verwirrende Forumsbeiträge durchzulesen, die meistens in Englisch verfasst sind. Die Abhilfe liegt meiner Meinung bei Bohemia. Bei Arma haben Sie es ja auch einigermaßen hinbekommen. 
Das Spiel an sich ist total fesselnd und eine Super Art von Unterhaltung. Viele schöne Möglichkeiten, es wird nicht langweilig. Aber leider wenn das Spiel fortschreitet, und man immer mehr Gegenstände auf der Map hat, wird es immer schwieriger ein flüssiges Spiel zu haben. 
Daher meine Bitte an Steam bitte Support für diese Spiel und auch andere Spiele von Bohemia aufbauen.
Wenn das Problem mit der Ruckelgrafik nicht wäre, wäre dies mein Lieblingsspiel was die Unterhaltung betrifft.
Wenn jemand eine Lösung für die Grafikprobleme griffbereit hat, dann wäre ich über eine ziehführenden Link (nicht erst stundenlanges Forumwälzen) sehr dankbar.
Der Preis im Wintersale unter 6€ war natürlich ein Schnäppchen. Hätte ich das Spiel für den Normalpreis gekauft, würde mich das furchtbar ärgern.
Ich hoffe das sich in dieser Richtung was bewegt, sonst stirbt dieses Spiel leider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000584604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 7357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3430, 'last_played': 1579540495}
review:
franchement, j'ai vraiment hésité avant de mettre une recommandation... j'étais à 2 doigts de mettre non, mais bon, vu que tout n'est pas à jeter, je vais être sympa, surtout vu le prix en solde d'hiver autour de 5 €...
Mais qu'est ce que ce jeu peut être frustrant bon sang, surtout quand on sait qu'il y a autant de chances de le voir terminé par le studio que de voir pousser des dents aux poules...
Commençons par le positif, si tant est qu'il y en ait, graphiquement, je ne suis pas difficile de base, je trouve donc que ça le fait plutôt bien, les véhicules peuvent être vraiment sympas, et finalement assez variés à l'utilisation, mention spéciale pour le labo mobile, qui avec sa grue est assez fun à utiliser et à de la g*** quand même, voler peut-être plutôt fun aussi...
Point positif, ce jeu est modable, et la communauté a mis un bon nombre de mods qui peuvent simplifier la vie dans ce jeu, et puis on peut en plus créer sa propre campagne, avec tous les items que l'on veut, les conditions météo, environnementales etc etc, ça ça rend le jeu déjà plus abordable et fait oublier en partie ses défauts, tellement nombreux que c'est compliqué d'en faire une liste exhaustive...
Déjà, bah les mouvements quand on se spawne en astronaute, p*** mais qui a programmé ces mouvements ?
n'importe quel vieux fps fait mieux, ça gâche le plaisir constamment, il faut mettre 36 coups de souris sur la gauche ou la droite, c'est vraiment nimp', surtout quand on veut s'amuser à construire une base assez fournie, ça prend des plombes, surtout que cerise sur le gâteau, la gestion de l'inventaire c'est on ne peut moins pratique, la frustration est constamment de mise, et ça prend un temps qu'on perds déjà avec les mouvements, par contre si on passe en mode free fly, là c'est le contraire, faire de petits mouvements est une gageure, surtout en mode editor où le placement d'items peut être ch*** à mourir avant de commencer à bien gérer les doses de mouvements...
je n'ai pas encore essayé le mode campagne normale, même si je commence enfin à comprendre les mécaniques pour les rovers, les autres types de drônes, faut encore que j'essaye, mais je sens déjà la bonne frustration venir, je vais plutôt rester en mode astronaute sur place, même si là encore, ces ab*** de devs n'ont pas pensé à juste foutre un bouton déconnexion sur le menu de la carte, pour switcher de son pnj à son rover, franchement, aucun sens pratique, faut passer en free fly, se mettre à côté de son pnj pour basculer vers celui ci avec F, encore du bon gros nimp' aussi, alors qu'il suffisait de foutre un bouton déconnexion à côté du bouton connexion, bref, ce n'est qu'un des détails frustrants de ce jeu...
Et c'est bien dommage, parce qu'il y a de très bonnes idées, des phases de jeu sympa, une fois qu'on commence enfin à le prendre un peu en main, mais c'est tellement long et ch*** que ça doit en décourager plus d'un avant d'y parvenir et de prendre enfin un peu de plaisir...
Dommage, c'est vraiment le mot, il y avait tellement moyen d'en faire une simulation de mars de premier ordre, la plupart des éléments sont là, quand on épluche les pages de configuration pour chaque élément, on voit bien qu'ils ne se sont pas tournés les pouces, mais laisser le dev' en plan, en plein milieu, ça fait pitié, il fallait bien sûr encore du boulot pour passer de cet Alpha, en Béta, puis en version définitive, mais là, quel goût d'inachevé, ça pouvait devenir une référence dans le domaine de la simulation spatiale... pf, quel gâchis...

author: {'steamid': '76561198037087124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1664522801}
review: Ani neviem prečo je tento produkt ponúkaný na predaj a ešte za cenu 25€. Podľa mňa je to projekt ktorý skončil niekde medzi alfa a beta testovaním. author: {'steamid': '76561198289726363', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1708014853}
review:
Take On Mars is this one of a kind game that delivers a unique and precise gaming experience.

This is a game by Bohemia Interactive, the devs that made the ARMA series and the engine is very similar to the ARMA engine. In fact, Take On Mars is technically ARMA but in space and without warfare.
It was designed to be a multiplayer cooperative mars exploration simulation.

As any other games by Bohemia, the flesh and bones of TOM is the editor, they created a sandbox for you to play with and the missions that are added are kind of a bonus to show you what the editor is capable of. As any games by bohemia things will go south and there will be weird bugs along the way so save backups of your projects and be ready to reload a scenario and start all over.

You can make incredible scenarios that have a lot of depth despite the limited tools available to you depending on the amount of time you are ready to put in mastering the editors tools.

If you are looking for an easy plug&play game with some action and a linear gameplay this is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982933574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 26358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23591, 'last_played': 1689666771}
review:
This game... This f*ckin' game... Such a time sink.

Okay, so the game has two 'modes', more or less. Robotic exploration, and colonisation.

Robotic exploration is what it sounds like. You run a space program doing some science with the tools available, to get funding. Develop better tools, send better things, have more options and get better data. Then there's phase two, which is more resource management and construction, with a few survival-y elements. In my experience, the survival aspect is rarely a challenge, so it's basically a mine-refine-buildfest. Still kinda cool. 

Like I said though, it's a time sink. Mental chewing gum. But that's okay.

review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nIKMfQHe7w&list=PLkGyZcxsQFo1pyD-FiJ2Xb4DWp6tji7DM
На 2020й год самый красивый, но далеко не самый интересный симулятор комонавтов на других планетах. Графика красивая, интересный но короткий сюжет пилотируемой программы, крайняя аркадность кампании за АМС скрыта необычным и выглядищим сложно интерфейсом....
Игра становится очень простой если ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНО ПРОЙТИ ОБУЧЕНИЕ. Многие этот пункт игнорируют.

К сожалению с игровой точки зрения все хуже.
1) Многие вещи не поясняют, что требует помучаться, прежде чем понять. 
2) Крайняя недоработанность оборудования - нет прицепа для перевозки грузов, а грузовики требуют слишком большого принтера для изготовления....
3) бочки с ресурсами все время укатываются и не позволяют увидеть какие ресурсы в них хранятся, нет ящиков для их хранения.
4) регулярно встречаются баги типа ускорения и катания верхом на проводах, канистрах и так далее.
5) Не хватает описания для оборудования (что делает, сколько электричества потребляет, в какой разьем вставляется? 
6) дисбаланс в развитии - в начале дают на Луне бесполезный ветрогенератор, чтобы сделать провода - нужен пластик, который добыть можно только на поздних этапах игры.... Мало обьектов для производства, из растений - только картошка.... Микрокарманы вообще не для чего использовать...

Дело несколько поправляют моды, которые добавляют полочки для хранения канистр, переработку отходов, 4 новых вида растений, дают больше информации по оборудованию и ресурсам и еще пара полезностей... Но, всеравно эта игра с игровой точки зрения уступает Mars Colony Challanger, Lacuna Passage или JCB Pioneer Mars...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h8kthLaH97o&list=PLkGyZcxsQFo0VYS38H5Aijs4E8RhbPxZ3

review: Take On Mars is Moonbase Alpha on steroids. While trying to survive in a hostile environment, you will feel how fragile is life. There are some smaller and bigger bugs in the game, you'll have to excuse them, as the development seems stopped. There's coop, mission editor and workshop support. Will you accept the challenge of manned space exploration?

author: {'steamid': '76561198128733829', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1573719419}
review:
Очень давно хотел попробовать этот проект, но как-то не получалось. То пиратка будет кривой, то ценник конский, а потрогать хотелось. Однако я все-таки приобщился к этому проекту. И у меня есть что сказать.

ВАЖНО! Игра разбита на две логически верные части: беспилотное изучение Марса и окрестностей, и пилотируемый полет к нему. Если не боитесь мелких спойлеров, читайте дальше. Если боитесь - брать стоит только если вы фанат космоса, космосимов в целом и KSP с Subnautica в частности.



Формальности кончились теперь по делу.
В игре два больших этапа. Беспилотная часть состоит из постепенного преодоления технологических барьеров и изучения красной планеты. Этап с выведением аппарата на орбиту, расчетом трансферного окна, маневрами Оберта и прочим - оставьте любителям KSP. Вы будете сидеть на месте инженера и исследователя Марса. В ваших руках самые различные аппараты и приборы для изучения, которые дают информацию и возможность прикоснуться к Марсу так, как мы это делаем сейчас. Сделано добротно, приятно, глаз радует. Так же есть режим реального времени, чтобы жизнь медом не казалась. В этом формате, этот режим превращается в нечто, похожее на мобильные стратегии, где поставил на постройку и через 2 часа будет готово. Только тут ускорять нельзя - доната в игре нет, и слава богу. Для любителей более, кхм... традиционных взглядов, есть режим с нормальным ускорением времени. Оценю эту часть на 4/5, за то, о чем скажу ниже. Отдельно, лишь, скажу - крайне медитативный этап.
Вторая часть - пилотируемый полет. На этом этапе нам предстоит покорять Марс в составе экспедиции, которая СПОЙЛЕР! провалилась, и герой, аки персонаж Мэта Дэймона, строит из себя "марсианина" пытаясь выжить. Подсказок минимум, драма присутствует, накал, особенно в первой части, чувствуется очень остро. Что будет дальше - молчу. Однако, за некоторым исключением, тоже спокойно и медитативно. Строить базу, собирать ресурсы, выживать. Иногда прятаться от солнечных бурь и холода. В целом - типичный выживач, но с историей, что приятно. Мультиплеер не трогал, однако там видимо что-то подобное. Тут тоже 4/5.

И в итоге оценка 7/5. Да, с математикой всё в порядке, ибо в игре всё еще есть баги. Самый страшный - невозможность загружать ручные сохранения, только последнее созданное автоматом, или через ф5. Это рушит весь процесс игры и погружения, а главное - не позволяет чередовать исследование Марса "в прошлом" и выживание "в настоящем". Крайне грустно. Плюс мелкие недочеты и внезапные смерти. Это тоже вносит свой вклад. Картинка мыльноватая, но пойдет. Если же вы не фанат того, о чем я сказал раньше - обходите стороной. Вы просто потратите деньги, час по-скучаете и рефанд. Остальным - советую приобщится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153959249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4517, 'last_played': 1606561006}
review:
I really wanted to like this game.
It has an amazing topic, amazing features, looks great.
The features are great but it lacks dept.
What killed it amazing game is the many bugs.
It feels like the game has been started with a great idea but abandoned half way.
With after 3 years still no proper updates to fix all the bugs they shouldnt ask such a big price of 26 euros for it.
The creators sadden me, having such great idea, making everything so nice and then doing only half the work...

author: {'steamid': '76561198134956277', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1604323762}
review:
开发者弃坑了，17年后就没有大的内容更新，全靠社区撑到今天。物品鬼畜问题至今没有解决，载入社区mod会好一点。
前面载具部分实在是无聊，玩了一会就跳过了，就是在行星表面着陆，然后把载具开到对应的地方，开对应的设备，无聊透顶。
载人部分还行，但是物品鬼畜实在是受不了，补给的箱子根本不能正常用机械臂抓起来，必须自己手动一个一个搬里面的东西，否则就会在箱子里触发各种碰撞，飞天遁地。
总的来说这个游戏要是有几个基友一起联机造房子还是挺有趣的，如果你是一个人玩，建议打上社区mod，也能玩上几十个小时。语言不是问题，里面的关键词汇很少，机翻下就能知道物品作用。
题材和机制都不错，可惜游戏不太有可能再更新了，现有的bug不修复没法玩，差评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041422330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1631560370}
review:
Docela zajímavá hra. Hrál jsem zatím tu "nudnější" vědeckou část, kde se posílají sondy na povrch Marsu. Pro někoho, kdo se o tyto věci zajímá je to docela zajímavé. Pro "akčněji" naladěné hráče je to fakt nuda. Ale mě se to líbí.

Stále mám problém s "radioaktivní" grafikou. Musel jsem přepnout ve Win10 na kompatibilní mód Win98, pak to funguje.

Absence fungující češtiny mě docela štve, je tam dost zajímavých textů a bez velmi dobré znalosti angličtiny si moc nepočtete. Strategická část hry pak ztrácí prakticky smysl. Existuje sice mód, který jde stáhnout, je však zabugovaný. Spustíte li s ním hru, všechny mise jsou z nějakého důvodu hotové a hra nejde hrát.

Hru doporučuji spíše skalním fandům tohoto žánru. Pro nováčky rozhodně existují lepší hry.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971905574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1374, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1572034820}
review:
I'm sad to say I had to give up on this. It has tremendous potential, but it us the least user-friendly game I have ever played. 
E.g. the game expects you to sleep in real time x12. It doesn't speed up time, it expects you to wait and watch yourself sleep for 8 hours (equating to around 30 minutes). Yes, You read that right.

So, great game idea, spoiled through lack of a little common sense and beta testing on the part of the developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049366291', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2366, 'last_played': 1572118174}
review:
Holy crap, is this game under-rated. Take On Mars is a very good game and the nay-sayers are just being ridiculous because they want Kerbal Space Program on Mars and that's not what the developers of this game are offering. I'm not even convinced the devs of this game are even *interested* in Kerbal Space Program.

First thing, play the tutorial in stages. Before starting your Space Program, play about the first 20 minutes of the tutorial, basic landers and basic rovers. If you play the whole tutorial at once, you'll get over-whelmed and you want to play the game, right? So only do as much of the tutorial as you need at any given point. TKOM has a lot going on and if you get flooded with information, you'll get frustrated.

Second thing: you're going to have to be realistic. You have a budget. If you take your budget and you spend it all on research, YOU WILL LOSE and you will have to start over. Shepherd your budget and spend it only on what you need to spend it on. Look at the missions that are available. Look at the spacecraft and the technology you need to complete those missions. Just research those. The rest of your budget goes into your spacecraft. Build up a reserve and don't break into your reserve.

Next up: Mars eats spacecraft. Get used to it. We've seen this again and again in real life and if you ignore it, the Mars in TKOM will eat your spacecraft. Don't land them at night, or in dust storms, or in terrain that they can't handle. Don't send your basic rover up into Mount Sharp in Gale Crater because it's not going to make it, it's going to flip over and die, and you will be sad. Don't ram your delicate science instruments into rocks. Don't jump over embankments because that's fun in KSP. In TKOM, this will break your spacecraft. If the crater you want to visit is in darkness on the terrain map, then it's going to be dark when you land. If your rover relies on solar panels for power, land it when the sun is high in the sky. Skip time is your friend -- use it!

And I need to stress this again: don't research stuff until you need it. Let the missions guide you. TKOM will bankrupt you without pity if you go for Large rovers before you are ready.

Next, shepherding your resources goes for when you are on Mars, too. Most of your instruments have limited uses. Don't use them for silly stuff or if you don't need them, and be careful about making sure you've got the right instrument selected, pointed at the right thing, within the instrument zone before you turn it on. Don't be afraid to bring spares of some instruments, particularly the EAS, which only has 10 uses.

Finally, the whole point of TKOM is to teach you that your spacecraft can and should exceed their mission parameters. Build for the long term. Instead of sending cheapo rovers to Mars, build a good one with solar panels or RTGs, load on all the instruments the rover will cary, conserve your limited chemical battery power and your instruments, and run mission after mission with a single rover! Even some landers can do this. In particular, the Large Lander has enough fuel to do one $4K mission, complete it, accept a second $4K mission, fly to it, and complete it. But in particular, a well-designed Medium Rover in an equatorial crater can rake in the cash by completing half a dozen major and minor missions.

TKOM is all about shepherding your resources and playing smart. If you are aching for little green men to do your space exploration for you with disposable spacecraft, you know where that game is...

author: {'steamid': '76561198403548862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3443, 'last_played': 1677193223}
review:
Take on Mars un juego basado en la película "The Marcian". No lo recomiendo. Tiene demaciados bugs y se cuelga en todo momento. Da miedo hasta darle guardar a cada momento porque hasta se cuelga allí. 
El juego no esta en Español para que lo tengan presente. Aunque tiene la opción en el juego pero se nota que no le han tomado el tiempo para terminarlo desde la última actualización en el 2017.
Te pasas tomando pequeños recipientes que contienen 130 para llenar otros mas grandes 9500 de capacidad pero la misión suelen ser de llenarlos a 1200. Como son cilindros salen rodando por las pendientes y solo uno a la vez puedes manipular, En una caja la levantas y los cilindros salen como salchichas en un sartén hirviendo. "MAS QUE PACIENCIA POR DIOS"
Pero lo que mas detesté de este juego, es que el personaje en primera persona mueve la cabeza como si tuviera un resorte en el cuello y todo no deja de moverse a ese ritmo. 
Puntos positivos es la gráfica y ambiente. 
El concepto de la impresora 3D en el juego me gusto mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114808532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1588186528}
review:
Warning:this is a simulation developed by the Russian space agency for their scientists and astronauts,if you are not an astronaut or someone who wants to live and die on Mars then this game/simulation is not for you

it is very realistic:probes have 4 retro thrusters,landers and rovers have heat shields and parachutes and sometimes the big cover made of steel stays on top of them and you cant use the cameras

but the simulation is very rewarding,you shall learn a lot about Mars

most of the negative reviews are made by normal stupid people who cannot appreciate the simulation


This is a beautifull and under-appreciated game
in fact it is a NASA simulation
you must be a scientist or an astronaut
or someone coming from 300 million years from the future
in order to fully appreciate it

yes the rovers are painfully slow
yes the first 2 hours is only launching 20 probes and watching them fall to the ground

the satisfaction when you penetrate the martian soil with your arm
and use all 5instruments cannot be measured in words

besides there is life on Mars
I come from there
born in 1761

update:)
there seems to be a nice speed update for all my little rovers
welcome to the Mars Rally of Robots:)

review: Product description claims "No need to wait until the 2030s (or longer)" to explore mars. Based on the lack of updates, support, and all the placeholder content, I do not believe their claim to be true. The game had a ton of potential, but was scrapped and released from early access in an incomplete state and abandoned. RIP

author: {'steamid': '76561198068966233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1582477579}
review:
I should have bought this when it was first released so I'd have been ready for when the CSA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO, JAXA and NASA came to me for advice on how to handle the mission to the Moon and Mars. Instead I had to tell them to watch Space 1999 reruns. Another missed opportunity. Damn.

Be prepared for an engrossing and reasonably accurate space program simulation.

If you love space travel and believe that the gaming community has a lot of impact upon how humanity's future in space unfolds, get this. 

If you're a fan of any of the world's space programs, get this.

If you've ever bought a game on Steam just to spite the reviewers who gave it poor reviews, get this.

If you feel that humanity is unfairly represented by the Matt Groenig style characters in KSP, get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017736490', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1545061378}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198066591148', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1566485299}
review:
I got Take On Mars and other Bohemian Interactive games for $1 on Humble Bundle. A while back I wanted to buy the game but I never did.

So now that I'm proud owner of this space sim, I decided to dig a bit deeper and realised that this game is basically dead. Was officially released the 9th of February 2017. looking at update history the last update was somewhere in November. Not even released a year you can clearly see it's dead. The game itself is really cool. I really enjoy the realism like damaging your suit and having to repair it and how the base system work It's really cool. Apart from that the game can be really buggy.

Stuff falls through the ground really easily when you move or drop objects. When I say really easily is because in one night a solar panel fell through, then later moving 3d printer parts, some fell through.

I'm actually really disappointed that the game is no longer being maintained. I see there are still people playing most nights I see around 4 to 7 people playing on co-op servers.

Bottom Line:
Don't buy it unless you get it on massive sale. The retail price on steam is a joke for a broken and abandoned game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302248227', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1595899032}
review:
My first two hours on 'Take On Mars' were very fun. The game has a step by step tutorial on how to set up a base on mars as well as all the different equipment and tech you will be able to play around with.

Secondly I am running a space operation running in real time where I am able to command drones and use them to literally scientifically explore and research Mars. I would definitely recommend this game to a friend as the game also supports a multiplayer mode which I am yet to experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027074529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3359, 'last_played': 1614072023}
review:
J'ai passé 56h dessus, plaisant et laborieux.

Beaucoup de possibilités, d'expérience de jeu intéressante, malheureusement le gameplay est encore à optimiser. Je le trouve horrible. 

Je suis à la mission 6 du chapitre 2. Ca devient injouable avec des chutes de FPS terrible. Je tourne entre 1 et 10 FPS sur un Shadow PC. Entre le panneau des missions qui clignote et les tremblements du personnage je suis en train de craquer. Je vais attendre qu'il avance dans le développement pour continuer. 

Sinon l'histoire est sympa mais dans le jeu çà manque encore d'explication avec la jouabilité. A revoir vraiment car c'est un super jeu avec un potentiel énorme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137076870', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1566923908}
review:
Hallo!

Meine Erwartungshaltung war am Anfang sehr hoch, aber sie wurde bei diesem Spiel schnell auf den Boden der Tatsachen zurückgeholt. Am ersten Tag klappte kaum was, denn einige Tastaturbelegung gingen nicht und ja sogar das Organigramm aus dem Space-Programm war für mich ein Unikum. Nachdem ich zu irgendwelchen Downloads gekommen bin, hat sich das Blatt zu Gunsten des Spieles gewendet.

Schnell mit einfachen Worten gefasst. Seht am Anfang zu, dass ihr die erforderlichen Downloads bekommt. Wie auch immer und gebt nicht auf. Danach funktionierten alle Tastaturbelegungen und das Organigramm aus dem Space-Programm der Forschung wurde klar, weil die Pfeile zur seitlichen Sicht funktionierten.

Nun konnte ich das Space-Programm genießen und hatte meinen Spaß daran gehabt. Zwar weiß ich immer noch nicht, warum ich keine G-Probes produzieren kann, aber ich komme noch dahinter......Sehr wahrscheinlich liegt es daran, dass ich mich wohl noch voll im Anfänger-Modus befinde.......

Okay, alles in Allem kann ich dieses Spiel mit sauberen Gewissen empfehlen, vorausgesetzt, Ihr gebt nicht so schnell auf und sorgt dafür, dass Ihr die Downloads bekommt. Die Erläuterungen und Tutorials finde ich etwas unglücklich, weil sie auf einem hohen Spieler-Niveau ansetzen und ein Anfänger kann kaum etwas davon verwerten, weil einfach die Voraussetzungen fehlen.

Schade nur, das dieses Spiel in English ist. Hier sollte der Software-Hersteller daran arbeiten, denn es gibt doch erstaunlich viel Menschen, die der englischen Sprache nicht mächtig sind. Dabei bietet der deutschsprachige Raum sehr viel Marktpotential...

author: {'steamid': '76561198041778349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1565303579}
review:
The multiplayer is buggy.  I can't move when the host has any menu open.  My movement controls frequently get rotated, ex. W goes backwards to the right instead of forward.  Pressing any button is a challenge as it doesn't seem to register.  There's some sort of weird mouse acceleration too.  And lag, mouse acceleration and lag.  It's really weird.  I would not recommend this game to anyone except as a morbid curiosity.

Also, ALT+F4 does not close the game.  No respect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198411202899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1565379999}
review:
HECK NO. I bought this game for $1 in a humble bundle sale and I feel completely ripped off. Let me explain...

The tutorials are impossible to complete. Bugs galore, which means that you go into the game with patchy incomplete information on how to actually play it. 

I chose the "game time" option (as opposed to "real time") so I could skip time and not have to wait for real hours to go by in order to research one item. LOL. By the time I finally got to sending a rover to Mars (thanks internet friends, because I couldn't get that far on my own) it takes an absolute ERA - in real time - to drive that damn thing 400m. 

Everything in Chapter 1 (the robot section, not the manned trips) seemed to be this way. Want to drive to your next research site? HA - find something to hold down the right arrow and time for 15 cuppas while you wait. Finally get to the site and need to take a picture? WAIT - can't even automate this because it's SO DAMN FIDDLY, and now I need shots of whiskey not tea. Get everything you need done whilst gaining a full head of grey hair, downing the contents of a fully stocked bar, and throwing your computer out the window twice? MWHAHA - ERROR, ABORT. *Smashes screen with keyboard, doesn't even regret it*.

I love these kinds of games, and this is the worst one I've played yet (and I've played a fair few). It's been a few years since the last update (from what I can see) and questions/answers on forums have dwindled - so don't hold your breath that anything will change. Good luck if you choose to go for it, I'll make sure to listen out for your screams. 

Off to humble bundle for a refund...

review: Poza tym, że tłumaczenia są kompletnie uszkodzone- przykładowo portugalski wyświetlany juest jako coś tam #language_portugues a polski na przykład jest przetłumaczony w... 20%? Nie bardzo wiedziałem co robić i zacząłem wynajdywać technologie tylko po to, aby potem zostać z 35k i kompletnie nic nie móc robić. Wyszukałem w internecie i jeżeli skończymy na takim etapie, to jedyne co nam pozostaje to restart. Ah, byłbym zapomniał- po uruchomieniu tutoriala w 10 sekund wyskoczyłem poza mapę spadając kilkanaście kilometrów na planecie Ziemi- przy okazji wspinając się tak po prostu na czubek głowy jednego ziemianina. Gra mogłaby być dobra, ale wygląda jakby była robiona jak jedna z tych gier dodawanych do płatek śniadaniowych.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1565173603}
review: Well, at least this one has trading cards. As anyone can see from their catalog, aside from the arma3/dayz fanbois this publisher is horrible. Right there with Iceberg which is saying a LOT..lol Their catalog aside from the aforementioned arma is a nightmare of disaster efforts, abandoned, unfinished buggy mess ripoffs. Strange but, it's right there for all to see. This game can have it's moments, and you can drudge through trying to find something to do to navigate this unpolished and unsupported "outing".  It's better off then their other crap games, take on helicopters and that carrier command game, also unfinished, abandoned junk. One wonders why they bothered to make anything BUT the arma stuff is they aren't going to even try. Better to make 1 game that's good (Not saying arma is, it has major issues but treads water fine) than to sully your reputation with a bunch of junk games that you don't even try to finish. As company that seems pretty stupid. Either way, if you can get "their other stuff" for a buck or two you may can play around it for a moment, but it's not worth anything more (not because they aren't good ideas or have potential, but because this publisher is trash and has no intention of finishing what they start for some reason).

author: {'steamid': '76561198098478284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1563664865}
review:
While the idea behind this game is certainly interesting, there are a few too many issues for me to recommend it. Some of these are deliberate design choices, while others are issues one would expect to have been corrected during the game's Alpha, which it did have.
1. Training voice-overs. If you click too fast, or investigate a screen part before the voice-over expects you to, the voice begins talking over itself. This obviously presents a problem, as you now don't recieve training for two different things, one of which may have been a bit boring.
2. The research tree is counter-intuitive. I respect the idea of going for a more realistic approach, with different components requiring multiple pieces of research in a variety of fields, but between the difficulty of scrolling (the lower portion of the screen, where there's lots of blank space, doesn't respond to the cursor for some reason), and the fact that there is no recommended order to purchase components (Do I try getting a better camera first? Go for a large lander before the rover?), it is difficult to know which components to purchase when.
3. There aren't any alerts for when new missions are available or new parts have been researched. This is a bit of a continuation of the last one, but while there are alerts for new technologies, there's nothing for when you have all the technologies to make a new part. Given that the latter is much more relevant than the former (there's no limit on how many things you can research, after all), this seems wrong.
4. It is all too easy to soft-lock the game. If you research the wrong things (or even research in the wrong order), you often end up without enough money to fund any of the potential missions you have available. While this may be an intended part of the game, there are numerous factors that make it unfavourable: there's no warning that a given research may not allow you enough funding to continue. There's no way to see the price of any given chassis until after you've fully researched it, making it difficult to plan ahead. (How much do you need before researching the rover, if you want to actually be able to afford the rover afterwards?). However, worst of all is what happens if you run out of money: nothing. Literally nothing. If you aren't able to progress, the game should automatically provide a game over. That way, at least you know. Sure, you have to restart the game either way, but a game over is preferable to a softlock.
In summary, this game feels incomplete. While I could understand that back in the Alpha, now that it is a fully released game, one would expect better.

review: Мне в игре многое нравится,но есть причины,которые все портят.Во первых в игре много багов.С разработчиками не возможно связаться чтобы задать им вопрос-официальный их сайт вне доступа.В мультиплеере создаешь игру и потом не возможно эту игру удалить,если решишь создать новую игру.Можно только создать новую игру в мультиплеере,а старую игру невозможно удалить.Разработчики забросили работать над игрой и не доделали ее полностью.Если в чем-то я ошибаюсь,тогда я оставляю право комментировать мой текст.

review:
I'm not sure how they made this concept boring. They've got video tutorials for things that don't need tutorials, no directions for things that do need directions, and the literal entire first hour is clicking "let's launch another probe, watch blankly as it parachutes down, then go back to the menu without being able to interact in any way".

It's more complicated, and yet also less interactive, than Kerbal Space Program and I just can't will myself to get to "the good part", wherever that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018019395', 'num_games_owned': 2469, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2895, 'last_played': 1559143404}
review:
Lamentable y abandonado.

El juego presenta unos mapas enanos con apenas mecánicas. Una campaña que apenas tiene duración, mal realizada y sin motivaciones. Básicamente te pasas el juego moviendo bidones de una maquina a otra.

Unos vehículos de endgame mal pensados o que se nota que le faltan cosas, parece un juego a medias. Si me dijeras que esta en desarrollo y que le faltan meses de meter cosas quizás, dado que como base lo que hay no esta mal, le falta una vuelta a ciertas cosas pero es un buen comienzo. Pero tal como esta, darlo por finalizado es de risa.

Personalmente esperaba un juego de exploración donde se pudiera explorar, irte a días de viaje con los vehículos de endgame, pero por mucho que te alejes, prácticamente siempre estas viendo un punto que es tu base antes de caerte literalmente por el borde del mapa. Muy triste y una autentica pena de juego.

Yo lo compre de oferta por 5€ y sinceramente creo que no vale ni eso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302868766', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1625329420}
review: Здрасти, в крации о игре "Take On Mars": сел на Марс, посадил картоху, добыл анализ грунта, притащил 3D принтер, подключил к солнечной батарее и создаёшь материалы для, большого 3D принтера но это не сужетка. Графика в игре добротная, ну точно не как в майнкрафте. Но баги, баги тут бывают угарные и не угарные, например во время прилунения на Луну, и случайно вылез из кресла ударился головай и умер, взорвётся шатал или вот ты прилунился, и хочешь вылисти из шатла но не можешь, не знаю это я такой криворукий или что не да пилил. Но игра даже с такими багами прекрасная, если вы ищете с другом хороший симулятор про космос, то "Take On Mars" для вас.(МАЛЕНЬКИЙ СОВЕТ) под базой есть баги, нажмите кнопку под базой и откроется апорель, и там будет стоять баги, он если что он ездиет на метане. Баги вам поможет доставки предметов в кооперативе, инструментом который выглядит как шуруповёрт, и он вам поможет в установке всяких других штук. Короче говоря, методом тыка вы сможете понять механики игры. Но игра реально затягивает, короче попробуйте но если вы всё таки купили её, я вам скажу удачного одыха вам на Марсе, если это можно назвать отдыхом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073431466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1560219441}
review:

Start of game training: 
Trainer looses head frequently
Confusing key press instruction for pick up/drop and interact
Open a water container box to get water and no key press works to exit the container.

As I could not even continue training from this point it was end of game for me.

So payed about $10 Australian got about 10 min of play. Bit expensive at a dollar a minute. 

Ripped off again (becoming something of a norm in gaming these days... sad)

review: Ive played the main mission of manned and a bit of the rover, both are very enjoyable and i highly recommend for anyone just wanting to sit down, relax and do simple tasks. though it can be difficult at times to realise what to do as there is little help other than main objectives, that is enjoyable and can make it more challenging. Please do save though, there are points where you can randomly die instantly after hours of work with no saves for some random broken reason however they are infrequent and amusing at the times they happen if a recent save is possible and only drive you to want to do more in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181592802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1558781168}
review:
A lot of my friends raved about this game and I thought I'd give it a go when it was on sale.  I honestly thought the game was an alpha release with all the crashes, glitches and game-breaking issues.  I mean, I could handle having to wade through the floor meshes or the game simply refusing to run if it was an alpha or beta...  Hopping on the game site I realised that not only was it a full release but there'd been no development since 2017.
This game reeks of a side project that was rushed to full release and then dumped by the developers in the hopes the community would take the reins and turn it into something not... terrible.  Thankfully they have and the community has brought some fantastic mods.  Unfortunately, they have to run those beautiful mods on a terrible platform - somewhat like building a mansion on a volcano.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010785369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1647731364}

review: Should have read the reviews i guess,,, game is unplayable on windows 10 with constant errors and crashes. there seems to be some people with suggestions on how to fix it in the community forum, but it does not look like a sure or easy fix and so many steps to just try and play the game. shame, from the few minutes i was able to play before it crashed it seemed like a good simulator and something I would really enjoy playing, but not worth buying or paying anything for it if you have to do all sorts of troubleshooting to play a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073164083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1558801735}
review:
if it would be an early access it would be promising. but Bohemia interactive seems to have done a lousy job. no face animation when speaking, awkward walk animations, tedious and bad designed controls. this should be a game and tries to cover building stuff as you would do in real life but with items colliding all the way with other constructed parts. makes the construction of a building very unsatisfying and non payable at all...
very poor gameplay and aged graphics.
i could have been a great game, but it's seems to be in the store for no reason and without any further development... 
not cool...

review: I give this a thumbs up given you get it on sale and are into painfully slow simulators..we are talking like real time in outer space,takes minutes to get in and out of vehicles or do pretty much anything else,while this may be fun for some its far to slow paced for me i could not bare to even get through all the training..also if you play this in 4k the UI does not scale you will need the best eyes on the planet or a microscope to see what it says to do next or to see hints,and dropping things into inventory slots is very hard when they are so tiny if you are slightly off you have to exit to pick them back up and try again...game was very tedious to me but im sure some will love that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057056847', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1558106793}
review:
Complicated controls.  Enable this mode to enable that mode.  With that mode enabled,  select option C, but NO! Not like THAT.  Click THIS first THEN click that.  Okay, now switch to this mode, then enable that device, now switch back to the first mode.  Right, now acti... NO! Don't GO right!  Now, go back... the OTHER back.  Okay, Now click this button in that menu after you selected the menu select in the menu selection screen.  Now go back to the other mode screen and guess where you're supposed to click to do the thing we want you to do.  ***10 minutes later*** Congratulations!  You took a picture!

Super...

Hot.

Super...

Hot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123294288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 4553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3908, 'last_played': 1554758963}
review:
Bel gioco di sopravvivenza spaziale, diviso nella parte robotica e umana.
Riguardo la parte robotica (che esisteva inizialmente da sola) è davvero ben accurata anche se diventa presto ripetitiva una volta acquisite tutte le tecnologie. Europa non è incluso nella parte robotica anche se si può usare la sonda a 0 G nello spazio (niente di che..). Tutti gli achievement si rifanno alla parte robotica, questa offre perlomeno una 30-40 ina di ore di gioco (di più se si vogliono compeltare tutte le missioni anche se, ripeto, è ripetitiva alla lunga)


La parte umana è stata aggiunta dopo e consiste in una specie di survival/building/gestionale in prima persona. Basata su una campagna e 4 scenario (2 brevi sul satellite Europa). Una marea di MOD e ADDONS oltre al multiplayer hanno reso questa parte molto interessante. Questa offre un numero in teoria infinito di ore di gioco , Direi almeno 100 senza grosse ripetizioni. 
Gran possibilità di creare mappe editor.

Grafica e musica accattivanti

Consigliato a:
-Chi cerca un gioco rilassante ma che è comunque richiede molta attività cerebrale (soprattutto nella parte umana)
-Un gioco accurato scientificamente (conoscenze base di chimica aiutano anche se non necessarie)
-Ha sempre sognato di guidare o comandere un rover marziano o di colonizzare il pianeta marziano e costruire la propria 
 base.
-Vuol in generale acquisire conoscenze su Marte, la sua atmosfera, geologia, geografia e conformazione.

Sconsigliato per:
Gioco comunque abbastanza complesso, ci vuole un po' per capirlo e gestirlo. Comandi per altro non proprio sempre intuitivi nella parte umana.
Alla lunga un po' ripetitivo e dai paesaggi un po' monotoni (Marte è un deserto rosso nel caso non lo sapeste..)

Voto finale 7,5 dovuto alla complessività, ripetitività di certe cose e poca intuitività di certi comandi.
Consigliatissimo almeno da provare se comprato in sconto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082847338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1558278357}
review:
WOUW !

Mais quel jeu sympa xD

Très compliqué comme j'aime ! très complet ! très réaliste ! très prenant ! un peut comme les arma jeu phare des éditeurs, ATTENTION ici on est a des années lumière du gamplay kéké console et TANT MIEUX ! c'est ce qu'on aime, ce qui fait acheter un pC 3000 eur au lieu d'une conne-sole 400 balles.

Anglais pointu, mais on comprend tout ! si on est intelligent et censé.

Une merveille, un jeu sérieux ET BEN CA MANQUE PLUTÔT !

Quelques plantages et retours bureau mais pas grave !
Bonnes perfs avec mon PC jeux 2 (lol) GTX 1070, I5, meme pas eu besoin de mon pc jeux 1, i7, RTX 2070...

Encore une fois c'es réaliste et sérieux !!!!!!! on joue a être un scientifique de la nasa, a la recherche quasi réelle de données  ;) entendez par la que c'est bien simulé, et qu'on cherche les informations du jeu en avançant comme les scientifiques.

Un café ou autre boisson chaude, 2 ou 3 écrans devant soit, et c'est MAGIQUE on y est, l'ambiance est exaltante, on est a la nasa ;p ou carrément sur le terrain sur mars.

Un jeu qui aurai du être plus connu et qui as surement peut marché, tant le consommateur peut être a 80% préfére largement se taper des trucs avec des zombis ou faut surtout pas réfléchir apprendre, patienter....alors gardez a l'esprit que peut être 50% des mécontents sont ceux qui ont regretté qu'il n'y avait pas de zombis dans le jeu ou une fille avec une combi transparente....c'est une très bonne simu OUI ! et c'est un mauvais beat 'm all console avec du sang partout et deux boutons de contrôle oO

Les textures et graphismes sont corrects, surtout sur Mars, sur terre pendant l'entrainement, le ciel bleu et les arbres sont pas top ;-/ mais on s'en fiche c'est 10% du jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032214340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2490, 'last_played': 1574542551}
review:
What a great shame. This game is by a developer who I have great respect for and have followed since they release the original Operation Flashpoint.
With this game, they had the right idea and could have made something truly awesome but instead, they have ended up with a bug ridden mess that hasn't been properly supported.
It is always annoying when a developer who you know is capable of so much more, falls short like this.
I have enjoyed bits of the game, but constant issues and crashes mean it's also one most frustrating games I have played in a very long time.
If you choose to buy save often. when (not if) it crashes you will lose all progress.

Es ist so komplex welches vieles möglich macht wie z.b. das vielfälltige bauen einer Anlage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971037696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1560, 'last_played': 1535520851}
review:
Given the developer, and the screenshots, you should expect this to be a fantastic game. It's not. Chances are you've realized that from the overall review score. 

ToM has two segments, unmanned and manned. I don't know if it changed since the last time I played it, but the former was quite simply an inch deep. This isn't a space program simulator, providing neither significant interaction with technological development and the application of scientific knowledge nor a meaningful financial management aspect. It literally feels like a little simulator at the end of the Kennedy Space Center tour where you watch historic moments in space history. Does this qualify as a game? Who cares, just look at little Timmy beam with pride that he pressed a red button and got a short clip of a satellite deploying or a rover driving 1-2 meters out from the landing site. Good job Timmy. Right this way to the gift shop.

The manned section is a sandbox, and it has potential despite it's long-standing bugs. But like most sandboxes that languish in early access, it lacks a point or an endgame. We see way, way too many of these. Nobody's asking for combat, or aliens, or artificial drama... but a game either needs conflict or a wealth of interaction points to drive its core gameplay loop. And worst of all, the one thing it glosses over the most is "science". There's no great struggle against the environment other than brief radiation storms you can't really do anything about (and usually don't need to) and the occasional "oops, I accidentally opened the wrong airlock, time to reload". There's no intricate mechanical or electronic elements to the building/construction gameplay beyond littering the landscape with janky plugs you keep tripping over. There's no significant experimentation or scientific discovery.. you barely have to put any effort into finding resources and constructing parts (with a 3D printer), the gameplay of which challenges you about as much as using a coffee-maker. I'm not saying any or all of these were necessary, but if you're going to make a game you need to have a plan for how and why it's going to be interesting to play. 

There was a lot of opportunity here, but Bohemia treated it as a side-project for a couple of developers using some existing code, and that's more or less how it came out. Standing at the window of the Mars base you toiled for hours upon hours to build and staring at the horizon is certainly cathartic... for a few minutes. But ultimately there's nothing to explore, nothing to find, little to overcome beyond the initial scramble stage. 

Take On Mars exists because of The Martian, we all knew that going in years ago. The theme will be enough to satisfy hardcore fans of the space program despite the paucity of interesting gameplay, but it's a constant reminder of how much more there could and should be. If you've played other content-light sandbox "do whatever and set your own goals and twiddle your thumbs" games and enjoyed them, this might be up your alley for a sale price... but don't expect mods to add meaningful content where it's lacking.

review:
I tried, i rly tried, but this Game is the biggest bugged Bullshit i played in my entire Life. Im not saying this cause im frustrated of my last attempt to play this Game, its my adult Opinion.
I will explain in 4 Steps.
1. I went to my secured Poptent, laying down to skip the Night, and ...well...i died...just like that. No Issues before, well fed, enough 0xy, i just...die.
2. I went down to sleep in my ,,save,, Mobile Lab...and, guess what..no no i didnt died...i just fall unconcious, over and over...nice one.
3. I want to refill the Barrels of my Cargo Truck...and...honestly...i dont know, maybe it was i giant Rock on the Ground i didnt see, or it was a Martian Unknown Weapon that deactivates the Gravity...but, i just fell to the Ground, broke my Helmet and...died.
4. Only positive Thing i saw till now, is the Player Community, thats it. No active Devs or anything. 

So jeah, if you wanna spend your Money i can give you a LOT of very Good Games...this...is NOT such a Game. If you wanna dump your Money, there are better Ways.
So unless you love to suffer and get annoyed by stupid unrealistic Gamemechanics, i would strongly advise against buying this Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988311122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2863, 'last_played': 1563654505}
review:
It's a unique game. It's a slow game. It's more of a physics and science simulation than anything else. So once you are okay with that, then take the plunge. Yes there are bugs. I highly recommend saving often, and use multiple save files. You will likely be set back due to unforseen issues.

But, if this is what you have been waiting for, then you will love the game and push yourself through these things because there's just no other experience out there quite like this. It stays true to the science as much as possible, and is a sandbox to experiment with and explore. 

Also, from what I have read in discussions lately, development continues but it is currently very slow going until the dev can commit more time to the project.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999424584', 'num_games_owned': 1231, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1710074918}
review:
(Updated 2/5/2021)
Great game except for a few critical issues:

1) The camera bugs out at some points trying to center itself at low FPS and hence "bounces" around the center point.

2) Implementation of Picture-in-picture (PIP) interactive interfaces was poorly executed. Each monitor is rendered independently and appears to use some kind of raytracing detection to determine where a player is looking at on the screen but also appears to be handled standalone from the rest of the world. This is partly due to the fact that TKOM is almost entirely server authoritative and these interfaces seem to be no exception. There are plenty of other games that do this right without tanking performance for the entire game.

3) FPS drops over time as more objects are added to the world. This is largely due to an increase in simultaneous physics iterations over time, but this can be mitigated to some extent, but is further exacerbated by the number of PIP interfaces in a given area.

4) Vehicles (particularly rovers) can break easily and unexpectedly at high speeds when hitting an obstacle. Don't drive like a dumbass and this usually isn't an issue.

5) You can be launched towards the ceiling/space if you collide with something the wrong way, especially if that other thing is another player or object in motion or you perform an action that would move your character (Climb a latter, climb onto your rover). If you hit something hard enough you will damage or even break your suit. This is partially avoidable but you should be prepared to deal with this when it inevitably happens sooner or later.

Conclusion: If you have a truly VR Ready machine these issues become less noticeable but be aware that the minimum/recommended specs are low balling this game by a lot, particularly when it comes to multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437398523', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1574590308}
review: 我得帮这款游戏正个名，其实也不能说很差，虽然抖动的问题确实存在，但是如果是从机器人章节开始玩其实还是可以接受的（机器的抖动比人少很多）。在画质上毕竟是波希米亚的游戏还是有保证的，如果把画质开高，那种探索别的星球的陌生感一下子就出来了。虽然说这款游戏在星际转移和火箭制造上是缺乏的，但庞杂的科技树还是能让你玩好一会的（开火星车超级消磨时间），相比于坎巴拉太空计划这款游戏在行星地质方面（坎巴拉太空计划的科学仪器只会卖萌）可以做一个完美的补充。最后，谈一下语言问题。其实游戏的英语并不复杂，每一个设备都会给出详细的解释（也就是说专业名词也有英语释义）。而且如果玩熟练了，升级科技其实都不需要把英语看懂，点一下科技树左边要升级的科技，然后去找需要的条件就可以了。综上所述，如果各位对宇宙探索尤其是行星地质和慢节奏的科研类游戏感兴趣的话，这款游戏还是完全值得入手的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198197066833', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1587827459}
review:
Úžasná. zábavná a velmi atraktivní hra s hezkou grafikou. 

Tahle hra je velmi nápaditá a chytlavá. Jen na to že společnost studio Bohemia Interactive má pobočku v CZ né-li je česká to nevím... ak mně velice mrzí absence češtiny. Tudíž prosím studio o dovytvoření officelní češtiny. 

Jinak všem hru doporučuji, ale ti kteří neumíte anglicky, tak nekupovat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027294712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1544080117}
review: The game concept is great but this is really just a technology demo for the next game engine offering from Bohemia Interactive. The point of space survival games is emergent gameplay. This does not offer it. I think it would be great if the game allowed for more things to do in multiplayer other than build and collect resources. Maybe more thorough construction, air transfer, resource management, and incorporating ideas from a game such as Space Engineers or Stationeers would make it awesome. At this time the game is playable and that's about it. I would say it's still "Early Access" quality and isn't worth it currently. Bugs that essentially reset fun are not good, such as failure to prompt for loading from saves making you go back to the very beginning, unexplainable death caused by self-destructing doors, and inconsistent physics being applied to vehicles. It would be nice to be able to repair vehicles and make outposts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317449988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2616, 'last_played': 1545920849}
review: Evet bir hayatta kalma oyuna daha. Arkadaşlar Mars gezegenini merak ediyor ve orada ne yapardım diyor iseniz oyun sizi bir nebze de olsa bu atmosfere sokuyor. Ancak 99 TL gibi bir fiyattan satılan bu oyun yeterli bir oynanabilirliğe sahipmi ! Bence değil; Oyunda etkileşime girdiğiniz objeler çok çabuk Bug lanıyor ve anlamsızca hareketler yapabiliyor. Bu sırada istemsizce oyuncunuzun hayatını kaybettiğine şahit olabilirsiniz. Geliştiricilerin oyunu terk ettiğini düşünüyorum . Oyun kendi kendini aşırı tekrar eden bir pozisyonda. Bir space engineer ayarında değil. The Forest bile daha hızlı yapılanmıştı. Yaratıcılık kısmında da sık sık kısıtlanıyorsunuz. Oyun sizi sürekli bir alandaki bir bölüme zorlayarak açık dünya oynanışını belirli bir bölgede göreve odaklanma olarak karşılıyor. Görev adımlarını sırası ile yapmaz iseniz çoğu durumda fail olabiliyorsunuz. Örneğin Ay üssündeki görevleri adım adım takip etmeniz gerekiyor. Yoksa bir sonraki adıma atlayamıyorsunuz. Oyunu alalı bir süre oldu Hermest Evall oyunu incelediğinde almaya karar vermiştim. En son güncelleme ile oynadığım varsayılır ise oyun yapımcılarının Space X sayesinde para kazanmak için yaptığı bir çalışma sanki. Oyunu hayatta kalma ve uzay oyunlarından hoşlanıyor ve ağır Bugları görmezden gelecek kadar çok seviyor iseniz alın. Aksi halde oyun incelemelerini izleyerek oyun hakkında bilgi sahibi olun. Beneden bukadar. Herkeze iyi oyunlar.
