author: {'steamid': '76561198023716890', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 26979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16272, 'last_played': 1668837287}
review:
This game has some physics related issues, like cables in particular, but if you know how to play the game, you won't really have much issues.

I used to help people in their reviews fixing bugs and reporting those bugs to the developer but then Valve decided to screw up steam community even further by defaulting all reviews to not allow comments so now I can't help people anymore.

I can say this for common issues though,
There are bugs but a good many of them can be worked around and I almost never encounter them as I think most were fixed. If you do find a bug, REPORT IT! Don't curse out the devs or insult them for making "a bad game", games have bugs, deal with it.
If you have low FPS, lower your light setting to minimum, it doesn't really change anything at all and you gain back a lot of FPS from it.
Don't walk on cables while you're holding them, that will almost always lead to disaster.
Try not to walk on bundles of cables either, if you have a lot of cables in an area, walk around or jump over them.
Crouch and enter the pop tent, don't try walking into it while standing or standing while inside it.

The game's primary functions were the rover campaign, and I've never seen a bug in it before.  If you like driving rovers around mars, you'll love the rover campaign.

Feel free to ask questions in my comments below.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006565206', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1521503795}
review:
Was so excited about this game, wild hopes of an amazing survival game and what we got is essentally Abandonware. The Dev has been pretty much MIA since launch. Shame, this game could have been awesome and with the craze around space and specifically Mars picking up this game could have been super popular.

Instead we have a game that was aborted at birth and a developer I will never trust again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028640474', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9562, 'last_played': 1564801843}
review: This is not a the game for everyone.  If you love everything about mars, then this is the game for you.  There are times where the game is very slow pace, so if you are looking for fast action, then this is not the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154100974', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 18783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12100, 'last_played': 1579466865}
review:
This game to me was the second game I had played on the PC back when I was 11 back in 2014 when I had to play this on a potato notebook laptop. It ran at a stable 15 FPS but I still enjoyed it non the less and ranked up 312 hours, Enjoyed the editor and the Manned missions and the Rovers. But times change and I got older, I got faster PCs, Now I have a debit card, I moved to shooters, I had a passion for Computers to Astronomy and I got older. Now that I am 15 I recently looked back at this game and it's a mess, End of story. The Devs silently put out updates without any blog, Buggy Physics engine that doesn't recognize when it's in a other object. I can't recommend this game at all, Buggy engine with physics and Graphics that were impressive for 2009 and a Failed multiplayer.
Thanks for reading. Buy KSP, It's a way better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130873117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5088, 'last_played': 1679839465}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007539832', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 3130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1581195074}
review:
No es un juego acabado. Hay muchos bugs y uno de ellos es en la traducción. Podemos poner varios idiomas, pero mas de la mitad de los textos, están incompletos y llenos de carácteres extraños, ni han usado el google translation. 
Hay dos tipos de juego, la carrera robotica y la carrera espacial. La primera iremos lanzando sondas espaciales para realizar pruebas que nos reportarán dinero, el cual tendremos que invertir en investigación para desbloquear nuevas tecnologias como los rovers, nuevos tipos de cámara etc. Tiene el problema que si uno sigues la pauta de desbloqueo de misiones y tecnologia, te quedas sin recursos y no hay forma de seguir.
La de la carrera espacial es mas tipo de supervivencia, pero tienes ir a por unos objetivos para poder seguir. No se si llegas al sandbox o algo mas libre donde puedas construir tu la base, pero hasta donde yo he visto no es así. Todos los objetos tienen unas físicas que intentan ser realistas, pero está mal desarollado y es una pesadilla en si mismo haciendo que toda acción sea muy torpe.
Te puedes hechar unas risas si no te lo tomas muy en serio y en la carrera espacial hay una opción de multiplayer, pero no es un juego recomendable, y desde hace una año o mas, la última fue por finales del 2017

author: {'steamid': '76561198031956067', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 20156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10397, 'last_played': 1663476634}
review: it has its ups and downs. but i like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976995326', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2957, 'last_played': 1615983628}
review:
Nada me duele más que votar negativo este juego. Soy fan de bohemia desde que sacaron el OP flashpoint junto con codemasters y hasta la fecha he tenido todos sus títulos. La idea fue genial y más para un amante del espacio como yo, el juego prometía, podría ser épico y algo único en su género, pero no. El juego final no deja de ser una versión alfa camuflada, llena de bugs, con optimización pésima y a la que le faltan características por todos lados. Parece ser que se les fueron ocurriendo ideas que desviaron el juego de su plan original y al final no terminaron ni una cosa ni la otra. Con el tiempo el motor ha ido quedándose anticuado y el juego ha sido abandonado al final. 

Me gustaría recomendar este juego, aunque fuese para promover el género espacial, pero no puedo, mi recomendación es que no se compre ni aunque bajase a 5€. Han estafado a sus fans y compradores. Debería ser delito y dudo que vuelva a comprar nada más de Bohemia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053809870', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1672874237}

author: {'steamid': '76561198202330038', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1664965324}
review:
To jest jedyna gra którą uwielbiam a zarazem nienawidzę przez tą spora ilość bugów.
Można by powiedzieć 1000 sposobów na buga:
- Po cutscence moje trzymane narzędzie znika. Wczytuję ostatni zapis
- w śluzie łazika niechcący wyżuciłem skafander na podłogę przez którą przeleciał. Wczytuję ostatni zapis
- przyciski do drzwi łazika przestają działać. Wczytuję ostatni zapis.
No coż mimo to wcale się nie poddaję bo gra mega mi się podoba.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028333111', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1482890860}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056696909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 543183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6394, 'playtime_at_review': 94360, 'last_played': 1710788430}
review:
Take On Mars by Bohemia Interactive is the best most intense realistic first-person game I have ever played, and I would say that it is my FAVORITE of all time.

The solitude, the consistency of play, the urgency of survival, the limitations of equipment, challenges of contruction, the game atmosphere (darkness/breathing)... all contribute to a an edge of your seat experience that you won't be able to leave!

I've been PC gaming since Megafortress, Freddy Pharkas Frontier Pharmacist, F-15 Strike Eagle III, Wolfenstein 3-D, Hexen, Return to Zork, Rise of the Triads, and DOOM in 1994.  Recent favouries include Farming Simulator 2011, 2013, 2015, 2017 (all with mod community), X-Beyond the Frontier et al family of games, Arma family of games, The Sims 2/3/4 family of games, Need For Speed family of games, MineCraft, and many many more, but Take On Mars takes the cake... Take on Mars is undoubtedly THE *BEST* and personally most enjoyable game I've ever played.

I've been playing my own Take On Mars copy offline since January of 2018.  I finally decided to connect to STEAM for multiplayer in June, and in only four months I've spent 2000 hours playing Take On Mars (since I connected to STEAM in June 2018).  95% of that time has still been single player games.

There are problems with the game, yes... I won't list them, but I've seen them all, and I have found workarounds for them myself... I had extensive problems for two months on Win10 (that da*n spontaneous upgrade from Win8.1) but after formatting my drive and reinstalling Win8.1PRO it has worked wonderful !!  I never have lockups or crashes, and I can immerse myself in Take on Mars for 8 hours straight without any problems.

The forums have been a valuable resource, and Mr. Monochrome is always there to non-judgementally answer a question, no matter how primary or complicated the question may be.  Mr. Monochrome's dedication is obvious, and I am 1st runner up.

Look at the history of Bohemia Interactive... they would loose investors and funding by missing deadlines because Take on Mars wasn't ready to be released... it took years... I can appreciate the LOVE that has gone into this game.  On the other side of that coin is Rockstar Games <sic>.

To anyone that were involved in the development, release, and support of Take On Mars... I salute you all, for a job very well done.

I am in your debt.  Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025662949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2673, 'last_played': 1493233825}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998338718', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6256, 'last_played': 1581040195}
review:
I had great hopes for this game but time flies. With almost 1 year without any update, not even a single news you can't deny, this game was abandonned unfinished.

Graphic bugs, unfinished gameplay, broken campain, unplayable multiplayer. Some release it was, not even a stable beta.

In the end, it turn out it was some sort of scam. But Bohemia Interactive accustomed us with this business model (Arma II, DayZ...).

I'm sad to be finaly forced to say that I can not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418911718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3303, 'last_played': 1691148939}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048929723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1540502999}
review:
Si vous hésitez à vous procurer ce jeu, un conseil : PASSE TON CHEMIN.

"Take on Mars" est une daube sans nom.
Pas mis a jour depuis fin 2017, buggé jusqu'aux menus, et j'en passe.
Ce jeu avait du potentiel pour les fans de Mars et de l'exploration spatiale. Malheuresement, le jeu est mort et les devs très loin du projet.

RIP in peace Take on Mars

author: {'steamid': '76561197981932421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4317, 'last_played': 1570362310}
review: So viel Potenzial. Doch leider so verschwendet. Immer wieder gaben wir Take on Mars eine Chance. Doch immer wieder wurden wir enttäuscht, da nichts reibungslos funktionierte. Das letzte was passierte war: Wir wollten die Luftschleuse des shuttles öffnen. Diese entschloss sich dazu einmal kräftig zu zucken und dann mit Mach 4 in den Boden zu rammen. Wirklich schade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400681486', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1925, 'last_played': 1674136583}
review:
很好的一个游戏，目前人物剧情已经通关，探测车任务不想玩，太无聊了。
编辑器玩的感觉也有一点够了。希望出一些新的地图及其装备。
另外游侠上面可以下载中文补丁，可以打到目前的版本上，不过汉化的不彻底，但是不影响正常玩。
还有最重要的一点，希望官方能够出中文版本，谢谢。

我们需要中文，
We need Chinese，
Nous avons besoin de chinois，
 نحن بحاجة إلى  الصينية ，
Wir brauchen chinesisch，
私たちは中国語が必要とします，

author: {'steamid': '76561198050219877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 30931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26533, 'last_played': 1580330549}
review:
It's a bit rough around the edges, but it's a pretty good game. People on the workshop usually make up for the sparse updates. The community here is great, and to the people who say "This game doesnt even start", or "The UI is totally bugged!", you rarely ever find a case on the steam community or forums that haven't already dealt with the issue. It's not the simplest of fixes, but it fixes it. Like i said, it's not a finished product by a long shot, but that shouldn't deter you from getting the game for it's existing features, including:
[list]
[*] Vehicles
[*] Bugs that actually make the game a bit more fun to play, and is a shame when they are patched (For instance, being able to break newton's first law and fly around everywhere by propsurfing. Those were the good old days, flying around at like Mach 7 around the map)
[*] Working multiplayer
[*] Resource Mining
[*] Custom Habitat Construction
[/list]

In summary: It's an unfinished game, but it's a cool game nonetheless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015252766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1517760806}
review:
The problem with this game is, that it just is not a finished product. There is really no finished game mechanics or storyline whatsoever, just a bunch of random missions that let's you play some scenarios. 
The gameplay itself is very clunky and unpolished also.
I really liked the premise of a realistic space game, however, this is just ridiculous, what they put out here.
And that comes from a huge fan of sci-fi and manned space exploration.

A huge disappointment, stay away from this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022648306', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1537248054}
review:
This game looked like it could be a load of fun, but instead it was nothing more than an unfinnished mess and was/is loaded with bugs that make the game crash way to often and not at all fun to play. 
The story has limited instruction as to what you need to do next to live, and is laggy at best even with a high end machine like I have. 
The graphics are sub-par at best and the ability to move around is not even there, its like you are moving in sludge. 
nothing feels smooth and or enjoyable. it's instead a hastle and a stresser.

IMHO, Don't buy this game until the studio does some much needed work and improvments. At the moment it a no go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291465472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 24266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1665421928}
review:
Nach gut 200 h ist es noch immer sehr Spannend und angenehm zum spielen, habe mitlerweile erfahren das man wenn man mit dem Roover so weit wie möglich fährt von der Welt runterfällt, war echt witzig! Aber man stirbt dann einfach wenn man nach 7 min freien fall auf den boden prallt. Mein Vorschlag für ein Update: Baut doch Space X Starship oder generell die Racketen von Space X ein das währe mega und würde dem Spiel eine neue Aera bringen. Nach gut 50 h spielzeit muss ich sagen, ich mag es immer noch. Die Shortround gamer könnten dieses spiel hassen weil es sehr komplex ist also ein SIMULATION nicht ein spiel ist. Dadurch das die Simulaton komplex ist muss man viel studieren, was ja kein problem ist der der menschliche organismus hat ein GEHIRN ZUM BRAUCHEN. Einer der besten und realistischen Weltraum-Simulation. Die Story ähnelt sich ein wenig von dem Film (der Marsianer). Die Grafik ist sehr gut und Positiv für mich. Dieses Spiel empfehle ich , wenn man auf Weltraumsimulationen steht. Die Steuerung könnte noch ein Problem verursachen, denn es ist nicht leicht, dies zu verstehen. Mann ist auf der Erde, im Orbit der Erde , auf dem Planeten Mars, dem Mond und sogar auf einem Mond vom Jupiter. Man kann ebenfals im Asteorieden Gürtel zwischen dem Mars und Jupiter eine Raumsonde bewegen. Es gibt auch ein Uboot auf dem Mond des Jupiter wo man ebenfals steuern kann.
Oh habe ich auch erwähnt das man verschiedenste Roover auf dem Mars fahren kann? Und einen SELBER BAUEN? Sag mir ein Spiel dass das nicht kann. TAKE ON MARS IST EINZIGARTIG

author: {'steamid': '76561198049303139', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1615229773}
review:
This game sells on potential and nothing more, and Bohemia does nothing with that potential. It could be a great game if it was more polished and they actually let you do whatever you wanted, but it's not.

This game's level editor is atrocious. It is nothing like ARMA, this uses a different engine, and the base building is borderline impossible. I bought this expecting it to have issues, but with a level editor figured I could make my own stuff.

No. You can't. I'm not even sure if I'll get my refund because it took me several wasted hours just to TRY to figure things out, but oh well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072000556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1182, 'last_played': 1709405466}
review:
EDIT: The game doesnt save properly so you're not going to make much progress. 

This game is actually really awesome. It's similar in playstyle to "The Forest", almost like Gary's Mod. Except on Mars. There is a bit of a learning curve but just stay with it and follow the instructions on - screne. This is like the second half of Kerbal Space Program. You dont have to worry about getting to Mars, all you need to do is design what you want to land there and a cut-scene shows your flight to Mars and your landing. There are tech / research trees for you to buy parts to upgrade from a simple landing bouy - looking probe, to landers similar to Phoenix or Insight, to rovers similar to Spirit / Opportunity all the way to a rover similar to Curiosity. Graphics are beautiful. You can take photos and conduct experiments with the rovers and completed experiment goals for different areas on Mars give you monetary rewards, which you use to purchase new technology. There are also a few other planetary bodies you get to explore, like the Moon, Deimos (Mars's moon), and a few others. Very fun and I would recommend it if you want a solid science game where you can learn quite a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026055118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1693080814}
review:
Just as I expected, Take On Mars has a great balance between "space simulator" and "first-person adventure". Too bad it's not getting more content, but I guess the Workshop would do.

PROS:
-Very good and balanced gameplay
-Ambient music is perfect
-The "Space Program" and "Manned Mision" are both interesting, and the "Europa" scenarios are a very good addition
-The graphics are optimized, no problem there

CONS:
-Still buggy, need more fixes
-Content is scarce, but the scenarios are good on themselves
-Feels like a beta, a very good one, but a beta nonetheless. More updates would be very nice


It's a very well-made sim, it just needs a little more support from Bohemia to become a much better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008218741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 51372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45782, 'last_played': 1619062438}
review:
What is take on Mars?

A space simulation/survival game with two parts. A robotic rover portion and manned mission (sandbox survival). Plus a short single player campaign that acts as a quasi tutorial.

Unlike the majority of survival games this will appeal more so to players that have a facination with space exploration in a near future environment.  

There are no space spiders jumping out of the ground forcing you to unload mags of bullets. Or hyper warp drives zorching you across the galaxy. This is as close to a simulation that takes place on the moon, mars and europa that you can find out there. You can explore real life locations on these celestial bodies.

 It is not an adrenaline rushed experience, but an immersive adventure using some of the possible neartech required to explore Mars.

With this expectation, TOKM delivers, plus with the mod support provided by the community there is a lot of tailored experiences.

review: Although I feel this game was released from early access way too early, I still find this game fun. It's also quite educational. The unmanned campaign does a very good job of providing information about Mars as you discover them. The discovery is great! The manned missions are fun in their own right. Granted, most complain about the physics bugs here and they would be correct. Despite all that, I can say I'd recommend it. It definitely is not for everyone. It's more of a simulator than a game. Keep that in mind as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124467435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1527274187}
review:
If you like Space, Science and/or Kerbal Space Program you can't not like this game. It's interesting and "Fun" in that nerdy role play as a Flight Director or Astronaut kinda way. It does get repetitive especially in the initial stages of the Career Mode if you start off with the Robotic missions. Endlessly launching porbe after probe until you have enough of a budget to research all of the Tech needed to build a rover and then Launch it. 

It is cool that you can build and test any probe,lander or rover you build in the "Mars Yard" before you launch so even if you lack the funds to launch a wheeled vehicle you can break up the monotony by zipping around practicing your driving and science skills, after you have researched the small rover, until you can build up your budget to get one on Mars. Also, the graphics are killer. The Mars environment was wonderfully done and very realistic even the weather. They also have other bodies in the solar system you can check out including Europa

I haven't gotten into the manned missions yet so can't speak to much to that; but I did do the training program and it looks pretty cool. Again I have a feeling it will get repetitive fast but is fun while it lasts. 

The game is still a bit buggy but nothing compared to what you might see in earlier comments. One particularly entertaining bug makes it rain inside the Mission Control building if you come back inside from the test yard and it was raining outside. Either that or they put that in game because the building is supposed to not have a roof ;) Other than that I have not experienced any major bugs that would turn me off from wanting to play the game and it seems very stable. Not one CTD or freeze in several hours of play. I still get frequent crashes in KSP and that game has been out for years. 

They (Bohemian Interactive) brought something different and entertaining as will as educational. It's not your run of the mill strap on as many rockets as you can and see how fast you can get to Mars. It is more realistic and practical. I may have been a little miffed if I paid 60 bucks for this game but for around $25 I am getting more than my monies worth.  I give the game as a whole a B- and Bohemian an A+ for effort. And once Modders start digging into this game I think we will get some really cool stuff out of it. They have it set up with an editor already built into the the game to create and share basic missions and scenarios so like KSP this game will only get better with time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023520785', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6886, 'last_played': 1511800493}
review:
火星探査をテーマにした大変硬派なゲームです。
無人機による探査と有人探査のパートに分かれていています。
無人探査はロボットアームを操作して火星の大気や地質を調べていくのですがアームの操作に繊細微妙な調整を要求され、さらに地面にこすると計器が破損する場合もあるのでかなり神経をすり減らします。
有人探査パートは一転して資源を集め3Dプリンターを駆使し様々な建造物を作っていくサバイバルゲームに変貌します。
探査船が不時着、大破して唯一生き残った主人公が火星から脱出するという某映画を彷彿させるストーリーが展開されます。
ゲーム全体としてバグが多く、無人探査では一部マップで探査スタートと同時に地面にめり込んでしまって進行不可になったり、ミッションマーカーが表示されなくて途方にくれたりと火星探査は多難を極めます。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969809274', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2323, 'last_played': 1664278620}
review:
{This is about the robotics part of the game and NOT the First person manned part.)
I really love this game and this is the first time I've played it since it's been out of beta, BUT, seriously, you have to fix the wheel breakage on the rovers, It was bad enough in the beta with a rover costing over 12 million but I think it's gotten worse with small rovers.
1 Wheel breaking can bankrupt you in the game early on.

Going forwards and backwards whilst turning is only ok (breakage wise), but turning on the spot is almost instant rover wheel death, even on a flatish surface.
If the built Real rovers with this strength then it's a wonder any of them survive 5 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028139069', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1494448353}
review:
So Bohemia released this... "game" and it had it's bugs but the concept was cool.
Then Bohemia stopped update the game for a year. Well, you know it's early access, things take time, they'll fix the bugs later etc.
And yes they started to work with it again, introduced a (short & bad) story mode, astronaut mode, multiplayer. Bugged to all hell but exciting!

And now it's out of early access but the laundry list of borderline game breaking bugs are still ingame? Not to mention the multiplayer is... arse.

And now it's been a year since the release and they've released a free Europa update 6 months ago. The bugs are all accounted for, the multiplayer is unstable to hell and back.
They fixed F all for a year, probably working on other things and having this as a back-burner project where they throw people at their studio with free time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032929103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1540923116}
review:
So 10 hours in (manned missions). Yes bugs... savegame got corrupt but you should save often anyway. ..did explode when my helmet grazed the window... i am entertained. Truck jumped and landed on side ..dead.. 10 seconds after i got it... meh.. bugs seems to have stayed in the first 2-3 hours of the game..so hang in there... but apart from that...

I like it. Got it on sale, and i would call it a steal.

Pros:
Building machines, lots different types of resources,  ok story line. feel the stress of cold, oxygen, sleep, food etc.
havent even tried the probe missions.

Cons:
Night = cant sleep/wait to daytime and gets lost in utter darkness
(christ... fix navigation/create waypoints).
Janky physics when moving things ex. cables.
----------------
Sounds 4/10, gfx 6/10, Good kind of stress 10/10


save your game, save your game, save your game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198006582969', 'num_games_owned': 1273, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1520394301}
review:
[u]Early Review, may update as I get further into the game.[/u]

Great Concept, Follows SemiRealistic to Realistic Space Exploration concepts.

Game could be divided into 3 main parts in a sense, 2 large parts of which are the single player chapters of robotic and manned space program missions, last part being the multiplayer:

- Rover/Robotics section is neat and superbly done in my opinion.

- Manned Mission are fun and well realized, but suffer from needing a bit of extra polish from what I can see.

- Have yet to try Multiplayer but the fact it's even in the game is a plus. Looks like only Manned multiplayer, but it's got competitive and co-op.

The game also has modding possibilities and 9 default scenarios not attached to the main game. (Have not dug into what mods are around yet, but the editor seems to work.)

Currently having a blast in the Space Program Robotics chapter. Loving that I get to manage the program budget/research and all. I wouldn't say it's as fleshed out as the mission/research/reputation system of Kerbal Space Program, but if you're like me and like that sort of thing; it's there. And it helps tie the multitude of premade missions together. Win Win.

[u]Bugs:[/u] 

Haven't found nearly as many bugs as some reviews are hinting at, but I'm not far enough into the game to pass judgement yet. 

I can say that a lot of the physics/interface issues I've had so far stemmed more from lack of patience and not understanding the pace of gameplay at first. If you are looking for a solid, fast paced action game this isn't what you're looking for. Patience and deliberation can be key in this game, and at least some of the bugs I've run into stemmed from a Manned mission where I tried to do it as fast as I could. (Madly clicking the cycle airlock button and running around? You're going to have a bad time.)

I will say that the Rover/Robotics seciton has considerably less bugs, but I think that part of the game has been around a lot longer and was patched considerably more.

[u]Recommendation:[/u]

So far I recommend and hope Bohemia Interactive revisits the realistic space exploration game genre again in the future! This one may not be perfect, but I think it's worth the full price of admission. [spoiler]And hey, if you can nab it on sale, even better! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197963216300', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2309, 'last_played': 1676152612}
review: This game has driven my blood pressure through the roof.  I love the concept.  But after ten hours of play, now, the physics engine is so borked that I even die when I lay down to sleep in the MML, and airlocks on the MDV will not equalize to enter or exit.  I've actually gotten stuck in the airlock three times now.  They only have one dev working on bugs, and they are at least six months behind on fixes.  Don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045704578', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2032, 'last_played': 1521189758}
review:
FUN GAME BUT HAS ISSUES. There is a lot of depth to the game play and crafting system. In general I think the game was done well however it still has plenty of issues that need addressed. I hope the developer will continue to polish the game though some reviewers believe it will not be getting further updates. It is playable in its present state however you may want to save often. 

	As far as the issues go, let me start by saying I am running a well above average rig with a 4790k overclocked to 4.7ghz, SSD games storage, and a GTX 1070 Strix. Even with this strong hardware I had some issues with running the game maxed out. Given the quality of graphics this was surprising and shows that the developer did not spend enough time optimizing. I tried to run vsycn to smooth things out but it just made things a jittery, screen tearing mess. I was experienced typically between 30-65 fps. The 30 fps lows happened after there were machines built. I also ran into issues with collision and interaction. One time I accidentally dropped my space suit when trying to put it on in a tent when some sort of collision issue happened and the suit went flying some where outside the tent. There were some weird collision problems with movable items like steps on the truck that broke of when an item decided to make an amplified collision that I was carrying or the storage door on the buggy that decided to close while I was loading and broke off. These was not the only collision issue but it was the worst ones that happened and I had to reload a save to continue playing. I also experienced problems with item interaction. Some items refused to interact on the buggy unless I moved it to a different position. That was the worst interaction bug but I did experience some others that were not as bad.  Bugs and lack of optimization did have some impact on enjoyment and overall immersion for me.

	If you can look past the bugs it is a fun game. I picked up for $13.49 at 50% off and feel I got my moneys worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991992521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1521929245}
review:
Gekauft habe ich einen Rover-Simulator für Nerds. Und dann kam "The Martian" ins Kino...
Nun ist es ein ungarer Mix aus Rover- und Landerbau, Basenbau, Survival. Von allem ein bisschen, nichts davon wirklich gut umgesetzt und zusammenhanglos aneinandergereiht. Das ganze wirkt so, als ob versucht wurde, JEDEN Wunsch der Community irgendwie da reinzupressen, um möglichst viele Kunden zu gewinnen. 

Wirklich schade...

author: {'steamid': '76561198020149761', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1637665781}
review:
I must say that the ambition this studio has taken on, is grander than anything i have seen. The subject of actually managing all aspects of taking on Mars is covered. The preparation, learning the controls, and finally one day actually going there, through hard missions, and atmosphere and menus of adjusting your own made mars-walker... It is all here. They even tried to make it more simplistic than when i discovered the game many years ago. I played it way more than 4 hours ;)
Don't expect a rush.. Expect to invest time... It is not a speed game.
It is not simple walking and building a base, no you start from earth, developing whatever mars mission you want. It is this grand a a scale you have to be thinking about.

You can imagine a game this scale has a lot of menus.

The grand scope this game covers is beyond me.  It is really immersive. Although:

First complaint: It asks you to read the tutorial very fast. Because a simulation to Mars is simple math to us all right? No. It hammers you with stuff that no one, apart from NASA could understand in this speed. Without doing a great job of explaining what the hell they are talking about. Sure the tutorial lets you show all that you need. (i am in from the beta, so a lot has improved) but it sure delves into names and menus so fast, you forget to even know what you are doing.
The tutorial is lacking. It's speech speed is too high. I found myself doing what i needed to do, without actually  ' getting' the purpose of all the different buildings. Without me given chance of recalibrating what i just read. Yes i know that a energy tube has to put in, before it works, but what is actually the function of the device, it was explained to me in a murdering 8 seconds of speech. But then the instruction was nowehere to be found. Or maybe, should i push the button again? Now i wonder. Really the narrator should slow down. Or a proper recall of what is said (especially in the robots district) would be nice.

I cannot stress enough, the amount of coverage this game has. It is truly beyond me. It is wonderful. And appreciated. Therefore certain aspects can be overlooked. It tries everything. in one game. And it does quite a good job. I come to the wormhole in a second.

Second complaint: Yes, there are some bugs. Which is totally fine. The amount of creativity you have as a player is fantastic. And bugs arise whith every creative spin a player takes. I understand that they went for total control of the player, thus also leaving a lot to be desired in bug control. What i mean with a lot of aspects, and player control: Eventually you are going to make your own Rover onto Mars and controlling its behaviour through modules you have researched. This is just a small facet of the options. You can also time your missions, and what not. It is out of scale this game. I kid you not.
Which is grand, truly. So bugs arise, of course. I won't say the studio is small, i have no idea.
My instinct tells me, they wanted to put all ideas out there, and cared about  for bugs later. 
My opinion.

 I saw in the tutorial a bug that the chopper was spinning. (it happened every time) I needed to get into the Chopper ( ;) )  but the choppa was spinning, and i waited until the guy next to it was beheaded, but of course not, it is not that game. These bugs should definately be adressed. 
Which brings me to the third complaint. 

I have the same face, as every effin instructor in the tutorial. Really... That is just cheap.
I understand this is not the meat of the game. But really, you lose your Base (no pun intended) of fans, when every instructor, even yourself has the same face... Hit C next to an instructor and you get what i mean.

Furthermore:

The physiscs, i feel in the game are ok. But they damage the game as well. I tried to put some tubes back on the spool. And the whole spool when haywire and shot in every direction.  ( I didn't select the spool, but  another tube...) An explosion i hadn't foreseen, putting a cable back on a spool. Other things occurred, like driving back (yes back camera was on) And the starting point of the Buggy, you would think was ok to just drive back...nooo... I was caught in the wall next to it... and tumbled outside...  Thse little annoyances, with a game that wants you to have total control of your mission make like you don't have control at all.

This is the wormhole: A game that wants you to prepare for a misson, and suddenly the game mechanics send it to Hell. I cannot stress enough how injuring this is to a game.
I forgive this game. Because you can save it!

I blame it on the overuse of Physiscs in the game. I've had  that i stood on a tube, wanted to coinnect it. And i went flying, and the tube started gavocking my set up base. 
Because it couldn't find rest. Like a lot of physics systems need to rely on.

Boom, missions lost.

Rule one of gaming:" I need to know, my simple caring for my own survival is reckognized by the game. It may be hard, but when chosen properly, i should survive."


A game that puts so much effort in realism should adress these issues.

My overall view is... my God what a grand scale, and my God, why are the tiny little annoyances not adressed.
This game is overall grand, it let's you really emerge into the Space aera. But lacks in its polish..
The polish mostly being, physics engine.
(Goddamn you container, get back in the box)

Which is fine... I am glad such a projext exists. This is truly a game beyond itself. And for what it is worth.
It delivers. What fronts does it deliver?
Well you are there from day one, you develop what you want, you have a budget, you have certain goals, and the path towards it, is not simple. But very doable. It is a hard planet, u understand that they chose for the physics to get out of hand. (to be honest, if you let it take more time, it will be fine..i was a bit speedy)

This is a game not to rush, it is not that game.
Putting a tube into a machine, which you just 3d-printed. takes finesse


Maybe i saw it just like any other game, whoch it surely isn't
It is greater than that.

But don't expect a polished journey.. From  the game itself i mean.
I had one crash in the tutorial, which bugged me.

This is a game to care for. Which gentle hunongous gloves.\


Conclusion:


The very realistic nature of the simulation is truly amazing, it lets you be NASA in all aspects, from time cojtrol, misison control towards being a pilot, or even the robot onto the very planet. 
It is all up to you to make the mission succesful.
If it only was not for the (sometimes) very buggy nature of Space, the game covers very well (in my opinion)
From the tutorial, towards the controlling centre.
I took the misscgievings as i did my blessings. I never expected for my missions to succed in the first place... 

I truly love ambitious projects.
This one succeeded already.
A little polish would be nice.

Kind regards,
Keimpe

author: {'steamid': '76561198017688025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3387, 'last_played': 1614549244}
review:
There are still major bugs; However I will recommend this game because the scenario and various missions force you to understand some astronaut job requirement and this special way of thinking : mission first, don't loose time, no side quest, don't forget anything, try to reduce your moves, save fuel/energy, etc. My advice : save the game each time you plan on getting to sleep, as laying down may move part of your body oustide of the vehicle/tent/habitat. The Mars terrain maps available are taken from real topographical data. (real places on Mars). Chemical reactions are oversimplified versions of real working ones that will make living on Mars possible. Like racing drivers can be selected by video games, maybe if this Mars Simulation genre is pushed further, we will be able to train the astronaut theory/course. I wish for more. 
My list of bugs :
- running with a cable do not stop
- laying down lead to death
- suit patch / repair does not work

Overall this game is more realistic than a movie like "The Martian" (really you don't repair a Mars habitat with a tarp) and this game gives the thrill of "being there".

review: 이건 쓰래기입니다. 유로파 업뎃했길래 인내신을 가지고 플레이 해봤는데 게임내내 욕이 절로나올정도로 넘쳐나는 버그에 사용자는 엿먹으라고 만들어논 인터페이스하며 뭔놈의 게임하면서 전선이 제일 무서운건 처음이네요 전선들고 10미터만 달려가면 어디론가 내동댕이쳐져서 죽지를 않나 착륙하고나서 기본물자 정리하는거만 빨라도 2시간은 잡아야하고정리좀하고 뭐좀 만들어 볼까해서 기기배치하고 와이어링하다가 터무니없는 버그로 팅기거나 죽기일쑤..결정적으로 할게없어요 컨텐츠가 빈약한 정도가 아니라 베이스만들면 땡임 .빈약한 컨텐츠 숨겨볼라고 플레이 타임만 느리게 만들어논 희대의 개쓰레기임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052302367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1515960262}
review:
Solide Single Player Kampangne, hab das Spiel nur für die bemannte Marsmisson gekauf und das hat sich meiner Meinung nachl gelohnt. Ne hübsche Story die man in ca. 6-8 Stunden(wenn man nicht so blöd ist wie ich XD) durch gespielt hat. Schwer ist die Kampange nicht, man muss nur wissen das "N" Nightvision ist. Zusätzlich sollte man tun was einem gesagt wird und nicht anfangen eine Base zu bauen die völlig übertrieben und unnötig ist ;D

Als nächstes werde ich mir die Szenarien anschauen, die scheinen auch viel versprechend zu sein.

Der Teil mit den Rovern interessiert mich eigentlich nicht daher kann ich dazu nichts sagen.

Letzte Anmerkung: Achtung das Spiel schluckt viele Resourcen und fängt nach und nach immer mehr das Ruckeln an! Muss man mit leben können, habe leider keinen Weg gefunden das zu umgehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066102827', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1508, 'last_played': 1656992656}
review:
Le jeu a la base est interessant , cepandant, pour plusieurs point je mes un pouce rouge :( malgrer sont potentiel et SURTOUT venant de Bohemia Interactive que se travail est pas si extraordinaire que l'ont crois.


Point positif : Acheter le jeu pour les connaitres :)
Ingénérie et machinerie ses sa coche j'adore énormément.

Point Négatif : 

-Carte FLAT  8x8 , j'ai jamais vue une planet qui n'etais pas ronde :(
-Mal optimiser a mon gout.
-AUCUN lien entre Terre - Espace et mars (pourquoi faire des systemes de décollage si ont ne peut naviger entre les planets et l'espaces ?
- 2 mode séparer , j'ai pas vue la possibilité de controler la ""robotique"" directement depuis un vaisseaux sur une planetes ou meme dallez vers l'espaces pour en prendre le controle , ca ferais plus que gameplay direct a mon avis.
- Se sont les "experts" en moddings qui garnisse le jeu mais Bohemia Interactive se fiche un peut de se jeu .


- DÉBUTÉ EN 2013 , sortie sur steam en 2017 , sérieux a 34.99$ CAD a se prix , 4ans de dev et juste ca ? sérieux venant de Bohemia Interactive ses Mmmm un  peut "merdique" sachant que ont vois des bases de arma dedans.
Je l'ai eu a rabais a 15$ et encore je trouve ca trop cher pour se qui aurrais pu être créer.(Je m'attend pas a avoir un jeu donner non plus) mes a se prix la , passer votre chemin.(j'ai pas fais de demande de remboursement pcq j'aime le concepte et le contenue de base mais bon , il aurrais pu faire 100x mieu en 2017 a telle point qu'il a plein de concurant qui ont fais mieu en + fantasique que réel mais la base de l'espace et planete ses justement de pouvoir naviger entre , pourquoi faire un MAV(si jme trompe pas ) pour sortir de la planete pour ce faire dire ,ses finie et tu na meme pas controler le vaisseau en mode manuel , rien de "logique" enfin bref, 34.99$ avec le potentiel qui aurrais pu avoir et faire de se jeu le meilleur de sa catégorie il ont rien fais et font leur argent sur ca et un autre pour payer le dev de arma 3 ses clair .... voila se que j'en pense.

- Francais ? y'en n'a pas , mais il sont capable de faire Arma 3 en plusieurs langue ..... (J'ai rien contre l'anglais mais quand tu sais qu'il ont les capacité a le faire , pourquoi ne pas le faire avec les autres jeux ?....

author: {'steamid': '76561198172179098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1697284624}
review: Игру советую всем кто интересуется космосом, наукой и т. п. Некоторые аспекты конечно будут по началу сложны игроку , но в них через время ты быстро разбираешься и осваиваеваишься . Дополнительный балл за советскую АМС "Марс-3" , которая совершила первую мягкую посадку на планету Марс . Небольшой минус за отсутствие русского языка .

author: {'steamid': '76561198064353150', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1518307064}
review: A lot of the reviews I see for this game complain about how the game is abandoned and/or filled with game breaking bugs. The game is finished stop complaining. I can't speak for the people who did have problems, but I completed most of the unmanned chapter and finished the manned portion with a corrupted save and one crash. That was annoying, but I got 20 hours of entertainment for 14 dollars. It gets tedious at times, but overall I enjoyed the time I spent playing. If you like realistic space simulation games, then give this one a try. If it crashes frequently then just ask for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994218699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6311, 'last_played': 1708204314}
review:
Das Spiel sollte man von verschiedenen Seiten betrachten. Es macht irrsinnig viel Spaß und kann einem den letzten Nerv rauben. Wer tolle Grafik mag, Fan ist von Spielen in einer (wahrscheinlich) sehr realistischen Atmosphäre oder einfach mal nur mal Mark Watney aus dem Film "Der Marsianer" sein wollte, kommt streckenweise auf seine Kosten. 
Ich verfolge das Entstehen des Spiels quasi von Beginn an. Seit Release vermisse ich allerdings einen Suvival Mode. Es gibt dort im Workshop zum Glück gute Abhilfe. Der Editor lässt sich eher hakelig bedienen, wenn man den Dreh raus hat und genug Geduld, kann man sicherlich auch damit seine Freude haben. Die jetzt eingebaute Kampange macht schon recht viel Spaß, nur ist sie relativ kurz. Da man jedoch dazu neigen möchte, diese mehrmals zu beginnen um vor Einbruch der ersten Nacht Essentielles erledigt zu haben, bekommt man so auch einige Spielstunden zusammen. Anstatt sich auf Bugs zu konzentrieren wird auch gerne neuer Content hinzugefügt, auf den sicherlich niemand gewarten hat. 
Ein großer Kritikpunkt meinerseits: Kamerafokusierung! Stellt Euch vor Ihr sitzt in einem Auto und könnt nur bildlich scharf erkennen, was sich im Fahrzeug befindet, wärend Ihr gerade auf Exploration seid. Alles außerhalb ist quasi unscharf. Auch die Suche in den Einstellungen hatte keinen Erfolg gebracht. Vielleicht liegt es auch an mir.
Es gibt einen Multiplayer Modus. Ich habe noch nie mehr als vielleicht 10 User gleichzeitig online gesehen, jedoch kann man mit seinen Freunden oder auch Unbekannten einige Zeit auf dem Mars, dem Mond, in der ISS, der Erde und einigem mehr verbringen. Wenn ich 10 Punkte vergeben könnte würde ich wahrscheinlich 7 geben, da ich aber dem Spiel und der Idee dahinter sehr aufgeschlossen gegenüber bin, ist es meinerseit - trotz aller Abstürze/Bugs/Nervmomenten - eher eine 8. Ich möchte lieber keine Spielvergleiche machen. Es gibt viele Early Access Spiele, die seit Jahren noch nicht den Releasestatus erreicht haben und fast schon wieder in der Versekung verschwinden, da sich anscheinend die Entwickler ..... nee, lassen wir das lieber! Ihr wisst was gemeint ist. Hier haben wir wenigstens ein Release!
Hier haben wir ein mitlerweile recht gut spielbares, realistisch angehauchtes Game, was dem Survivalgenre mal auf den Zahn fühlt. Mitunter hatte ich schon das Gefühl in diesen verdammten Raumanzügen könne einem die Luft ausgehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031052687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 15288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10249, 'last_played': 1651255133}
review:
Take on Mars est un jeu formidable par son concept de survie sur Mars, c'est un complément du jeu Kerbal qui lui est plus basé sur la conception de fusées et de voyages sur des planètes mais non basé sur la survie sur celles-ci. Bien sûr Take on Mars n'est pas encore abouti car il plante très souvent obligeant à sauvegarder toutes les cinq minutes sinon c'est toute la progression qui est perdue. Ce point est vraimant dommage car c'est vraiment pénalisant pour la longévité du jeu si les concepteurs n'agissent pas rapidement sur ces problèmes récurants. 
Outre les scénarios de survie, il y a bien sûr la recherche robotique, l'envoi de rovers et landers pour étudier la surface de Mars, bref vous pouvez choisir entre ces deux options, recherche robotique ou colonisation humaine. A voir maintenent comment ce jeu sera corrigé et mis à jour par leurs concepteurs.
Ha oui, j'oubliais, on attend toujours la traduction en français! on n'est pas tous anglophones!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006260763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1543208632}
review:
Have mostly just played the unmanned section of the game logged a lot of offline hours. I studied planetary science in grad school and my advisor used to work for NASA and his big area was Mars, and Martian Meteorites. I do recommend the game it can be quite fun especially with all of the information that they give you on the different areas of Mars. I'm really hoping that with future updates they expand the regions that you are able to visit, would love to take a rover up around Olympus Mons, or down in Valles Marineris. It can be slow and tedious though, but at the same time most of the basic rovers do seem to move at about 0.5m/s which is decently generous on Bohemias side, since the Sojourner rover only moved at 0.01m/s and even Spirit and Opportunity only moved at about 0.05m/s and Curiosity (MSL) only does about 0.04m/s. Plus they let us control the rovers in real time instead of there being the control time delay as in real life.

Overall pretty decent game hopefully they just put some more time into everything and expand their explorable world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065518966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5015, 'last_played': 1498174191}
review:
Since this game has been released and its out of early access for a while now i have to give my opinion. 

I had no problem with the probe and roover part but when you get in manned missions or multiplayer it is full of bugs. One time you jump and get stuck the other you fall unconcious and die for absolutely no reason. Even in the scenario of manned mission i died because of the little poptent. In this little tent if you try to sleep in it without a suit your head gets outside and you die.

Also, as there is no other danger than the atmosphere this game get boring real quick.

This is a Bohemia interactive product. If you are a fan of the ARMA series and Dayz the "glitchyness" will not be alien to you. It seems to be a simillar engine. Its weird at first, yes... but then you kinda get it and start to understand it how to use it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253871173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1532121603}
review:
This game is the best space sim i ever played.
Some people say it's not optimized, but I got around 45 FPS on my GTX 960 card.
Also, there are minor glitches but nothing that spoiles the great gameplay.
The manned missions are great, feeling like i'm inside "Mars" the movie. Surviving after a crash being all alone.

If you're looking for a space sim that takes things serious, this is it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066990136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1274, 'last_played': 1513019636}
review:
Не знаю, чем не угодила эта игра многим, оставившим отзыв.
Игра очень интересная и расслабляющая. Состоит из 2-х глав. Первая - этап изучения Марса и подготовки к отправке туда человека. Мы начинаем с простой камеры, которая не может двигаться по поверхности планеты и даже повернуться в сторону. Потом улучшаем технологии, создаем новые аппараты. Каждая успешная экспедиция приносит дополнительное финансирование вашей космической программы и позволяет развиваться дальше. 
Вторая глава - будущее, в котором человек прилетел на Марс и старается всеми силами выжить там и изучитьтакую близкую и такую недоступную планету.
В общем, игра очень интересная, но в ней мало экшена. Если вам нравится космос и вы устали на работе - она для вас.

review:
Arma粉，冲着波西米亚来的。玩完训练任务忍不住评论一番，真的很棒，不需特别高的英文水平，但还是希望有官中。有许多致敬The Martain的地方，比如火星上没人能听到你的scream。拟真的太空探索，对未来的预演。趁半价还等什么？Airlock对我这种二货有点费劲，要多试几次才能打开，加减压需要时间，很真实.
追评，space program 载人部分任务4进行中.
用一个小时把机器装上cargo，再运回应急帐篷，睡了一觉，中间为了避免低温和太阳辐射翻了翻Datapad里面的文件，顺带自拍一张，又搬下来机器与储罐，正准备接电缆时，cargo上的left stairs 阻挡了我，轻轻一跃，0.4g之力！一片黑暗中传来玻璃碎裂的声音，让我感受到来自火星的恶意—take on mars，再一次提醒我波西米亚的硬（ni核（chun）
关键是还没法F12截屏k

author: {'steamid': '76561198040610649', 'num_games_owned': 1439, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1434522995}
review: This game had potential when I first saw it announced and that's what drew me to it, originally. However, upon actually playing it, I realized just how incredibly CONFUSING the game is. Definitely not something I'd advise anyone to purchase, unless you have the patience of a saint. Also bugs. Lots of bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970612305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2876, 'last_played': 1485227514}
review:
This is an underrated but also sadly under-developed game. The base mechanics for what could be an outstanding simulation and/or suvival experience.

I've on/off played this since it was first available and to be fair, its come a long way since it first set foot on mars, moving along nicely from unlimited, creative-mode style play to "proper" survival levels.

However- the learning curve is pretty steep at first and until you become familiar with it, it's menu system, mechanics and control style it can be a challenge.

Thankfully you get enough resources and time to easily be able to get self-sufficient, but I can almost guarantee your average person will come at least passingly close to courting disaster before learning what's what.

Once that's done though? It's glorious. It's beautiful and has enough complexity in it to start to engage the more depth-seeking players out there that feel there isn't enough to keep them interested in other games. Heck, it's almost a mini-factorio to a certain degree, but just falls short.

Sadly development moves at sub-glacial speeds and there are long, long waits between any real milestones and performance is still pretty poor considering how long the game has been released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071830761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1558504052}
review: This is by far the most broken actually freakin released game that I have ever played.  I am a very patient person, but JESUS.  Really developers you thought that this was finished.  To begin with had the memory errors due to the fact that I am on a x64 system.  Fixed that with large memory allocation program I found online.  Then still not able to open the game unless running in developer mode.  Also I am running this on a very high end pc and tried on my alienware 15 laptop as well with gtx 1060 in the graphics extender same result.  Ok finally got in game doing the manned mission, between 5-10 frames with riddiculous head bobbing that makes you feel sea sick (and yes I turned it off in the settings).  The physics are complete crap placing things is just terrible.  I wanted to like this so bad the martian is one of  my favorite movies.  I made it to the section on the moon and tried to just refuel the damn rover and the physics got super glitchy and the oxygen tanks would not allow me to place them back in.  I at that point said F...it.  I really hope they can fix this.  I want it to be good so much, but right now it is just so unplayably bad.   I am going to keep it in my steam library with high hopes.  Fix this bohemiah

author: {'steamid': '76561198128470023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 3678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3499, 'last_played': 1480221343}
review:
Giving it a thumbs up because I have played it since the beginning, and the rover / lander (unmanned) part of the game was pretty well done.  Echoes real robotic mars missions in a lot of ways.

I was not too interested in the manned missions / base building parts because they didn't really do much with them...was a very slow work in progress.  Apparently that's still the case, hence the negative reviews.

Anyway...if you think of this only as a decent robotic mars mission game, good for educational purposes, then it's a winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037453426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13624, 'last_played': 1664910616}
review:
Csak azoknak akik elvakultan szeretik az űrkutatást és az ehhez kapcsolódó játékokat! Sajnálatosan a Bohémia ezen játéka is iszonyatosan bugos, a játék motor optimalizálatlan, a terület nagyon kicsi, a grafika nem hozza a színvonalat a kért gépigény mellet.
Az egyszemélyes kampányát inkább többen kellene játszani, viszont a multit meg egyedül érdemes(mert az is bugos!), és ez rávilágít a managmant hozzá nem értéséhez.
Egyszóval nagyon jó élményt tud nyujtani ha a dühítő hibák felett szemet hunyunk, és vesszük a fáradtságot, hogy magunktól rájöjjünk mit is kell és hová, mert a tutorial ebben sem segít, mivel igen felszínes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 190174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1464, 'playtime_at_review': 4683, 'last_played': 1710781788}
review:
Take on Mars... scenárom a nápadom výnimočná hra ... stačilo ju dorobiť, tak ako ARMA II ktorá nepotrebovala ARMA III z kopou hlúpych DLC. Ako každá jedna od Bohemie. Firma na hry je Bohemia výnimočná ... ale od Flashpointu sa z ňou ťahajú zásadné chyby v hrách, človek čo si ich kúpil vie zhodnotiť o ktoré dedičné sa jedná - ANIMÁCIE vždy boli slabosťou, ROZMERY - okno voči kľačiacemu človeku, POHYB - medzi dverami - to sú tak staré chyby čo už mi starí viac ako 20 Flešpoinťáci počítame a sme už na nich zabudli :) 

To isté sa teraz vlečie aj v Take On Mars. V skafandri alebo bez je jedno a to isté. Scenárom - programovo je hra už teraz v test verzii 1.0.0007 solídne hrateľná. V test branch verzii 1.0.0010 je na tom ešte lepšie. 

V pirátstve viac ako 600 hodín na rozličných verziách na ktorých bola postavená moja lokalizácia do CZ a 65 hodín už v oficiálne ( tá hra stojí za kúpu). Neoľutujete. Ak si do toho stiahnete módy od Mr. Monochrome [Hood Certified]. Odporúčam.

Za mňa. +++

author: {'steamid': '76561198011513057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 7313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7153, 'last_played': 1511120958}
review:
I'm enjoying this game.  Went through the rover storyline til about 2/3rds into the research tree, when it finally got too repetitive.  Then I went through the whole manned mission storyline over a couple of days, and now I'm enjoying myself puttering around on the moon starting from scratch and working my way up.  Kind of a factorio or modded minecraft vibe.

I've had this game on "the shelf" for about 2.5 years before I finally started playing it this week.  I have to give serious props to the devs for sticking with quite a difficult programming feat until release, and not giving up in spite of all the negativity.   At better than $1 / hour, I've gotten my money's worth.

Just like Car Mechanic Simulator is Finnish patience simulator, this is martian patience simulator.  If you're an Overwatch kiddie with no patience or attention span this game isnt for you, dont bother.  The physics is finicky; your character loves to trip and knock himself out.  But you can learn to be careful and know what maneuvers are safe and what is going to get you killed (for starters, dont step on round things). 

Single player is fine.  Lan multiplayer is fine.  I cant speak to online multiplayer.  Networked physics is very difficult, think how hard it's been for the Space Engineers team, so I don't think you should go for this game if non-lan multiplayer is your only objective.  I hear Ark is a game, try that.  If you want to feel like you're on a mars mission all alone, this is your game.

review:
Definatly not worth full price. Seems like another cash grab. Sad thing is that the game has so much potential. It just needed more polish. Graphics are pretty good but still full of bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003234214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1507127376}
review:
The Silent Killer: or how I stopped worrying and love the free chemotherapy.

So the game has been out for a while now, and it's been 6 months since last update, so I'm considering this the final form of the game.

If you go outside the lander hab you are exposed to radiation. This radiation will eventually build up and kill you. The only way to avoid it is to not go outside the lander. Apart from the radiation it is almost impossible to die in the game. Potatoes grow in 5 minutes, giving you infinite food. And water is abundant in the top soil, and you only need to go out for a couple of minutes to get it.

Not sure what this game was going for, but if it was "Radiation Poisoning Simulator 2017", then they did a fairly decent job, I have never been so sick and tired of radiation in a video game. Not 25€ worth of job tho. I even regret paying 10€ for this mess. I could pay 2€ for a radiation poisoning simulator. There are no goals, no objectives, no tasks, nothing to work towards. There is no progression, other than the inevitable progression towards death by radiation.

So in summary, don't go outside other than to get more water, don't collect mineral samples, don't analyze said samples, don't build anything, and maybe you won't die of radiation. And the easiest way to avoid doing all those thing is to uninstall. Bye.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052247208', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6843, 'last_played': 1675018818}
review:
I have this game for a long time now and i find that the devs have done a lot of work on it, BUT: Yes there is a lot of work to do for the future. I think it is nearly contenct complete, but there are still bugs to fix and multiplayer optimisations to do.

This game IS playable, but it takes very very loooong time until you have constructed something. I have used the Manned features nearly all the time alone and it took me nearly 8 hours until i had build an airlock-chamber for my planned base. This time was needed to construct the 3D printer, more effective power generation and resource mining facility´s before i finale started with the basebuilding.

When you are alone it is very lame in the first 2-3 hours, but then you have enough to do for yourselft alone and after 5-6 hours there is enough work for a second player it think.

This are the times for a standard scenario, you can short this time extremely by using an custom scenario, but i have used the originals for the most time.

This game isn´t something for everybody, but i think it is very nice for everybode who likes e.g. the film/book " The Martian".

Here you have no gun fight´s or attacking animals like in the most other sci-fi games, the action in the competitions with other players in multiplayer is based on something like killing them with a truck or steal their resources out of their facilities. To win a competition with another base it could be enough to steal them their food and seeds. Or you can work together and build a giant base oder base-network on the crater map.

Long story short: This gime is NOTHING for People who only wanna play a game for a couple of hours or who need action very fast after startig the game, but when you want to get a little feeling how it is to live on the mars, how there there could likely be build realistic colonies, then buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064736000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2456, 'last_played': 1545347989}
review:
Habe gar nicht gemerkt, dass es aus der EA Phase raus ist.
Es ist noch lange nicht fertig und benötigt zumindest für die Oberfläche noch einiges an Anpassung.
Generell fühlt es sich auch unfertig an, da alles so ewig lange dauert und das Gameplay daher nicht wirklich flüssig ist. Dazu kommen unzählige Clippingfehler, so wie bugs und glitches.
Als ich es damals, als es ziemlich unbekannt war kaufte, hatte ich große Erwartungen, da die Rover-missionen richtig spaß gemacht hatten, doch nun bin ich ziemlich enttäuscht.

Ich habe einige Spiele von diesem Entwickler und es sieht so aus als ob es ihnen nicht wirklich gut geht, da dies hier nicht ihr einziges Spiel ist, welches mir negativ auffällt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978968208', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1506729310}
review:
The game seems really awesome (although probably too slow for most), but I got stuck on the tutorial twice and needed an online guide :P Love the detail and concept though.

First, I couldn't figure out how to activate and take photos, so randomly pressing buttons I finally figured out it was C - instructions mentioned that before but it wasn't clear there.
When it happened again - I followed the arm/head stone analyze directions, nothing was happening no matter what I did - I figured this game would be me slamming my head against the wall for what is supposed to be the basic commands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135810527', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1555936750}
review:
Дорогие разработчики, я все могу понять но палец вниз это потому что нет русского языка, молодцы те кто знают английский язык, но вы же можете и русский вставить при том что он есть в игре но не работает, я свой лайк поменяю только тогда когда хотя бы появится русский интерфейс и суббтитры... А так 9/ 10 игра очень крутая но поймите одно, это симулятор где дают вам задания, где разработчики добились не вероятного: Ваши следы не изчезают ни через 3 секунды ни через 5 минут 
 это просто пипец.. Если вы превыкли в Daz Standelone бежать за спиной и следить за выжившим то сдесь можно просто идти по его следу. Я считаю это великим достижением, так как токого я не видел ни в одной выживалки... И вообще такого нет ни в одной игре в мире. 
Так что ща пойду записывать игру для ютуба но диз лайк я ставлю только из за того что нет русского языка...!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990155409', 'num_games_owned': 1629, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 8588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8588, 'last_played': 1707994773}
review:
Go get stationeers, you'll have a better time and the devs are better with people than this team ever was with replying or talking with people. Take on mars was abandoned, it doesn't have much in the way of gameplay elements and there's not too many mods to help you out.

While i did like this game, the achievements of this game speak for themselves at how abandoned it really was.

This game has an achievement called half mark frank which is to sustain a 0.6 framerate for X seconds.... From this you can gather the idea that it's not optimised in the least and i found that out even more so at how rushed their missions were into the game. A normal sandbox game can have tonnes of items without much frame issue yet the missions you only need to build 10 items before seeing the camera shake bug which is directly attributed to frame rate. This all happening on a 1080 G1 graphics card.

The devs have stated one last patch was coming and I did also try to mod with this game finding lacking guides and asking the devs directly, they didn't come out with much more, even their manuals / youtube modding guides are incomplete as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134150942', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 43188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2111, 'last_played': 1703381929}
review:
Hello,

First Impression: Great Simulation ! It is worth the money !

For those with screen FPS issues although I just started I will take this in mind; IE keep the number of objects limited; afterall, you are not trying to make a city in this game. It is a survival simulation. Perhaps 3 story mansions and half a dozen big trucks with all kinds of equipment around are not suitable.

However maybe we can get away with this by creating outposts that have some distance between them to avoid these FPS issues; it is either in the game or on the screen as far as FPS issues are concerned.

I would recommend this game for those learning about Mars and survival. I am live streaming this and I just bought it too so check out my stream link in the siggy !

author: {'steamid': '76561198068476294', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1540677937}
review: Great premise and lots of things to do with good mechanics.  Either bad engine selection or bad optimisation spoil this game as after about 3 hours game play it degraded to 7 FPS making it unplayable on a I7 3770k 16G RAM with GTX970 4G.  This game is definitely not worth the $35 dollar price tag as it is.  This is a shame as this game has had a lot of thought gone into it with good mechanic's and good story mode with lots of content to play with, it's just that you can't due to the performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011533463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4350, 'last_played': 1549141777}
review:
Az egyjátékos mód tetszik, van benne kihívás, még a grafika is elég jól fut. Érdekes a játékmenet is. Mindez igaz a robotos küldetésekre. Az emberes küldetést viszont eléggé nehézkes volt nekem elkezdeni, mivel rögtön a játék elején egy katasztófával indít a játék, és van 10 perced, hogy oxigéntartályt keress. Nem csak néhányszor kellett az újrakezdést procedúráját végigcsinálnom. Bár elég nehéz életben maradni a legelején a játéknak, de ha ez sikerül, onnantól már a szórakozásra is lehet gondolni. Ha jól tudom az eredeti marsi küldetéseket hozza, értelem szerűen megtoldva a fejlesztők ötleteivel.
DE!
A többjátékos mód viszont teljes halál. A játékosok közötti szinkronizáció gyakorlatilag egy f.. . Nem is csoda, hogy a legtöbben egyedül játszanak többjátékos módban. Gyakran előfordul, hogy ha valaki egy akkumulátorhoz csatlakoztat egy vezetéket, ő rendesen látja, de a másik játékos viszont azt látja, hogy az akkumulátor felett a levegőben lóg a vezeték, de együtt mozog azzal. Vagy ha egy szerkezet több elemből áll és többen is építik, akkor a másik által beépített elemek elcsúszva látszódnak mindkét játékos számára. Gyakran előfordul még, hogy egyes tárgyak eldobásakor azok átesnek a talaj textúráján és menthetetlenül elvesznek. Vagy: minél többen játszanak együtt, annál lassabb a játék és esik az FPS is.
Szóval van még mit dolgozni ezen az egyébként jó ötleten. Lehet, én nem adtam volna ki még egy ilyen állapotú játékot. Legalábis nem úgy, mint kész, teljes értékű program. Mert ez még nincs kész. Remélem azért még jön hozzá javítás, mert így, ebben a formában a többjátékos mód használhatatlan, de legalábbis felettébb szenvedős. És ezért nem ajánlom még megvételre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089804782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4303, 'last_played': 1503576368}
review:
I bought this in early-access, it looked good and had a lot of promise.  Unfortunately, now that we're in post-release, much of that promise has turned to disappointment.  The gameplay itself is actually really good, the story in the 'Space Program' campaign is semi-engaging at least but it gives you a fair amount to do with some help along the way.  It does leave you to figure out some things, but I like that.  Having my hand held through a campaign just makes the campaign a feature-length tutorial (something else it has, a full set of tutorials).

Most disappointing, though, is the bugs.  There are many, of varying types with different levels of impact.  It's not that the product hasn't been polished, it hasn't even been finished.  There are bugs in the save games (my latest save is now corrupt, so I have essentially lost about 6 hours work I did last night) and god help you if you are sat in a vehicle's seat and try to save the file twice to the same file - goodbye your previous user-saved file, it just disappears and you have to rely on the incredibly infrequent (save if you're lucky) auto-save files.  Then there are the visual glitches, the way crates will just sit on the surface jumping up and down ever so slightly.  Got a crate on a hill?  Move it a little bit, watch it ever so slighly jiggle around, then leave it.  After an hour or so it'll be at the bottom of the hill, and you try getting that thing back up the hill - it's impossible (a crate full of containers is impossible to move, yet you can pick up an entire power rig without batting an eye?  Seriously?).

So, here's hoping they sort this out.  It may only be a labour of love from some Bohemia staff, but come on guys we PAID for this...  It's not as if it was a 5.99 special either.  I loved Arma 3, played it for sooooooo many hours, I was expecting so much more from this game.  Such a pity it hasn't delivered.  I might go and check out KSP

author: {'steamid': '76561197984830732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4867, 'last_played': 1486850339}
review:
Très déçu que l'élément principal du jeu lors de sa sortie en EA (2013), le Space Program avec l'exploration distante en rover, soit devenu secondaire pour faire place à un énième FPS de survie... Je comprendrais jamais pourquoi le studio est partie dans cette voie en lâchant ce qui m'a fait acheté le jeu il y a des années... Si j'avais su le virage que le studio allait opérer avant je ne l'aurai jamais pris.

Et tjs pas de français évidement...

author: {'steamid': '76561198098778490', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1502828586}
review: Fullscreen is still broken after it has been brought up in forums for years. When you go fullscreen the colors turn into a violent green and nothing is visible. There is physically no way to play in fullscreen because you cant read anything on screen and the colors will make you sick. No borderless widow mode so you have to play in a window and a very bad one at that. Even with the correct resolution, the game doesnt actually line up properly with the screen so trying to click the left side of the game doesnt work and if the click actually registers then the widow gets crammed to the right of your monitor and the cursor can only go halfway across the sreen. When the gameplay actually works its pretty good but there are too many annoying obsticles to overcome before you can even get to the gameplay. Until this game fixes the same issues it has had for years it isnt worth buying.

review: For the people who are having unhandled exception errors that say it's an illegal copy, there's two methods of fixing that. One is changing the compatability to running Windows 7 or 8, another is moving the folder from the Steam/steamapps/common/ drop, and putting it directly into the Steam folder. Either way is possible for fixing the error.
