author: {'steamid': '76561198012212042', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1551732187}
review:
EDIT: I don't even recommend it with people with good computers. It runs terrible even after I upgraded from my aged 7970's to a GTX 1070 and it still performs at sub 20fps in certain areas.

Showed so much promise, but clearly Bohemia Interactive threw this game under the rug. It performs absolutely terrible and has incomplete features and lots of bugs. I would not recommend buying this even on a sale unless you have a god computer and really REALLY like Mars Sims.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023452047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2163, 'last_played': 1589730195}
review: I'm tired of waiting. Bohemia clearly gave up on this, and thus, is largely uncompleted (half-cooked features, vehicles with placeholding panels, foundations for feature that never arrived,...). The idea is so good, Early Access was actually going smoothly, but they gave up. Guess this is not as profitable as the Arma series, wich brings to light the ambition to make mediocre moneygrabbing games rather than invest in the only (relatively) original idea Bohemia ever had. At least now I know what to expect in the future from these guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136495715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2309, 'last_played': 1500042806}
review:
Cons:
* Only one type of Suit, an EVA suit so your charactor is very slow and it takes a long time to do the simplests of tasks.
* Storage containers hold much less than real containers today requiring you to have a large number of them and change them often.
* Radiation Levels spike to lethal levels for about 5 min forcing you inside every 15 min (give or take).
* No other Atmospheric dangers other than radiation and a non-breathable atmosphere.
* No way to depressurize the inside of a base forcing you to have to wait in the airlock evertime you come in and out while moving supplies inside or out.
* Mods are required to allow the player to have a more realistic power supply, storage ect.
* Limited world size, you can not travel all over mars you are limited to one area.
* Random bugs that force you to start over, Like dieing when you lay down or sometimes when you eat, tripping and your charactor can't get up without falling right away again. ect.
* Seems based on the movie "The Last Martion" as the only food you can grow without mods is Potatos.

Pros:
* It's a Challange.
* Requires the player to prioritise each action by Benifit and need over cost and time.
* Sandbox Style Gameplay allowing the player to build how they want for the most part.
* A decent sized modding community supporting the game with mods that make gameplay better.
* A helpful community willing to take time to help you figure out any problem you are having.

Over all:
Take on Mars is not a bad game as such, it does however feel unfinished to me. I feel that the game needs a lot of work, there are a lot of Pre-Alpha and Alpha level bugs in the game that should have been addressed but are still there.  

I would not buy the game again at full price, but I will continue to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075734374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5154, 'last_played': 1686238227}
review: Как только я купил эту игру я был просто в восторге. она захватывает. Но я купил её именно для мультиплеера. потому какой смысл ездить в двухместном багги, или пересаживаться с места на место в кране? Само собой в начале часов 8 угробил на одиночную кампанию и изучение основ и обрадовавшись полез в мультиплеер с другом. Тут то и началось, то самое что не поддается никакому восторгу. Первые часа пол мы играли нормально, а потом пошли жуткие лаги, у друга вообще постоянные разрывы соединение каждые 2-3 секунды, причем мы играли ЛОКАЛЬНО! карл ЛОКАЛЬНО! причем это не только на домашних компьютерах было испробовано. результат один и тот же в начале все хорошо а потом не возможно играть, постоянные фризы, спотыки, дергания персонажей. Повторюсь не важно кто хост, у клиента всегда после промежутка времени станет лагать, причем не думайте что это можно стерпеть лаги со временем только увеличиваются и причины тут только в коде самой игры, который никто не будет дорабатывать, Крайне не рекомендую тем, а я думаю их будет много, кто хочет поиграть в ней по сети. Деньги вернуть отказались, да я бы за два часа и не успел бы понять что она не играбельна в этом плане:(. А для тех кто хочет потратить деньги на одиночную советую быть благоразумней и ... ну сами знаете: "Бери всё - не отдавай ничего перемешай все старое и продай как новое" (C) Джек Воробей.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159412431', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6405, 'last_played': 1688231039}
review:
(Jeu recommandé lors de la première écriture) Alors, premièrement, étant un grand fan du film "Seul sur Mars" et de Mars en général, je peux dire qu'il est super beau, réaliste et bien réalisé. je vais énumérer ici les points forts et les points faibles que j'ai relevés dans ce jeu. 

Points forts : 
1- Jeu très beau graphiquement.
2- Mécanique de gameplay intérréssante.
3- Vehicules plutôt bien pensés.
4- Dangerosité de la planète fidèle (pressurisation, faire attention à sa combi, ...).
5- Mises à jour régulières et plutôt conséquentes (elles ne rajoutent pas juste un petit outil).
6- Mode Multijoueur et Solo.
7- Histoire très intéréssante et trame plotôt bien faite.
8- Simu super bien réalisée.
9- Possibilité de modder son jeu.

Points faibles : 
1- Personnage plutôt lent (les rovers aussi mais sa je peux comprendre).
2- Pas de version française.
3- Serveurs hébergés par les joueuers et donc souvent plutôt lents pour les autres personnes.
4- Manque de gameplay sur la fin de la campagne solo.
5- Pas assez de tutoriels
6- Pas beaucoup d'objets de construction.
7- Encore pas mal de bugs (comme dans les escaliers en colimaçon).
8- Manque de scénarios dans l'espace et de scénarios en général.
9- Manque de reliefs martiens (grottes, gouffres, ...) et d'emplacements (ou plutôt de maps).
10- Certaines parties multijoueurs contiennent une tempète solaire trop vite, on à même pas le temps d'atterrir que l'on est déja irradié.

Voila, malgré le nombre de points faibles plus conséquents que ce lui de points forts, je trouve que les négatifs sont plus insignifiants que les positifs et je recommande clairement ce jeu à toute personne passionnée d'espace ou de la planête rouge. Néanmoins j'attends tout de même une version française et un ajout de scénarios qui sonts trop peu à mon goût.



J'edit cette évaluation le 24/02/2018 pour parler de la maj EUROPA. (Jeu recommandé lors de la modif)

Je n'irais pas par 4 chemins, pour moi, ce "dlc" n'est pa abouti du tout pour les raisons qui suivent:
_non-possibilité de fabriquer les éventuelles structures ou véhicules présents sur la campagne du  dlc
_pas de scénario coopératif ou compétitif sur Europe
_Surface de la map d'Europe faite à la va-vite (il y a des carrés de partout)
_Aucun moyen d'acceder à l'océan souterrain via la surface

Voilà pour le moment, je remodifierais surement mon évaluation de cette maj quand il sera plus abouti.



Modification le 16/07/2018 (Jeu recommandé)

_Maj trop distantes
_Toujours pas de Français pourtant promis il y a des mois
_Le dlc Europa toujours pas modifié depuis sa sortie

La feature qui ferait sans aucun doutes décoller le jeu pour l'éléver au niveau des meilleurs serait de pouvoir fusionner les parties rovers et humaine, en pouvant construire une sorte d'usine assemblable de rovers (un peu comme l'imprimante survie), et de pouvoir les controler via un poste de controle, un MDV/MAV, ou même un véhicule tel que le MML.

Je ne fais qu'exposer mon avis sur ce qui pourrais rendre ce jeu complètement oufissime pour moi, je tiens également à préciser aux développeurs éventuels qui me liraient que si les maj ne corrigent pas les bugs très vite et les éventuels points négatifs sités ci-dessus, cette modif de mon éval pourra être la derniere en tant que jeu recommandé. Réveillez vous Bohémia, ce jeu tombe aux oubliettes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138113866', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3783, 'last_played': 1677976427}
review:
Really fun game. Kinda time consuming if you are solo playing, but I found it quite fun still. I liked the manned story, but I did draw it out quite a bit trying to coldest ALL the items/crates and exploring a bit. I could see getting through the very short story pretty quickly, which is quite short for a game out of early access. I'd like to see a couple more compaigns: maybe some follow-on missions of future crews to Mars that have other objectives.

You can build some really interesting structures on Mars. Just a lot of grinding: airlock, mine, build, kine, airlock, eat, airlock, suns down, back in the airlock, sleep.

There are one pretty amazing mods which are easily supported in game bh steam workshop.

I could see some people getting quite bored though. Another review I read said, "simulation first, and a game second," which I do feel to be quite true. I do recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163254630', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 30043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14252, 'last_played': 1702877229}
review: this game is awesome. its fun... as you can see by my hours on record above. it is glitchy though. you run by your machiness to get from a refinery to your base. as your running your heart rate goes up. you are running because you are low on oxygen and your suit is going bee boo(high pitched) bee boo, bee boo to say hey, get to a suit holder and put the suit on it to refill it and be in a pressurized environment. all of a sudden 3/4 through the machines, weaving and winding around them, you trip and boom. your dead. you can fix that with the tripping fix mod or by having a quick clear path from one extreme end to your base or put your machines in a kine and your base in the middle. your screen will start shaking violently when you run and have too many CABLES. machines dont count here. just cables off the spool. also, never pressurize your base to 1ATM. the airlock will kill you. you will suffocate and die. guaranteed, or no money back. running with a barrel in hand and jumping can put the barrel underneath your feet and your guy will attempt to put it where he is looking, most likely pushing itn forward and up underneath your feet. you go flying. all of those are avoidable and fixable. for the shaking, use fewer cables or download a wireless power mod. never run and jump with a barrel in hand, and put your base in a spot quick and easy to reach in relation toy your machines. also, F puts you in free-cam mode and it stops the shaking until it comes back, then do it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031374078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5912, 'last_played': 1681243839}
review:
Bought this game a year ago thinking it would be a sort of mans first steps on mars simulation and it is to some degree, however the problem is that they have focused so much on the simulation aspect that it gets very boring and repetitive, especially in the campaign on both manned and unmanned missions. For starters in the unmanned campaign after a while you have a small rover that moves at the same speed as an asthmatic old man with parkinsons disease, you then need to travel for several miles and over an hour just to reach your destination to collect data and stuff, rather than having a system of plotting a course and letting it follow that course. You then have to repeat this several times to get the money required to unlock new parts, eventually i got to the large rover and got so bored I quit and went into the manned campaign. The manned campaign i then discovered is much the same with rubbish physics where you can be killed or knocked out when in the airlock of your truck, or by any other means for very little reason. The buttons are also hard to press and you'll press the wrong ones allot, sometimes ending in your death. Eventually I reached the point where I managed to get the refinery and drills, however i had been killed so many times by the airlock in my truck that I eventually quit the game.

Would I recommend this game? not really as there are other games such as space engineers that do the game part much better, however if you want something thats a hard core sim then probably yes. I can also recommend the Scenarios and the editor in this game as some of them can be quite fun.

Edit: If you really want this game I would advise you to watch some videos on it before making your decision, that goes for every other game aswell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059415830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5707, 'last_played': 1492226077}
review:
This game looked awesome, so I decided to buy it about a year ago. Even with all the gliches inside, it was in Early Access, so I gave that a pass, and had fun. For some time I thought "Man, this is kinda cool!"
So, all in all I would recommend it... IF it were still in Early Access. 

This game looks cool, sounds cool, even has somewhat cool gameplay (Though very difficult), but it has more bugs than a termite colony, and they didn't fix any of them before release. (In fact, they have MORE)

Essentially, they should have waited longer to release it, and in the meantime, fix those bugs. I sorta hate saying this for such an awesome looking game, but I would not recommend until they fix these bugs (If they even will).

author: {'steamid': '76561198002122500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1461658515}
review:
I am a massive space nerd. I stream KSP all the time. This game showed sooooo much promise. When it dropped on Early Access it was good for what it was. Then there was almost no action on the game for the longest time. Years of inactivity.

Then BOOM! It's out of EA!?!?! holy crap!?! 

Still pretty bad. Bohemia does really know how to make a good reliable engine that doesn't feel clunky or dated. They really finally added what would have been good to have almost 2 or 3 year ago. At this point the game had been retired from many people's libraries and minds. Sadly I have to say I think it was too little, too late with games like The Forest, Space Engineers and Subnautica having taken a good step forward in survival and building games. They keep up the updates and have a good content base with better engines and gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038377325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1497796627}
review:
Just to get them out of the way, here are some general problems:
- unintuitive UI, unclear object interactions, tutorial is extremely boring and not really that helpful
- weird physics interactions (falling down when climbing over terrain, flinging objects and sometimes yourself when pulling stuff from debris, etc)
- poor mouse control
- bad gamepad support
- performance issues
- crashes

But the biggest problem with this game is pacing and keeping player interested.

The unmanned campaign starts OK and for the first 30min is quite fun. But after that it gets super tedious and repetitive.
The manned campaign just doesn't feel right. The voice acting and `story` (if I may call it that) are done very poorly and don't work together at all. It feels like initially it was a tech demo or just a space sandbox thing and then it got `enriched` with story elements, voice acting, some attempt at progression and that sort of thing. It doesn't feel like a complete game, it doesn't feel like a game at all. Player struggles along with the main character and it doesn't feel rewarding at all.

I gave it a couple of hours for both manned and unamanned and just couldn't be bothered.

I bought the game back in 2013 when it was planned to release in mid 2014 I believe. Now 3 years after original release date it's here and it didn't really progress all that much since 2013. Yes, there is some manned content, but it's not much different from a couple of scenarios that were present in 2013. Yes, there are some mods available, but the game gets in the way of enjoying itself.

Maybe it's me, but I just can't understand how I should approach the game to enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198266861694', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1495136458}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002567771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 3137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3018, 'last_played': 1626118022}
review:
Take on Mars is more simulation than game, and clearly showing that the goal was a simulation first, and a game second. That said, it remains very interesting and works quite well as a game, when you can figure out how to do things and get it to work.

And that is one of the problems. The biggest problem however is the complete lack of time acceleration and slow speeds. I understand wanting realistic speeds in your simulation game, but this is not an experience that any but the most patient people are willing to go through. For reference, to complete the unmanned campaign you will need to travel ~50,000m at speeds between 1.5m/s and 2m/s, or in more understandable terms, your rovers go at the speed of an old man with a walking aid and you need to travel roughly a small country's length. The game does helpfully offer you a realistic wheel speeds option, which will bring your speed down to around 0.6m/s, or roughly the speed of that old man if he had to stop to take a breather after every step. I firmly believe that I am one of the most patient people in the world and submit this game as proof for that.

With the biggest problem out of the way, the smaller problems are still noticable. It essentially does not tell you how to do or use most things. When starting a campaign, the first thing I had to do was push every button on my keyboard in the hopes that it would move along the interactive first landing of an historical Russian lander. It worked eventually, and I could play the game after that. After that, you are never told how to use specific instruments, and you aren't told what technologies actually do for you as a player. But that is something you can figure out as well with a lot of looking for things, so eventually it will work out.
There also still appear to be a fair amount of bugs in the game, including random missions asking you to take microscope pictures of the atmosphere, and one that makes it so missions do not spawn when they should so the game literally becomes unfinishable. With the last one in mind, I had to stop my playthrough before I could get to the manned stage, as the missions I needed to complete did not ever show up. The physics at times become a large problem in that your science instruments need to be held still to do science, but the physics tries to make your rovers almost dance, which makes it nearly impossible to use your instruments unless you forcibly jam them against the rock or sand you are trying to perform experiments on.

Even then, Mars is a nice and often varied place, with a lot of interesting terrain and good looking locations, with missions placed so that they show you to all the good places with almost scenic tours. The economic part of the game- Getting your funding, is very rough early on and practically doesn't exist in the later stages. This may be to save up money for the manned missions, but I never actually reached that part, so I wouldn't know.

All things said, Take on Mars needs work. It is not an unpleasant experience for one with a lot of patience, but I struggle to see what would draw in anyone other than the most scientific minded people who at the same time don't mind gameplay. For anyone else, it is a nice novelty, but very repetitive and slow. There does not seem to be that much here, at least not in the unmanned campaign.
There is also a multiplayer mode, but I've yet to be able to motivate anyone into playing it with me. I will update this review whenever I get people into a server with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032809922', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1487732148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198257656353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1550424138}
review:
Positives bit first in all fairness it is a lot of fun to play both in robotic mode and in 'The Martian' mode. and with a high enough spec to run it everything is awesome... However there are still just a few to many issues with this game for me to be able to happily recommend it. Firstly no "Fullscreen Windowed" mode which the devs were promising back in 2013 looking at the forums.

Biggest for me is an issue which thier own patch notes said was fixed which is an error on the mission window "jittering" when FPS drops below a certain amount. However it isnt fixed at all, i was running a solid 50-60fps quite happily but as soon as I started building my base in the manned mission it started dropping, once it reached 30 fps the mission bar bugged out and as soon as that happened FPS plummeted to below 10 and the character started bobbing in time with the mission window which made the game completely unplayable.

Tried every variety of settings known to man and beast to no avail and have now had to resign the game to uninstalled status

author: {'steamid': '76561197982396540', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 28845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25246, 'last_played': 1517557699}
review:
I have wasted 477 hours of my life on this thing.

477 hours.

I don't blame it for that. You could say a game's quality is measured by how many otherwise productive hours it can steal from you. Right and wrong on this one. A word for every fifteen minutes, shall we?

Quick verdict: Excellent idea, rushed by the studio fairly wanting it to finally ship after five years in EA, after the developers fallen to the ruinous siren song of feature creep. If I bought this for its early access price of 14USD today, I'd dislike its lack of polish, and might refund it. At 27USD? Giddouttahere!

Pros: The Mars terrains are really quite pretty, with the exception of Lyot Crater, which is nothing but repetitive dunes. The rovers look neat and are fully physically simulated in terms of joints, suspension, etc. and have lots of breakable things that can *and will* break if you don't avoid obstacles.

Cons: Manned is janky. If you felt like a clumsy robot in an ArmA game? It's worse here. That clumsy robot is hamfisted into an engine originally for an RTS and is wearing a space suit in somewhat confined spaces. There's little in way of actual science, despite how the trailer keeps saying that. Construction is hard and unrewarding. No dedicated server support. Unmanned campaign feels neglected. Replayable help info replaced by videos that play only once that were, for some godforsaken reason, recorded while the game was in holiday mode with Christmas trees and lights everywhere.

3/10, at this price point. 4 or 5 at the price I bought it. Do not recommend.

[url=https://pastebin.com/qwVMzNPr]In this link is the rest of the review. Read if you want, I guess. I'm gonna spoil everything, but you really won't missing out on much.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198036975621', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1495256148}
review:
我是一个宇宙游戏迷，玩过很多没汉化的宇宙游戏，就这款最难上手。
文字量太大，系统有点复杂，最主要的是这游戏算是小众游戏，完全没人做汉化。
所以想买这游戏的朋友，如果你英语非常好，或者很有耐心的话可以试一下这款游戏，否则的话可以等游戏普及了，有了汉化再买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198103397029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 12772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8004, 'last_played': 1670987931}
review:
I'm going to start simple; Take On Mars is a good game, but it's not a masterpiece. That basically sums up my thoughts on it, but then why am I writing this review?

To go in-depth, Take On Mars, which I will refer to as "TKOM," has two campaigns to chose from; robotics and manned. Robotics is the simpler; you build a vehicle and send it to Mars. You have four choices of vehicle, and you need to consider what you bring with you. You have your choice of probes, zero-g probes, landers, and full-blown rovers. The latter two come in many sizes and variants, bigger means you can carry more instruments and keep them around for longer, but the downside is that they're more expensive. You send vehicles to complete mission assignments, ranging from exploration to sight-seeing, and doing science. By completing missions, you get more funds to either launch more vehicles, or research more advanced vehicles, cameras, and instruments. While these missions can be tedious at times, they very beautifully deliver the fact that Mars is a desolate, irradiated wasteland. It gets to you, but in a good way. By completing these missions, you'll also learn more about Mars than you did before playing, so it's an educational experience, as well. For example, simply by launching probes to Mars, you'll eventually learn that Mars has four polar ice caps. Two permanent water-ice caps, and two seasonal dry ice caps that form during winter and melt during summer. Moving on from science facts, the robotics missions aren't perfect. The epilepsy-inducing broken camera screen is bad enough, but some areas, like Gusev Crater, don't have missions at all (See my "Lack of missions in Gusev Crater" in TKOM's discussion forums for more information). Once you've had enough making and breaking robots, you'll be able to play the manned campaign. (You can play manned without playing robotics first, by the way)

The manned campaign is an oddity. It still captures that "desolation" feeling I described in the last paragraph, but it doesn't do it as well. This may have to do with the fact that you're controlling a human instead of a robot, but that's something to be explored seperately. By the start of your first mission after the International Space Station, it becomes very clear that the story was inspired Andy Weir's "The Martian." (Very good book, by the way) Sadly, it doesn't translate well into TKOM because unlike Mark Watney, your character, Mark Willis, feels relatively one-dimensional. This may be because Bohemia Interactive wanted players to be able to overlay their personality on top of their Mark, but I think this could be done better if there was interactive dialogue (that's a pun, by the way) with your squadmates during your ISS and Moon flashback missions. There's nothing about the story that surprises or excites, to the point where I'm not even going to bother giving you a spoiler warning, only helped further by gameplay that feels more like a chore and clunky controls. You crash on Mars, get supplies, get a vehicle, drive to the next mission site, take the ascent vehicle to the transfer vehicle, go back to Earth, get rescued, all is said and done. And by the way, when I said that the gameplay felt like a chore, I meant it in a good way. It truly replicates the tedious feeling of a real mission to Mars, even if some people do have their gripes about said tedium.

Finally, I'll cover the multiplayer and scenarios. The multiplayer comes in two forms; competitive and cooperative. Both forms are basically gameplay clones of the campaign, without the crash, and with different quirks. The Cooperative has you cooperating with players to set up a Mars colony. If, at any point, you want to end the game, you can take the MAV that came with your MDV up to orbit and leave the planet. (You don't actually enter orbit, you just become a free-floating invisible camera that can move and look around) The competitive multiplayer sees players competing against one-another for resources and 3D printers. While I don't think that the concept of a 3D printer that can create items from thin air without power or resources makes much sense, it was a concious choice by Bohemia to carry this over from alpha development into the final game, as modular printers would require resources and power, therefore making the already challenging competitive mode a nightmare to play. Though I think a combat system would make competitive multiplayer better instead of using a construction tool to depressurize somebody's base, given the long sightlines involved and the attention to realism, I think what we have is good enough for now. The scenarios are also gameplay clones of the campaigns, except they're taking concepts from both. Despite having only two manned scenarios, all of them are good gameplay-wise, but like the manned campaign, the manned scenarios have mediocre stories, at best. In alpha development, there was the option to play scenarios as a solo survival map. These scenarios were removed sometime during beta testing, and I would like to see their return someday, as currently, the only way to play a solo survival map in TKOM is to reduce the max player count on a multiplayer map to one, and optionally add a password, therefore defeating the purpose of the map supporting multiplayer. In all my attempts to create a public multiplayer map that anyone could play on, I got one guy who didn't even know how to read English and some very crappy net code out of it. (Okay, that guy did know how to read and type some English, but not enough for us to understand each other (He actually ended up quitting because we couldn't communicate)) In fact, it wasn't just me. Nearly everybody was playing the multiplayer maps as solo maps, defeating the purpose of the maps supporting multiplayer.

Overall, TKOM is a good game, but it's not perfect. Every game has it's flaws, regardless if it's something as sublte as pacing issues, or something as drastic as total disregard for cohesion between gameplay and level design. TKOM rests somewhere on the halfway point of this spectrum, henced mixed reviews at the time of writing. While I wouldn't fully recommend it, due to the fact that it feel largely unfinished and the fact that the game engine calculates your position based on your feet instead of your head, like in Subnautica, I would at least give it an honest try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099424400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1506107869}
review:
Nedoporučuji ani hráčům po lobotomii.  
Naprosto nehratelný balast od Bohemia Interactive, ARMA je oproti tomu super hratelná hra s naprosto plynulou hratelností a projevem. Optimalizace v Take On Mars praktricky neexistuje, dost možná je v záporných hodnotách. Neustálé nepředvídatelné crashe hry. Problémy s ukládáním pozic, kdy po 2 odpolednech hraní dojde k nepředvítatelné destrukci save i ve hře bez jakýchkoli módů. Multiplayer je zcela nehratelný, totální desynchronizace pouhých 2 hráčů i na stabilní synchronní 300 Mbps optice s nulovou ztrátou packetů a s 11 ms do NIXu. Připojený hráč v multiplayeru poskakuje jak gumový panáček a ze žlutého až červeného LAN konektoru který neustále problikává na obrazovce chytá osypky. Přesun ve vzdálenosti 30 metrů min. 5 pádů na hubu a často rozbitý skafandr s následkem smrti. Nemluvě o dalších problémech s cyklováním a otevíráním dveří v tlakových komorách více hráči. Multiplayer zkoušen od více hráčů vždy se stejným silně negativním nehratelným výsledkem.
Result: Jen pro silné povahy. Pokud chcete za několik desítek minut hraní zestárnout o pár let tak tento "super produkt" doporučuji.
Holt se můžeme zase stydět že čeští vývojáři dosahují takových kvalit a jsou schopni uvést na trh produkt v téměř nevídané kvalitě která hraničí s pokusy na zvířatech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272881191', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1710, 'last_played': 1679968369}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022347120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1595154526}
review:
I purchased this game January 2016 and it crashed multiple times. I gave up trying to play it and forgot about it and moved on to other things. Today, end of May 2017 and nothing seems to have changed. I tried playing it this morning and after 15 minutes I fell through the world. I tried again and after 30 minutes the lift in the lander killed me as it moved down and my character didn't. This happened again 15 minutes later. 
This game needs serious attention. Game breaking bugs like these are disrespectful to people who paid good money for a game. I understand it's pre Alpha, and I expect a few bugs in these kind of purchases, but this game is completely unplayable and has been for over 18 months. Bugs are also random as all Hell and updates for this game are few and far between.
I'm not sure, but I think the developers have grown tired of the game and now can't be bothered with it. They seem to be adding the occational update, but the same bugs that were there 18 months ago are still there.
All this is a shame. I like playing this game. Sadly I cannot recomend anyone to buy this in its current state. I fear this game will never get fixed. 
My advice it to Stay Away and NOT spend your money here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995713451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2524, 'last_played': 1495701626}

author: {'steamid': '76561197982875866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1496109316}
review: Okay how in the heck can someone give this a bad rating?  This game is hella fun and very challenging.  The immersion is beyond really anything else I've experienced.  When you wake up and your helmet is leaking, you honestly have to move your ass or perish and that sense of urgency is throughout the game.   I'm not going to give away anything here, but when you get to the MAV and make your 3D printer, just be very sure you don't throw out any resources.  You will need almost every single bit of them to make the stuff you need to just START making other stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989153789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1561222511}
review:
Also ich persönlich kann nicht verstehen warum das Spiel derzeit ein "Ausgeglichen" in der Gesamtwertung hat. Das Spiel ist mal eine willkommene Abwechslung zu den anderen "ich lande auf einem Planeten mit Aliens, baue mir ein Raumschiff und haue andere"-Spielen.

Take on Mars erfordert einiges an Einarbeitungszeit, aber wenn man die erstmal gemeistert hat. Dann packt einen schon der Ehrgeiz und man will mehr entdecken und bauen. Aber den Multiplayer empfehle ich eher, denn wenn man die ganze Zeit alleine auf einem tristen Planeten ist, dann bekommt man irgentwann einen Lagerkoller.

Für Spieler die nicht pausenlos darauf aus sind sich mit anderen zu messen und deren Bauwerke kaputt zu machen ist Take on Mars nur zu empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561197992574380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5812, 'last_played': 1495911845}
review:
This is by far the best Mine/build/survive game i ever played.
Its so complex and far reaching, so it gives many fun play hours (days or months).
There is bugs, true, i even had quite many of them, i had many where i got unconsious, because i hit something,
or stumbled over something.
Even one time i fell inside truck cabin, and when i got up again, i had my head outside of the truck, and sufficated to death :P

But i will still say its the best ever for me :D
And it can only be better and better, as devs keep going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126907619', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5306, 'last_played': 1582777127}
review:
Sure this has some bugs like the tripping and falling while running with cables...well that might just add to the reaslism tho.
This game is very immersive with great sounds and a nice soundtrack.
Multiplayer was a little glitchy. Every now and then a part of my base would get stuck in the ground but it would eventually come back up and let me move it.

 A not so nice player joined my game and launched the shuttle and that straight sucked. Everything was all foggy from the launch and rendered the game unplayable, not to mention all my hydrogen and oxygen was gone. Dev should really put a lock on the door or something. 

I have been surviving on Mars for many days with the real-time day-night cycle and it makes me hurry to finish up tasks before nightfall. Adds to the realism to make the cycle 1:1. Nothing like seeing a Martian sunrise. 

Gathering resources is tedious but that also adds to the realism. A few times I ran with barrels only to trip and crack my helmet on the ship or some equipment. I have torn suits while collecting Mars Rock but it was fine because I had a suit patch kit. Yes the crafting with the 3D printer is pretty deep and fun.

My only complaint would be the lack of any real missions aside from the starting mission which is great. Definitely try that one. I would like to see more to do like finding the old Viking lander or some of the rovers. Maybe even discovering life? 

Really this is a great game if you like space and especially if you love Mars. Just don't be disappointed when you realize you are surrounded by red dust. Hey at least you have your green potatoe plants.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113765447', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4663, 'last_played': 1615305764}
review:
I only recommend this game really because of it's potential.

The game has a numerous amount of bugs that need fixing, such as barely hitting your head and going unconscious until you die, or trying to sleep in your poptent and getting thrown under the surface of the planet just to die. I have a pretty good computer, with settings on Medium and my frames are still around 30, which tells me the game needs serious optimization. A lot of other general fixes could be implemented, but it's still a decent game.

The gameplay is like no other game I've played. It's deeply immersive and rather time consuming, but this is made up for with the challenge of the game. You start out and have to find emergency oxygen dispensers to stay alive for the first 30 minutes of gameplay, as well the necessity for food and water. You have to maintain your suit from wear and damage, which is rather interesting. The managing of resources such as methane, oxygen, water, etc is none like I've seen other than State of Decay.

All around, I'd give it a 3 star review, due to the excrutiatingly painful bugs it presents. Other than that, the gameplay is phenominal and would be much much much better if more content was introduced, as well as isolating and exterminating the bugs currently in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053645064', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3801, 'last_played': 1546807227}
review:
A prime example of what happens when developers are pressured into releasing a game too early!

Easily the most frustrating game I have ever encountered, not because it is difficult to play or not an enjoyable game, but because it is so glaringly obvious that it simply isn't finished!  It should be in beta, ironing out the glitches and responding to testers observations, like "Why do I have a bed if I cannot sleep at night?" (A Mod is available, but shouldn't be needed)

While some on social media and in video reviews slate the game as 'just a "The Martian" game' (Which could be helped by adding a bit of variety to the diet! ( also avaiable in a Mod)) it is close to being a diamond in the coal seam of current games.  The atmosphere is spot on, for the most part it plays very well and it's easy to pick up.  It's also very easy to die.

Multiplayer is another story unfortunately.  The single player "Human missions" pit you against the elements with little equipment and requires you to harvest resources to create items in a small 3D printer.  Use the small 3D printer to make bigger versions and you can craft anything, if you have the resources.

Competetive Multiplayer (which states you are landing on a part of the planet where resources are scarce!) consists of landing on the planet, finding the nearest supply drop which all have a "Creative" printer that requires absolutely no resources at all, so you can make whatever you want unless it's massive, what exactly is the point?  Why fight over resources you don't need anyway?

Co-Op Multiplayer hits the mark better, although the option to begin a game with minimal gear ( Tent, Small Fabricator and enough resources to get the basics made) without the MAV would have been a nice touch for "hardcore" explorers.

I sincerely hope the developers have the will to finish this game and add some polish to some of the mechanics that aren't perfect as yet.  If they do this game will, for some, be one of the best survival games to date.

As it is though there is a lot of pain for the gain.  Please finish this properly Bohemia!!!

Still recommend although with a lot of caveats.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969907665', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1419272164}
review:
Careful i only review the MP portion of the game, Solo / Career does NOT interest me:

The Game has been in Alpha for to long without enough change. I fear there's not enough workforce actually working on it. I absolutely love the promise of the game as a multiplayer Survival with a more or less realistic approach on mars. Unfortunately it develops so slow that it will be overtaken pretty soon by other newer games that actually show progress.

I don't recommend investing in this, it's now time that the developers really show that they can develop an actual game out of it rather than keeping it in this bare bones state. It is playable but not enough content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027232863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1558229099}
review: It has great potential..... But that potential cant overcome the deficiencies. This game is buggy as hell and needs polishing. I hope someone gives this another try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969554548', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1514007869}
review:
Prozkoumejte kamenitý terén a pouštní pustinu rudé planety. Hra Take On Mars od studia Bohemia Interactive vás vrhne přímo do víru nejnapínavějšího počinu lidstva všech dob, kde začnete jako operátor průzkumného vozidla a postupně se stanete prvním člověkem, který kdy vkročil na Mars. K dispozici máte celý arzenál vědeckého vybavení, stanete se průkopníkem průzkumu a kolonizace jiné planety.
Vydejte se na cestu rozlehlou a nelítostnou krajinou Marsu, jehož prostředí se ve hře zakládá na skutečných satelitních datech ze slavných míst, jako jsou například krátery Victoria a Gale a oblast Cydonia. Připravte se na extrémní počasí a písečné bouře a dávejte si pozor na ozáření ze solárních úkazů na Marsu. Kromě rudé planety najdete ve hře Take On Mars různá další neobyčejná místa a nebeská tělesa, včetně měsíce Marsu Deimos, oběžnou dráhu Země, Měsíc planety Země (oblast přistání mise Apollo 17), mezinárodní vesmírnou stanici (s kompletním interiérem), pozemské výcvikové centrum a výcvikovou krajinu planety Mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994719283', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1401437692}
review: Feels unfinished, confusing and plain boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026517005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1478963724}
review:
Take on Mars has been in Early Access for three years, more than enough time to iron the wrinkles out of their tech, to realise that their script was cringeworthy garbage, to say the campaign to ensure collecting 1200 units of oxygen to install in your mobile laboratory is actually fun. I would be lying.

Here are a list of 10 features you can enjoy:

1) No dedicated server option
2) When building the Cargo truck, Willis tells the truck to watch out, because he's a "DIY enthusiast", a phrase that has never been spoken by any human being in the history of mankind
3) Take On Mars is currently an early-access game; while the core mechanics are finished, several features such as video tutorials are not yet available.
4) Take On Mars is not fast-paced, nor is it particularly action-filled. Instead, Take On Mars is focused on science, discovery, and roaming around the Martian desert.
5) The vastness of the locations, each encompassing an area of 16 km square, adds to the immersion that players have when landing on Mars.
6) You can take selfies on your PDA
7) The Martian terrain will eventually become a bit dull and boring, making it difficult to maintain your sanity during the long drive.
8) You can holding down the "S " or "W" key for over an hour staring at a computer screen.
9) Many of the missions are similar if not identical.
10) As you expected being a Bohemia game, it's a game that did one step forward and three backwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006588613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2271, 'last_played': 1526061140}
review:
Une perle... Quand j'ai fini le mode histoire... J'ai coupé le jeu.... Et regardé (encore) The Martian.
Beau & intelligent, il demande patience et réflexion.

L'ambiance graphique et sonore sont exceptionnelles.

Alors oui, il a des bugs, et ne pas hésiter à sauver plus que de raison. Parce qu'un beau jour, on s'apprête à faire un petit somme... Et paf : la mort fauche.
Petits soucis sur les collisions pafois énervants.

Bon, bref : oui, il y a des défauts... En attendant : vivement une nouvelle campagne !

author: {'steamid': '76561198101461728', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1494744257}
review: 挺有意思的游戏，希望有中文，或者创意工坊有大佬做一个汉化

author: {'steamid': '76561198000046410', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1550918935}
review:
I'm a huge Mars and space fan.

I've been really happy with Take on Mars, although I did have to push through a few clunky UI challenges and google a few things early on.  But once I got them figured out it has been rewarding, and I do feel like I've accomplished something by surviving from day to day (playing the manned story mission so far).

The graphics are good, although the engine is similar to ARMA and it can therefore be a bit of a beast to run at high frame rates.  Be warned (nVidia 1070, but I can tell it's CPU-bound on my i5-6500).

Some reviewers commented about dying while going up stairs, rocks, etc.  This sometimes happens if you rush up them, and in a bulky spacesuit is probably very realistic!  You will need patience to play this game, as one would need exploring a planet in real life.

Take on Mars is a simulator, and it is the best Mars "experience" I've ever tried.  Very few truly goofy paradigms for the sake of gameplay (although there are a few, but are easy to overlook).  There's also a great ISS scene that is apparently pretty accurate in its layout, and a few lunar missions too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014923034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1494713436}
review: The game is extremely buggy, I thought I could overlook it, but after getting pulled under the map after what was perhaps the most stressful moon buggy sim I've every played, I've decided that I simply can not recommend this game to even the most ardent of space sim fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022992061', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1494636274}
review:
もし、あなたがSpace EngineersやEmpyrion、Osiris等の宇宙サバイバルゲームをしているからSteamからオススメされたならCall of DutyやBattlefieldシリーズをしていて「お、リアル系FPSじゃん」と思いARMAを購入して（良いか悪いかは人によるが）なんか違う・・・。と言う事になる。
それもそのはず、同じ会社なのでARMAシリーズはリアルFPSじゃなく、リアル戦場シミュレータであり、このゲームはリアル火星（月や小惑星も含む）探索シミュレータなのだ。

このゲームで最もWorkshopでサブクライムされているのがオープンワールドのサバイバルゲームにするMODなのでわかるようにこのゲーム自体はあくまで火星探索シミュレータなのです。

そんなゲームの内容は
[h1]ミッションモード1[/h1]
（これがメイン）火星の写真しか取れない技術の時代から火星に降り立って調査、探索していくモード。自分は司令官のような存在。

各技術の開発には数時間から数十時間かかる、これを初めにゲームしていなくてもリアル時間で進めるか、スキップできるかを選ばしてくれる。
写真を撮るだけでミッション報酬をもらえるのでそのお金でさらに技術を開発してより良い写真を、ゆくゆくはローバー（現地探索用無人機）を設計して砂とか持って帰って来て最後は人間が実地探索までがお仕事。
ちなみに借金などはできませんので打ち上げ費用を考えずに技術投資すると積みます。

[h1]ミッションモード2[/h1]
初めだけオデッセイのマットデイモンになれる、いきなり宇宙遭難するが現場が月なのですぐに応援が来る。自分は宇宙飛行士の立場。

初めはミッション目標が出るので英語わからなくても大丈夫だが、いきなり酸素ボンベ落ちてるから探せ！2分以内でな！とか、基地の南の方に補給品がちらばったからなんとなく探してきて。等が目標矢印などもなくヒントは英語をヒアリング＆字幕を見つめる。
ARMAよろしく激しく揺れるが「C」キーで三人称になるので酔いやすい人も安心。

[h1]シナリオモード[/h1]
ミッションモードの各部分を切り取ってそこだけやるモード、マルチは基本シナリオのいずれかを選ぶかWorkshopでユーザーが作ったシナリオをする。


ARMAでおなじみのリアル志向、私は宇宙へ行く予定がないのでここまで挙動をリアルにしてもらわなくてもよかったのですが、火星探索ゲームとして見れば非常によくできていると思います。
ただ、このゲームをした後はデザートにSpaceEngineerをしたくなりました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198231133148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1495528592}
review: 我该怎么说呢，首先没中文差评，其次这个游戏还不如叫bug之旅呢，特么训练卡出无数种bug，进了五次出了五种不同bug，然后蜜汁抖动也很奇怪，感觉脖子要断掉了，不知道是不是我个人原因，这种抖动弄得我很晕。不过这个游戏还是有优点的比如画面不错，题材也很赞，这种异星探险的类型很吸引人，太空无重力环境很棒，尤其是忘记系安全绳就出仓然后.....然后就没有然后了......存档重开吧。总之，要是能出个中文再把bug修一下这个游戏就会很棒了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198022274377', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3052, 'last_played': 1630312654}
review:
This isn't the kind of game where everything is magical unicorn fun times.

Take on Mars is a serious simulation of what it would be like to explore mars in real life. Everything from the USSR Mars-3 lander to sci-fi grade manned exploration is here, and it is in the manned portion where the game grabs you by the scruff of the neck, spits in your face and dumps you onto a hostile world with very few supplies and, if you're lucky, a basic 3D printer. And I absolutely could not be happier for the experience.

And since mars has no magnetic field, you'll need to find shelter from the solar events that saturate the planet in extreme radiation. And you'll need to make your own oxygen and water before your current supplies run out.

And that's just the premade campaign.

Between the hostile environment and equally hostile physics, you'l have a challange in every play session.

Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030644416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 30171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7766, 'last_played': 1632939543}
review:
Best seasickness simulator ever.

Seriously - I really want to recommend this game - it's got a lot of potential but the graphics engine is ridiculously unoptimised, to the point that I have to spend most of my time playing in immersion breaking 3rd person to escape the constant lag induced bobbing motion (with head bobbing turned off!)

I've kept coming back to this during early access and thinking that this time it will be better. But no - just more features on top of an unoptimised game engine, equals increasing frustration.

Playable on a GTX1080 (albeit with some graphical bugs) but was sickness inducing on an older machine. If you've got a high end graphics card it's playable, otherwise I'd steer clear unless it's fixed (which looks unlikely now its out of early access)

If you can get past this issue it is an immersive game if you like a fairly realistic survival experience (although we need to talk about mission architectures - seriously who makes the vehicles internally methane generator charged but without charging ports and with no standalone methane generator?!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198087933619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1529354276}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039486046', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2846, 'last_played': 1624656441}
review:
Gra nie jest prosta. Szczeglnie dla początkujących. To jednak uważam za plus. Byle odnalezienie torebki z wodą czy jedzeniem cieszy, nie mówiądz już o odnalezieniu rafineri i jej uruchomieniu.
Klimat wspaniały, podczas przerwy od gry sprawdzam czy dokładnie zamknołem drzwi od kibelka jak by to był właz w obawie o dekompresje.
Linia fabularna może nie jest jakaś wybitna ale ja osobiście nie mogłem się doczekać następnego zadania a chyba o to tu chodzi.
Graficznie... to chyba każy widzi na screenach. Jak na symulator to bardzo dobrze moim skromnym zdaniem.
Gra aktorska to wisiemka na torcie. Tak zgadza się. Nie spodziewałem sie w grze tego typu wogule usłyszeć jakich kolwiel ludzi a tu prosze.

Na tą chwilą dał bym 10/10 ale niestety...

Bugi! Nie raz zdarzyło mi sie umrzeć podczas kładzenia się spać (polecam zapisywać przed) jak by potkną się, uderzył się w głowę i umarł. Z wchodzeniem po drabinie tęż jest podobnie. BOOM dead!
Polskie napisy. Po ustawieniu ich, teksty z misji zmieniły sie na jakieś bzdury po angielsku poprzeplatane hasztagani i slashami. Może poprawią spolszczenie, wtedy będzie 9/10

Narazie jednak z uwagi na dłędy i polskie tłumaczenie moja ocena to mocne 8/10!

ps. Starałem się napisać tą recenzją rozsądnie jednak mój pogląd jest nie obiektywny, jestem fanem wszyskiego co związane z kosmosem i z symulacją.

Pozdrawiam

author: {'steamid': '76561198032330870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1584834696}
review:
You can imagine yourself in tight space suit middle of martian surface where u have all time in the world but in other hand u don't have time at all because your suit is leaking oxygen.

First of all.. This game isn't for you if u looking for speedy space shooter. It takes a little of your patience to get in but when u made it u found that TOM is best Mars exploration game/simulator around. Take a control of your own rover or build a huge outpost. Theres so much to do!

Some players reported bugs in single play but I think that latest patch fixed many of them. Well... I died couple of time when went to sleep but that happened only in emergency poptent, I got over it anyway. You have to be carefully when jumping around, its not bug if u fall to martian ground and break the helmet, its just stupidy. 

Multiplayer is awesome but still found some bugs. Played many hours with my friends, sometimes other can't use devices when other can do so theres a little things to fix up. The multiplayer session works very well no connection issues or drop downs.

Altogether it works very well now. Thumps up from here, go ahead and feel fantastic moments on mars!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041343803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2448, 'last_played': 1564861352}
review:
So far it's the only game that gives you that [b]Mark Watney[/b]/ Mars-survival-feeling over a whole and complete campaign. [b]I enjoyed it very much and would buy it again.[/b] (For this review I played the manned program a second time, half of it in [b]VR[/b], and played multiplayer scenarios).

During the campaign you have to fix leaking suits, find/collect supply drops with the truck, set up devices/machines, extract resources, refine chemicals, travel to the MAV, analyze soil samples, build/puzzle 3D-printers,  to – eventually – produce fuel for your ship back to earth. You get to experience the ISS and in flashbacks the Moon too.

The graphics and the atmospheric background music are really nice. The controls could be better/smoother, but you get used to it. The game is a simulation: pitch black night; correct sound (no atmosphere - no sound: well done in the air lock!); or low gravity: no crazy sprinting or driving possible!; not to mention the laborious machinery-based grinding process: electricity, chemistry, potato-horticulture... cool!

Do not expect an action-packed game, or a huge ecosystem of dinosaurs to tame, or hundreds of enemies to kill. You WILL feel cast away and very lonely. It's just you against the odds on a beautiful but hostile and empty planet (similar to "The long dark").

And every now and then, unfortunately, it's you against the physics/collision engine, that can kill you by accident (catapult you/things in the air, or smash your helmet – followed by a quick death). But with wise save-games and experience this can be overcome (single player allows reloading). Btw it adds to the survival setting – catastrophe is just around the corner.

A top-up is VR: you can play TKOM with the Vive and Vorpx. It works nicely, but you need to know the menu/control system, because the inventory-font-size is too small in some cases).

[b]If you are a fan of Mark Watney it's worth buying during a sale.[/b] Read some tips and tricks to have an easier stay on Mars (see below).

The game has a bigger potential (multiplayer, mods, and user made scenarios) that is sadly not being exploited much due to slow bug fixing, which disappointed the community, and made it shrink, and the reviews drop. Which is a pity because self sustaining bases are best build with other players. 

Similar games are in development / early access. So far TKOM is the most developed and offers the  biggest variety of features and scenarios (editor, user made content). I wish it had a modern engine and a bigger community. This way it could compete easily with the upcoming similar games and could carry itself quite some time into the future, especially with VR.

Some tips and tricks (no spoilers):

* always use multiple savepoints
* do not jump crazy (bunny hoping)  - eventually you will fall on your visor and crack it
* do not be slow: you can run out of food quickly
* nights are fairly long and very dark - use your vehicle lights (there is no time lapse during sleep yet, but announced)
* always stow truck ramps and stair cases before driving (can be ribbed off at rocks)
* even a flat and empty water bag can block your way inside the truck cabin – keep everything tidy and crouch when it happens
* its hard to move inside vehicles while having it parked on a slope
* activate the mission parts to see the waypoints of the supply drops or be a very good navigator instead 
* the building system is not as fast as in Ark Survival due to smaller parts and real 3D printing – be patient
* the object snapping works fine and is more accurate but slower in speed – be precise 
* resource grinding is much more challenging: think carefully about chemistry and ALL your resources at hand
* never forget your helmet or do not take it off to early inside an airlock/pop tent (yes, it happens to everyone at some point in time)
* plan ahead
* do not forget to play some disco music ;-)

Have fun - be save!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025933728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11624, 'last_played': 1585199617}
review:
Buen juego con muchas posibilidades. Aúna temas reales de exploración espacial con temas más imaginativos, como la exploración humana en marte. Los controles no son lo más intuitivo del mundo, y de momento no he visto que tenga buena compatibilidad con pad (esencial para manejar landers y rovers). 

El tema de las modificaciones de usuario dan mucho juego, como en todos los juegos de Bohemia Interactive, y suelen ser lo que hacen los juegos en grandes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069587898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 14521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8488, 'last_played': 1706630133}
review:
Recommended, with a few caveats.  The rover portion of the game is solid, and it can be very relaxing just driving a rover around on Mars.  Added challange of driving it using the POV of the rovers camera(s).  One issue that does crop up occasionally is in the dynamic task creation, it will sometimes ask for impossible combinations, like using the ASPX on atmosphere.  Not a huge issue, as those tasks are completely optional and can be ignored.

The manned portion can be both fun and frustrating at the same time.  The campaign is fairly short, but it is just meant to teach you the basics of base building.  The frustrations come from the occasional bugs, some serious, most are not.  Part of the issue stems from the engine used(ARMA 3 I believe) and trying to get it to do things that it was never meant to do.  In some ways they would have been better off creating their own engine from scratch, but I can understand why they didn't go that route.

As to multiplayer, I have never used it due to high latency on my end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032486485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 41239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38184, 'last_played': 1623087322}
review:
Juego  con posibilidades excepcionales, tras el lanzamiento final, lleno de bugs, y sin terminar.

Se prometen actualizaciones y no se ven por ningun lado.

Tras mas de 600 horas e juego, es un verdadero desastre, Dramm este Señor que dice querer finalizar y terminar el juego , no hace absolutamente nada.

La seccion Robotica no esta finalizada, mas aun, esta totalmente incompleta , si te te embarcas en ella que sepas que no la terminaras.

La seccion Humana, esta mal creada , ya que faltan objetos basicos para poder sobrevivir en Marte.

Ni que decir sobre actuaciones online, es totalmente imposible. 

Y ya para terminar, como proyecto muerto , lo unico que nos faltaba es una sola actualizacion con una sobredosis de no se que, montando en Europa, un simil de subanautica, sin terminar.


En fin no te lo compres, hazme caso.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994011326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5474, 'last_played': 1496682704}
review:
So I've played around with this game alot. While I enjoy, mostly, what exists..I have too many concerns with it.

This game is so far from finished it isn't even funny. Like.. imagine the worst game you can remember playing.. then delete half the code. It's almost *literally* a perfect analogy.

That being said, here is my list:

Pros:
Mars Survival: (If you liked the movie "The Martian" you might like playing this.)

Diverse building/construction capability. There is a lot you can do in the game.

The graphics are not too shabby at all.
It's a game.
It's one *heck* of a way to waste time.

Cons:
- It's 90%+ a rip off of "The Martian". In both, you are named Mark. A Botanist. And you grow potatoes for food. Just for starters.

- In order to grow potatoes.. you need potato seeds... Think about that for a second. Potato seeds. *Hint* Potatoes *are* the seed! So when you are farming.. in this game.. you plant the "Potato Seeds" and grow a potato plant.. Which you can harvest for potato seeds and potatoes. (NOTE: As Vas pointed out.. the potato *isn't* actually the seed. Learn something new every day! Unfortunately however.. that *really* doesn't change anything now does it? This game is still "The Martian" v.01)

- The physics are completely broken. There are things that happen when running wires, or even just laying down in your emergency poptent that can not physically happen, will kill you, and potentially waste hours of your time if you haven't recently saved.

- The graphics engine is one of the worst I have seen in years. The coding of the game causes even my 1080 SLI setup to get so bogged down while I am playing.. That even it can't keep up. How this "developer" managed that.. I don't even know. 

- The UI is so painful to use.. you will constantly find yourself yelling at the screen.. after you tried, unsuccessfully, to put something in your inventory several times.. but instead dropped it on the floor... several times. You have to have the pointer in *just* the right spot, or the item in *just* the right position.. or it is either going to go where you don't want it to... Or the item is going to *literally* shoot off like a rocket to parts of Mars yet unknown. Possibly Pluto.

- As you build up your base.. the game becomes so bogged down that the screen has a persistant "shake" when you turn your camera. Build too much (which is something like 20-30 items--impossibly easy to do) and it happens, and only gets worse.

-Build too much (40-50+ items) and the game starts to slow down.. Allowing you to do slow motion Moon-Jumping... because the game is now running at a fraction of it's normal speed.

-The Narration is garbage. The voice actor will eventually make you want to deck the crap out of him--Because he is an idiot. You can tell they watched the movie "The Martian" too much, and tried to think of good dialog to replace it and do the exact same thing... And could not have done a worse job.

-You build in this game using a 3d printer to build everything. Clothing. Glass. Computers. Wires. Complex Refineries. The developer apparently doesn't understand 3d printers.

-Electrical cables are alive. They do not just lay down. They squirm and/or float up into the air like earthworms in pain. It is a *painful* eyesore when trying to build a cool base.. and the wires float up, around, and other insanity.. making your base look like cancer.

-So very much more.. I can't even begin to remember it all. You have to just learn to ignore everything about this game.. in order to just play it, let alone like it.

-ET for the NES was better. This alone speaks volumes.

I will update this if I think of anything I've forgotten. Do yourself a favor. Don't buy it. Take an intro to C/C++ college class.. and I guarentee you that within a year.. You can program something better.

Yeah.. that's not true. But the sad part is... it *almost* is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972793589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 31732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1642784599}
review:
This game has a lot of rough edges that let it down. Some problems game engine glitches that will kill you. Somehow while playing around in a nice safe tutorial on Earth I managed to slip through the surface of a grassy parkland and died falling to the center of the Earth. [b]Get in the habit of saving regularly![/b] Other problems are [i]infuriating[/i] UI inconsistencies - sometimes you left-click to open a door, some door buttons demand you press E.

That said, I have been enjoying the game a lot, particularly the manned mission, and I expect I will be putting in more hours. It's a decently well thought out Mars mission simulator with mildly realistic in-situ resource utilization. If you had the patience to build a space station in KSP, give this a go. If you haven't, go play KSP some more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052369790', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1585419094}
review:
This is a fantastic game, with so much promise. 

However, simply walking can, and sometimes does, kill you. 

Want to walk up some stairs? Death is coming. 

Want to climb over something that's blocking your way? Death is coming.

Want to go through the same door you have hundreds of times before? Death is coming.

Want to drive on the moon or mars? That's nice, the views are stunning. But enjoy flipping your vehical back over because you were silly enough to drive over a pebble... That or you'll die of course.


Fix these issues and it'll be the perfect game to sink some serios hours into. With these all it does it stress you out, and make you want to hurt people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065305154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2824, 'last_played': 1616885597}
review:
Right title for this game is: "Making mars work"
When I first bought this, it was going to be a mars rover sim. 
And it did a good job at that.
But then the wishing genie met all-around excited engineers, and a paper castle was build.

Great thing about this game is it's mods do awesome things to the high level side of the game.
If we take on mars, shouldn't this be here... Someone builds it, game get so much better.
Example: Disposing of directional energy grid (wtf devs, fysics)  material pipelines, ...

Worst thing, commercial engine, we can't fix what breaks
*network play will kill you *crashes will happen *performance, this is a fat simulator

How to fix this game:
- Make extending straight forward
- Rely on scientist & engineers that play this game to do the high level stuff
- Pack these approved Items into the game
- Fix your engine, spend your time on fixing

author: {'steamid': '76561198040131637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12544, 'last_played': 1598845954}
review:
First of all, I would like to say that this game is fun and had entertained me for hours.  I don't believe that this game was ready for release, however.  There are numerous things that need to be addressed in the current state, especially in multiplayer.  The story mode for manned took no time at all to beat, however, you can choose to stay on Mars and build your base and gather supplies until you wish to leave, but there wasn't a lot of challenge to the manned story.  I would recommend this game if it were still in the early stages of beta, but I don't think that I would be able to recommend the game in it's current state based on what I believe a final product should be.  If you want to fight through some bugs and do some online playing or just do the single player scenarios to occupy your time, I would recommend it.

Again, I do enjoy the base building and playing the rover storyline, but I think they tried to rush the final product in the manned story mode and mulitplayer seems to still have a number of bugs that need squashed.  3.5 out of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561197984871587', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8454, 'last_played': 1490292587}
review:
There is a good judgement to tell if your going to like this game or not. Ever watch one of the NASA livesteams of them doing an EVA working on the ISS? If you thought it was exciting, then you are going to love this game. if you got board and wonder where all the space pew pew pew was, You are going to do the same in this game.  

Couple that with a game engine that is not optimized for this sort of game. While it might say no need to wait till the 1930's to take on mars. You might need to wait so you have a decent enough computer to play it.  Listed system requirments are garbage, Even the recomended is garbage.  I would put the 680 is a min and the 980 os recomended. And even with a 1080TI, your going to hit performance isssues with some settings and building.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014043568', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2199, 'last_played': 1574550316}
review:
First off let me state that I'm not the type of person to say "I told you so".

But during this game's time in EA I kept stressing the fact that Bohemia Interactive missed several deadlines that they themselves assigned; even making a [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/244030/discussions/0/541906348054837933/]few posts[/url] on the Discussions board and leaving a [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/244030/discussions/0/154641879463901867/]few comments[/url] to warn people about what to expect. The responses I'd receive were in the field of, "It's Alpha just wait it'll be great!"

Well now after several delays we're here and out of EA and while this game is an interesting concept it handles like hot garbage. Bugs bugs and more bugs. The controls are awful and getting anything built of worth is a slog through sticky muck.

I enjoyed the concept of the single player campaign/story they added (ignoring that it mirrored the Martian almost completely, cause original story design is hard), but my enjoyment was hard fought after dying when I tried to lay down in the Poptent my first night, dying when I sat down in the Cargo Truck, dying when a canister I dropped into a cargo box ricocheted and slammed into my head (that was pretty funny despite the auto save being almost an hour old), and the worst of them all, me eating one of the ration packs erasing the progress I had on a previously completed objective making it impossible for me to actually finish the story. (Why the objectives don’t lock upon completion is anyone’s guess)

On the subject of Multiplayer, why in the world does this game lack the ability to host Dedicated Servers? The Peer-2-Peer that they have in place now is god awful. I guess I can hope that eventually they’ll address this issue and release dedicated server files, but I’m not expecting much. 

So to wrap this up after all the delays and all the “It’ll be great” fan service what we’re left with is a game that feels unfinished and an overall sense that BI didn’t have the time to sit down and actually test their game from a playability standpoint. I’d say avoid at all costs unless it’s on sale for $5 and you really enjoy the concept of space games, even if this one explicitly does a bad job at most everything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126717988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2474, 'last_played': 1490976748}
review: Tak of Mars , jedna z lepszych gier survivalowych jakie są na rynku w chwili obecnej.  Katastrofa lądownika na marsie i tylko ty przeżyłeś,  hmm  co dalej co zrobić? O tym właśnie jest gierka wymaga myślenia szybkiego działania i organizacji w tym działaniu. Mnie urzekło szczególnie budowa drukarki 3D , aby stworzyć inne urządzenia pomocne do przetrwania samotnie w surowym klimacie marsa. PS: oszczędzajcie materiały do budowy . Gra z wczesnym dostępem , ale wszycho działa jak należy owszem nie brakuje denerwujących bugów  typu nie można podnieść skrzyni z itemami a jak podniesiesz to je wysypiesz,przewracanie się postaci o byle co itp. Jednak twoje działania w pełni to rekompensują i zadowolenie że dałeś  radę. Nie próbowałem multiplayera , ale po skończonej kampanii i wyhodowaniu ton ziemniaków (coś na marsie trzeba jeść) teraz go wypróbuje ,solo spędzicie wiele godzin starając się opuścić marsa w multi w kooperacji min czterech graczy pujdzie szybciej ale i tak każdy z was będzie miał ręce pełne roboty . Organizacja ,organizacja i jeszcze raz organizacja to sukces no i cop. z innymi . Próbne odwierty ,badanie próbek atmosfery i odwiertów ,próbek z powierzchi to wszystko ważne gdzie są surowce, tak tak nie wystarczy maszyny ustawić i załatwione. Gierę gorąco polecam naprawdę daje radę i wiele satysfakcji ,życzę cierpliwości. Bohemia znów nie zawiodła.

review: That the game released in this state is a disgrace, even from Bohemia. It's discussed at length in other reviews, but it is an unoptimized bug fest. There is a lot of content, plenty of good ideas, but it's like nobody thought about how to make it enjoyable for players. The controls are the clunkiest I have ever seen. Mind you, I play ArmA a lot, so it's not the complexity nor the variety of control schemes that repulse me, it's just that everything from the mouse movements to the character animations are absolutely atrocious. The game doesn't let me enjoy it, and that's reaaaally frustrating for the simulation / space enthusiast (and early-backer) I am.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030027512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1659619802}
