author: {'steamid': '76561197994514528', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1489072705}
review:
This game is awful in so many ways - and yet, I highly recommend it!

The basic premise is to run a space program, explore Mars and other parts of our solar system, and if you play the campaign from start to finish, you start with Rovers and progress to manned missions. As the player you can very much scale the challenge to what you want to do - some missions require you to just move a camera, others need you to pilot a spacecraft in zero-g - and that is both as boring and as challenging as it sounds.

The game tries to give you that Space Program feel, and there begins the problems. The interface is clunky, it's not explained at all, and there are any number of cutscens that just bore the crap out of you. Some of the challenges require a mindnumbing rover-drive for 1 km across mars - that gets really boring too, and feels like you're investing offline time for in-game progress. 

The game is just as unforgiving and buggy as all of Bohemia's products are. I've had two crafts fall through the ground on insertion, and since you're always kind of strapped for cash, that can cripple your program and force you to do some of those long drives or reload. The game - for some inexplicably bad design reason - doesn't autosave when you start a mission, so reloads can cost you if you forgot to constantly save.

And yet, it is so much fun! The feeling of building a space program is very real and the challenges with bugs and the penalties for failure make you feel exposed to the elements like in a survival game. I've played a ton of Kerbal and I love the heck out of this experience, bugs aside.

So really: give it a go if you love space exploration and strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008130717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1300, 'last_played': 1487204045}
review:
Je commente très rarement mais là, il y a de quoi.
Tellement déçu par cette production de Bohémia que j'ai demandé à Steam d'être remboursé. Bien entendu, je n'ai jamais revu mon argent car plus de deux heures d'utilisation (que j'ai passé plus ou moins à vérifier ma config).
J'ai un ordi assez costaud, un i7, une r9 290x et 16GB de ram mais ce jeu ne semble pas optimisé du tout. Le pire des problèmes rencontrés (car ils sont nombreux)  est d'affreux clipping sur l'écran HUD qui provoquent de violent pics de température et rende le gameplay quasiment impossible tellement ca clipe et ca rame.
J'ai essayé différents réglages et même au minimum ca bug horriblement.

Pour moi, ce jeu ne mérite pas le statut de Gold. C'est encore une mauvaise beta voir une alpha. Mais il semblerait que Bohemia ait tenté de sauver son investissement en le releasant tel quel. Pathétique. 
J'ai vraiment insisté en me disant que les problèmes pouvaient être liés à des parties du scénario mais après 20 heures et être arrivé sur le 2eme site de mars, j'ai abandonné et désinstallé cette m###de.
Bon courage à ceux qui voudront lui donner une chance mais dites vous que vous ne reverrez jamais votre argent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004007155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2157, 'last_played': 1594237493}
review:
Hab inzwischen rund 35 Stunden voll und muss sagen, dass das Spiel an sich eine Menge Potential hat.
Der erste Missionsstrang beinhaltet das unbemannte Erforschen des Mars mit Hilfe von Robotern. Das ganze ist gut umgesetzt und man hat eine ganze Menge Möglilchkeiten, was viel Spaß macht. Leider wird das Gameplay nach einiger Zeit etwas eintönig, weil man im Endeffekt immer das Gleiche tut. Dieser Makel wird allerdings von immer neuen freischaltbaren Bauteilen und Werkzeugen wett gemacht.
Der zweite Spielteil beinhaltet die bemannte Marsfahrt. Die hier angelegte Kampagne ist gut umgesetzt und ziemlich frei spielbar. Man hat gute Möglichkeiten das bemannte Spielen kennen zu lernen und die ganzen Mechaniken zu testen.
Im "freien" Spiel, also ohne vorgegebene Story kann man, wie von solchen Spielen gewohnt, alles tun und lassen, was man möchte: Basen bauen, den Planeten erkunden, eine Colonie aufbauen, oder einfach nur das Nötigste erledigen und die Aussicht genießen.
Ebenfalls interessant ist das Zusammenspiel der ganzen im Spiel vorhandenen Rohstoffe, welche sich alle miteinander zu neuen Materialien verbinden lassen, was ungeahnte Möglichkeiten mit sich bringt.
Zusätzlich bietet der dem Spiel beiliegende Editor die Möglichkeit eigene kleine Scenarien und Mission zu erstellen, wobei es leider keine Einleitung zu diesem gibt, man sich alles also selber erarbeiten muss. Ich persönlich bin damit leider überfordert.
Als letzten Punkt möchte ich den allgemeinen Spielfluss ansprechen, welcher im großen und ganzen recht flüssig, schlüssig und zusammenhängend aufgebaut ist.
Was die Performance angeht muss allerdings noch ziemlich stark nachgebessert werden. Wer sich mit zwei Fahrzeugen und 4-5 Maschienen bei seiner Basis befindet, der bekommt schnell Probleme mit den FPS. Ich selbst kannn für meinen Teil im Moment gar nicht mehr spielen, weil das Spiel mir bei meinem aktuellen Spielstand nicht mehr als 5 FPS erlaubt. Dort ist also dringend ganz starker Nachbesserungsbedarf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058811579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1796, 'last_played': 1657998374}
review:
First off, yes this game has a few bugs but nothing game breaking, just frustrating at times. If you're looking for a serious astronaut simulator, this is your game. It brings to life the slow tediousness of working in a space suit ridiculously far from home. After completing the main storyline, I am happy with the time I spent and will be playing through the extra scenarios included and hopefully finding some extra content in the workshop.

Some tips if you are jumping in:
- Save often, particularly if you're about to go through the cargo truck airlock. In one instance I had removed my suit and was suddenly pushed through the ceilinig of the airlock where I suffocated quickly. Just save often.
- If the 3D printer you build says it has incorrect/missing parts but you are absolutely sure it has everything; take it apart and rebuild it with the same parts. Also make sure you have 4 resource inputs, the picture in the datapad only shows 2.

so played this game for a few hours, i really enjoyed it at start then getting through the game i started noticing all the bugs, first mst annoying your character falls over everything and 8/10 times i have died from this it is such a bad desig and ruins it so i recommend saving all the time. and do not overwirte or delete saves this will course the game to crash.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998683084', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1489062897}
review:
Take on Mars sarebbe il simulatore per eccellenza per quella che è la missione della NASA su Marte e di quella che probabilmente sarà l'esperienza di colui che metterà (forse) piede per primo sul pianeta rosso. Parlo dicendo [u]"sarebbe"[/u] perché, se da un lato le idee e come sono state messe giù queste idee è da apprezzare, dall'altro lato [b]dobbiamo tenere conto che il reparto tecnico lascia molto a desiderare.[/b] Bug, glitch e a volte persino crash random rovinano quella che è un esperienza unica nel suo genere. Non mi sento di consigliare a pieni voti questo titolo, ma ve lo consiglio scontato per le bellissime emozioni che può trasmettere il vuoto marziano.

Vedete molti più dettagli nel video sottostante.

Pro:
- Unico nel suo genere
- Molto dettagliato
- Molto immersivo, rende benissimo l'idea di solitudine
- Ottimo potenziale dal lato Coop
- Due giochi in uno: Robotica e Manned

Contro:
- Bug, clitch, clippings.. si passa attraverso strutture
- Reparto tecnico che lascia a desiderare
- Coop praticamente impossibile per via di glitch e bug
- Totale assenza di server dedicati, ma non mi meraviglia come cosa.
- Consigliato da scontato e mi dispiace

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qYKFK4iIurA

author: {'steamid': '76561197983351778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1484960508}
review:
TKOM is a good game for an alpha-version.

But many years and have passed since start of the early access phase and while it has become a full game in complexity, it is still very clunky and needs a final streamline. 
Right now, it is a game for an open beta-test and not a releasable game.


C'mon Dram + Team, one final push!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067262045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 29705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12946, 'last_played': 1686649938}
review: Le jeux en lui meme et bien, il manque quand meme certaine chose (sur la map de la lune les traces du premiere alunissage , sur les maps de Mars sa manque de reliefs pas de grotte, il manque le visage martien, pour les fusées (landing) il resemble au fusée de retour des missions gemini et apollo, les rovers pas mal mais il manque une station de commande fabricable pour pouvoir les controler en mode MP et SP , les combinaisons sont aussi tres typer année 60, juste le hub fait moderne (battement du coeur soulant dans le temps ) vu les combinaisons actuelle et celle a venir il a du choix et de la matiere pour le jeux tout comme les fusées et planete a explore , les véhicules  sont bien sauf la navette de transport qui et vraiment nul de chez nul et qui na aucune utiliter. je recommande se jeux en esperant des patchs pour rajouter du contenu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289321669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1499070594}
review:
Ein tolles Spiel könnte es sein oder noch werden. Aber momentan ist es einfach nur schlecht und selbst mit einem langen Atem und viel Geduld ist es nur schwer zu ertragen. 

Positives zuerst: - es ist ein spitzen Szenario - die atmosphäre im Spiel ist super - es gibt viele Möglichkeiten sich seine Baasis zu gestalten, Rohstoffe zu gewinnen u.s.w. also alles in allem ein sehr gutes Konzept.

Negatives: - die grafik ist absolut schlecht, auch mit hohen einstellungen wird es nicht besser - es ruckelt ohne Ende (fps im Durchschnitt ~ 10-15) - die steuerung ist hackelig und der Charakter bewegt sich nur im Schneckentempo, wobei bei mir die Gehgeschwindigkeit von den Grafikeinstellungen abhängt (Bug oder Feature ????) -der Charakter ist allgemein schlecht animiert - der Charakter schwingt bei jeder Mausbewegung nach wie ein Wackeldackel oder als ob er nicht ganz gesund wäre, das ist auf dauer Übelkeits erregend - das GUI ist momentan auch noch verbugt und flackert wild umher, man kann das GUI auch ausschalten hat dann aber auch kein Fadenkreuz mehr - das Fadenkreuz an sich ist ein bisschen Mager und dinge zu greifen ist nicht immer leicht - eine Deutsche Sprachübersetzung fehlt, zwar ist schon eine drin aber die ist nicht zu gebrauchen ( das Spiel ist so Komplex da langt das "grund Englisch " nicht aus) - Div. Grafikfehler u.s.w. .

Also es ist durchaus noch Luft nach oben um daraus ein gutes Spiel zu machen. Ich hoffe sehr das noch weiter an dem Spiel gearbeitet wird. So wie es momentan ist kann ich nur jedem davon abraten das Spiel zu kaufen (vorallem nicht für den Preis !!!), das ist es nicht wert. 
Ich werde es bis zum nächsten patch nicht mehr anfassen und sollte es sich in nächster Zeit noch zum positiven ändern dann dreh ich den Daumen gerne um!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018891057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1572802260}
review:
I'm very disappointed - so much potential wasted in half-baked beta sold as actual game. I wonder whether people at Bohemia Interactive know that ideas like testing (SQA) and user experience (UX) have been conceived long time ago. I heard that TKOM was in development since 2013. Seriously? What were developers doing for four years? Designing new bugs? Here is the list (incomplete) of 'features' I have found out while playing the game:
- when I load saved campaign I have to 'press any key' twice - why?
- the graphics is blurry! I guess it was meant to simulate depth of field, but it resembles severe case of tunnel vision instead
- there is no user manual
- rover missions are designed in absolutely pathetic way - on several occasions I have sent a rover with black and white 
camera, only to find out later that color photos are required to complete the mission - description of required equipment of the vehicle clearly indicated 'BW camera'.
- Terra Imager, the camera capable of taking color photos, is considered black and white when it comes to completion of missions where color photos are required.
- on several occasions I was stuck in a mission because there were photos to be taken, but one of markers was not turning green (in open terrain, pretty close to the rover), or a marker was inside a boulder
- when I drive a rover, something really strange is going on with solar panel (there are no other power sources on board). For instance: during the ride charge is 20W and drain is 30W, but when I stop the rover, the drain drops to 0 (it's not realistic, but I can live with it), but charge drops to 10W! Why??? Of course it's 20W again when the rover starts to move
- animation displayed during time skip is simply awful
- just after start of a campaign, several locations are described as 'all missions in this location have been completed' - by whom?
- from time to time whole mission control room turns black and I have to restart the game.
- level of detail in mission control room was probably designed with ZX Spectrum in mind 
This is not to say that the game is worthless, there are several aspects that are pretty good:
- technology tree is rather short, but organized in sensible way
- Mars shown as far, lifeless, desolate place.

Long story short, currently the game is piece of you-know-what, but in few months it may become something worthwhile. Meanwhile, I'm getting back to absolutely fantastic Kerbal Space Program!

review: Regarding the price it's a nice game. Especially in the beginning. But then comes a looooooong booooring phase where you drive miles and miles with your veeeeery slow rovers on the surface of the mars, doing all the same tasks over and over again: Drive to point a, extend roboarm, scan, retract arm. Drive again. If you don't mind spending 3-4 hours watching a rover drive in slowmotion over a waste planet because you are a sim-fan, than this is for you. After that, it becomes interesting again when you finished the robo-phase of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036657840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2453, 'last_played': 1660663673}
review: Game is still running on integrated graphics only. The bug with the mobile nVidia GPUs hasn't been fixed in more than a year. I would love to play the game on my fast GPU, but this is unacceptable. I have played over 40 hours on integrated graphics, just because I like the idea so much, but the final product is disappointing. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS!!! I wish I could get a refund. Definitely the last game I bought from Bohemia!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040727720', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1487011188}
review:
I was actually issues a Steam Credit refund with 4 hours on record.

I really love games like this. The whole "Super realism" thing always gets me, and it is in space which is also super cool.

But, when playing it I just felt like it had been through 0 play testing, and no one had tried to push the limits at all...

For instance, durring the manned mission campaign you need an Oxygen Tank to pressurize your little tent in order to complete the mission. But I did not know this because it was my first play through. So, I tried to use the tank on my suit to get more Oxygen for my suit.

However, it didn't work it just emptied it into the atmosphere. Then when the part where I needed to fill my tent up, I could no longer do it, it wouldn't even snap in place anymore.

So, I thought it was the wrong item or something and spent the remaining 14minutes of oxygen I had looking for something else, but never did.

Then once I figured out why it didn't work, I beat the mission and went to the lunar mission where it told me I needed to go south of the base to find supply drops, and that was all it told me.

So, I started driving the buggy south (Which refueling the buggy was insanely difficult, it doesn't tell you how or what to do, left is empty, right one is fuel up spent maybe 10-15minutes messing around with it.)

So, Im driving on the moon with my buggy when all the sudden I fall through the floor of the moon, and I am just now falling forever under the mission.

I restart and walk up to my buggy and i get flung into space, the movement and physics engine is horrible. You can prop surf on accident very easily.

As far as the robotics campaign goes, I am not sure, whenever I tried to do a mission and went back to the Mission Control room the screen was entirely black and I would have to restart  the game to fix it.

It really just should not be out of Early Access, it feels like a game that shouldnt even be out of Pre-early access. There should still be lots of inhouse testing.

i would not recommend in its current state.

However, i feel if by some miracle they fix bugs, I feel like online multiplayer with some good mods might make for a really fun space survival game. IF IF, one can dream.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055359056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 17311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11852, 'last_played': 1510963234}
review:
I like this game, specifically the manned portion of it. You really get to experience what it would be like on Mars.

But I can't really recommend it.
1. The manned portion is short, and rather disappointing. Storywise it was ok, but not great. Most of the manned portion mechanics are completely unused. You can build bases, but it's not at all needed. You can mine, but it's also not needed. It almost feels like they ran out of ideas or got sick of developing it..

2. The game is buggy. Really buggy. You can accidently kill yourself at times by jumping and somehow getting launched into the air. You can stand on items and pick them up to find yourself surfing through the air. The atmosphere in your base can suddenly vanish, for no apparent reason, leaving you to asphyxiate because your suit ran out of air.

3. It's poorly documented, making it very difficult to know how to do some things, ie pressurizing a base.

4. The UI is not great. It's very easy to accidentally use the wrong refinery recipe. It's sometimes hard to see the displays on machines because you just view them as in game scenery rather than getting a display interface. It's sometimes hard to connect barrels to slots and the key needed changes depending on scenarios.

The robotic portion of the game is ok, but it again is hard to work out what to do at times, and can be hard to meet objectives because it's either unclear how or buggy, though it's not clear which.

If you are only interested in the manned portion, then you most likely will need to be playing multiplayer, because the campaign is brief.
If you can tolerate all these issues, and the idea interests you, then you'll probably love the game, as I do, but as it is, it should not have left early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271885293', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1639029837}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070733698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4802, 'last_played': 1640220435}
review:
I would like to begin with that I got this game in EA and have given this game alot of time to become something beautiful.......

I love space games and thought this would scratch a itch I have had for a while but it just made me feel really really sad.


EA and Game Mechanics:
There has been alot of frustrating bugs since EA that are still there in full release
- you can stand on something and pick it up so it makes you into the silver surfer
- you can run to close to a wall and trip over
- you can run over a little rock and trick over
- you can run up a slight hill and guess what.......... you trip over
- sometimes when you trip over you can fly 100's of feet away and also so can the object your holding

Unmmaned Mission:
- the game gives you no idea what the mission symbol's mean.
- you can go bankrupt so easy because you have no idea what you are meant to be researching because at no time did the game ever explain.
- You can programe a rover a course to follow but will not follow it because it slides and goes way off course (I first thought it was because wind but it slides into the wind) because of this rover missions feel so boring as you have to sit there for maybe 30-40 mins at snail pace.

Manned Missions:
- The story is just plain ripped off a film and even then its awful
- very short and can complete it in 1-2 days
- filled with alot of tedious stuff

I thought the unmanned missions was going to finally lead to you actually leaving earth and making your way to mars but you will never use earth apart from the tutorial and you will never use the space station apart from 10-15 section.... such a shame

Multiplayer:
Sadly to say that multiplayer in this game is just pointless
- once you build a base there is nothing to do, research or any reason to use your base.

Conclusion:
The price they are asking for this complete mess is crazy and would only MAYBE think of buying it at a heavily discounted price because this company has never really cared about this game or worked towards fixing long outstanding bugs

author: {'steamid': '76561198019535806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6336, 'last_played': 1505705170}
review:
Well I was honestly hoping for them to fix the multitude of existing bugs before even considering a full release . Boy was I wrong , they went straight from bug ridden alpha to full release. That leads me to assume they gonna stop any and all development and move on. Sad as they game had potentiall but needed  the bugs fixed. Simple things like no rocket sounds on desent in landing in mp, tripping on a rock and flying 100 metre to your death, these have been around for far far too long and still not addressed. So many small bugs it hard to list them on the list goes on and on. Sad that they decided to push it to full release in its current state does not bode well for this game.Best part is does not matter what mp you choose coop or competive the landing craft nasa sends you down in is not radiation proteced. As if NASA would really be that stupid to send an astronaunt to mars and not shield his landing vehicle . Why even send us there to let us die before even leaving or landing craft makes really good sense way to go NASA.Hard to believe but it gets worse , major solar events every few minutes making it impossible to survive due to the total lack of any kind of radiation shielding provided . like really NASA would send ppl to mars knowing full well they would die of radtion exposure on day one HMMMMM something up with that.
 Not to mantion your astronaut is a total clumsey fool. falling and tripping over the slighest obstacle or even when brushing walls, would NASA really send a person to mars that uncoordinated, Thier a danger to themselves and everyone around. I get the feeling that somehow the research that went in the game was misguided or deliberately corrupted. In all honesty the game played better 6 months ago than it does now.

Lets get real , true astronauts which  Nasa wold send to mars would be the best of the best , physically , mentally etc. They not gonna run out of breathe or have extreme heart rates after a few sec of exertion lol , they certainly not goona be majorly clumsy either  the current ingame representation is the exact opposite of who would be sent to mars. Unless of course you wanted a guarenteed failure of the mission.

As an interesting side note appears certian member of the community have taken to using thier acess to Dram as a tool to attempt to silence the ppl they disaggree with



Originally posted by Caribcanuk:
Reality is niether space x or nasa would ever send a person to mars knowing full well the instant they land they gonna recieve a lethal dose orf radition before even leaving the capsule. Who would send ppl to mars knowing full well the instant they land they dead in hours from radiation poisioning. The capsule has nothing that is in anyway effective , the coop capsule has shielding but the competive , thats a death sentance fisrt storm your radiated to the read level not the orange the RED , You stand outside or in the capsule you get the exact same dose , A buddy and myself tested it i , makes no difference inside or outside same dose . So IF it is shielded then its clearly broken. Oh and BTW Dram basically accused him of pirating as well wjich i find quite appalling for any developer to do completely unproffessional, considering that the op may of bought then refunded, clearly you two are presuming thier guilty with no proof.

I've REPORTED *OH NO!!!!* your concern about the shielding being too low to Dram.

Apperntly broken or non existant shielding  on lanfding capsules in competitive is not an issue for Dram and not important. Guess game breaking bugs are too low on his list.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982973113', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 37161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28882, 'last_played': 1678730580}
review:
Die Grundidee dieses Spiels ist genial, die Umsetzung katastrophal. 
1. Spiellogik
Die Entwickler haben keine Ingenieurskenntnisse - furchtbare Fahrzeuge und Landekapseln.
So fehlt in der Landekapsel der Sportbereich, welcher anscheinend wichtig sein soll, denn der Astronaut verliert dort an Fitness, steht zumindest in der Gesundheitsübersicht.
Unsinnige Position des Rovers mit einer Klappe unten am Hitzeschild - ohhhkaaaaaaaay.
Nahrungsmittelversorgung ist mangelhaft für sechs Leute - aber die Kartoffeln wachsen binnen 1h erntereif... das bei einem 1:1 Zeitverhältnis. Mirakuliiiix
Es fehlt einfach ein Berater, der von außerhalb der Programmierung denen Tipps zur Spielgestaltung gibt. Technische Umsetzung ist mangelhaft!!!
2. BUUUUUUUGs
Echt mal, das sind einfach zu viele Fehler, einige nach wie vor im Spiel vorhanden, welche ich vor zwei Jahren gemeldet hatte. Die Entwickler haben einfach keinen Plan von dem was sie machen.
3. Missionen im MP fehlen komplett, was mache ich nach dem Aufbau der Basis…
4. 3D Drucker sind ja gut, aber das ganze Konzept ist einfach zu lasch und nicht zu Ende gedacht.
Insgesamt ist das Spiel unfertig und nicht durchdacht. Die Idee war gut…. Aber so wird das nichts.
Glücklicherweise habe ich damals nur 10 Euro bezahlt. Lehrgeld oder LEERGELD… 

Nicht kaufen, das wird nichts mehr!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004274010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1496949046}
review:
Bugs bugs y mas bugs. Si me dicen que es una version Alpha me lo creo.
No es ni de lejos un juego terminado, pensaba que despues de tantos años en early acces me encontraria con un producto terminado... y lo que pasa es que deben haber abandonado el proyecto y lo han lanzado como estaba.

Me lo compré por que soy fan de Arma 3 y no me esperaba una chapuza asi de Bohemia. Encima como es un juego leeeeeento, cuando confirmas ya que el juego no está terminado ya se te ha pasado el tiempo y no puedes devolverlo. Una chapuza.

Tiene algunascosas interesantes, pero inacabadas o mal desarolladas. Si lo encuentras por 5 euros o menos quiza valga la pena probarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971324709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1491070896}
review:
I can survive the poor quality UI, the wasted time due to lack of direction on shitty missions, but this game is so incredibly buggy. I can't walk through an airlock without dying either by being throw viciously out of it or because the character has walked too hard into the wall and is somehow suffocating in a pressurized room because his mask is broken.

Or how about not being able to use the poptent because I had chosen to walk 10 degrees right and found it first rather than 10 degrees left and found the other part of the mission? Or how I found some machines but they just won't work despite plugging them in. Can't put an empty barrel on it. In Mission 4, an hour and a half in.

Does bug testing just not happen anymore? Don't buy it. Wait until it's 80% off two years from now when they've half-heartedly released some patches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084608045', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1510876736}
review: What little of the game I've played, I've enjoyed. I've played a little bit of the unmanned chapter and nearly gotten up to unlocking landers. However, I have not been able to play any further than that because I cannot play the game any more. And not in the "I hate this game, it's literally unplayable!" (And you mean metaphorically there, not literallly.) sense, but in the "game will not run properly or at all" sense (the proper use of the word 'literal'). Since some time in the fall of last year, whenever I try to boot it up I get some sort of "illegal read" error. At the time, this didn't bother me too much. I did contact customer support, who promptly told me to try uninstalling and reinstalling, the thing that I had done at least six times previously of my own accord. Of course, this did not work. Then, the game was in beta so I assumed it was just a beta glitch and would get fixed eventually. After the full release, the game still will not run. That's a pretty serious bug to leave in a full release. I've also read elsewhere about the difficult physics, something I (un)fortunately have no personal experience with but is still significant. As much as I like the concept of the game and want to recommend it, right now I'd have to recommend against it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032591725', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3096, 'last_played': 1639271039}
review:
Bohemia has just stated the game is complete. They will continue to support for bugs but no new content will be added. 
Currently there are 2 campagin modes. 

You can go unmanned in which you have a budget and need to research items to unlock lnaders rovers and other more advanced items. If you do not unlock the correct items in the the correct order. You could run out of money and not be able to launch anything to gather more. 
At 1st all you can do is launch a probe with a camera. As you upgrade and complete more missions. You can build rovers landers. Take soil air rock samples tempatures and everything like real space agencies. 

Huge con:
The 2nd campaign is manned mission. Which is the down side. It feels more like a demo vesion. 
You have crash landed and must get back to earth. There are objectives to complete. When you complete those (Don't mess around. You have limited air food and water.) You go into a cutscene to the next scenareo. 

There are 8 (I think 8) scenarios that you can play. They are sort of mini missions that will take you about 20 minutes to 1 hour to complete each 1. 
Will help you get used to the game.

The manned mission willl last you about 2-5 days of playing. Depending on how fast you find the items and how much you play. SAVE OFTEN


PRO:
Mods but also a con. 
You have to install a mod to get empty land to build your own base as big as you want. 

Multiplayer. Build a base with your friends however there are a few bugs here and there "Bohemia is aware there are bugs in the multiplayer"



WAIT TILL UNDER $15 It gets boring fairly quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021267227', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7653, 'last_played': 1510871749}
review:
Just like other Bohemia Interactive products - the game is extremely buggy. Mostly in movement mechanics. That usually causes strange behavior and death of a character :(
Other gameplay things are very cool and challenging but 
Multiplayer sandbox lacks any goals (like scientific exploration research). So once players establish a prosperous base there is nothing to. That makes further gameplay boring - both in singleplayer and multiplayer modes.
Furthermore - the game has critical bugs in multiplayer mode that would stop you from further progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976605846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2027, 'last_played': 1486920582}
review:
Take on Mars has evolved massively since I first bought it in 2013. Driving my rover in the Victoria Crater for the first time was jaw-dropping and I still get that same sensation whenever I return to the red planet.

The game is a detailed simulation, focusing on the science, technology and management of a Mars space program. It is generally a slow-paced, thoughtful affair. Admittedly, I left the game alone for some time as I didn't want to spoil everything before the full release, so I've only dabbled slightly in the co-op / manned missions, but despite the feature-creep of survival elements, the game's focus still appears to be managing the budget and tech for scientific.

Most negative reviews seem focused on bugs and stability, which I've never had much of an issue with (even in Early Access), but Bohemia interactive have a great reputation for supporting and updating their games for a long time, so I have faith that any issues will be solved soon.

If you're a space buff and want to try your hand at believable missions at a fictional space agency in the vein of NASA / ESA / ROSCOSMOS / etc., this is exactly the game you've been looking for. However, if you're more interested in an extraterrestrial co-op survival experience, you should probably look elsewhere ([url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/383120/]Empyrion[/url] / [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/244850]Space Engineers[/url] are more likely better options).

author: {'steamid': '76561198138437297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2150, 'last_played': 1633014298}
review:
If you're a fan of the Space Program and you're not looking for an action game, this may be the one for you.  Lots of folks are reporting issues but my installation is working near perfectly.  I have only one minor issue, easily worked around, with a black screen when disconnecting from a vehicle and returning to Mission Control.  Saving the game, dropping to the menu and restarting fixes it.  Outside of that, I've had no crashes nor experienced any other bugs.  I'm still early in the Space Program, so maybe that will change, but for now it's $27 well spent.

Congrats on a nice job Devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002531211', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2185, 'last_played': 1541784960}
review:
Fairly good game if you can handle a slight bit of chopyness here and there. A lot of people complain about chrashes.. I have yet to experience one. 

Things that must be noted...

If you plan to play alone.. Enjoy the company of your own mind.. The Campaign is fun.. but long, You will be searching for things constantly. And occasionally you will flip a buggy.. or send a wheel off flying far away. Or you might trip on air and smash your helmet into the ground.. good times.. gooooood times.. 

If you plan to play with friends.. Same as above only with other people breaking stuff ! Its great! Try it out! 

The game has DEFINATELY Changed since its first release, I plan to put a couple hundred hours on it in the next week or so. 

Oh and.... classic Bohemia Voice Actors.. Now and then I feel like i'm smack in the middle of Arma 3.. but I'm not, cause i'm on Mars.. Alone.. Named Mark ... or Marc.. or what ever.. Yes... i know... you know.. we alllllll know... gg....


UPDATE

I finished the game! And the game crashed during the final cut scene but meh.. ! Was short actually if you take out all the waiting around.. This game is probably better suited for multiplayer senarios or base building.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995714610', 'num_games_owned': 1278, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1547594159}
review:
Having had this game since it was still in early acess and with alot more hours than the 8.6 I have on record (thank you steam for not keeping track of my hours when I played on my laptop) and I can say that yes while the game does still have some faults it is a significant improvement from when it was first released in EA. 

To the naysayers give it some time. The BI team has shown time and again that they do continue to support,update and improve the games they put out so please give it time before you go and blast the game for it being a "complete wreck" or "unfinished not deserving of a full release"  (certainly from the BI Gamer Elite who seem to overlook Arma's own early day snafu's or Take on Helicoptors or Carrier Commands issues)

The Manned and Unmanned portions are simply amazing (I love the unmanned alot due to the feelings of Kerbal's building portion) and it really invokes my childhood feelings and love for the great black expanse our planet is in. 

Even if you end up getting it just because the Arma devs made it look at it for what it really is. a Space Simulator and for me it is hands down the best early and pre spaceflight sim and early exploration of planets sim out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021205873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3235, 'last_played': 1531388807}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198011108461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1522490789}
review:
***MARCH 13TH UPDATE EDIT***

So another update post release, started the game up, loaded my save, drove a vehicle forwards to create a 'new state', clicked the save button and the game, once again, crashed to desktop.

Maybe next update it'll be solved, who knows 

------------------------------------------------------
Trying the solo campaign;

Map doesnt work
Free mode camera doesnt work
Shadows missing features (Astronaut has no head)
Rotation of objects and placement is an absolute cr*p shoot, theres no telling what way an item will rotate when using the 'R' mouse function, you have to hope it just flails into the postition you want.

This game could be so good, it just has many features that are impossible to play with without huge frustration

****EDIT****

Tried to play more of the game, advanced a touch more through the single player, got lost on one of the missions just driving around so decided to reload using the in game menu - This caused a CTD.

Started up again, managed to progress and thought to myself "I'll save my progress", used the in game save function - CTD once more.

Im hugely disappointed at just how poor this game is, its really beautiful and could be something amazing, I find it hard to believe the developer released this and was happy to do so, this barely scrapes as playable, and I can not in good conscience let people buy this expecting to enjoy themselves, this game needs a lot of work before this review is turned around

author: {'steamid': '76561198010792615', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1545172688}
review:
Hra není připravena na vydání v plné verzi. Stále mnoho bugů a glitchů v manned misích, které ze zábavného hraní dělají frustrující zážitek.
A po dvouhodinovém ježdění po měsíci a hledání třetího supply dropu do úkolu, který není nijak označený a ještě splývá barevně s terénem měsíce jsem unuděn k smrti a nevím jestli hru v brzké době zapnu. 

Hra měla velký potenciál, ale můj celkový dojem je velké zklamání z nezáživného titulu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961044762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1486027950}
review:
I really wish the developers would play their own game or maybe they do and can't fix it. This can be a magnificent title but the glitchy graphics and movement engine they are using almost destroys the game.

The main issues:
- Trying to move objects or place them is an exercise in frustration. Only the most patient players will put up with this.
- Moving feels horribly sluggish. I am not sure if they are trying to go for realism but it destroys playability.
- If you turn your head too far when trying to fine tune a placement of an object your feet do this weird shuffle which causes your whole body to jerk. This also frustrates being able to move and place objects.

They need to fix object placement and movement above all else as a matter of urgency. Other games do object manipulation so much better. For example Kerbal Space Program and Astroneer where objects snap together easily.

Yes this is a simulation but if the gameplay frustrates the player then they will not play it. A tentative thumbs down for this title until they make some urgent improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009884217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1486696301}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. I played early access, and had really high hopes for release. 

Reinstalled when I found out it was taken out of EA and released...

Completed the introductory part where you have crashed on Mars. Managed to get into my tent and sleep. 
Next part, you're another character on the moon. I spent 20 fuggin' minutes trying to get the 2nd Methane tank connected to the Rover. No matter what direction or angle I came from, it absolutely would not give me the option to connect, only drop. 

This game is an absolute buggy piece of sh*t. Don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016121382', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5499, 'last_played': 1484923744}
review:
I have 92 hours of play time in Take On Mars.

This is the only review I've done since joining steam 8 years ago. I can not in good conscience allow this game to be released without saying anything. This game was not and still is not ready for release. It is still full of bugs and crashes a lot. I've tried so many work arounds I've seen on the forum and elsewhere to stop this from happening but to no avail. Personally, I feel like I shouldn't have to do something like all that just to get the game to work at it's basic level.

The game crashes when you try to scroll with the mouse wheel. It also crashes when exiting to the main menu. The worst crash for me, is when you try to overwrite a save, the game crashes without saving and deletes your current save on top of that.

I think a fair amount of the issues could be temporarily remedied by incorperating an auto-save feature into the game. Or even a quick save button. Like just pressing F5 to save for example. As it stands, you have to go through a few menus just to save. It gets tedious to do this every five minutes in case the game decides to randomly crash. Then you wouldn't lose hours worth of work when it does.

The discussion forum is full of threads about crashing issues. A lot of people can't even get the game to start running. I've spent hours going back through the thread's and I've come to the conclusion that these developers put the game into release to make one last cash grab and then wash their hands of it.

And this game is certainly not worth the 26.99 they want for it. Discounting the problems this game has, I would say with how basic it is, it's worth maybe 10 to 15 dollars at most. I really regret the 30 dollars I spent on it a few years ago.

The thing that really bugs me the most about this game is the power production. I had to download a mod increasing the power production of the nuclear reactor just to be able to play. In the vanilla game, you have to build 11 nuclear reactors to power one simple device continuously. With resources as scarce as they are in the game, that is just rediculous. And solar panels are a joke because they produce even less power and obviously none at night. And the night lasts far longer than the day. And there are no batteries you can make to store power for use at night so wasting resources to build solar panels is pointless.

TL;DR
This game is an obvious bug/crash fest and cash grab. The devs obviously want to wash their hands of it. Please, protect your hard earned income and do not buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016940013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 496, 'playtime_at_review': 2364, 'last_played': 1710323637}
review:
SECOND REVIEW:

 I am now updating this review to reflect the launch update and information that i found due to the comments made by Mr. Monochrome and INFIDEL in the comments below. I admit changes have been made and the game up to the point i have progressed to is working, that being said i still beleive this game needs alot more work in that the tutorials are incomplete as far as explaining all you need to know when it comes to the machines,the mission objectives are poorly worded and easily misinterpreted, and still no guidance in game on how to complete the unmanned missions and still make money. This game is frustrating and i personally believe that most gamers will lose interest due to this fact in very little time.
 If the developers decide this is worth there time it would bring many new players to this game and could grow by leaps and bounds community-wise maybe even to the point of the ARMA franchise. 
 In conclusion as i stated before DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNLESS YOU LIKE FRUSTRATION.

FIRST REVIEW:

First i really like this game, maybe even love it. This is a honest reveiw and i hope it is taken that way.

   This game is broken even in vanila, true it is early access, but it is coming out of early access on the 9th of this month. The developers are silent, there are no explanations or reason that this game should not work at this point. I have played this game with an open mind as to having small bugs or glitches, but that is not even the problem. The vanilla manned story seems to be broken at the point at which you need to set up soil extraction machines to gather fuel. The power is connected and rechecked multiple times and reran tutorial to check yet again and still the resource barrels will not attach to any machine or storage device which stalls your progress to a halt.
 The robotic missions seem to work okay, but again little to no explanation as how to progress along without going bankrupt and halting your exploration.
The atmosphere and enviroment of both the manned and robotic missions is believable barring a lack of realistic logic and science as to how a flare would burn in space, not being able to scavenge dead astronauts space suits/helmets, empty crates on a space flight, missions popping up in areas behind you and you have already drove through with the rover, solar panels barely charging even though its bright as all ****, and others that im sure i cant even get to because of the afformentioned.
 That being said the game has great potential given that the developers will be more vocal on what is going on  as far as fixes and general information. 
 
Breakdown: 
                    1. The game is broke
                    2. There is little to no guidance within the game or anywhere for that matter
                    3. The developers are silent
                    4. Community content is irrelevant being 2+ years old

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Unless you really like being frustrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211258948', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2246, 'last_played': 1649880247}
review:
Всем привет. Хотел бы поделиться моим мнением по поводу этой игры. 
Игра достаточно увлекательна и среди выживалок в космосе, пожалуй, она займет хорошее место. Плюс реалистичность.
Я почитал комментарии к этой игре ниже и решил написать обзор более серьезно. Для начала, играя за космонавтов, вы попадаете на Марс и вам нужно выбраться (Схоже что то с фильмом Марсианин))) 

Реалистичность: 
  Многие пишут, что как на Марсе может быть ветер, как так получается, что о предметы ударяясь можно убиться, отлететь в сторону и т д. 

- На Марсе, как и на любой схожей планете (Земля, Венера, Меркурий и т д) есть атмосфера. На любой планете она есть. Просто у каждой своя. На Марме атмосфера слабая (слабее чем на земле), на Венере наоборот плотная. Но атмосфера есть. 
- На счет ветра на марсе. ветер образуется за счет разницы в давлении( Вспоминаем уроки географии в школе) поэтому наличие ветра на Марсе вполне объяснгяемо и есть мето быть. 
- На счет предметов, которые могут вас толкнуть и вы отлетите, или если вы споткнетесь о провод и вы отлетите вперед: Напомню, что на Марсе притяжение ниже. То есть на Марсе ваш вес, как и вес любого предмета будет ниже. Его будет и поднять легче и при еэтом если вы вдруг ударились о предмет вы отлетите, потому, что ваш вес легче и притяжение меньше. 
- По поводу медленного перемещения игрока скажу так. Посмотрите фильм Джон Картер. На марсе притяжение меньше, опять же. И допустим, если бы вы щас были на Марсе. Вам там идти тяжело будет, так как у вас будет слабее сцепление с поверхностью. 
Подведу итог. Исходя из всех моих представлений. Физика в игре изумительная. Проработана каждая мелочь. Есть малые косяки, когда например не могу войти в дверь грузовика в скафандре. Приходится садиться)). 
А так физика на отлично. Реалистичность на 5.

Что касается Мультиплеера и развития в этом режиме. Очень увлекательно. Однако в одиночестве это очень нудно и скучно делать. Нужно хотябы человека 2-3. Тогда в развитии все пойдет быстрее.
Мне лично очень нравятся выживалки подобного рода. 

Разработчикам советую что бы они не бросали проект и дальше работали над мультиплеером и на искоренение багов и не доработок

author: {'steamid': '76561198035639365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7151, 'last_played': 1577466815}
review: I was not going to write a review on Take on Mars until it came out of Early Access but i feel i should. This game is a bit of a mixed bag for me and while i love the concept of this game i feel it could contain a lot more content. Take Multiplayer for instance, Once you have built your habitat? Nothing. There is simply nothing to do. Even collecting samples and analyzing them is too simple and gives you nothing for it. There are still a few bugs for me which hopefully should be gone by the time it goes full release. Singleplayer is another story though (forgive the pun). To me this was awesome, hands down just awesome, especially the recently introduced manned space program. Its like being in the movie martian. i would recommend buying this game just for the story. The other selling point for me personally is "who wouldn't want to go to mars?". So final verdict i give this 7 out of 10 for A originality and B just to take a concept like this and turn it into a full standalone game is worthy of praise. I will review it again after 9th feb when it goes out of EA.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971289536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5100, 'last_played': 1598813492}
review:
This game... or work... is actually fun! I've downloaded a mod that gave me the opertunity to start at Victoria crater almost with no supplies at all. Only enough to start making the basic 3d printer and resource gatheres. Also got the truck but it is almost useless untill now. It's 1:1 and I've played through the night. It is dawn and my basic base is set up, with a hydrophonics and water station - a toilet. Enough for me to grow the first batch of potatoes in time before my two beef meals ran out.

Fun!

As my basic base is in place, some of the resources has been depleted where I am. So for the first time I loaded the truck with my drill and lots of powerstations... and moved it couple of 100 meters. My base now need to expand as I need more room for beds and resources.

I actualy feel that I have saved that stranded guy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007015585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1505929934}
review:
So.. I played this game for about ten hours now... and I would say it has tremendous potential... but that is as far as I will go. Potential. 
While the robotics programme starts fo kinda slow, the manned programme throws into the deep end and does so in a very immersive way. You are actually afraid of running out of oxygen...

Soo.. now for the other side of the medal. Bugs... everywhere... and the occasional probelm with the UI or generally how the  player interacts with the surroundings. Ramps are aparently a massive problem! You can not simply walk up a ramp. You'll get stuck and have to jump (and jumping is dangerous.. more on that later). Once I parked my vehicle on a slope so it was tipped slightly to one side. My character, always facing exactly 90 degrees from the ground would simply not fit through the now slanted (reliative to him) doorframe anymore.
Another thing is buttons... you can't reliably press them... and in an enviroment with a LOT of buttons a characters button pressing skills should be considered essential.
On the other hand when you are working with equipment that has a touchdisplay, simply stand in front of it and click on the screen... and that is really cool. 

So... I stopped playing after about 9 hours... because some of the bugs just made it too frustrating... I was trying to get into a vehicle over a ramp... got stuck... tried to jump.. aand I asume i clipped into something, was propelled towards the vehicle and upon the impact tore my suit and died... it had been a while since I last saved.... (no autosaves and no quicksaves make it really hard to keep on top of that).
As for the robotics... I built my first rover launched it to a site somewhat close to the edge of the map... It missed its drop zone... by enough to entirely miss the map... and it just kept falling the distance numbers next to the site markes started growing bigger again after a while... and it just kept falling... and since I had spend my last few coins on that rover I was stuck...

So in its current state I cannot really recommend the game... but If the devs iron out the most annoying of these bugs and glitches I think it can be a very interesting game. Let's hope for the official release!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013235991', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2462, 'last_played': 1582577076}
review:
So after all these years I decided to give this game one last chance and play Manned mission.
I was playing RC2 which will be most likely the final version, neverheless no more major bugs will be eradicated by the time this releases.

I simply cannot recommend it because of large amount of gamebreaking bugs and performance issues.

From my last playthrough:
On the moon it is rather easy to trip your buggy. When you do so, there is like 80 percent chance you wil die when trying to exit the buggy, because you fall trhough the moon. 
When this happened to me after 1 hour of playing and being in 2nd mission, then I painfully realized, there is no checkpoint or autosave function. My last save was from one month ago. 
OK. I had to restart whole manned  campaign.

Then I had to follow transmiters to find second one. It is stated that transmiter is situated south from the base and I should follow that path. Very first transmiter is situated north of base however. I did not realize that and followed direction of the transmitter, going north instead of south. And after like 1 minute of driving I fell off a map... Moon just ended and I fell to the void and kept falling until I loaded saved game.

After like 25 deaths I managed to enter 3rd mission. That was where I rage guitted.

I had to load 25 units of water to the truck. UI is very clunky so it was a pain really.
But I lowered stairs to the truck and planned to grab water packs from crates and bring them to the truck, put them on the foor of the truck and so on.
Then I found out you cannot simply climb the stairs by walking. You get stuck.
So I started jumping on those stairs... I flopped almost everytime, but I manegd to get there like 12 packs of water. Then I jumped, flopped and bashed my head and cracked helmet, died, and last save is stil on the moon! I forgot to save when starting 3rd mission.

When the stairs are not walkable, how do I load or enter the truck while only possible options almost everytime kills you?

This game is so broken, that I cannot recommend it to anyone, and I am afraid it is bound to the game engine, since these are the same bugs as were 2 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006629109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1487688881}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978155502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1647518323}
review:
COMPLETE CRAP STAY AWAY!!!!

The Devs are now saying "it's DONE" and leaving EA on 2/9/2017

Total CRAP.  You can't even SAVE a game in multiplayer and LOAD it when you come back!!!

Total junk, a complete history of failed dates and missed features, NOW, they'll just BAIL ON ANY FURTHER WORK BY CALLING IT "FINISHED".

It's FINISHED alright, I'm finished with these Devs...

* Stay away *
developer_response:
Hi,

It is a pity you feel that way but thank you for your feedback nonetheless.

That said, I would like to voice my view on the matter. When we released Take On Mars into Early Access back in 2013, we only ever promised single-player rovers/landers. There was no human section, nor any plans for multiplayer - this was communicated very clearly.

However, as we neared the end of the development cycle for the robotics section, we made a major decision - to extend development and add humans and multiplayer. This increased the projected release date by a year or more - of that we were aware. This meant players such as yourself got 2 games in one - an all-encompassing simulation of Mars exploration. It also meant more bugs would appear at first, due to essentially developing a second game into it from scratch.

I understand your frustration, and issues such as the multiplayer crash in the current build will be fixed before February 9th.

I hope that addresses your concerns.


Martin Melicharek
Project Lead

author: {'steamid': '76561198008950144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9919, 'last_played': 1528670237}
review:
heres a game that keeps your mind in the space age. wearing space suits, breathing air from tanks, eating food from bags, and drinking water from a bag. the days of regular eating and drinking has changed. your normal activitys are not the same. all life depends on your work and experance in making sure your every breath is taken in the future. if you do not work for the future of your exsestance it will end in agony. 
starting off with nothing but a few supplys, that will last a week or less. the enveroment is terrable. sand storms, dust collecting on your solar panels. equipment that works but needs a lot of power, where their is little of but from the sun. wind power would be nice. 
multi-play is ok but their is littel to do and with small amount of supplies. no monsters to fight and no other colonist to fight. 
game is slow at min to min but can be crazy fast with min to hour mode.
can be better and i am sure it will be with new update coming soon.
look out mars humans are coming

author: {'steamid': '76561198194129417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10407, 'last_played': 1612950104}
review: Не рекомендую,игра полный шлак,жаль потраченного времени и денег. Такое количество багов я просто ни гдене видел. Проекту 3 года,кроме песпилотных миссий ни чего не меняется. Графика на уровне 13 года так и осталась,движок игры просто устарел морально. Физика как таковая полностью отсутствует,одни балоны с ресурсами чего стоят,когда раскатываются по поверхности и марсохоы дергающиеся,не в силах взять пробы. Что такой ветер на Марсе? при почти полном отсутствиии атмосферы? баги,сплошь и рядом баги.Настолько скучный и однообразный просто до ужаса гемплей.Хотя изначально задумка была хорошая,только вот руки не дошли,в продажу выпущена не просто сырой проект,а проект которым даже и не занимаются.Вообщем настоятельно не рекомендую,купите лучше мороженного.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165621019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2237, 'last_played': 1484669223}
review: I have read lots of reviews with people wondering why this game is getting a poor review and excusing it by saying that it is an early release...come on ! Yes it WAS an early release back in 2013 and YES myself and many others purchased it with the understanding that it would be a work in progress, but there is a limit to the term "early access" I have seen little in the way of progress in YEARS !!! The game is so far from being enjoyable that it leaves me feeling cheated out of $20. This will be my last title from Bohemia Interactive as this is ridiculous...perhaps early access for $5 would be reasonable, but this game isn't worth much more. If you are thinking of purchasing this game....DON'T....at least not until BI shows SOME amount of effort towards fulfilling their obligation to those who graciously supported them in the hopes of seeing the game take proper form.
developer_response:
Hi, i am really sorry and disconcerted you feel that way.

Since the initial release into Early Access back in 2013, we only ever promised to complete Rovers/Landers at the time. Since then we added massive manned vehicles, missions, survival and also multiplayer. I dare say that is nothing minor. We have not stopped progressing forward for a single month since EA release, and do not intend to stop until the game is released from Early Access and polished.

I understand the frustration you must feel for having to wait for so long for the game to reach completion, and in retrospect adding an entire new game onto an existing game (manned section onto robotics section) was perhaps not the wisest of decisions. That said, players received these updates entirely for free. We added this as we believed it would bring more interesting content to the game, and believed it would represent the entire process of Mars exploration from robots to humans.

If you are inclined to disbelieve me, here is a change log documenting almost every change in the game since 2013:
http://mars.takeonthegame.com/changelog

It's a long read. I hope that sheds light on how dedicated we have been during the entire process, never abandoning the game, never averting resources to other projects. I kindly request you reconsider based on the above evidence, and in any case thank you for voicing your opinion, every voice counts.

Take care and kind regards,
Martin Melicharek
Project Lead

author: {'steamid': '76561198062440797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 9677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9519, 'last_played': 1547372658}
review:
Watched the movie Martian?  This is as close as you will get to living that experience, and so much more. Can you survive?

This game is shaping up to be an amazing simulation of visiting far off planets in our solar system as a pioneer into the limits of human survivability. It is a hostile place filled with dangerous solar radiation, no air to breath, no food, no water, and nowhere to live. You are tasked with overcoming these challenges using the most current technologies available to mankind.

Mars... your journey begins here...

author: {'steamid': '76561198045302046', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2403, 'last_played': 1668304009}
review:
Played this game on a friends computer and had to buy it for myself, so that's why my time played is low.  

Summary:
While this game does have it's bugs, and the physics system can be downright frustrating, this game is addictive and should be looked at by all survival game enthusiasts.  So far I'm loving it and with the modding and multiplayer features, especially the custom scenarios, it has alot of replayability potential.

Long version:

The campaign mode is broken up into two parts. The first half involves you sending unmanned probes and rovers to the mars surface to complete missions for money.  That money gets spent on purchasing new equipment to carry out those missions as well as the research required to build new devices.  You can customize the equipment you send to mars as well, and its possible to use the rovers to complete multiple missions if it is equipped properly.  To be honest, this part of the game bored me, and I didn't get past the first hour of dropping probes to map out different parts of mars. 

The second half of the campain mode is the manned storyline.  It includes voice acting (well done imho) and a cohesive storyline that parallels Andy Weir's "The Martian."  This part was fun and well paced.  It centered around a manned expedition to mars that goes completely wrong and you are left stranded.  You complete goals and gather supplies to survive and attempt to make it back home.  The final mission even gives you a 3d printer that you use to craft things with to complete some goals, and in my opinion, this is where the game was the most fun.  I encountered a few issues with the storyline getting stuck (cutscene transitions mostly), or goal completion not registering properly, but not often and nothing game breaking, and I'm sure those will get resolved by release.

However, this game doesn't come without it's problems, as any game does.  The biggest problem is with the physics engine's collision detection.  Object seperation due to collision does not always resolve gracefully, and many times results in a violent seperation.  Too many times you will die from an object (or you) spazzing out trying to resolve a collision detection event resulting in your death, or objects will be sent flying off at great speeds.  Because of this, SAVE OFTEN as this game has no autosave function, and you could potentially lose hours worth of work to a buggy physics death.  As a developer, I realize that physics are important for realism, but sometimes there is a need to disable physics or fuse objects together for the sake of game stability.  For instance, grabbed items (in your hand) should not clip with the avatar, creating a "surfing" effect causing you to fly off into space.  Some of this might be fixable before release, but I imagine some of it might require some extensive changes to the core physics engine, thus we might be stuck with it.  Movement is slow which makes accomplishing tasks take longer than in most games, but that's part of the realism and completely intended, so I don't have a problem with it.  

The modding system seems pretty powerful and already there are some interesting mods in the steam workshop, including scenarios for you to play that have unique environments, goals, and starting supplies.  Fun survival vs environment mechanics that is a refreshing change from the constant stream of zombie survivals.  

Multiplayer:
I've only played locally by myself on a LAN, so I can't really tell you much about net play.  From what I've read, it's buggy, but the devs are working on making it more stable.  It has two game modes, competitive and co-op, so that part is nice.

Survival aspects:
Resource gathering is done via powered machines that gather generic resources from the martian environment such as rock, dirt, and atmosphere.  These are then put into a refinery to be broken down into chemical compounds, as well as raw elements.  These resources are then used for crafting, vehicle fuel, and personal survival (oxygen and water).

Crafting in this game uses a unique modular 3d printer system.  The 3d printer is capable of building most game objects, but larger objects need larger printers.  Upgrade to bigger printers by building the parts from the previous one and assembling the new one.  Habitats can be custom built through a modular part snapping system.  Crafting and resource gathering is fun, but after a while you might get sick of hauling tons of resource barrels around from place to place.  That's where mods help out (resource cables/digitized resource transport)

Can't think of anything else, so if I missed something, feel free to comment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024478687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2417, 'last_played': 1489444986}
review:
UPDATE TO MY UPDATE:

So they released a new update after almost a year of nothing and all the bugs are still there.  Seriously, this game is looking more amd more like a quick cash grab while the developer works on other projects.  I am still going to have to give this game a do not buy unless it is really cheap and you have cash to burn.  I would recommend something like Stationeers if you want to play a Mars survial game, skip this.

UPDATE:

Now that the game is offically launched I can say the bugs are still there if not multiplied.  After the 2nd update since release none of my save work from the previous patch.  I enter my saves with all my structures blasting apart into pieces.  If I try to launch one of the built-in campaigns I am instantly dead.  I am going to have to give this game a "DO NOT BUY" until it is somewhat stable.

ORIGINAL POST:

First it should be said that this is NOT a released game and is still being developed.  The negative reviewers here cite issues like performance, audio sync issues, etc.  Fine tuning and optimization is one of the LAST steps in game development so you should expect performance and audio issues.  To walk into this game and expect every aspect that is in the game to be fully polished is an expectation that will not be achieved.

The idea of Early access is to help the developers make a better game, not to submit negative reviews for items you should be alerting them about instead.  Be constuctive not destructive.  

If you are not willing to accept bugs, performance problems, missing content or compatibility problems, then do not play an "Early Access" game.

So far what i have seen of the Manned mission, it is a Mars survival game. You crashed, you need to get air, and a temporary shelter.  Then you go off and try to find better resources and build better ways to survive, all the while trying to find or build that piece of equipment that will save you and get you home.  If that is not your cup of tea, leave now, this is not for you.  If you are looking for big green aliens to shoot, look elswhere.  If you are looking for cutting edge graphics or horizons of breathtaking vistas, this is Mars, its rocky, red and dusty.

This is about one man fighting to survive on Mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978131999', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1483902184}
review:
Do not buy. Plays like a $5 pre-alpha to advert a kickstarter, nowhere close to a $22 "release candidate."
These remarks apply to "Robotics" career.
I bought this yesterday and binge played it for over 12 hours. I started with a Robotics career, I haven't touched the manned career that Manley showcased in his video that inspired me to purchase Take On Mars. 
- It's very easy to go down a path that leaves you with no more viable missions, and not enough money to progress down the tech tree to a point where the game spawns more missions.
- the surface is littered with side missions, but you cannot just send a vehicle down to do them. You have to be seeing a big main mission to launch a vehicle at. 
- If you want a scarred forehead from slamming it into the keyboard, this is definitely the game for you.
- I build my first rover after the third restart of a career (tech tree, and mentioned mission issue). Upon launch, the vehicle flipped radically and parts broke off as the chute deployed. (the player does not control maneuvering, it is scripted at this point). The rover free falls to the surface, crashing. This repeated six times with various builds to see if it was my fault. 
- Expect to spend six hours of play in your first career figuring out what not to do.
- Expect to spend twelve hours of play in your second career, getting a little bit further, but hitting a similar block further on.
- Expect to spend... no forget it. 

In summary, this game does not play like a "release candidate." I get the sense that Take On Mars is a money farming mission for the developer company to generate a new engine for their Armed Assault line, which desperately needs multi-core CPU and GPU support. Take On Mars could have been a fun title, but it's not a $22 experience. It is a frustrating series of dead ends, messed up careers, and buggy robot deployments. Avoid this title until is matures (it hasn't done so in three years). This title suffers from an obvious lack of QA work in terms of bug stomping and play "fun factor," something this company is notorious for. Even with their policy of de-centralizing testing, in other words, letting the community test it, this title has essentially been in community testing for over two years, and this resultant game is COMPLETELY UNSATISFACTORY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036732294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1483073062}
review:
のんびりまったり作業ゲーです。なんでも許せる人向け。コンセプトは好きです。

ただ、一人称視点で激しく画面が揺れるので、ものすごく3D酔いしました。
過去の掲示板に 物理演算の問題で画面揺れが起こっているので修正するという開発者のコメントがあったのですが、
直した結果が現在の状況なら、酔いやすい人は辛いかもしれません・・
(バギー等で火星の凸凹した地形を走れば、そりゃ視点も揺れますね・・)
解像度を下げて画面を小さくしたら酔いは軽減されるのですが、
ゲーム内に表示されるボタン等の表記が小さいのであまり小さい画面にするのも難しいです。
まだ何とかアップデートを続けてくれているようなので、のんびり改善を期待しようと思います。
