author: {'steamid': '76561197996464882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3586, 'last_played': 1512738878}
review:
I can't understand, why people are so angry about a Early Access Game with some bugs and glitches. Yes, they are in the Game and maybe a long time, but I repeat: It's Early Access!!! The other thing is the way you play the Game. Myself, I had the patience to drive around a Rover for HOURS and I MEAN HOURS!!! You can adjust the speed to "realistic" but that is too slow, even for my kind of patience. For a "realistic" player, i must mention, that you can also give orders in form of timed console inputs, instead of driving a rover (or other craft) with the keys. I am bit over 40 Years old and can remember the steps of Mars Exploration from my Childhood until now, so for me, a dream came true, when I saw the Game in the Sale and decided to buy it now, even in EA-State, because I watched the Game for a long Time.

I still enjoy it very, very much! I have a 4 year old PC and a 2 Year old Graphic Card, not the best, not the worst. The only lag i had was, when physics and graphics, for example in a sandstorm, came together. Then i noticed, the game becoming "clunky". Simple Trick: Save the Game, back to Game and it vanished and you can play another hour without disturbance. And I'm playing on max Graphic settings, so can't understand the problems of the other people here, having massive lags and graphic problems.

As you watch my gametime, be advised, I'm still in the Robot-Exploration Phase, because I want to play the Campaign "My way" with discovering ALL Missions and earn lots of money. You may play the Game another way and that's also, what pleased me much: Do what you want, when you want, where you want and follow the path of Exploration, but: LOOK FOR HAZARDS!!! The sandstorms can kill your Rovers in short time, so seek shelter behind rocks or dunes, before the lenses of your cameras are so scratched, that you only can drive in 3rd person Mode. I love this realism! I love the way my Rover makes a "Salto" when i underestimated a small cliff. I love it, when Energy runs out, because i forgot, that the polar region is MUCH colder than the deserts and driving AND heating the Instruments need too much energy together.

That leads me to another point: You always can save and load, WHEN you decided right at start, where the Game asks you, if you want to play realistic (no fast forward in Mission Control) or not. A crash? Ok, loading Game, once again. What  are the people expecting, when they play the "realistic" way??? Donuts and Coffee? Self steering, magic, landers, avoding obstacles and rocks for themselves? Red Carpet for your machines and a flat road leading to your exploration targets on the surface? Man, THIS IS A SIMULATION!!! Maybe realistic, maybe not, that depends of the player, but you have to LEARN, that Mars Exploration is a series of failures and crashes. Mr. Google can help you find out, what REAL Exploration is like. I am German and watched with great interest the actual Mars Probe of the ESA. What happened? Another unsuccessful Mission and a bit of very expensive hardware rotting in a Mars Desert! That's LIfe!

Hey, i bought this Game, i can exploring the Mars myself and don't have to wait until ESA has success!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009166703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 45485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35253, 'last_played': 1681560270}
review:
This game is absolutely a must have.

Comments are for the manned mission

The initial game play is intriguing albeit it takes time to get comfortable with the controls (the controls are superior in the long run).

The Expedition One campaign is a fun experience... but if you are left wanting more (or perhpas better) their are volumes of community content at hand which is steadily expanding.

Build habitats and greenhouses, extract and manage resources, provide for long term survival. The remarkable thing about the game is the immersion into a simulation and that it was purpose built for modification.

My Personal Note: This game requires significant processor, GPU, and memory resources. Standard laptops and old or lower performance desktops will not likely offer a satisfying experience. Additionally, reliable broadband is required for MP.

Post Release updates are forecasted

author: {'steamid': '76561198006397241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1644858807}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071884577', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1483425594}
review:
TL;DR I've had this game for a good long while now, and every now and then I start it up again to see what's changed, but this last time had me really disappointed as I finally realized that in four years they've only made the game less fun.

Let's start with the normal, singleplayer campaign. The beginning is going to be about 15 missions of dropping an unmanned, unguided probe and watching it land for about five minutes, then returning to the menu. Over and over. This could've VERY easily been skipped and the game would have lost absolutely no value. But I did it anyway. And then I started dropping actual probes, and even a couple rovers. I eventually had a decent amount of money which I spent on one really nice rover that I planned to drop in one location and then once it was finished drive it all the way to another, because it would save money which the game does not give generously. Let me clarify, the game gives money generously, but I found out why that's a bad thing when that special rover with all my money on board's automated landing system that you cannot control crashed into the surface and destroyed it. This is "realistic," however this is not fun, nor a consequence of my actions. It should not be in the game. It only detracts from it, and it cost me roughly six hours of gameplay. I have not played this game mode since.

Now let's go to the "special" singleplayer mode, the manned missions. Back when the martian was first hitting the shelves the first iteration of the gamemode came to players, and although the two were unrelated it was a somewhat similar scenario (not a bad thing). It's entire gameplay was about 5 minutes of a scavenger hunt in the wreckage of your ship followed by a Coming soonTM style screen, though. So I left it. I came back to it today and found the following. The mode now starts with a short video in which the audio and video desync rapidly, to the point that they call liftoff on the rocket about 40 seconds before the video shows liftoff, which is sad as not only do you miss the joy of a rocket leaving earth, the video cuts out over a minute early from where it should, so a good portion of the intro is never seen. You dock with ISS (though I only know this through the audio cues) and gameplay starts. And by gameplay, I mean a micro-scavenger hunt through the station to find a console, and then a repeat of that exact task, and then a flash forward. Do the same thing as before where you commit to a scavenger hunt on your downed ship on mars, but now with the worst voice acting I've seen in a long time. After it ends with literally no content added, you get a flash back to the moon, because apparently your character was on the moon in the past. To clarify, the actual stranded on mars part has not changed in about 2 or so years. The moon mission is a scavenger hunt of the worst kind, as there are no HUD cues and the objective is to find three supply drops that nearly blend into the ground, are far apart, and take a while to get to. After about 30 minutes of driving the moon buggy and finding two I stopped and wondered why I just wasted all this time doing literally nothing that I want from a game like this. So far the ENTIRE manned portion of the game is just various prescripted scavenger hunts accompanied by horrible acting and poor design.

Now let's move onto the multiplayer. There is none. To clarify, there is multiplayer, but there are no players. I logged today and say exactly four people across four servers. It's dead. The reason being that it takes literal hours to build even the smallest of outposts with the game's mechanics and griefing is exceptionally easy as even the smallest bump can kill you.

Overall, given the ample amount of development time and the substantial lack of progress that is good or promising in any way, I have to say this game is absolutely not worth $22. Go buy astroneer instead, the only thing this game has on it is the BI label that implies realism, but in reality the airlocks don't vent or pressurize and oxygen is handled very poorly indoors in general, and the whole game just feels like a strange pipe dream that wanted to go many directions and never picked one.

3/10, without the awful random chance of losing everything the singeplayer would not be bad, but due to how slow and simplistic it is, I cannot say it's worth the buy on its own. Buy it on sale and avoid the manned stuff like the plague.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993572531', 'num_games_owned': 2117, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1489429340}
review:
Take on Mars - игра от Bohemia Interective и... этим всё сказано. Так что если вы играли хоть в один проект данной студии, то вас удивить будет нечем. Ну а если, это ваше первое знакомство с чешскими разработчиками, то я постараюсь в четырёх основных пунктах описать положительные и отрицательные фишки всех их проектов, включая и данную игру. Начнём.

1) Первый и пожалуй главный отличительный признак - незаконченность всех их игр. Не важно, сколько пройдёт времени с релиза - неделя, год, пять - игра от Bohemia Interective не будет доведена до играбельного состояния. Всегда будут баги, вылеты, лаги, недоделанные функции интерфейса или настроек. Ну а так как Take on Mars даже не вышел в релиз, спустя 3 ГОДА после появления в раннем доступе, то будьте уверены, что на данный момент всё ещё хуже, нежели вы можете себе представить. Игровой процесс становится похож на экранизацию какого-то фильма ужасов - ты никогда не знаешь, что и где тебя может убить. Я говорю буквально, ведь в этой игре тебя может убить ВСЁ. И если вам кажется, что главными врагами станет голод или радиация, то сразу выкиньте эту мысль из головы. В 99% случаев вас будут убивать обычные предметы обстановки - двери, лестницы, кровати, баллоны и тп. Но если вдруг вы сможете избежать позорных смертей, то не переживайте, нормально игрой насладиться всё равно не получится. Скорее всего на 2-3 часу игры у вас тупо выскочит ошибка и игра мило закроется, поломав все сейвы.

2) Так почему же многие ждут игры студии и продолжают верить в чехов? Потому что потенциал и амбиции у их проектов невероятны. Огромный открытый мир, свобода действий, обильный набор инструментов и построек - всё это может запросто соблазнить любого неосведомлённого человека приобрести игру и ждать, покуда она станет играбельной. Правда в данном аспекте Take on Mars не слишком повезло, так как если при появлении в раннем доступе у игры почти не было конкурентов, то сейчас есть уже десяток игр с похожей задумкой, но либо с большим функционалом, либо с лучшим исполнением.

3) Помогает смириться с ожиданием и незаконченностью игр многочисленное коммьюнити мододелов. Конечно полностью исправить проблемы мутированного, искалеченного физически и морально движка фанатам не под силу, но выпрямить интерфейс, добавить ещё с 500 новых игрушек для издевательств на марсианской поверхности, а так же несколько десятков продуманных сценариев и карт - это пряморуким, в отличии от разработчиков, модеделам под силу. Но как я уже говорил, если у тебя не работает сама игра, то как ты не старайся, моды это не исправят.

4) А вот последний пункт для кого-то может быть плюсом, а для другого - минусом. Дело в том, что игры Bohemia Interective имеют специфический геймплей и сложность, а разработчики относятся к игровому процессу как к совокупности полуторачасовой медитации и 5 секунд экшена, за время которого вы умираете. Take on Mars пошла даже дальше, и кроме увлекательного симулятора бега, коим является Арма, поместила игрока в скафандр, который делает игровой процесс ЕЩЁ МЕДЛЕННЕЕ. И вы можете сказать: "Ты придираешься, они ведь это сделали, чтобы сделать игру более реалистичной". На что я отвечу, что да, безусловно, многим покажется вялая неторопливость игры плюсом, но лично мне кажется, что я присутствую не на другой планете, а на бондаж/БДСМ вечеринке, где меня любят связывать по ногам и рукам, и всячески стараются вставить раскалённую кочергу в задний проход, для того чтобы я почувствовал все проблемы космических первопроходцев на своей шкуре. Не помогает с погружением в игру и чудесное управление, взятое наверно из какого-то профессионального симулятора жонглёра для безруких. Если вы хотите понять насколько оно неудобное, то попробуйте собрать что-то из лего, замотав свои руки скотчем, дабы они походили на палочки из-под китайской еды. Ну а чтобы прочувствовать игру полностью, сделайте всё вышесказанное, заперевшись в тесном чулане, так как к движку, уже не сильно любящему закрытые и ограниченные пространства, добавили космические постройки, которые обязаны быть компактными и органически выгодными, что сделало передвижение на космических станциях просто пыткой. Я уже не говорю, про невероятную симуляцию работы грузчика, после которой вы возненавидите все цилиндрические контейнеры на всю свою жизнь.

Так что совету пройти мимо. Как я уже говорил есть куча аналогов данной игры, с большим функционалом, лучшим исполнением и за меньшую цену.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992155714', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3621, 'last_played': 1482537702}
review:
-game is trying to do two things at once, and it's not that great at either one.
-novelty wears off pretty fast, both in manned and in robotic mode
-glitchy as hell physics bullshit
-slow performance on my reasonably okay hardware, even at the absolutely minimum settings

+It has a nice encyclopedia thing about Mars you get to read through when you make discoveries


My vision for Take On Mars would've been sending commands to a rover that's 20 light minutes away, managing dying systems using minimal energy and processing resources. It would be deciding between going to site A or site B. Which rock to inspect, whether to deviate from the mission plan and visit a rock that's 50 meters in the opposite direction or not.

Not "drive around with your gamepad for a couple days and build moon bases while wearing a space suit."


I don't know. This should've been two games, not one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131822009', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4416, 'last_played': 1686338332}
review:
I don't know how to feel about this game. It was an amazingly impressive game when I got it 6 years ago, and the year and a half afterwards they made a decent amount of quality of life changes to put the game in a "playable" state. Nevertheless, its been completely abandoned and unfinished. I thought coming back to this a few days ago would have years of updates piled up and the campaign would be complete, and there would be some new features to try out, but its the same exact game. That really fucking sucks because both the human campaign and the europa submarine maps had some real potential.

Based on what the game was and still is, there isn't much to do. There is no objective, mission, events, or endgoal. You land, you build a base, and you keep improving everything until you decide you're bored of repetitive tasks and stop coming back to the save. Either that or you do the campaign rover mode and drop individual rovers in so you can make a bigger one and repeat the cycle. They did drop the game to $10 though, and this is exactly the quality of game you'd expect from a $10 game regularly, so I don't feel ripped off.

It's cool to try a few times and then never touch it again, and I would call it worth the money and time. I can't in good conscience give it a positive review looking at the content and knowing what could have been if the developers stayed active.
developer_response:
Hi, actually we never removed 3D Printers. There are 3 types:
- Creative
- Basic
- Modular

Creative:
This printer is for those who just want to create things immediately, build and not worry about resources. This can be spawned with the in-game editor.

Basic:
This is the printer that lands close by to you in coop MP (in a supply drop). It requires resources, and has a small printing space. You can use it to print small objects, barrels, and parts for a larger printer.

Modular:
This printer is modular in that its potential size is unlimited as you can upscale it as needed. It uses resources, and can be used to print anything including large vehicles (provided you make it big enough).


I hope that helps clarify your worries :)

Kind regards,
Martin Melicharek
Project Lead

author: {'steamid': '76561197980207138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4147, 'last_played': 1494417212}
review:
I bought Take on Mars (TKOM) a couple of years ago, following an article in PCG, while it was early in it's early access phase.  It was at the time monstrously, hideously, gloriously broken.  How broken you ask?  Well, most of the main game didn’t work and while there was a game engine for clamouring around on Mars, trying to build anything usually resulted in catapulting fragments of base hundreds of meters away.  Your character on Mars also lumbered about like an arthritic pensioner in the final stages of terminal collapse, and it crashed at the merest hint of a physics-object conflict.  
And yet…I kept playing it.  Slowly, glacially slowly, updates came out.  Months went by at one point where a build made it impossible to play at all.  Most games like this, I’d have shrugged, written off the purchase price as an object lesson in looking before I lept and moved on.  But I’ve never uninstalled it, and periodically, between games of GTA, Kerbal and Metal Gear, I’d pop back to Mars to see how things were going.  

As a result of my continued curiosity, I’ve somehow managed to sink over 60 hours into this game now, and rising.  It is still, safe to say, far from polished.  Movement is still a challenge.  Building anything before starving to death or running out of essential minerals, certainly in the core ‘manned exploration’ missions is a Sisyphean struggle.  But it DOES payback in spades in giving you that feeling of being the first person on Mars, exploring in a hostile environment.  Survival SHOULD be challenging, and every minor victory feels like a grand slam.  Didn’t starve to death before getting the mobile lab down?  VICTORY!  Managed to work out how to build a working, modular 3D printer? VICTORY!  Damn…out of resources to build anything else though…

Don’t buy this game if you’re lucking for something easy to play, honestly hours can be sucked in and you’ll only make teeny, tiny progress.  But what progress you, and the developers, make in TKOM, will really feel satisfying!  See you on the dawn side…

author: {'steamid': '76561198001850020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1445226539}
review: Astronomie und Raumfahrt interessiert mich. Und nachdem ich den (kostenlosen) Orbiter 2010 einige Monate erlernt hatte, dachte ich mir, könnte ich mich auch an diesen Simulator von meinem geliebten ArmA/DayZ Studio Bohemia wagen. Leider nicht besonders zugänglich und irgendwie war Roverfahren auf ner Oberfläche dann doch nicht so ganz meins. Außerdem bezieht sich die Simulation eher auf das gesamte Projekt, also auch Budgets im Auge behalten etc. Interessant und ich finds schade, daß es mich nicht genug gereizt hat um tiefer einzusteigen. Kaufempfehlung nur für Liebhaber dieses Genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008537647', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1487447143}
review:
Baví mě vesmír a jeho objevování...baví mě simulátory... z toho vyplývá, že Take on Mars je pro mě splněný sen, pro někoho možná trochu nudná záležitost, pro mě zábava na dlohou dobu, tím spíš real-time mód je pro mě lahůdka...
   Zatím asi největší mínus hry je fakt, že je to stále Early access, což by nevadilo, kdyby postup ve hře zůstával... žel bohu, po aktualizaci pokračování ve hře vyhodí chybu (jste na nekompabilitu starších uložených pozic upozorněni)... a to mi po pravdě řečeno rve žíly, hru totiž nemá cenu nějak hloubavěji hrát dokud nevyjde verze 1.0... Tak BI, už aby to bylo!!!!
   Update: Tak nám vyšla v1.0, mnoho se toho změnilo, spoustu věcí přibylo, vesměs se jedná o pozitivní záležitosti... Nicméně každého bude spíše zajímat co vše se nepodařilo... upřímně řečeno, dle mého názoru celý režim MANNED... ten je tam dle mého soudu úplně navíc, ani filmové sekvence které mají za úkol vás vtáhnout do děje mě nijak nenadchly, spíš jsem si říkal proč tam vlastně jsou... však tu jde o vědu, zde nemají emoce co dělat, kdybych chtěl spektakulární show tak zahraju COD... no což, režimu MANNED se vyhnu a na zbytek bych mohl vesměs psát ódy. Tedy teoreticky, prozatím je oblast HELP pustá a prázdná a tak především nováčci se budou plácat sem a tam a nebudou si jisti zda je onen další krok ten správný a zda jejich omezené finance nevyhazují z okna...momentálně se mi celá hra jeví jako velice slušný a hratelný základ na který by se mohlo časem nabalovat další a další obsah.... zda-li tomu tak bude či ne, ukáže čas, nicméně by si velkou a dlouhodobou pozornost tento titul rozhodně zasloužil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031224508', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 5043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2126, 'last_played': 1579725571}
review:
If you liked the movie The Martian with Matt Damon, then get this game. It is brutal, it is unforgiving, and it is hard but then again you are surviving on a hostile planet in a game set in the near future. You may see reviews of Mixed but much of this was based on the developers taking a little while to get the manned mission to Mars. Beforehand it was a robotic section and teaser of the manned.

The title is new future complete and the only EA is them polishing it up and squashing bugs. It is a thinking mans survival game and a lot of fun. So in Steam review fashion:

Vented my airlock without a suit 10 times, would play again: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046618974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5064, 'last_played': 1531897438}
review:
So, in a nutshell, this is bit of campaign with a lot of sandbox. There isn't a heck of a lot of content at the moment and there are bugs and missing content to contend with. That said, this is one of the more polished early access games I have encountered and it looks as if it is just going to continue to grow.

The way the game is designed though, I feel like it will eventually turn into something akin to Skyrim if a large enough fanbase were to get into it as the ability to mod the game allows for the creation of amazing things.

The editor is a little wonky though, so hopefully that will get some more polish as well.

All in all, this is one of the best space sims I've played so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966021094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1486308076}
review:
> Had the game on wishlist for almost a year
> Bought in sale
> Was training for the Mars, got hot and heard strange breath
> Saw my Avatar the first time, had to ignore
> Travelled to Mars
> Found myself stranded in an incomplete campaign
> Played a scenario from workshop
> Deeply impressed by the immersion on Mars
> Just enjoying the atmosphere
> After 20 min recognizing that seems to be all
> "Mars sightseeing sim, have ur travel booked today!"
> Tried creating a good scenario on my own
> Failed in the Editor due to missing options and functions
> Kinda frustrated and sad
> Writing a good review cause hoping the game is beeing finished!

Its great. Dont get me wrong. The game lacks a huge amount of content and thats kinda frustrating. But if u wanna experience the great immersion beeing on Mars on your own...go! Only thing to remember, thats nearly all. Its like "go and have a look, how it feels there". There are some user scenarios which add additional experience. But they are all very simple. No long term motivation.

I bought the game for beeing on Mars on my own and try to survive in these conditions. And i had 1-2 hours fun in the "campaign" (which suddenly ended after 20 minutes, BÄM, incomplete) and then tried some scenarios from the workshop. Nothing really motivating.

Hope to find some energy to deal with the "Editor" and creating a nice "Martian" experience some day.

review: Take on Mars is good for what the unmanned part offers, but the manned part is still in heavy development right now. It does look promising as the game is still under development by the devs. The development may be slow but it is still there. They give out information about what they are currently doing and they even have a trello page so you can check out what they are developing and what is to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970707904', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1504833902}
review: I can't get any mode of this product to run (even the tutorial)... bugs everywhere... totally dissapointed... you can see where this would be a great game, but it's incredibly frustrating interface followed by bugs makes it 100% unplayable. It's a lot like a lego game where you build your stuff in first person, except 99% of the time, the building blocks don't recognize what you're doing... this leads to a 10 minute exercise in moving a single building block around... you need to build a ton of stuff... pieces should lock together easier. I could go on and on... heck... my avatar couldn't even make it up stairs... not just in one scenario or two... any time I ran into stairs, I ran into trouble. Anyway... if you like aspirin, go for it... otherwise, I can't say that this sci-fi loving, "The Martian" reading/watching, worked with NASA in the military, guy can hang with this. It's just too broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003533593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7329, 'last_played': 1640468678}
review:
A survival on Mars?
Waouh, simply amazing and the game is always updated.
in fact there is two game in one, first you're playing as a command center and send probes and after rovers on  mars to explore. Mars is the first step, you can also explore asteroids or moon, I think.
Relaxing game and really beautiful.
second, you're playing as a human alone or not ( yes there is co-op or multi ), and try to survive on the red planet, construct your base, vehicules, mining, foring, analysing stuff, and try to make foods and water on this friendly planet.
just awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121119026', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1486673369}
review:
不错的火星登陆游戏，喜欢这类题材的玩家推荐入手。不过最好等1.0出来之后再正式玩，现在还有很多不足的地方，最大问题还是bug多。。游戏的潜力还是很巨大的。
Buono gioco per chiunque piacerebbe di esplorare il pianeta Marte. Tuttavia vi raccomando di comprarlo dopo la distribuzione ufficiale a causa dei bug esistenti.

以上是一年多前的评测了,现在正式版终于出来了,喜欢的可以入手了。
Un po' più di un anno dopo lo commento sopra,oggi ecco la versione 1.0! Guardiamo:

优点:
1，相比坎巴拉操作和设计更硬核，世界更小。但是麻雀虽小五脏俱全，火星做得很精致。
2，联机。这点击败坎巴拉战争计划。
3，画质更拟真，现实风格
PRO:
1,Il disegno e la manovra è più difficile nel confronto al Kebel Space Program,anche il mondo è più piccolo però più particolare,grazie al concentramento dei lavori su Marte.
2,MP,che bello!
3,Il Grafico è più reale come nostra vita dopo decadi, non di cartoon.

缺点:
CONTRO:
1，刚玩不久暂未发现
1,Non ho ancora trovato

author: {'steamid': '76561198004963785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 42770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5701, 'last_played': 1706555657}
review: Bjr, je trouve le jeu très bon. Paysage magnifique et réaliste si on aime la conquête spaciale. Par contre c'est unjeu qui, comme tous les jeux Bohémia, demandent beaucoup de patience et de temps pour maitriser l'interface et la complexité du jeu. Pour ceux qui se shootent à l'adrénaline, passez votre chemin.... Pour les autres, ceux qui aiment les jeux réalistes et lents, je recommande fortement ce jeu. (même si il est assez cher mais je l'ai acheté tout de suite (19 euros je crois), je suis fan d'astronomie, mais les possibilités sont infinis...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198151542325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3272, 'last_played': 1614115429}
review:
I Really like the game which on it's own really does not tell all that much. But the way it feels and even more what it can become is just great. But there it is... What it CAN become. Right now for my taste the building part has not been developed enough to be statisfying.

What you can build is awesome but then it would be nice if it actually worked well... for example I spend the last four hours mapping out and building a base only too tear it all down again because it snapped wrong in place and it could not be finished since it was not airtight... which when you have your entire HUD filled with "LEAK" is something easilly missed.

What also is a downsite for me is the fact that i have been killed more often by my building then by mars itself, try to take a step up the ladder and be stuck. use shift to run you suddenly become the flash and slam so hard in the wall your entire suit is torn too pieces. 

Building items that suddenly decide you are the badguy and shoot towards you like being fired from a catapult are also not that uncommen for me.

And yet... I Reccomend this game and this is why:

It is a challenge but one in one of the most beautifull and stunning enviroments I have ever seen with this amount of freedom. You can do as you like (within certain boundries) but it remains realistic. It is slow moving but it has a beauty to that as well... and no matter how frustrating it sometimes might be it is one hell of a feeling to be racing a scout buggy across the desserts of mars with your home made base sitting there amongst nothing.... a beautifull and creepy thing to behold and see.

If you want a simple survival game you should pass... but for a game that is in my opinion unique and visually stunning however with still a way to go and you are up for a challange.... You will not regret it.

review: Le problème de take on mars c'est qu'en faisant évoluer le jeu (ajout de la simulation humaine)  ils ont réhaussé les attentes. Et comme de nombreux jeux en early, passé un moment, il n'y a plus personne.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970878964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1481117558}
review: Habe den fortschritt schon eine weile verfolgt und ich muss sagen, das dieses Spiel wirklich toll ist. Die schon jetzt spielbare erste und zweite Episode des Spiel im Single Player modus ist super. Das szenario bei dem der Astronaut auf dem Mars abstürzt und nun um sein überleben kämpfen muss, ist wirklich sehr gut gelungen. Ich kann es kaum abwarten mehr zu sehen. Das Szenario, ist wirklich toll und vielversprechend. Ich kann es kaum abwarten weiter zu spielen. Am ende kam dann die Nachricht das es mehr ende des Jahres gibt. Endlich mal wieder ein tolles Einzelspieler Spiel, das auch noch eine Packenede Geschichte vermittelt und so viel mehr lust auf Abenteuer macht.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988428254', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8903, 'last_played': 1585534743}
review:
A fun semi simulator / Survival game. You are in charge of the Mars space program and bombard the red planet with probes. If you experiece a bit more "curiosity" then start sending rovers and configurate them in order to complete your science objectves without wasting the tax payers money by crashing a million dollar rover on the surface of Mars.

If that sounds utterly boring to you and you don't want to drive the rover painfully slow on the surface of Mars. Then go ahead and play the survival aspect. Pick a scenario, create one, play it solo or take it to multiplayer and start building your new home on Mars and make sure you have all the resources you need.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033834522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1496338147}
review:
idiotic - insulting.

no remapping keybindings! stuck with aswd in 2016.

i require the numpad for all key bindings. 

any game in the 21st century that doesn't even allow users to remap movement keys is INSULTING.

as for the game, well I couldn't tell you. could I, I'm denied access to the game!

No remapping of keys?????????????? (Sure change a few minor keys, big deal... bur no A S W D substitutions??????)
developer_response:
Hi, actually the game supports remapping of absolutely every control onto every input device. In the 'Options' menu, press the tab on the left-hand side titled 'Keybindings'. There you can change everything.
Note the 2 combo-boxes at the top titled 'MOUSE & KEYBOARD' and 'GLOBAL'. These indicate which input device, and which set of controls. I hope that helps you, cheers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111892633', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 94269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40752, 'last_played': 1708726907}
review:
My first game on Steam! This little game is one of the best on the market, but unfortunately has been abandoned and still has many bugs. The single player is functional and driving rovers around in the campaign is quite relaxing. Building bases as an astronaut takes too long since resource gathering takes a lot of waiting. The cooperative multiplayer mode is workable, and fun if you have a friend. Little alive community.
Rating: 3/5 since the game is buggy and performance issues (fixable with community mods)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031084532', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4346, 'last_played': 1666027171}
review:
Táto hra ma úžasnou grafiku a atmosféru, jedinečné ovládání.

Koupil jsem prakticky jejich téměř všechny hry simulátory, od dob OFP, hostoval jsem konunitní dedikované servery a vytvářel komunitní stránky a fóra. Některé hry jsem ani jen nenainstaloval, jen zakoupil, abych touto formou podpořil BISTIODIO.
Aktualizace (stabilní větev) se vydávají až po několika měsících.

Doporučuji zvolit si místo "stabilní" větve hry rovnou "test" větev (branch). Ve "stabilní" verzi nešlo hrát některé mise, chyby nedodělky. Nicméně v "test" větvi zatím vše funguje.

Edit: původně jsem hre dal špatné hodnocení. Zkoušel jsem několik SP misí, žádná nešla hrát/dohrát. Nicméně "test" větev funguje skvěle. Upravuji proto hodnocení.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043126818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7040, 'last_played': 1560362760}
review:
Gut gemachtes Game. Aber in Anbetracht, dass es seit 2013 immernoch eine Beta ist, eine schlechte Leistung des Entwicklers. Viele Funktionen sind noch nicht integriert und müssen Mittels Workshop-Mods nachgerüstet werden. Wenn man Glück hat funktionieren diese auch. Aber meist ist dem nicht so, wie z.B. bei den Mods wo man Human Waste zu Methan und Wasser splitten kann.
Auch die schlechte Multicore-Unterstützung trübt den Spielspaß. Je größer und umfangreicher eine Basis wird, umso mehr muss man die Details runterschrauben. Da gibt es grafisch wesentlich aufwendigere Games, die in den höchsten Einstellungen flüssig laufen.

Auch verträgt das Game keine "Alt+Tab"-Aktion. Es stürzt sofort ab und macht zudem das zum Zeitpunkt des Abstürzes gepeicherte Savegame dauerhaft unbrauchbar.

An sich macht das Game Spaß. Im Multiplayer sicherlich auch.
Aber wegen der schlechten Performance (trotz aktueller Hardware) und der seit Jahren andauernden Kinderkrankheiten nur etwas für Menschen mit starken Nerven.

évaluation debut 2018:

On est en mai 2018 et les devs avaient promis pour janvier la release de la traduction en 6/7 langues, la communautée steam et autres on fait toute la traduction, les devs ont jeté cette trad faite par la commu dans un coin de leurs pc section "la corbeille", aucun respect, je vous laisse voir cela par vous mème, vous en jugerais ma bonne fois, du temps perdu pour aider les autres, ils ont les fichiers traduits, corrigés mais ne les mettent pas à disposition...
Le patch FR:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/244030/discussions/0/666827315301347452/
Les autres traductions:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/244030/discussions/0/1520386297685025538/
Des mythomane j'en ai vue, mais la c'est le pompom!

évaluation de 2015:

Bonjour.

Attention ressemble plus à de la vrai simulation qu'un jeu, donc très dur à prendre en main!
Très dur à prendre en main car comprendre le keybinding releve du miracle car codé avec les pieds, mais qu'es-ce que c'est beau putain! (dsl) une claque visuel, bien opti par moment et d'autres non, beaucoup de missions que se soit en coop ou solo, de la robotic à la simulation spacial survival, plein de scenarios bien rodés, attention nous sommes beaucoup plus en simulation qu'en arcade, foncez si vous aimez les simu-survie réaliste dans l'espace, il y a la lune, les bases en orbite, mars, la terre et d'autres pour ne pas spoil...

Pour finir et conclure cette évaluation, se jeu était prometteur, mais nous nous sommes fait arnaqué par des promesses... 
Donc jeu en anglais, donc bye bye les anglophobes, les devs l'avait promis pour le debut d'année, je site "release localisation translate for junary", on est en mai, 1 an apres mdr! et toujours rien, donc pour se manque de respect, un gros pouce rouge bien honteux mr les devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028601118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3657, 'last_played': 1510278865}
review:
Okay, I love this game, really, I really, really, really do. Wish there was something between positive and negative. But some things have kinda been in limbo for a fair amount of time and it makes me question what's exactly going on over at BI, awhile ago they broke suits for manned missions, meaning randomly, you'd start either freezing to death or burning to death, even if wearing a heavy suit, come back a year later, still happens and modders have tried to fix this to no avail, I believe this happened shortly after they changed how controllers functioned in the game.

There are also a variety of bugs that have been in the game since day one and haven't been squashed, but they add more 'content' before fixing them, meaning they're building a massive stack of bugged content. Hell, sometimes the game just dies from the Player dying. It wasn't so bad, but as soon as random deaths started happening, it just took me right out of the experience.

Basically, I loved this game, but God damn the bugs are killing me. I'll change this review as soon as a variety of the bugs that kill the experience get squashed. (That said, it's still better than NMS :P) I wish the devs the best in this endevour as honestly, this, for a long time, was my go to game to have fun and feel immersed on another planet.

EDIT 27th Sep; there is a mod that increases thermal protection so you don't die every 2 minutes, still this should be addressed officially.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013214557', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2268, 'last_played': 1563565593}
review: If you have a thick skin when it comes to bugs that can utterly destroy your progress in a slow-paced game like 'Take on Mars', if you love to send probe after probe, lander after lander and rover after rover on our small, red, dusty neighbor, if you love space-exploration-games that truely try to display the work of astronomers and generally people working with exploration of outer space, then this game is for you. It is not finish (it might never be), but personally I just can't get enough of traveling with my small robot over endless, red deserts, shooting photos and measuring temperature. It is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004527447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10573, 'last_played': 1570183161}
review:
This Game is very fun to play. This style of game is simular to a Survival/ Exploration/ Science type game. Although its still in development, that does not hinder its already fun content. Play the campaign, play a single map, or maybe try to create your own adventure with the editor. With some luck you may even attempt to create your own map in the workbench tool from TKOM's Launcher.

EDIT: For those who do not like this style of gameplay or the game in general, i must note that you are not obligated to by this game before it is finished. Early Access Games are ment to have the community help in the development of the game, not to give you a polished game from the get go.

I have come to realize that some might not like my point of view on this game, and that is your right but to challenge someone based on your own opinion is not what is needed. Post your own review if you want to give potential buyers your POV.

As for the Modability of this game, yes its modable but so are most games now adays. It allows the developers and industry to showcase those hidden talents of those who may not be able to develop their own game.

This game is primarily a space agency simulator that has mars, the moon and a few astroids as it's goals atm. It also has a manned mission section to it, this is where most of the multiplayer aspect comes from.

This game has good things and bad things about it. But most games also have this and they have been top award winning games. If you want to know the good and the bad of a game, seek a review that gives you the pros and cons. I like this game and as such the cons are minor to me if ive even encountered them at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009210009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1505659606}
review:
I remember reading on the bohemia interactive forum that Marek and Ondrej Spanel originally didn't want to make a war game like OFP or Arma. I wondered what they wanted to do then. Maybe Take on Mars is the answer?

I played OFP/Arma/ArmaII/ArmaIII with all the mods and addons from 2001 on. I really liked the series but I withdrew from it, because of the war theme.

But after a break I'm with BIS again! Because of TKOM! I really appreciate BIS is making a game that concentrates on exploration/surviving/managing rather than killing and destroying.

I'm really impressed by the quality of the game and by the climate. BIS is really a great game producing company! I will buy any DLC that will come out after TKOM is final!

Your faithful customer for 15 years now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009964589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3148, 'last_played': 1399455614}

At least this time they can't use the excuse that developers were arrested on Mars...

author: {'steamid': '76561197980811109', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3995, 'last_played': 1546436920}
review:
[h1]Un juego lleno de encantos y frustaciones, como la mayoría de los juegos de Bohemia Interactive.[/h1]

Si te gusta la carrera espacial y hablas un poco de inglés posiblemente este juego te sorprenda. Destripando los modos de juegos, tenemos el primero que consiste principalmente en controlar un centro de mando e ir lanzando sondas a Marte, para ir evolucionando en equipo hasta montar tus propios Rover según demanda de la misión. Para ello tienes un arbol de ciencia donde vas investigando a tiempo real (o no, según el modo de juego que elijas) las distintas funciones de tus sondas y cacharros que vas a enviar a Marte. Cabe destacar que las superficies de los planetas son muy fieles a las reales y cuando digo planetas es que el juego tiene acceso a una de las lunas de Marte "Deimos" y a otros astros. Este es uno de los puntos en los que se dispersa el juego, las misiones en otros astros son mínimas y no les da demasiado peso a este módulo de exploración. Tanto en este modo de juego como en el siguiente que explicaré a continuación, la presión atmosférica, la climatología y otras carácterísticas como la radiación, están perfectamente implementadas. Este módulo solo es single player y aprovecho para comentar que la gestión del capital es crucial, dado que aquí la "muerte permanente" ocurre en más de una ocasión por ese mismo motivo.

En el segundo modo de juego nos encontramos con otra cosa completamente distinta del anterior, aquí entramos en la supervivencia espacial. Podemos establecer una base en Marte o en una Luna, para ello contamos con instrumental de todo tipo, una especie de mesa de crafteo (y quizás este muy mal emplear el crafteo dado que no pide ningún tipo de recurso, solo tiempo) que nos permitirá construir un hábitat de supervivencia espacial completo, un sistema de abastecimiento energético basado en los estándares actuales, minería y sintésis químicas de sustancias y también cultivo de tubérculos (y que conste que esto estaba mucho antes del lanzamiento del largometraje "The Martian"). En este módulo del juego se permite el multijugador, permitiendo así colonizar un planeta entre varias personas de forma cooperativa. Aquí es donde más gana para mi la implementación con Steam Workshop, dado que la comunidad ha diseñado decenas de mods que nos harán la experiencia más completa. Creo que también es interesante comentar que este modo de juego con la mesa de crafting se aleja completamente de la realidad, si el modulo de exploración está lleno de datos enciclopédicos y de procedimientos reales aquí difiere más con la realidad. Podemos elegir varios tipos de escenarios con diferentes demandas de supervivencia y varias demostraciones muy dispersas. Por ejemplo podemos hacer un anclaje a la Estación Espacial Internacional (ISS) y recorrer todos sus pasillos con una vista impresionante del globo terráqueo, la han diseñado muy cercana a la realidad por lo cual la sensación de que estás viendo algo muy real se acrecenta.

En este párrafo voy a comentar un poco las características comunes que poseen ambos modos de juego:
[list]
[*]Ambos poseen el engine gráfico Enforce, gracias a el se pueden obtener una vistas impresionantes del juego, su motor de física funciona a las mil maravillas ofreciendo diferentes movimientos según gravedad dentro y fuera de los planetas y astros. Su sistema de destrucción está muy bien implementado, gira de manera brusca una sonda y la harás pedazos de basura galáctica en menos de lo que canta un gallo.
[*]Los dos modos disfrutan de Steam Workshop, podemos modificar nuestros Rovers, como aplicar mejoras a nuestra base o sistema energético o incluso mejorar parámetros gráficos e importar modelos.
[*]Ambos poseen un mapa detallado de la superficie que estamos explorando o viviendo, pudiendo hacer escaners de gases y recursos o una vista aérea completa dado que nuestra base siempre está comunicada al satélite (a no sea que se rompa algún instrumento que dependa de ello)
[/list]

Y ya por último voy a extenderme un poco en los aspectos negativos que he ido viendo. La mayoría ya los conoceréis pero para los que no Bohemia Interactive siempre han desarrollado juegos muy técnicos pero a la misma vez plagado de bugs. En este momento estamos hablando de un Early Access con nada más ni nada menos que tres años de desarrollo, durante ese tiempo [u]hemos ido recibiendo actualizaciones cada mucho tiempo y apenas solucionando la cantidad de bugs[/u] (creedme, son muchos) a la par de no meter apenas nuevas funciones o rellenando las cosas que hacían más falta. Siempre he pensado que este estudio intenta abarcar más de lo que puede y se dedican a demasiados títulos a la vez que siguen estando en un estado demasiado precario. Arma 2 que data del 2009 todavía está lleno de bugs, [b]por no nombrar DayZ.[/b]
Por otra parte, el juego se llama Take On Mars, pienso que deberían haberse centrado en Marte, al menos habrían menos bugs, que si, que acercarse a la ISS es algo impresionante, pero luego ahí aparte de abrir puertas no tienes nada más que hacer. 

Resumiendo: cómpralo si te gusta el espacio y sabes algo de inglés, cuando aprendas a jugar va a ser uno de tus títulos favoritos, eso si, sabiendo que está plagado de fallos y a este ritmo [b]dudo que se complete el juego[/b]. En cambio, si quieres algo rápido y jugar sin demasiadas complicaciones no te lo recomiendo, el idioma es un problema y los juegos de Bohemia son muy técnicos, siempre recomiendo devorar videos de YouTube para enterarse como funciona todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056468354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2476, 'last_played': 1577042389}
review:
Une arnaque pour un jeu négligé, bien que les graphismes soient plutôt bien fait, le jeu est une mine de bugs et de plantage, encore heureux qu'il y est les sauvegardes quand ces dernières ne sont pas corrompu toute fois...
Il y a des moments dans le jeu où c'est intéressant comme faire des manips avec le robot pour faire des analyses et compléter le wiki sur Mars intégré, mais à part ça c'est juste horriblement chiant d'attendre 45min pour traverser un cratère et si par malheur vous ne sauvegarder pas et qu'un caillou se coince dans votre roue, je plains votre clavier...
Sans compter que la mort par manque d'air est une mort définitive, même s'il y a un bouton respawn, vous respawner certes...mais sans oxygen en plus, du coup vous mourrez à nouveau. Et je sais que ça fait très longtemps que ce bug y est et n'a toujours pas été corrigé.

Et le pire dans tout ça c'est une incompatibilité avec win 8 et 10 (soit la totalité des pcs de maintenant >_>' ! Bohemia ferait vraiment bien de travail ce point, sinon j'irai demander à me faire rembourser pour prendre quelque chose peut être moins 'fun' mais qui démarre au moins.

review:
Глючная и однообразная игра. Сначала надо потратить много времени, чтобы разобраться в ней, а потом понимаешь ее бессмысленность. Но уже 2 часа пролетели, вернуть деньги нельзя.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074876920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 17547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14387, 'last_played': 1677972415}
review:
Really, you are getting two games in one here: exploring Mars with rovers and the whole manned mission thing.

The rover gameplay is what this game was built from the ground up to be, and it does an amazing job with that.  It's very relaxing to drive a slow rover across alien terrain while listening to music or a podcast, definitely not everyone's cup of tea but if you like that sort of thing you will love Take On Mars.  There are plenty of scientific experiments you need to do and it's fun to figure out how to partially complete new missions with rovers you already have on Mars.  For example, if you are launching a new rover but don't have enough money to add an environmental monitoring station you could do those objectives by making your new rover work with an old rover that completed it's mission long ago and has an environmental monitoring station.  After a rover completes it's mission you can try to squeze every bit of profit from it that you can by doing optional objectives or more missions until it gives out and can do no more.

The manned mission is a different story, and it's what most reviews have been focusing on because it's the newest and shiniest thing.  Don't be fooled into thinking that's the entire game though, it was sort of tacked on as an afterthought and not fully finished.  Gameplay is slow in both game modes, but if you're getting a Mars rover driving simulator with the expectation of of fast paced action that's on you.  It's not the greatest gameplay experience I have ever had, but I still find it entertaining and relaxing to slowly build up a self sustaining habitat one small piece at a time, go out collecting surface samples in my rover, take care of potato plants, and enjoy the amazing visuals of the red planet.

In conclusion: if you get this game, get it for the rovers.  That's what Take On Mars really is, a rover driving simulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148275142', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2206, 'last_played': 1555170747}
review:
This game at it's stage has a very great potential, and right now the game is going really decent.

Graphics - Slightly buggy at times, but good at max (recommend strong computers)
Scenarios - The maps are amazing, especially how precise they are.
Player - The HUD inside and outside the player are detailed, but could use some improvements.
Space Program - The robotics mission is alright and the manned mission is still in progress so not all of it is released.
Stability of the Game - At times, there will be memory issues but it depends on your computer so I'd suggest saving every few 15 minutes.

Rating: 9/10 - Would recommend this game to people who are interested into Mars and adventure (sort of).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037222083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1468267710}
review:
I wanted to like this game so much.  But I am already fed up with it after about an hour of just doing the training tutorials.

I can't get past the basic game movement controls, inventory, etc.  Walking is hideously slow, sprinting makes you exhausted, and you get caught on items/objects/people/etc.  In your inventory, you have to "examine" items to see details about them.  (For example, I can quickly double-click to add water packs to my inventory, but to see whether they are full or empty? Right click on the individual ones, click "examine," and THEN it tells you if it's full.  Uh... no.)  

I had to do the first part of the tutorial 3 times because it had so many bugs.  The first time, I interacted with a tutorial "quest marker" before I had actually put a tool in my inventory.  The only way to exit that section of the tutorial was to put the tool in my hand... but I had no tool yet... so there was no way to exit the screen.  Had to restart.  

Then, the next time, I was putting water packs in my inventory.  I accidentally dumped one water pack on the ground.  But, again, in order to exit that specific part of the tutorial, I had to put THAT water pack from THAT slot in my inventory into a water machine.  Couldn't exit my inventory to pick up the water pack.  Had to restart again.

Then, it took me 5 full minutes to get into a goddamn helicopter.  The tutorial said to use spacebar to jump in at a specific point (highlighted by a tutorial "quest marker").  Well, no manner of jumping, running and jumping, jumping while close, jumping while far away, etc. would get me in the damn helicopter.  The only way I could get in was to go around to the other side and enter in a different entrance, and even then I think it was a miracle, since I hovered in the air unexplicably for several seconds while trying to get in that doorway.  

Then, in the next part of the tutorial, half of my time was spent trying to make sure my cursor was within the 5 pixels necessary to open the airlock button on multiple sets of doors (but not the "cycle airlock" button, which was right next to it).  Then, I was supposed to switch out fuel cells in a buggy, but taking them out and putting the new ones in apparently requires some kind of god-like precision using the rotate button... or something....

Not to mention that, when you move your mouse to look around, your view moves hella-fast, but when you move your mouse in an inventory screen, the cursor lags slowly behind your movements.  There were no settings to change your mouse sensitivity, so you're stuck with it.

Honestly, maybe this game is awesome.  But I have played a lot of 1st person games, and the mechanics of this one are so ponderous that it isn't even worth it to me to learn more and keep trying.  Maybe if I could get through the creeping walk, getting stuck on corners/container lids/etc., having to spend forever centering your cursor on little buttons, or spending minutes rotating fuel cells so that I can get them at the right angle to switch them out (so that I have enough fuel to take another 90 second jaunt in a buggy), I could get to the good stuff.  But it's too maddening, so I'm gonna go play something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960378635', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1511112889}
review:
Very poor game.. Kinda stinks because BI is a pretty good company.  Movement is incredibly buggy and annoying in enclosed environments, you get caught on things, warp through walls, have jitter everywhere.  This is like a game in very early alpha where the basic, _basic_ mechanics are not worked out, like... movement and object interaction.

Updated 11/5/2017:

Much improved, at least until you get to the large MAV, then you get frame rate drops to 14-15 with jittery controls and slurred head movements.  Airlocks sometimes take 45s to decompress and the barometer gets confused and just starts throwing random numbers for the 2nd half.  Game is pretty good until chapter 3?  Hope they keep working on this

author: {'steamid': '76561197998198926', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1467990274}
review:
Right now I can't reccomend this game to ANYONE, not even my worst enemy..

It's just badly done, you die randomly for sometimes absolutely no reason, like the lift kills you when you use it, because it's badly coded..

Base building is next to useless, the parts don't even fit together properly, either due to the terrible multiplayer coding, or due to they are just not 3D modelled corectly, or bad game design..

You spend hours trying to make an outpost, and it just don't work, there are gaps in between the panels, because the auto-snap system is crap..

JUST DON'T BOTHER BUYING IT!

IF.. and that's a massive IF it's fixed upon release, and it all works corectly, I may change my review, but for now, don't waste your money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010387049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1467923495}
review:
So, I got this game from the Steam Summer Sale, despite the mixed reviews.  I LOVED the concept, and hey, if it takes a little while to finish, that's fine.  I mean, I bought Kerbal Space Program back in it's beta when it had PLENTY of room to improve.  It turned out to be an amazing investment, and I'm counting on this one being the same as well.  

NOW, my problem is that I cannot start the game.  It crashes every time, and I have tried reinstalling it.  I have a fairly modern computer, so it isn't an issue of graphics or anything.  At this moment therefore, I cannot recommend it.  If the devs update the game and it works, I look forward to changing my review!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045231999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 7447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3036, 'last_played': 1472264807}
review: I think it's cool that the devs are turning out updates to this pretty neat sim.  But what would really be helpful is a post or two now and then that explains what the updates contain.  Just enough high-level feedback to the community to help us understand how awesome the update(s) is that we are experiencing.  New features, bug fixes, support, etc...  things like that would help us gain a better appreciation for a sim we already know and enjoy.  Personally, I would like to know when the radiation is being addressed.  Will there be additional shielding we can construct to protect from radiation?  Will there be radiation sickness pills we can find or manufacture?  I'm sure there are many questions that fans of this sim have and are anxiously awaiting feedback from the devs.  I think the Devs are doing a great job, but a little blurb now and then to the community would be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113950157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2680, 'last_played': 1607972074}
review:
While the devs only work on the multiplayer, its kind of sad that the devs arent working on the singeplayer anymore.
They should have noticed things like, no loans or updated tutorials.

But its still not really THAT good.

The multiplayer side seems to be the main side, with new maps and such, and now the old legacy map is gone, with new decenders and things. I would recommend this to people for the multiplayer side, the singeplayer side is awfully terrible and down right boring. The game is now in its beta stages, and i was one of the few people to be on the alpha (i think, i had this game for a long time, it should have moved on. or i was always in the beta stage.) and now i see that they added a new campain for singleplayer manned survival.

Very buggy and unoptimized, still runs a solid 15 fps, for a decent pc. (with somewhat printed things)
It would be nice to have a thing for unprinting or something, because the wire barrels are really not needed.

But in conclusion this game is not half bad, (and i dont know why i waited so long to review xD)
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988816258', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1590639674}
review:
This is a really good martian rover simulator with a very flexible playstyle. You can drive your rover in 3rd person with the WASD keys, or you can play through a pixelated camera mounted on the rover while issuing move commands through a command-line text interface. It's just like real life martian exploration! (but without the 8 minute lag)

[h1]BUT[/h1]

Halfway through development the developers decided to add humans and base building to the game. This feature was not promised or hinted at when the game was announced and released. Now they will never fix all the rover bugs because they are too busy creating new human play features that i didn't ask for in my little $20 rover game.




This game is only for robotics and space enthusiasts who have interest in real world JPL and NASA space exploration.

do not pay more than $15 for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056205757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1551328813}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014665273', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1274, 'last_played': 1521905645}
review:
UPDATE: 03/21/2018
I WILL KEEP MY ORIGINAL REVIEW DOWN THERE FOR COMPARISON PURPOSES.

I didn't got time to play this game since launch, so i've decided to give it another chance.

Its been 2 years since my original review. What have changed since?
NOTHING! Really, nothing have changed (gameplay wise). The only new feature here is a campaign that is bugged and boring as shit.
Multiplayer still unplayable. Believe me, nobody will be able to play with you. Forget coop, MP is a lag hell. 
There were only about 8 servers in my list (all player made). All of them only had a single person playing (which is the own host). I tried connecting to a few ones, but its unplayable. Like i said, its lag hell...

On singleplayer, you got a few scenarios to play, but soon you will realise that playing them alone is boring as hell. This game wasn't made to play SP, but at the same time MP dont work.
Now, to make things worse, people are saying that bohemia have cut the funding for this game.

CONCLUSION: 
This game wont get better, MP will never get fixed, bugs will never get fixed. This game is DEAD!
It's dead, Jim...

Stay away from this one. There ain't much games of this genre out there, but if you are really want some space themed game with building mechanics and some survivval aspects, you could try Space Engineers.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
OLD REVIEW:

This is one of those alphalock games (forever locked in alpha). I really want to recommend this game, but i can't. It has so many bugs that it makes Assassin's Creed Unity looks like a piece of art.

Updates are rare and we are not talking about an indie studio here.

I bought this in a 4 pack to play with friends, but guess what? Multiplayer is unplayable (luckily i got it on a summer sale).

Anyway, this game can have future, but only in the hands of another studio. I hope those guys wake up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045109933', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 5385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3738, 'last_played': 1537626566}
review:
10/10 has bugs/lack of content but still the best mars sim ....

2021 update : After release they released maybe one update in november 2017.
I know not every game has the luxury to get updates regularly  or any updates at all after release but this game had potential and  i feel a lot of things were left in an unfinished state .
In 2021 i cant recommend this game for 25 eurodollaridoo . 
The rover part is unique but boring. I havent heard a game where you can send realistic rovers to a realistic mars  and do science stuff. 
The manned missions are not so unique anymore with space engineers , stationeers and the like games floating around in the steam library which are in their own ways more fleshed out and more digestable than take on mars' clunkyness . This mode needed the update the most.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045395997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1975, 'last_played': 1497048107}
review:
Short version - 

Take On Mars is a AAA game being made by an indi publisher. As such it's still in Beta and probably will be for some time - if that's an issue for you, favorite it and be patient. It is however being crafted with more realism and simulation and depth than any other space game you've played since KSP. You're going to kick yourself if you're a fan of real space sim stuff and don't play this game. 

Longer version - 

It started focused on sending probes to Mars and the inherent complications and experiences you'd find in that. That's already a very rich, very complex experience and worth the money. There's a tech tree you need to unlock, upgrades, scaling missions and tech and challenges that are a fun game already. Pick a location (created from actual surface scan data from Mars. No shit, it legit mapped from photos and heightmap data of the surface of Mars) and start figuring out what missions you can do with a single probe. Much like current space exploration you have to gauge the money and tools available to you to maximize your productivity on the surface. You'll find challenges of opportunity that provide additional income and so you need to plan for the unexpected while keeping in a manageable budget and resources. It's challenging in similar ways to Kerbal Space Program only focused on a far more realisitic experience rather than a somewhat fantastical one. 

The probe missions and content is a fun and challenging game and, again, worth the money. 

However the devs have recognized the demand for something more personal and have started laying the groundwork for manned missions to Mars. It's still simple and in a development state and has a long way to go. However the devs have shown with the content already created that they're dedicated and focused on making a deep, complex and challenging environment. That's going to take time and as the scope of the game has changed so has the development timeline. 

If you like what you see so far, pick it up. If you're concerned, then wishlist it and wait. If you're reading this review though then you're probably the sort of person intrigued by a realistic, challenging view of what exploring and even visiting Mars would be like, using actual mapping and images of the Martian surface and science we theoretically have today. If that's the case you're going to want this game sooner rather than later. 

If that's something you want then why settle for later rather than sooner? 

Game In Beta Note:

Some people are concerned with the development pace of the game. Always a concern with indie titles and it's a legit concern. You don't want a game that's been abandoned. That's not this game though. Devs have been working steadily so far, it's just a lot to make for an indie studio and there's no way you can look at the content that's already in the game and not realize that when it is released it's going to be the best, most realistic sim you could really hope for. It is a sim by the way - simulation is the name of the game. From different weights, uses and limitations to different sorts of suits to limited uses in the tests you can run on your probes to deadly radiation bursts from the Sun that Mars' whisper thin atmosphere and lack of magnetic field don't protect you from. You want a quick and dirty survival shooter they're already out. You want a realistic sim that tracks your oxygen usage based on your physical exertion, you need to have some patience.....

and if you want to survive on the Red Planet you're going to need to be patient.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966668699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2624, 'last_played': 1697355595}
review: Love the game... Or rather the promise of what the game can be... I bought this game in December 2015 with promises of a 1.0 non-beta version coming out in Feb 2016. Dissapointment after dissapointment has all I have recieved. Constant updates and little as far as information as to what had been worked on is available unless you spend an hour looking through the forums. Forums are great but when you are pushing a new update would it kill to put some info in the news stream? The last headline was from an article that originally led me to the game in the first place and its not much of a help as to the game play. There are tons of "coming soon" points in the in game gui that make using vehicles and such a pain in the bottom. PLEASE tell me whats going on and why I paid a big game dev company money for a product they dont seem to care about finishing. I know the team creating the game is working hard but they need to recieve the support they deserve. I'd gladly switch to yes as far as recomending this game if the dev team got some help and were more communicitive in a easily public way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999681876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1482327831}
review:
Super, die Einstellungen bei der Steuerung werden nicht gespeichert - nach jedem Neustart kann man das wieder einstellen. Wenn man sich für das Gamepad entscheidet, hat man es auch nicht besser. Sämtliche Optionen wie ein Inventar öffnen, auf die Map zugreifen usw. können NUR über die Tastatur bedient werden. Somit ist die gesamte Steuerung via Pad absolut sinnlos.

Im Tutorial hatte ich einen geilen Bug durch den ich das Turtorial nichtmal bis zu Hälfte spielen konnte. Steigt man dann unverrichteter Dinge in ein normales Spiel ein, kennt man sich aufgrund der fehlenden Infos aus dem Turtorial nicht wirklich aus und muss alles mühsam selbst herausfinden.

Ich kann dieses Spiel absolut nicht weiterempfehlen. Ich ärgere mich sehr darüber, dafür auch noch bezahlt zu haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115086891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 68807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1588758887}
review:
I know this is "Early Access" but I played the Space Program, and just barely figured out how to get together all the things I am supposed to be getting and then the promise, "coming soon in early 2016". Well, it is now MID-2016 and there has been nothing further added?

I know that some people might want the multiplayer aspect - but I don't, and would like to have a sandbox type play where I can build my own base -- the senarios do not seem to be so set up. I thought that was what this Space Program Manned was supposed to be about... but...

Seriously I hope you guys are really working on this 2016 release as this real real really seems to be a game worth playing and at $22 there should be much more than a teaser at this point since you said it was coming...

Right now, I would NOT recommend this game even though I marked yes -- that is because it is unfinished and other reviews suggest that there is no movement on this... I took a chance and hope that it will be rewarded with some kind of real update soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966391335', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 7321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7206, 'last_played': 1486849767}
review:
I hate to say it, but it appears this game has become vaporware.

Over the past year alone it has changed release date like 5 times, and recently they even dropped having a release date entirely.

They say this is to give it more time to be a finished product, yet they have not in the past year made much effort or progress on the game at all, despite being a real development studio. A solo indie developer works faster than they do.
It seems they have lost major interest and/or funding, I can't imagine any other reason for being this lazy with something so promising.

They also say they are working on major things behind the scenes and are holding back content, but they have provided no real evidence for this. At the terrible state the game is in, you would think they would just show this so called content, but nope.

The game right now has more bugs and issues than a swiss cheese has holes.
These same bugs and issues have not been touched at all for the past 2 years.

The game it self remains to this date so extremely buggy and crashy that it is difficult to keep playing, despite having supposedly been so close to release.

I really had high hopes for this game, I wanted it so badly to be a proper finished game, but that day may never come.
At the pace they are working at it will still take many years to finish.

This developer seems to be full of false promises and lies.

I still check in several times a week on what's going on with this game because I love space games so much, just in case something happens, but I have been doing that for more than a year too so...

Well, should things ever improve I will delete this review.
I would never make this exception for any other game doing this badly.

UPDATE:
To nobody's surprise, they released the game without fixing any of the bugs or crashes, added none of the requests people asked for, and no extra content other than a ISS you spend 2 minutes inside.... Multiplayer is a total mess because of this. Welcome to vaporware.. :'(

author: {'steamid': '76561198187363161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3918, 'last_played': 1591300342}
review:
I'm not sure why this game has mixed reviews.  It's still in beta, people.  Does it crash?  Yes, but you can STILL progress and have a meaningful experience if you're patient and save often.  I can't speak for multiplayer at this point, but in the last week I've built a fully functional base by myself (I'm a fan of the manned missions) and was into full-fledged methane production (a very time-consuming compound to make in the game).

It's worth your time if you're a space/science buff and are looking for an immersive space exploration experience.  With the way that development is going now, it seems like when the kinks are worked out of this game it could be a real-life simulation of survival on the red planet...if NASA ever develops space suits that can be put on/removed by one person. That's how immersive it is.  

It doesn't just stop at Mars, either.  You can send rovers or conduct manned missions to asteroids, the moon of earth and the moons of Mars (Phobos and Deimos).  The devs have thought of everything and the attention to detail is fantastic.  I'm eager to see what will come in future updates and the anticipated v. 1.0 release. 

I highly recommend this game as long as the devs keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073526950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1590937785}
review: Injugable, lleno de bugs, el multiplayer un desastre total, de verdad, demasiado caro para lo que es, si logran mejorarlo será un gran juego por que el simulador y por parte de gráficos no esta nada mal, pero de verdad, os voy a poner un ejemplo, en cuanto estoy en el multiplayer, mi jugador no camina, como si tuviera un puto derrame cerebral se mueve muy raro, otro ejemplo cuando estoy en la nave aterrizando no sale de la silla y empieza a 'volar' por el interior de la nave, en fin eso es muy poco, si explico todo hago una biblia, en resúmen, en estos momentos no te gastes tanto dinero pudiendolo gastar en otro juego muchissimo mejor, quizás en un futuro esto mejora y espero que sea asi, tengo esperanzas pero hasta el momento ni lo toco.
