author: {'steamid': '76561197976164835', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1527316092}
review:
After spending a while away from the "full release" I decided to come back. Hoping that this game had been crafted into a playable state that was deserving of the price tag and full release status. But no. This game is still BEYOND incomplete and with no updates occuring in a very long time it is clear to see that this game has been abandoned.  This game had so much potential but it was completely wasted.

I will never be buying an early access title by Bohemia ever EVER again. Take the damn funding out of the piece of crap you call DayZ standalone and put it into this. This game is way more deserving and you have basically released a completely unfinished product that should be in breach of Australian consumer law due to the quality of the product not meeting standards due to numerous crashes and bugs that result in the game being virtually unplayable.

I do not blame the devs as I believe they tried their best but bohemia refused to give this game and the devs the budget it deserved.  

In conclusion, seriously, I wouldnt buy it unless it is at least 80% off at this point. The gameplay youll get out of it is simply not worth the price tag any higher than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973661444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1540059268}
review:
NICE FOR hardcore simmer - for the space period post moon.
love it. simulated scenario are realistic.
would love a more recent graphic engine like in SC on this period.

once tweak your graphical settings to max in nvidia settings. Experience is really enjoyable.
You have those feeling of the real thing.

edit : once you anderstood how it works : do the "outpost scenario". Incredible adventure and quite easy . Do it until you finish all objectives in that one.
then learn to use the printer in an other mission with a base. ( rounded big plate ) use your assembler tool to fix it on ground. Here you go you can print everything you need.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163704433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1585, 'last_played': 1461190342}
review:
I love the game but what lets it down is the devs. I havnt played this game for weeks could be months as there isnt any large updates. I would expect this from a 2 man team in a basement. I think this game could be a cash grab of sorts as they seem to have forgotten about it. Website hasnt been updated for months. check for yourselfs. I dont want to promote other games but i have a few beta games which get updated every week. maybe these large companys could learn something from them.

I decided to recommend this game as it is a really good game and has alot of potential,  i really do want to see this game finished.

I would buy now when its cheap and wait for 1.0 to play.

Devs are cool guys and always respond to your suggestions whether good or bad comment

author: {'steamid': '76561198154884392', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1469102468}
review: I really think this game will be fun once it comes out, I really wanted too play online with my friend's, because building is kind of boring but what the hell doing it all yourself is still fun, yeah its slow, and yeah it takes a bit, kind of like it would in real life, But I Recommend it when its fully released, its going too be a good game, i've kind of wanted this for a while and hey it can be a fun game, plus how Bohemia made arma series i'm looking forward for it ^^. And just think of the mod's that will come with it, And for the people out their getting upset because the game has been on early access for 3 year's, i have not seen a company make a game that could keep me interested if it was done in a year or so, i mean i hardly will touch call of duty, and i loved black ops and Call of duty mw, but they suck and well, Arma 3 was the only shooting game i needed, but 10/10 but if they could fix multiplayer i would like too launch my friend into space >:D

author: {'steamid': '76561198000186522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1597129578}
review:
It's been in "Early Access" for 3 years and there is literally no one playing multiplayer. The single player is intensly boring and slow. It's very technical, which the development team is fantastic at, but there is no playable worth to the game. The only exception would be someone who is considered a tried-n-true enthusiast of robotics and/or uneventful planetary exploration. 

Message to Bohemia: I've been playing your games for years. As a company who chooses to focus on a very specific niche gamer, consider me to be as big of a supporter as anyone else you could meet. Thousands of hours devoted to your titles, so I don't say this lightly. You have two core game styles that emerge from Multiplayer, which is what honestly drives the popularity of your titles, not the campaign. Your fantastic military gameplay style, which would only need to be polished more responsive for future titles, whether it be ArmA or not, it's very very good being as intricate as it is. The other, Role Play servers. You inadvertantly created something that allowed the players to create the most perfect role play game on this planet. The only issue is that those people are inefficient, lacking development knowledge and core access. You have such a monumental level of potential with what's been made. If you were to make a non-military related civilian role play game, albeit equally weaponized with practical firearms, you would create a polished and perfected base for a very intricate and realistic roleplay experience. Just with ArmA 3 RP Life servers now, you are given the ability to do things that no other game allows you to live out. You need only spend a month in a Life server to see that the game is used in a manner that would overwhelm the gaming world if done in a fully developed way. With the advancements in VR, a Bohemia Realism Role Play game with a VR headset would be unstoppable.

Food for thought. 

I apologize for the negative review, it is purely based on the playability of this game, for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072577531', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1705719970}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066659845', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1524989426}
review:
This is probably not the game for you if you enjoy waiting atleast a year for an update. Stay far away... FAR, away.

Update -

It's now released, so I re-downloaded the game on my new computer - oh wow. First manned scenario, found a bug / glitch which flung me in the air. Got back to the objective, then the scripts failed and reset my progress even though I was at around the 10th checkpoint. Now uninstalling, thanks for waisting 30 minutes of my life trying to get back into this game.

No new content has been added since the electricity update - that was more than a year ago - I want to know what they've been doing for the past year and a half...
probably jerkin da gerkin :/

4/10.

Nice idea, one of the first space / manned exploration games with survival.

Buggy mess, overpriced, learning curve.

review:
Le jeux en lui même est super, quelques petits hic toute fois, comme le scénario survie qui est trés court....

Moi qui suit pas doué avec l'anglais, les mission avec les rover sont un peu compliqué mais bon avec de la bonne volonté on s'en sort, j'attends quand même la sortie d'une MAJ des langues...

Une petite suggestion aussi, y aurait t'il possibilité de faire des rencontre de personne humaine ou IA, une reconnexion de la radio pour communiquer avec la terre, afin de trouver un moyen de rentré ou de développer une annexe terrienne sur mars.

Je le recommande sans problème mais faudrait voir à donner plus de liberté au joueur (capacité a construire un vaisseau pour revenir sur terre ou autre dans le genre, pouvoir rejoindre l'ISS, etc...)

review:
It's really fun to get a mate or two together and build a base, then get up to all kinds of shenanigans with the various rovers. 

My only issue I have with it in its current state is that it crashes VERY easily. I try to play multiplayer with a mate of mine, we get past the ready room and we usually get to about landing stage on mars, then my game crashes. That's my only issue with it. When it worked properly I woulda given it 10/10, but I'm confident Bohemia Interacvtive can make it great again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137924634', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1431543478}
review:
Bought and tried it on Sale...for about 6 months ago... Took a peek now in Steam, and absolutly NOTHING has happend! What a hell did i pay for?!
The "game":
Was VERY confusing at start. Ad's and info, said.. "Come, be a astronaut on Mars and explore!" That did you get?
Playing a engineer in the 1960-70's controling same time "computers", send a probe here and there... wait hours (months in game) for some result (you never understand mening to)... Try build another... wait for months again, nothing happens.
Is it fun? NO! Is it education...? NO! Anyone seen a documentary about space, gets more info in 45 min, then playing this in 2 months...  in real time.
Im not a actiondriven man, i enjoy see things develope. But this is just bizarre.. 
I can't image this EVER gonna be that it promise to be. Since development seems totally stopped.
And the whole idea looks more like a dream someone had, and started, but not have the intrest, means or time to finish.
Dont waste any money on this! Probably its not gonna go anythere. And today, it is useless.

review:
This game looks great, then you actually buy it and it is absolute trash. Great ideas that have never been put into action. In scenarios you don't have to eat or drink for some reason, and there is only one manned mission for the campaign. 

Pros:
Looks good

Cons:
Not many campaign missions for the manned missions
There is no eating or drinking mechanic: (you can do it, but there is no reason to.)
Everything else in the game is trashy except the ideas and the ways building works.

review: Very fun game, even in its early access stage, in it's current stage as of march 23, 2016 it has 2 gamemodes, the manned and probe expeditions, the probe game is fun, but lacks challenge, and my personal favorite is the manned,being a mars astronaut on a barren, hostile planet definitely has its perks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094935797', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 17676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12590, 'last_played': 1644218614}
review:
--For those wanting to just get to a hands on review skip to the secondary section.--

I have been watching and following, and in the past had time to help with hunting bugs and harassing the devs with copy pasted reports since it first came out on early access. Over time I have gotten to see this game grow more and more, thus expanding it's own potential. Take On Mars not only is a simulator, but an educational platform (Hence the wiki data you unlock in the Robotics portion.). With games like this, and Kerbal Space Program, I see a lot of potential for games to bring new challenges and focus to many forms of education in simulation that can even be utilized in classrooms to get kids interested in space exploration, physics, astrobiology, and aeronautics through adaptive and hands on learning.

I know it's been a long time, and yes the due date has been pushed back, and yes there are still bugs that need to be smashed. But in the end, Take On Mars will be a perfect platform for both simulation lovers, and Mars Enthusiasts as the work put into this makes it one of the most unique games currently in beta. Long strides have been made in gaming technology that opens up more intuitive and complex forms of learning and adapting to in game demands through user comprehension and skill. This game needs as much notice and support as possible.

------------------------------------------------Section Two--------------------------------------

Take On Mars is a game based on the research of Mars in understanding what is to be expected for human crews to work with. In the first portion you are able to utilize probes, lander, rovers, and advanced equipment to study the martian surface and gather real world intel based on scientific findings. In chapter two you will take the role of a surviving astronaut who has to survive on the surface through building and maintaining equipment (Chapter2 is still in development.) 

Also there are singleplayer and multiplayer scenarios, along with an editor so that you can build your own scenario and upload it to the workshop. Along with this is the ability to easily mod the game files via the developer toolset if you're into that. This gives grounds so a lot of malleability to the game and what players can do with it. Overall, despite it being unfinished I have to give it a 8/10 for both the improvements, the dev team, and the uniqueness of the game. There are others sure, like Mars: Challenger, which is fun but not one I can honestly recommend. 

All in all, Take On Mars is a gem, and to those wondering if it is worth buying I will say this:

If you don't mind putting in the effort to submit bug reports, push the game mechanics, and test different aspects of the game then yes, buy it and help the developers expand and debug more of it.

If you want something polished off the bat and are not patient or willing to aid in development, then no, and nor should you buy any game on Early Access because that is what it is for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061420558', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3050, 'last_played': 1527317925}
review:
Take On Mars is a great game, but with any game there are many problems with it. The idea and way the devs have done Take On Mars is great but has lacked unlike the main game of bohemia interactivewhich is ARMA 3, doesnt have many Issue like take on mars. here are some of my issue:
-Cant play on a server for more than 2 minuets with out it crashing (i have tryed changeing all my settings but nothing happens)
-Cant delet missions or saves without going thought the game files
-Some mods are a death sentence for take on mars
-The interaction with objects, players, ect (in some cases) dosent work at all.
-No 64 Bit version of the game only 32Bit
-If I move to fast the game will crash for no reasion (vsync issues maybe??)
Here are the positives with Take On Mars:
-Great for simulating what life would be like on Mars
-Great mini Story/Missions with the rover Gameplay
-Great information on mars that has been supported by many different space programs
-With out the Bugs the game would be great and how cheap it is unlike ARMA3 it is great even in the AUS dolla (which is shit thanks to tony abbot <^_^>)

otherwise the game is great worth a buy if you want it in is current state

PS: i would wait till the end of this year of next year to get Take On Mars, Because it has a long way to go before it will close to a finish game

author: {'steamid': '76561198037782407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1458275849}
review:
First off i would like to say..... This game has potential but the mechanics are very sluggish. my character pulls to one side constantly. I die from barely touching a wall. and a lundry list of issues just like that. I understand the whole "make it realistic" thing. BUT, if your trying to tell me that a person getting ready to go into space has issues with just running 20 feet before getting out of breat h and thats "realistic" then i will have to say thats bullshit. 

Give this game a little bit before buying. As of right now id say its not worth it.

review:
Damn, I want my money back. I didn't realize it was a dudebros only club. That's some 1960's antiquated Sci Fi thinking there.

I went on a forum to see about why there isn't a female player option and the few comments I did see were quite matter of factly 'it's a low priority'.  Um.... fuck you? Way to tell half the gaming demographic they're a low priority. 

Heck, I'd volunteer to do the voice acting if that would help, but then they'd lose an excuse. It's not as if the male voice acting is winning any awards.  A passionate volunteer with a quality mic and a pop filter, can easily do about the same.

review:
Ich gebe dem Spiel 9 von 10 möglichen Punkten.

Grafisch ist das spiel sehr gut aufgebaut auch wenn es hier und da noch Verbessert werden kann aber im enteffekt ist das Spiel jetzt schon der Absolute Süchtig macher.

Ich freue mich schon auf kommende Updates und hoffe das es noch weiter verbessert wird.

An alle die meckern: es handelt sich hierbei um ein Early Access spiel und nicht um ein Fertiges Spiel.

Programmiert mal so ein Komplexes spiel, dann reden wir weiter!



An die Dev: Macht weiter so!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961596281', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1451422812}
review:
The idea is a great one but it only lasted in my collection briefly. Why?

Main reason was no matter what settings I used it induced horrendous nausea. No idea why as this isn't something I've had an issue with in the past.

But on to the game itself. Considering just how long this has been out and the developer behind it, it's a buggy mess. Random teleportation, inability to interact, missions competing without you actually doing them in the tutorial...

I'm surprised at how positive the reviews are for this given how many read. Maybe people are more forgiving but I actually want to play my game not feel like I'm just along for the ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134435640', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1793, 'last_played': 1706284301}
review: This game is good but the physics on the elevator in the landing pod need to be fixed. It keeps killing you when you go down. Plus when using the 3D printer at least allow you to be able to print the other parts for the Vehicles. Because when you print a vehicle, only the body comes out. Plus u should add something to the printer to make a holder for the spool of tubing, so the spool don't go everywhere when you unraval it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982607052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 602, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1455212324}
review:
Игра вполне играбельна,но много вы тут не поймёте нужно любить такие игры,приготовтесь к тому,что вас ждёт множество не понятных деталей в игре,и вы  один фиг сразу не поймёте.Я сам не понял,но могу сказать у игры есть большой потенциал,купил игру по скидке сразу 4 штуки .Если готовы мозги подкепяший варш засунуть то игра для вас.

7 из 10 игра заслуживает.Посмотрим что будет дальше!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007389515', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1487021250}
review:
Take on mars is a seriously great game and the type of game which is rare and i'm glad i found
This is a simulation game of both exploration using rover and then 1st persion manned missions
The developers are always active and updates are regular (usually monthly)
There is also a strong workshop community building addons you can download
Gamplay, graphics, sound and content are all really good

I'd recommend this game to anyone who likes simulation and would really like to go to mars one day

author: {'steamid': '76561197991904140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1592603720}
review:
Vraiment bien, une simulation de plus signée Bohémia, du très bon travail. l'immersion est totale, pour les passionnés d'espace, je le conseille fortement. Après il est fortement recommandé de maitriser l'anglais parfaitement pour passer des heures sur ce jeu ce qui n'est pas mon cas malheureusement. Je mets un avis positif car je suis convaincu que c'est mon anglais qui fait default au jeu et non pas sa qualité. Le travail est remarquable. 

Les devs s'il vous plait mettez cette merveille en français !!  P..... D. M..... !

author: {'steamid': '76561197962960086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1474478025}
review:
This game is a few months from its final release and yet it still feels like it's in early alpha. There are a ton of bugs and the game doesn't seem to run smoothly at all. Everything is tedious to do, even exiting the initial lander vehicle is difficult and you will most likely get stuck in the elevator or float in the air the first 3 or 4 times you try to leave.

This game has a lot of potential, but it seems to be very far from fulfilling that potential. Instead it feels like a very primitive sandbox in which you can only move with the speed of a crippled 80 year old man who lost his crutches.

I wouldn't recommend this game, at least not for the next 12 months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002551705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1489522383}
review:
고등학교 축제 때 과학실에 틀어놓으려고 샀습니다. 축제 할 때 즈음엔 정식 출시 되겠지 하면서요.  올해 3학년이 됩니다. 대학교 3학년이요.

원래는 무인 탐사선의 CPU가 되어서 실시간으로 사진찍기, 바위를 레이저로 지지기, 병에 공기 모으기 등의 박진감 넘치는 과학 실험을 하는 게임이었는데 갑자기 우주인이 나오더니 이도저도 아닌 이상한 물건이 되었습니다.

2015년 후반기에 낸다던 게임이 10월 업데이트를 마지막으로 잠수를 타고 있는걸 보면 보헤미아도 부끄러운줄은 아는가 봅니다. 맷 데이먼이 그렇게 홍보를 해 줬는데...

author: {'steamid': '76561197982813655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1458502409}
review:
Крайняя обнова превратила миссии в симулятор близорукого космонавта. Эффект близорукости передан с любовью и глубоким пониманием темы! Так я именно и вижу, без очков. :) Какая то положительная динамика видна. Например меня уже не так пугают ожившие электрические кАбели. До сих пор не могу понять почему 5 секунд бега без скафандра, на земном полигоне приводят к тяжелейшей отдышке, а 10 секунд бега к прединфарктному состоянию у самых тренированных профессионалов в истории чел-ва. Играть уже можно, но я бы подождал. В текущем виде, в русской валюте игра своих денег не стоит ИМХО. 600 рублей - это мой максимум в условиях кризиса и санкций.
 А...да, компанию играть можно конечно. Хотя что там играть??? Какой то глубины и смысла не видно. То ли это временно и могучий замысел и размах Богемов пока не заметен, то ли я их не понял.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971692688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1486778571}
review:
Have you ever wanted to be a truck driver? Or maybe a crane operator? Or a building engineer (janitor)?
Then this is the game for you.

Rather than strictly a survival game, this is a harsh environment (survival) in which you are the driver and manual labor needed to assemble a Martian base of operations.

Many bugs.
Holes to be filled. And they have been at this for more than 2 years.

Bohemia is doing the work with patches being released fairly regularly. There should be no fear of a game that has been in development for a long time. It is a sign of discipline that they do not rush a buggy POS out the door. More as if they have invited us along for the developmental ride.

I look forward to all that I can play with 40 to 400 million miles from home.
(Can you imagine how the data/telemetry transmission delays changing span would just drive you nuts? Half the year Houston is 20 minutes away and the rest of the time more than an hour)

Worst negative thought I have about the game is the price. I see this as a $20 ticket. 

Updates are excruciatingly slow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068210929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1453922352}

if you're planning on getting this game, wait for a few updates. Let the devs optimise it a bit more, fix a few bugs, and you'll be golden

author: {'steamid': '76561198072310130', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 64172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1017, 'playtime_at_review': 12531, 'last_played': 1710386411}
review:
this game is Great! 8 out 10.

WARNING - do not play this game if you like action. There generlly is none unless you make a mistake in which case it can cost you plenty.

When you fire up the single player mode you are given the option of robotics or manned campain.
the robotics campaign is then further broken down into Quick Time or Real Time opions.

for the robitics campain you are tasked with launching probes and exploring Mars. An extensive tech tree alows you to use funds raised by completing objectives to research improved systems and rovers, that allow you to perform more complicated research.
 
Larger missions can raise more cash but it's easy to get into the situatuion where alll your money is riding on one mission, only for a random system failer to cause it to smash into the ground. especially with new tech. Driving around taking photo's and air samples makes up most of the early robotics game play with surface sampling and other tests entering  mid to late campain.

Driving a rover is good fun but it is easy to underestimate the weather and/or terrain effects and end up trailing bits all over the place. When bad weather stikes you can hide behind a rock and just hope that the thing survives. Unlike real operatiors you have the option to swich to other probes at any time.

The Manned campain is still under construction but is a planed to be a series of liked sinarios

pro's -
  Very pretty even at low settings.
  Realistic locations and effects
  Punishing single player campaigns (robotic - and maned)

con's -
  Very SLOW paced.   low gravity enviroments punish rushed actions.
  Robotics campain consists of doing the same thing over and over to raise funds.
  realistic affects can lead to R.U.D. of your probes and rovers. (Rapid Unplaned Disasembaly).

author: {'steamid': '76561198000784141', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 24914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14151, 'last_played': 1691242006}
review:
Great game, a little bit tedius but still good fun and relaxing. The tediuness is because is in early access and all the bugs, problems and item are not be fixed or implemented completely yet! But still is a very good game.
The Primary Campain (Exploration) is complete but is a bit tedius for some players... Nearly everyone I spoke is waiting for the Manned Campain, and that means living on the Moon, Asteroids, in Orbit and Mars! The Tutorial is just ok, but is not fully clear how to do things, so for some players it may be a steap curve learning,

I will raccomend this game for 2 reasons: First the beauty of living in space, orbit or planets, the second is the stunning effect you can see and ability to construct nearly everything you want!

I will not raccomend this game for everyone, because it has no real continuous action, unless it is an scripted event. Let me explain in ditails: You can do almost everything, but the are moments where you cannot do nothing until the resources or event finish or trigger, like if you have set up your base and started the resources, sometimes the only thing you can do is do something that you really not need for the next mission or the one you are doing, like looking for more drops, that you cannot use at the end of a scenario to the next (Unless the devs change that in the final release).

Still is great to see Bohemia Interactive have great ideas for games and have the guts to takle a game like this brilliantly!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968650368', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 79979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6175, 'last_played': 1680505459}
review:
PROS:

SO, Their i was..

I Don't even know how to charectorize this game, simply incredible, and im surprised its not being shown to NASA or Space-x as a sim for space exploration and psychological study of our prime canadites we are sending on the MSL project (Mars Science Lab). This sim is so realistic in every way, from the rad counts and how solar flaires happen, all the way to airlock seals and intricate grid systems, i mean, even the solar panels get more dusty in storms.. This doesn't seem sci-fi at all, but more sim realistic..

the single player campain has a full training system, vehicles, and what not to teach you about the controls of all the diffrent vehicles and what have you. The construction lab where you build your own rover, the tech tree of diffrent teirs to unlock depending on how much funding you got with successful missions, and even the wiki information thats ACCURATE on current findings as you explore the missions.watching the sky crane or landing sequences, or even the total destruction or even partial one that can happen if you really mess something up..You can sample the dirt, drill, take atmospheric readings, its just nothing short of content rich filled exploration.. thats just chapter one...

The multiplayer works as well, and building with friends? theirs nothing like it. They GIVE YOU the engine tools to build models or import them from other graphic programs, the workshop community is vast, and even the scenarios, the scenarios are fun, never the same no matter how you play.

those pictures posted? IS ACTUAL GAMEPLAY. Its that pretty.

CONS:
Being in early access, the lack of dedicated server support, and sometimes the infintile lag on certain maps is horrible, but happens rarely, when I find this happens, you will need to start a new map to get rid of it, but again, this is early access. Their are some random crashes, however those are related to engine problems that are activley being worked on at the time of this writting.The game could use an auto save feature option in it that the user can toggle.

Good job developers, coming from a guy that swore off of early access games, i gave you a shot, and so far your not disappointing. please don't with the official build :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1627682040}
review:
Wanted this for a while, and half hour in - I'm disapointed.

I've not yet landed something on Mars, but I've been building and "testing" probes.

however as far as I can tell the probes are spawning under the ground. I've also got no real data reading to tell me what's going on - what's my altitude for instance? The only way I have any knowledge that I beleive I am underground, is going to the 3rd person free fly camera that's where it starts, miles underground.

Theres the start of a tutorial system but it barely tells me anything useful that I couldn't work out myself, then dumps me without the base knowledge of how I'm actually supposed to be playing the game. Like how do I build a probe? It's pretty unintuitive.

It's a shame I'd love to recommend this - maybe I'll edit my review later - but I'm just finding this too frustrating to recommend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044708188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1542057439}
review:
Truly enjoying this game, only been playing the single player technological missions atm and not the manned missions yet, will update when I get that far.  

The tech missions are all about building probes, rovers, etc to be launched to mars (the moon, asteriods, etc too!) and completing missions for money for research. Things like taking soil samples, pictures, and just generally exploring the area.  You can make it so research takes real time or in game time (which you can speed up).

author: {'steamid': '76561198016883154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1451920845}
review:
Looks very interesting and probably good played with friends but ultimately is too slow paced and dull.

Good:
+ Looks great
+ Really feel alone in space and mars / moon.
+ Will appeal to people who like slow pace simulations like Farming Simulator, Trainz, etc.

Not good:
- Player character perfectly simulates an 80 year old with Alzheimer's. (walks so slow you forget what you're doing.)
- Damn near has a heart attack if jogging more than 50m in the training area
- Stops dead still for 2 seconds after each jump, can't hop around on the moon like the Apollo Astronauts.
- Vehicles so slow they could be out run by a small child on a tricycle. Would be great fun if the vehicles were faster. Drifting on Mars anyone?
- Crafting needs instructions.
- Lack of "enemies" or NPCs make you feel like "what do I do now? what's the point?" after you build your base.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982349556', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1931, 'last_played': 1483811029}
review:
2015 has seen a lot of sandbox games rise and die in just a matter of just a few months, but there may sometimes come a game that defies odds and truly shows potential. Take On Mars is one of them.

Rarely have I seen a game that is quite well polished (has bugs don't get me wrong but it is still early access). It's got a lot of features incl. Multiplayer.  It is packed with features from Mars exploration with probes and custom built rovers... to actual colonisation of the red planet with extensive building options. Survival is a key element of this game with thirst, hunger and general health hindering every move you make. Lot's of vehicles from exploration rovers to forklifters and mobile labs will guarantee hours of fun with friends.

If a game keeps me going for more than 24 hours, then I know there is something special about it. I will keep my eye on this game as it progresses and update the review accordingly.

Update as at 2020
The project was released as an unfinished mess, and proved me wrong unfortunately. Such wasted potential so please do avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102360620', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1572568710}
review:
Pues una vez mas BOHEMIA INTERACTIVE -pone una Pica en Flandes- con este juégazo. 
A los que nos gusta esto del Universo cual es mi caso, deciros que esta realmente bien simulado el tema de las físicas; ¡Y como no! todas sus localizaciones son reales y de un espectáculo natural sin precedentes en la exploración de Marte.
Cojonudo para simular con los colegas y pasar de esta  manera unas horas relajantes y amenas, ya que aunque suene extraño para muchos,  sera lo mas cercano  de estar en Marte; Ese planeta que por hoy parece muerto, pero nada mas lejos de la realidad.
Saben ustedes que hoy por hoy  -no esta en la zona rizitos de oro- definición amena dada por los astronomos, la cual biene a decir zona habitable para el ser humano  -caso de la Tierra- ....Pero como ustedes saben nada es para siempre, y digo esto porque como ya se sabe nuestro Sol esta vivo pero a su vez esta  muriendo... y eso conlleva a que nuestra estrella llamada Sol tiene un tamaño, ese que todos reconocemos cuando miramos a nuestro cielo, pero de nuevo: >>>>Nada mas lejos de la realidad; ¿saben que dicha estrella no deja de crecer?. Esto lo que hará que Marte sera habitable en un futuro, haciendo de Marte un planeta en la -zona ricitos de oro- al contrario de nuestra querida Tierra la cual sera sometidas a temperaturas altísimas llegando inclusive a ser engullida por nuestro Sol, no dejando de esta manera rastro alguno de nuestra civilizaion en dicho planeta...... ¡Ayyyy religiones de las religiones... Opio del pueblo y vida de gobernantes!.

En fin... Compraros este juegazo y ha disfrutar, ya que nuestro Sol esta en el Ecuador de su vida 5.000 millones de años de los 10.000 millones que le toca vivir

author: {'steamid': '76561197969287191', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1576304709}
review:
OMG if you like technical and realistic to a point, this game is for you, TAKE THE TIME TO DO THE TRAINING COARSE , it makes all the difference, very very pretty game, eye watering stuff, I have a GTX 980 and i7 5960 8 core, runs perfect on it, and should, game is not a fast paced shoot em up, but a technical marvel, and really lets you appreciate the efforts humans must go through to do ANYTHING of our planet, 
It has some fantastic missions, the developers have really excelled in this area, using real NASA missions and shaping the missions around such, they have added KAOS, yes MaxWellSmart would be turning in his grave, if he had one, lol, 
Some kaotic events that make the game very interesting, lots of exploration, flying ships and other heavy equiptment, all alot of technical fun.
Definately  recommend this game, much fun exploring stuff, very different in the way this game has been created, a unique look into the world of NASA and its astronaughts and the complexities of space travel.

8 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993396174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 21514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4985, 'last_played': 1546905851}
review: I really can't get enough of this game.  Dram and BI are doing an excellent job crushing bugs and getting some amazing open-world feeling with tons of technically corrrect modules and research and exploration options.  I can't wait to plan a mission from Earth to Mars, and then launch from mars to some other destination.  Really amazing graphics and I love the terrain 9x9km blocks taken from HiRISE data.  Despite some crashes initially, it seems to run well enough now, and the homicidal elevator (elevator?!?) in the massive 4 story capsule being the only thing relegating the game to science fiction status.  The flying vehicle and helo need to be mods since there's no way those would ever be on the surface.  Everything else is pretty much science fact = Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058782180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1529, 'last_played': 1597262997}
review:
Honestly, I haven't played this game enough to give a full review on it, but I'll say what I need to for now. Take On Mars is a (fun) space survival sim that was made by the makers of the Arma series. And I have to say that it's a pretty good game so far. I haven't tried a couple scenarios, I haven't tried the Robotics campaign fully, nor have I even been able to get the time to try out multiplayer. But from what I have done (messing around on Mars Island in a helicopter, floating around in space in orbit around a planet, getting ejected into space via jetpack, etc.) can give me a basic idea that the game is pretty good. It could do with more content with items you can build or do, like more things to do in the vast area of space. With the build system, it can get frustrating when working alone, but become a lot easier with friends.

Honestly.... it's just space, what the heck do you think it would be? Boring? Ok well.... sometimes. Smash some bots in the campaign, fly a heli at Mars Island and crash it like an action movie would. Have fun for Christ's sake! It ain't all about Mars now ain't it? Ya got the Moon, can basically recreate the Neil Armstrong moment. Just get out there on Mars or the Moon and try not to die, either alone or with friends.

review:
The game status does not justified the price. Partial failures in game play disappointing the game feeling. (My opinion, while BETA Status of game) 
In my opinion some of the updates had presented a negative effect on game play instead of a announced fixing.

However it presents a nice and accurate designed Mars surface. 
The Designer are planing a lot of possibilities to interact with Mars and as well with other celestic bodies, but it appears not consequently enough to fulfill all the planed features. 

The performance is sometimes smooth on older computer systems and then worser. My be it depends on my computer.

It like be recommended after a final release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046521363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1613903542}
review:
I'll cut to the chase, If you don't like taking time to do things in game (like 2 or 3 hours to do 1 or 2 tasks) or if you don't have patience, this isn't for you. However, if you're an avid fan of the exploration front of our lives, this might be for you. The pictures and previews of the game aren't excatly accurate, BUT one day will be. And when it is, oh ho ho, man it will be amazing.

Personally, I think this game is amazing. Even in early access there is so much to do and so much excitement to be had in doing it. That being said though, I know there will be alot of people who disagree and straight hate this game. It's easy to understand why though. This game is for those who want to take their time and don't mind taking literally hours to do one little thing.

Now onto the bugs. Of course there are bugs, glitches and pieces of incomplete game, it's Early Access! what do you expect? There was a glitch I came across where (Because I was finishing up for the night and only just started on the scenario) I took off my spacesuit and exposed myself to the vaccume of space on the moon. While I was expecting a rather quick death, there was a noticable delay in the decompression of the small rover airlock (about 5 seconds). During the breath phase I closed the airlock but died. Oh well. They've offered a respawn button for now but I repawned half in the cabin, half in space and almost died again.

During the first scenario on Mars, I noticed there was a hole in the mountain. Now not the regular kind of hole but the one that let's you crouch under and walk inside the mountain. Simple incomplete texture.

While roving on Mars, It took multipul attempts to scan one area while clearly inside the atmospheric scan zone using the correct instuments. 

There are also many parts of the training yet to be finished (which again, Early Access, it was expected).

All in all, This game has one hell of a lot of promise and potential, which I am excited to see released. there will be patches along the way and many MANY additions but I look forward to every single one of them. Sure it's rough around the edges, and I probably sound extremely forgiving for this game, but it's because I can see it will be amazing and fun.

Small area to target but you hit the nail on the head! Absolutely amazing work guys! I look forward to the future of this!

review: Gra jest bardzo dobra mimo tego iż jest to dopiero beta.Posiada ona bardzo dużo misji takich jak wysyłanie sond na marsa,badanie właściwości chemiczne skał itd...Grafika według mnie jest dobra/bardzo dobra,dzwięki dają całkiem niezły klimat gdy zwiedzamy planety.Mimo mojej ktrótkiej gry napotkałem już kilka bugów jak to już gry beta mają ale mam nadzieję że w przyszłości zostaną one naprawione.Gra daje nam również możliwośc scenariusza dzięki czemu możemy swobodnie na kilku rodzajach map robic co się nam podoba bądz robic tam różne misje etc..Gra również posiada tryb multiplayer co otwiera przed nami wiele wiel nowcyh możliwości.Możemy budowac ze znajomymi bazę na marsie,księżycu dzięki czemu gra nie powinna się tak szybko znudzic,pamiętajmy że jest to dopiero wersja beta więc przed nami jeszcze wiele rzeczy zostanie dodanych.Jedynym jak na razie minusem tej gry jest cena,na aktualne możliwości tej gry 20€ to według mnie zbyt dużo.Grę oceniam na 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034265556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 13098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2609, 'last_played': 1500841933}
review:
The developers say this will be released in February, and I have no idea how they think that will be possible. The unmanned portion seems mostly complete, but the manned portion needs at least another year. It's full of bugs and glitches, there is absolutely no tutorial, explanation, or guide anywhere, and it's lacking a lot of immersion. The bugs range from being unable to attach a power cable properly to being flung across the Martian desert because you stood on said cable the wrong way. With no explanation in-game, on the walkthroughs through Steam, or on any forum for the game, every feature is hidden until you stumble across it and major components of the game are difficult to work out. It took me three hours to figure out how to assemble a structure, and I still have no clue what any of the various utilities do. The immersion problem is one they definitely won't fix, though, because they seem pretty happy with what they have: you can hear your astronaut's breath and heartbeat. All the time. Very loudly. Right in your ear. He also can't move any faster than a slow stroll, even on Earth, and can only run ten or twenty meters before getting winded. On the Moon, you would expect to do some cool Moon-style walking like in the NASA videos, but he just casually strolls from one place to another. I got to night-time on Mars (difficult because it's 1:1 timescale and there's no way to advance time, like sleeping or waiting) and expected some sort of awe inspiring view, but it was totally unimpressive. I was more impressed the first time I got a craft into orbit in Kerbal Space Program. I have the graphics all maxed out on a mobile GPU and I get 60 FPS - that means you're not trying hard enough.

From my previous experiences with this developer, I know what to expect: a game with countless flaws that showed promise and is occasionally, for very short periods, brilliant. Arma was like that, Take On Helicopters was like that, and DayZ is like that. They're very ambitious, and that's admirable, but they have no tenacity, patience, or follow-through.

If you get it on sale, like I did, you'll have a fun ten hours or so before deciding to just wait for the full release. But seeing as how they say that'll be in February, I'd say you should wait until the patch/update schedule has slowed a bit, because there should be a lot of them.

review: I can see this game becoming the next great survival game with the manned missions, but due to the lack of content, and a small modding community this game will always be a hidden gem. Overall the best part of the game is the manned missions, and the ability to play mutiplayer. You can build a bases grow food, and explore parts of the Martian surfaces. The maps sizes or decent, and graphics are amazing. I recomend this game if your a space nerd, or if your intrested in the survival aspect of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066252943', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1675167890}
review:
Take On Mars est un must have pour tous les férrus de simulation spatiale.

Le jeu est trés beau et immerssif en plus d'avoir une physique de collision et de destruction tout a fait crédible.
Il jouit d'un mode solo appelé "space program" ou vous prennez la place d'un opérateur de centre spatial, vous devrez développer des technologies, assembler des robots et les envoyer faire de la cartographie ou des analyses de sol, atmosphere ou radiations. Ces missions sont nombreuses et sont véritablement interessantes a faire. On se balade sur Mars et meme si les robots sont souvent lents (faute au réalisme) on se surprend a ne pas voir passer le temps tellement on contemple les paysages de la planete rouge et on s'y croit. Une suite pour le programme spatial est en développement et incorporeras d'aprés ce que j'ai compris les premieres missions humaines sur Mars. (ca vend du reve) 

Coté  Multi joueur c'est la que le jeu pars un peu en cacahuette.

A partir de 3 joueurs sur la meme partie:
Mauvaise optimisation, Désyncronisation totale et permanente, chute de framerate, bug de collisions entrainant bien  souvent la mort et donc la frustration et le pire déconnexion pure et simple des parties.

J'espere sincerement que ce sera réglé dans les prochaines mises a jour. 

Sinon en mode Solo vous avez aussi acces a des missions pour découvrir le Gameplay homme sur mars en mode sandbox en quelque sortes.

Le jeu est parfaitement optimisé pour ce qui est de la partie solo.
Le francais n'est pas encore supporté mais il y'a un excelent guide pour débutter sur le workshop.

En bref un trés bon jeu qui a un énorme potentiel multijoueur mais qui doit l'optimiser .

author: {'steamid': '76561198151608712', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1511531206}
review:
Итак, поиграв в эту игру несколько дней, у меня сложилось общее мнение об этой игре. Это мнение можно назвать положительным, и вот почему:

  Игра сильно затягивает. Есть режим космической программы, в котором вы можете посылать лэндеры, сателлиты и роверы исследовать Марсианскую поверхность и не только(!), открывать предложенное разработчиками технологическое дерево, и просто довольствоваться пустынной, красной и безжизненной поверхностью планеты, названной в честь Бога войны. 
  Этот режим сделан качественно, но с недавнего времени появился новый режим, в котором я зависаю большую часть времени - сценарии. В них вы посылаете командный модуль с людьми, одним из которых вы будете выживать, добывать ресурсы и строить колонию на красной планете.

                                                                                (+)Плюсы(+)

(+)Как я написал ранее, начав играть в игру, вы в неё затягиваетесь, она интересна.
(+)Качественная картинка на средних и более настройках.
(+)Хорошо созданные режимы Исследования и Выживания, у обоих режимов есть огромный потенциал.
(+)Большинство саундтреков приятно слушать, они ещё больше углубляют атмосферу  колонизации, одиночества и неизвестности.

Думаю, на этом все.

                                                                                (-)Минусы(-)

(-)Один из самых существенных минусов, которое следует после затягивания в игру -  надоедание играть в одиночестве в режиме выживания. Есть мультиплеер, но не закрытых паролем игр почти нет, да и игроков там один-два, не больше. Я буду очень благодарен, если разработчики займутся этим вопросом.
(-)Баги, Баги, Баги. Следует отметить, что на момент написания обзора игра была в раннем доступе, поэтому сейчас это несущественный минус. Но, тем не менее, это минус, так как это хоть и немного, но портит игру.

Вот, собственно, и все.)

Вывод:Игра очень специфическая, поэтому может понравиться не всем, но ценителям такого жанра однозначно РЕКОМЕНДУЮ. У игры очень большой потенциал, великие возможности, и светлое будущее. И я искренне верю в то, что разработчики не забьют на эту игру...

(Дорогой читатель, если тебе понравился этот обзор и стиль его написания, не поленись, пожалуйста, поднять палец вверх и наслаждайся этой игрой)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968559405', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1439030420}
review:
Before I purchased this game (before it became early access) there had been talk of VR support (Oculus).  Now we're at the end of the 2nd Oculus dev kit and consumer Oculus is only a few months away. The Take on mars developer has no interest in supporting VR and one of the devs has blamed Oculusvr for this: "Originally posted by Dram:
Hey guys, I am unsure at this point about Vive, but the Oculus will certainly not be supported. Since the newest 0.6 drivers they removed DirectX 9 support. TKOM runs on DX9, which means we're out of luck.

Just to clarify, they needed to make the move to better support direct to Rift mode, so I perfectly understand their move as being unavoidable. Pity though :)"  << The question is why a game still in development is using the outdated DX9 engine? DX11 has been around for a long time and we now have DX12.  I would say the problem isn't that oculus implemented direct-mode only but that Bohemia are developing their games on the outdated DX9 API.

VR aside... the game as it stands is pretty dull.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057143458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1522680583}
review:
It really pains me to write a negative review of this game. The visuals are stunning, and it has the potiential to be a great game. Unfortunately, at this point in time, its not. Its full of annoying bugs.
I've just spent the last hour playing the single player story line, started researching more advanced probes....then the game crashes, and its corrupted the entire save...gone. Won't be starting it again.

The "base building" is so difficult to control in the scenario mode that I gave up and didn't bother any further. Its such a convoluted control system, and the parts are very hard to get aligned at just the right angle for them to snap together. This issue pretty much extends to the entirely of the control interaction within the game.

In the early access version, over 75% of the tutorial videos are not accessable. This leaves the player to flounder around,and try to figure out what to do, and how. Surely, this is a rooky error?? Tutorial videos are there for a reason, so not having them is very counter productive.

If all the issues were sorted out, it would be a very good game, but at this point, I think its £15 I would have rather spent on something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000892258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1445995319}
review: This game was listed as a MMO but the actual only MMO capability is if you do a LAN or I guess Internet based game and invite people which is NOT the same thing as a MMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041292639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1523018201}
review:
Немного посмотрев обзоры в ютюбе, разобрался с управлением, с инглишом особых проблем не возникло все интуитивно понятно, ну более или менее. 

Итак, режим спейс програм, вот что за концепция игры в конечном итоге получилась;
1 Летаете вы исключительно на определенные локации на Марсе и не только.
2 Выполняете задачи в миссиях на этих локациях.
3 Получаете финансирование за выполнение миссий, открываете новые локации и миссии более сложные и тд.
4 Финансы распределяете на научные открытия и на запуск ваших зондов, роверов итд.
5 Научные открытия в виде древа, выбираете нужный эффект и смотрите какие научные исследования нужно проплатить, какие то пересекаются, можно одним исследованием открыть кучу предметов если под них другие исследования завершены.

Проходить игру достаточно интересно, но если кто то ждет от этой игры драйва и экшена, то вам не сюда, здесь нужно думать, расчитывать, прикидывать ну тд ( ну пару аппаратов расколошматить можно, ради прикола, не дорогих естественно)

Подводный камень; в лабаратории при выходе из зоны тестирования игра частенько вылетает, поэтому спроэктировали аппарат, сохранились и сразу запускаете на марс, если что не так загрузить сейв не долго. (надеюсь разрабы поправят скоро). 
Есть такие баги (реже конечно но) как проваливание под землю при загрузке, так же встречается зависание опять таки при загруке, поэтому "контральтделит" и "сейф" по чаще вам в помощь! Иными словами Early "asses" дает о себе знать!

Обзор оказался информативным? даже если нет все равно жми ДА, на всякий случай вдруг пригодится!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070709528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2819, 'last_played': 1575732960}
review:
Хороший симулятор. Отличная графика. Много возможностей как в иследованиях так и в колонизации. Жирный минус всей этой красоты много не доделок.

Роверы могут работать без электричества, очень расстроился когда он поехал дальше с нулевым зарядом:) Дальше играть не стал. Теряется сразу весь смысл сборки, на ставил и солнечных батарей и химических аккумуляторов. А итог? Всё это ни к чему:) 

Строительство базы и так называемая колонизация марса и луны с астероидом очень заинтересовала. Весь день на пролет просидел у монитора:) Ну и тут не без приключений. Соединение с сервером оставляет желать лучшего, если сам создал то играешь, если подключился, то пол минуты пытаешься взять какой нибудь предмет, ещё пол минуты пытаешься его положить:) Потом вся эта затея благополучно вылетает и можешь пробовать подключатся по новой. Астронавт иногда бегает сам:) Бежишь, отпускаешь кнопу, а он дальше бежит :)Очень увлекательный процесс.
Выпрыгивает из транспорта, хорошо если в костюме:) Если оставил костюм на зарядке пиши пропало:) Будешь дохнуть каждое появление.
Двери вообще чудо природы:) Похоже у них есть характер, проснулась дверь в плохом настроение и в комнате возле нее нет воздуха, заходишь в базу, есть воздух, снимаешь костюм, есть воздух, вешаешь его на зарядку, всё хорошо:) Открываешь дверь из воздушного канала в саму базу и оооо боже:) где я повешал свой костюм:)
Самое интересное:) Базу только построил, все лики убрал ни где ни чего не пропускает а двери уже качают воздух во внутрь:) От куда они ее берут??? Наверное от туда же от куда и ровер энергию:)
Очень хотелось бы чтоб всё это работала более реалестично, построил базу, подцепил к ней балон с воздухом или установку какую внутри построить, ресурсами загрузить и пускай себе воздух вырабатывает. Нет ресурсов, нет воздуха.
 Ресурсы очень важный продукт:) Только куда их толкать так и не понял. Максиму что нужно это почва и вода, чтобы картофанчик рос. Картофанчик на удивление растет быстро, а кушать хочется похоже раз в неделю:) Ну а что Вы хотели? Марс- там всё по другому:)
Поставил кроватку возле окна решил вздремнуть, проснулся на улице:) и опять же без скафандра:) Пока спал, другие астронавты высадились не заметно, тихонечко зашли на базу и вынесли кровать со спящим наружу:) Прикол такоё Марсианский:) Ну так чтобы не скучно было:) Пару раз задохнулся конечно, потом вспомнил, что костюм теперь не вешаю на зарядку а просто снимаю и оставляю в инвентаре:) 

Принтер 3D:) Принтер штука прикольная:) Делает все что захочешь и ни чего за это не просит. Домой бы такой, или на стройку работягам.Цены бы ему не было:) Вот те ресурсы каторые добываются туда точно нужны, но пока не доработанно. Всё можно построить на халяву и главное быстро:) Буквально за пару секунд. База строится очень быстро, особенно если в двоем. Но только один детали по пол минуты поднимает или тупо крутиться во круг себя:) а другой весь в работе:)

Не понятно что творится в сценариях с....... как бы их обозвать.... с станками которые добывают ресурсы.
Начал играть на луне, ни чего не работает, кабеля не подключаются, к бочкам не подключаются маленькие бочки.
Приходиться всё это добро вытаскивать из почвы лунной, да и на марсе такое было. Складывать в одну кучу как хлам не нужный и уже на старом добром, щедром копире делать всё что нужно и тогда всё подключается работает и добывает:)
Солнечные панели со временем заносит песком и их нужно чистить, очень понравилось:) При низкой температуре астронавт мерзнет и получилост один раз отморозить ноги, а потом и руки.:) Очень реалистично:) Пришлось греться в ровере и лечится на кроватке. Большой ровер тоже интересным образом заряжается и черпает воздух из ни откуда:)
Техника хоть и не живая тоже должна питаться. Где то видел на видео, у ребят была выдвинута стрела. В самом ровере ни каког пульта не нашёл, на крышу ещё не залазил.
Как он залазиет на возвышенности:) Очень понравилось как сделано, сначала одной коленкой, потом другой потом встаёт, а не тупо запрыгиваетшь куда надо и бежишь дальше сломя башку:) Голова очень интересная:) По крайней мере тени от нее точно нет:)
Функционал костюма на отлично, хочешь не много увеличь зрение, хочешь специальным увеличителем добавь по максимуму. В общем игра очень понравилась не считая всех косяков. С нетерпением буду ждать новых обновлений и исправлений.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040567293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1382934592}
review:
Like Dayz.... great idea but it seems the devs lose interest in the game and leave it in pre alpha for years and years with no real progress. I am losing faith in BI and will never buy anything in early access from them ever again.

That said it is not really my job to judge the company itself but the product that they deliver. The product is just not good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027368659', 'num_games_owned': 2422, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1456547059}
review:
Disclaimer: It's been a long while since I last played it, and people are saying it's basically broken now. I stand by what I said when I played it I think it was a fine game. I don't know about its current status, tho.

I don't think there's a better alternative for a "Mars simulator" out there. If you're into the trend of Mars-related sci-fi with more sci than fi, this is the game for you.

Not really the finished product, although I haven't played since the game left E.A. At any rate, stay away if you really hate bugs and glitches, and unfinished packages in general; but it already has great content, imo.

They keep updating every now and then, which is both necessary and welcome. I really hope they keep working on it and, over time, it could potentially become THE Mars Sim we all want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110268059', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1450899777}
review: I do like this game quite a bit, but it has some issues. It runs like molasses on my 2 year old computer. It has decent specs and can run quite a bit, but this game just overwhelms it. In terms of gameplay it is quite fun, and realistic, but also very slow. I know that real missions are quite long and arduous, but the game shouldn't be (in my opinion). Other than that, if you like space and have a pretty good computer you should check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042175608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1670043950}
review:
I would not recommend this game yet, it has a long way to go. 
I am a big fan of open world creative games and this looked amazing but after playing it, it really gets frustrating. 
The big thing that takes away the fun is the building, I mean thats sort of a big part of open world creative games right? Building in this game is slow and I dont mean minivan slow we are talking rascle scooter up hill with a 500 pound person slow. you want to build a base, cool, go ahead, but it will take you years, you build it 1 block at a time and you can create 1 block at a time on your 3D printer, yes you can make several 3D printers to speed things up, but each makes 1 block at a time and it takes from 30 seconds to 5 minutes each create the blocks. Now lets say the base you want to make has a simple 1000 blocks, after some math you will realize you are better off building your own mars mission in your back yard with sticks. Once you have the block you want then the "fun" part of trying to get it to line up where you want it. People that say its not that bad, true there are worse games, but if you think its not that bad, walk across the room in thbe starter mission without sufficating, go ahead, I'll wait. THats a bug thats still there how long after early access relese?

author: {'steamid': '76561198022000101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5311, 'last_played': 1693318278}
review: This game has been in the development stage for years now. Much content is still incomplete. Game crashes often once you get to the point where the game becomes interesting. Then you can't load save games either. Developers must be working on this part time. Has great potential but fails miserably. I won't buy another of their games. Great graphics though. So sad!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989114826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 21432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20019, 'last_played': 1569267784}
review:
Tja Jahre später bewerte ich das Spiel neu, lasse jedoch die alte Bewertung beigefügt. Nun das Spiel ist geil! Gefällt mir sehr gut durch sein hohes Maß an realismus. Hab kein anderes Spiel in der Form derzeit gesehen. Wenn man das Spiel auf die Beta umstellt erhält man auch weiterhin updates. Diese sind nach wie vor nötig, da noch essentielle Dinge fehlen. Weitere Senarios sind nett, jedoch nicht so wichtig wie fehlenden Inhalt nachzupatchen.
Wie man an meinen Spielstunden sehen kann, empfehle ich das Spiel. Würd mich freuen, wenn die Community weiter wächst und das Spiel mit etwas mehr Tempo weiterentwickelt wird. Es hat es nämlich wirklich verdient.




Alte Bewertung :Das Spiel hat Potenzial, jedoch geht die Entwicklung einfach nicht weiter. 
Sehr enttäuschend da der ganze Entwicklungsprozess nun schon Jahre dauert und wenn dann nur lächerlich kleine Neuerungen kommen. 
Das bereits vorhandene gefällt mir gut. Empfehle es dennoch nicht zum Kauf! Sollte das Spiel doch einmal fertig gestellt werden, so wird es doch dann vermutlich weit hinter seinen Fähigkeiten bleiben, da anscheinend kein Interesse besteht dieses Spiel vorranzutreiben. Sehr schade:(

author: {'steamid': '76561198023693385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5618, 'last_played': 1524831293}
review:
I'm a fan of the survival genre. I'm a fan of the science-fiction genre. Put those two together and you get Take on Mars.

While not completely finished, as denotes it's Beta Build, it is on it's way to becoming a remarkably accurate simulator (with obvious gameplay exceptions) of survival on Mars.

That being said... it does suffer similar problems to most Open World Sandbox games of the same ilk at the moment. Notably the 'nothing to do but survive' problem. At least in most scenarios. Take On Mars, however, seems to address this problem with the Scenario / Scenario Editor... you can utilise triggers, events, etc. to create a story arc style of play. From landing, base building, to extraction should you want it, and thus solve the major issues of the survive to survive most survival genre titles have.

What strikes me most about this game in either the Single or Multiplayer, is the emptiness. Some put it down as a Con, I put it down as a Pro... Mars is empty. There is very little to do there in reality, and this is refelcted somewhat by gameplay. However, the inclusion of science experiments, sampling, and more would add greatly to the overall experience. 

You can 'fake' science with the previously mentioned Scenario Triggers, but this pales in comparison to what the developers could possibly do in terms of story arc.

Single Player - The Single Player Gameplay starts with what could be considered a 'modern space age' where you send probes, landers and rovers to Mars, Deimos, and even the Asteroid Belt. After 'completing' this portion of the campaign gathering all the outlined data under objectives, you are ready to launch your manned mission.

I don't want to spoil the storyline of this mission arc, but Mark Watney move over, there's a new King of Mars. And it is story driven, though limited in scope. Starting in one area, and moving to another. With no option to alter which starting area, nor where you head to.

If you're looking for a completely free-roam Open World Sandbox game, this one is not for you. If you're looking for a game that throws enough realism in your face to be accounted a 'true' survival game then this is the one for you.

The team seems dedicated to keeping updates flowing, and they do address problems with the product as they can.

The game has been in Early Access for a while, but this doesn't phase me in the slightest. Years in development is basically any title that has something unique about it, or needs to be built in a different way from previous titles. Comparing development times of a game like this to games such as Battlefield or Call of Duty wastes time, and mental energy. Building onto previously formulae (Battlefield, Call of Duty, <insert other franchise here>) will always be faster, easier, and more efficient than creating something new, and I prefer the effectiveness of Take On Mars to the fast development that would see it be a reskin of another title.

In conclusion, the game does have bugs, and some of its elements lack polish, but if the development team continues the way they are going it may well show a new way to experience survival that actually throws whatever it can at you to make you fail, without big green aliens, zombies, or other post apocalyptic horrors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083497075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1491718659}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996968764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1550127991}
review:
At this point, I cannot really recommend this game.

It started out as a Mars Rover/Probe game which is currently all you do in the campaign part of the game. It's mostly complete with some missing features such as science results, I think the rovers still never actually run out of power and last I played it, it was still confusing as to what type of science a POI actually wants you to do. The biggest problem is the amount of time it takes for a rover to get anywhere. Obviously the rovers are slow, but there's no auto navigation and while you can trick the rover into driving forward without having to press a button constantly, you have to keep correcting as the rover will constantly veer off course.

The second part of the game, where the focus seems to have shifted entirely is the manned section, which is very interesting in theory, but falls short in terms of actual gameplay. Everything you do as a Mars colonist is very buggy and clunky with physics going haywire at the slightest provocation. For example, I managed to take out a bulkhead out of the large vehicle when trying to open a door, decompressing myself in the process. This is in part due to the UI being tied to game objects, which require precise clicking and even though you can change from interaction with the center of screen dot and cursor you can move independantly of the view, the UI is inconsistent about which input it will accept.

Another issue I have with object interaction is handling basically anything - you pick up an object and when it's in your hands, you can control how far from your body you hold it by scrolling the mouse wheel, the rotate it with one key and rotate it in a different way by pressing a modifier button in addition to the rotation button. Most objects won't connect with another object unless they're position in a particular way and when you add the weird handling of objects, pile it on top of the physics you will probably watch the resource container you've been fiddling with fly off into the distant martian landscape.

Content is being added but I'm not even interested in trying it out any more because the underlying issues persist and it seems backwards to add interesting things without having a stable framework that would allow you to have fun with all the elements present. The game is supposed to be nearing the end of its development cycle and I don't see it changing much in ways that would make it fun to actually play.

In short the game has many interesting elements that are combined with clunky, buggy gameplay, making a potentially fun and interesting experience dull and annoying.

review:
*Very good game, if you like science and space buy it !*


Vous devrez mener la conquête de Mars de A à Z

Ce jeu est un projet avec une ambition énorme on se demande même si cela peut aboutir rapidement ou si c'est un projet au long cours qui restera évolutif et ouvert de longs mois.

C'est plus une simulation scientifique qu'un jeu en tout cas pour la partie programme spatial mais les scénarios et le mode multijoueurs sont bien plus ludiques à la manière "Space Engineers" même si on ne sait pas toujours par quel bout les prendre.


Les graphismes et les sons sont très convainquants l'ambiance aussi ce jeu est la fois déroutant et stupéfiant ce qui peut ne pas plaire à tout le monde mais le prix est pour l'instant très raisonnabe. Si vous aimez la science et l'espace acheter le les yeux fermés.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993500303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 3860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3189, 'last_played': 1515974223}
review:
I still can't recommend this game. Most of the problems I mentioned back in 2015 still exist in 2017, and as it's now been released, the "it's still early access" excuse doesn't apply.

The only thing I can think is the person with the purse strings said enough is enough and forced a release date regardless of the state of the game.

If you enjoyed the book "The Martian" then I'd keep an eye on this game, it might yet still blossom. At the moment though the space program part is as boring, tedious, buggy and unpolished as it was 18 months ago, and the manned part is so buggy I've not been able to get past the 4th mission. At one point my character teleported outside the truck from the driving seat and of course suffocated.

The final straw was when your character "sleeps" time doesn't pass, so of course trying to complete the missions in a world of bugs is not helped by pitch darkness, blurry vision beyond 20 feet, and comical physics.

A definate no, and given that the game is now "released" I'm unsure as to whether that will change.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Early Access Review - October 2015

I can't recommend this game at the moment. It's not what it says on the tin.

I bought it having looked at the screenshots, watched the videos, and read the reviews thinking it was a base building/ mars colonisation game. It's not at all.

The main campaign of the game is just sending probes to mars, which involves pick a location, then watch the probe land, then depending on the mission you click "Capture" to either take a photo or take a sample of some gas. After a couple of hours you can make a more complicated probe that requires you to press one or two other buttons.

Eventually you'll get a rover, which is just a tedious experience. In my experience it always ends up hundreds of meters from my target, which then means I have to remote drive it to the location. It travels so slowly that it can take 15 minutes just pressing the forward key to reach your destination. Sometimes your rover runs out of power so you have to wait for it to recharge from it's solar cells. This takes around 15-20 minutes, and you can't skip time, so this is a good time to make coffee and maybe have a sandwich, perhaps have a tidy up of the house.

There are some single mission "screnarios" that have astronauts in them, but having played them that component of the game seems pre-alpha. It is very clumsy and unpolished. Arms and legs clip through walls, nothing has tooltips so you don't know what is interactable and what isn't, an issue compounded by the fact there are no tutorials. The UI on the 3D printer made me laugh out loud, there is no UI, just a list of things you can make in no particular order.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144739700', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1599771059}
review:
Take on Mars is a game where you try to colonize Mars (like NASA). If you want to have a lot of fun for hours on end, you should buy this game! It also supports the steam workshop so you can get a bunch of mods and see your game crash :). I have played 20.0 hours of this game by the time of this review and I dont see an end anywhere near!

PROS:
+Awesome Graphics
+Good sound design
+You feel really loneley
+Multiplayer
+Awesome HUD
+Vehicles
+Base building

CONS:
-You need a decent/good PC
-Really Buggy

10/10 - A must have for every space fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996633876', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 370, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1435412725}
review:
It's... um... really just what you expect. Buy probes, send probes, buy probes, send probes, buy probes, send probes...

There's nothing wrong with that, per se. It's just...

You know when someone says something to your face, and you laugh aloud, and go, 'Haha, that's hilarious, classic!' and then the person just look at you, confused, because you just don't get that this person is not kidding around and you just feel a bit stupid?

Yeah, that's this game.

It's Mars exploration. Nothing more, and nothing less.

review: Игра очень понравилась, увидел её давно но, даже в сыром выде я был приятно удивлён о чём она. Она в единственном своём роде. Не так давно решил купить её еще в раннем доступе. Не пожалел. Отличная атмосфера игры придаёт реальность происходящего. Приятно было видеть новые добавления и изменения от разработчиков. Во время выполнения игры, разве что, не хватает карты, что бы можно было при её открытии просмотреть расположение модуля или передвижения марсохода. В целом всё отлично. Игре нужно хорошее железо. Иначе не поиграете.
