review:
Take on Mars is a game where you try to be the pioneer of colonize Mars; but first you need to pass trough a Space Program Campaign. If you want to have a lot of fun hours you should buy this game: Campaign, survival, build, online multiplayer and so. I have played 18.4 hours this game the last month and I going to keep playing for a long while.

Take on Mars es un increible juego donde el objetivo principal es ser el pionero en colonizar Marte; para esto tendras que iniciar conociendo el planeta con sondas, satelites e incluso podras utilizar el Curiosity !Geniial!: todo esto en Campaña de Programa Espacial o podras probar las diferentes caracteristicas del juego en modo ecenario, al final el juego resulta muy entretenido.
Se trata de explorar, construir y sobrevivir, muy recomendado. (Con respecto al precio es barato para lo que te entrega este titulo.)

review: This game is hard to get into, as it is not very intutive and there is very little out there as far as lets plays and reddit posts are concerned. The game play is slow, challenging and unforgiving. But after taking the time to learn it, mainly thru trial and error, I have grown to love it. I suppose if you are looking for an expirence that takes little involvement, and requires more twitch than common sense there are many many games out there, but this one wont be for you. However, if you like a challenging and rewarding experience than you can do far worse and I would recommend this game.

review: Now of course, this game is in early access, Which, I do understand. Things will be a bit buggy, but this game was full of bugs I encountered, as well as actually getting the hang of the game, which I still didn't after 2 hours. Sure, I played with some people but when I played with them, I felt absolutely useless because it was impossible to understand how to actually play, Now for the bugs. OK so, this game was a waste of money, in my opinion. For bugs: When I was joining a server, I clipped out of the lobby thing somehow(WTF?) and then when I actually got to the map, I was trying to help, and the game got so laggy. And then, while I was printing something I got stuck so that I couldn't move. After wasting 30 minutes, I just decided to leave. Of course, in some peoples eyes, this game will be fun, but not in my eyes. I will gladly change my review later on if the game gets better. But yes, I understand that this is in early access, but early access will not change my point of view on the game. They decided early access, I decided thumbs down. Thank you, have a nice day devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104089191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 7088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1823, 'last_played': 1551009720}
review:
I ve had this since it first released on STEAM, but only got around to really messing with it lately.  Back at its first release it was really nothing but send probes to MARS and try to get money to send Rovers to Mars so you could drive them around. 
NOW. You can play it out in a campaign and work your way from probes to manned missions. Or you can play in manned mode right away. The game includes an editor to create your own mission, scenario's, add-ons and play how where you want.. from Earth to the Moon, to Asterdoids to Mars to other..
Currently you only need to worry about providing a food source and water for your astronaut. But you will see quickly that on mars or any location with any amount of moisture in the soil or air its pretty easily done. Although they need to keep their habitat pressurized, failure to do so has no affect such as sucking you and your O2 out the hole or door.. you just choke to death.  Building is not an issue as your not required to have resources, only a 3d printer included in your mission. 
SO. Its fun, and the vehicles are really a neat thing to mess with. BUT It has a long way to go yet. I say its going to be a great simulator of space, but not yet. At this time if its on sale grab it if you like astronauts and space, it will keep you busy, but otherwise its kind of like Stranded Deep in space. Once you mess with it a bit thats it... Unless you take the real time campaign mode ( minus the days of flight to Mars ) and play it for a while to. 
BTW.. Meat and potatoes are you friend in this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158009593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 8893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7735, 'last_played': 1491587141}
review:
This simulation is outstanding. Unmanned (land + space) and manned sim, all in one.

I'm outraged at some negative reviews written by people with 3 hours of game on record. Early access means opportunity to improve the game before final release, so use it, instead of bitching about it. Intellectual dishonesty is despicable, as is insulting the obvious hard work behind this project. And no, I-m not paid by anyone.

The scientifc depth, the attention to realism, the gameplay, the graphics, everything testifies of the skills of the developing team, and their commitment to an ambitious and fascinating project. Kudos to them, also for their responsiveness to the community.

I am about to finish the space program, therefore haven't nearly explored the whole scope of the game, not even tried the manned or survival part of it. But I can already confidently say that even only with what I have seen now, this is well worth the money. The BETA is stable. And it has the potential to be, simply, a masterpiece. If a number of recommendations and ideas as presented by the community will be integrated in the final development the game, it can IMHO attain a level of unprecedented excellence.

Of course, this is not for adrenaline junkies. I process my mails, watch the news, and even manage some substantive discussion with my wife, while playing this (...). 

But if you are into realistic space exploration, astrophysics, astronautics, (space) engineering, then do yourself a favor and support this project. Devs, don't give up. I know people want space zombies and stuff, but I-m not the only one enjoying and appreciating the scientific (and fun) dimension of your project.

Building my first large rover, landing it, navigating it through Martian terrain, and proceeding with a successful series of scientific tasks... that was freaking good.

The Zero-gravity probe is great fun too. Here too, the experience is very immersive, the wannabe astronaut in me has a hard-on when navigating the asteroid belt and getting, after a careful approach (prepare to see your vehicle shattered by debris, or crashed by your recklessness), to scoop dirt and more, while zooming out in the big black space.  

Highly, highly recommended.

Current games: Silent Hunter 5 (heavily modded...), Verdun, and now ... Take on Mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098260725', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1513964629}
review: I am a huge space fan, i love the moon landing and the prospect of the mars landing, so i would highly recommend this to anyone who shares my love. However, it is still in beta so there are a few unfinished things. Unless you are really into space, or just wnat to check it out, i would vist this later on in the development when there is more content and a more bug free game. But otherwise its GREAT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971285241', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13821, 'last_played': 1676956994}
review:
I wasn't expecting this game to be as fun as it was. Roving around Mars may sound fun for the first 30 minutes or so but the additional details they add to the game like building a field base or collecting data from areas of interest or visiting Deimos and the asteroid add a lot to the experience, 232 hour's worth in my case. I especially liked the space program and I think it has a lot of potential to be even better once Beta is finished. Even the scientifically accurate reports when completing tasks was fun to collect.
Good game keep at it BI.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983046341', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1591005964}
review:
I wanted to love this game/simulation so very much, but unfortunatelly, this has been stuck in endless Early Access for far too long. Initially, the development team seems to have been taking their sweet time doing tiny updates to this title. After a year or so wasted, the development did pick up. However, lately, it's back into constant-postpone mode. The release date is actually no longer even specified and just says "at some point in 2015", even though not that long ago it was set to "june 2015". 
The game itself is quite fun and relaxing, you explore the surface of Mars, using vaguely realistic and progresively more modern technology. Over the course of development, other bodies were added and a manned program is now also available as a "cherry on top". 
However, bugs are a plenty, and the neverending development hell is what makes this not recomended to anyone, but the biggest fan. Once it's released and fixed up, it'll be an excellent title, worth the recomendation, however, in it's current state, such release is no longer even guaranteed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120483839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1981, 'last_played': 1471613944}
review:
NEW REVIEW. 
Since I wanted this review to help anybody to take the decision if they should buy this game, I rewrote it in order to make it a better one thats worth reading. I only hope that my review helps you to make the right decision.

Well, to start with, the game will be loved by every fan of space exploration games. In this game you take the role of Mars colonization program and you basically do the following:
1.Choose how to spend the money you have by funding your scientist to find new technologies that are used to upgrade your equipment and by doing so, you slowly reach the point of being able to send humans on the red planet.
2.You control your landers, rovers, spacecrafts and later even humans. This is more or less what you do. Controlling machines so as to finish tasks and later humans in order to survive and explore Mars

Now about what it feels playing the game. If you seek action and adventure leave. If you seek to reach your adrenaline levels to the top leave. You won't like this game. But if you seek a calm lonely drive ithrough the Martians plains, then you are in the right place. If you don't like long rides from on side of a crater to the other just to collect and analyse some sand, this game is not for you.
I don't want to waste any more of your time so I will sum up. This is a game about space exploration fans, that would like to see how it is to explore for many hours Mars, and help mankind to achieve its next big step, colonising for the first time a planet. I don't want to spoil you any more of its content, so I will stop here.

I'm sorry for any mistakes I made, I am not a native speaker but I tried my best. If you think that my review is incomplete or false you are free to correct me down in the comments, and I would be really happy to correct any possible mistakes I have made.


I will tell you one more thing: 
If this game was a woman I would marry her. And instead of a dog we would have a rover pet. On Mars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118281616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1439859218}
review: Ill be honest. This game has some serious potential, good developers, good concept, BUT, it is nearly impossible to get into. Sure, if you spent all day and looked at dozens of guides and tutorials, practiced, and dedicated your entire day to learning it, maybe it would make more sense. But for a dumby like me who just wants to chill and play a game in my spare time, its difficult to really play this game for more than 10 minutes without getting a headache. It might be a good game, but reviews are about whether or not I would reccomend it, and I would not. If you want a mars game similar to this, I would reccomend Sol 0. Its not first person, but it is still very interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068697866', 'num_games_owned': 1477, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1439905003}
review:
Il gioco è stupendo se si è appassionati del tema spaziale, grafica molto dettagliata, molto bella l'idea di poter creare il proprio rover per le missioni.
L'unica grossa pecca per un gioco cosi complesso e articolato la mancanza della lingua italiana può essere molto snervante e rovinare il gameplay a chi non lo mastica bene, sopratutto perche le risorse del gioco sono limitate e sbagliare ad applicare modifiche al rover perche non si e riusciti a "capire" cosa sia quel determinato potenziamento  e molto noioso

Consiglio il gioco a tutti coloro che cercano un gestionale complesso elaborato e che permatta di simulare il "lavoro" in una base di lancio e gestione missioni spaziali...

author: {'steamid': '76561198008299910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1434338673}
review:
I am a big space nerd, particularly love Kerbal, and just couldnt get into this game.

Being a person on Mars seems like it is end game.

I played up the the point where you have to drive unmanned rovers around on the surface and I just couldnt take it - they are SO SLOW, and if you miss a point you were supposed to sample or photograph having to drive back pretty much doubles the torture.

To be clear, the game looks great, acts great and would be great for a more patient person.

If this changes with an update, someone please let me know!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202044422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5340, 'last_played': 1689481846}
review:
As a 13 year old space geek I can definitly say that this is the game a lot of people like me can love.

Yes the game is glichy, and yes its not complete, but the thing that makes this game what is it is, is the concept. See I love KSP, but I'm really into mars rovers and manned missions to Mars. 

I got this game when it first came out on my dads's laptop but had to delete it later. However, I got it agin before Beta release. The thing about the game in the space program is that I can get a look at what real rover operaters do. Now I know that the rovers part is really unrealistic, but it sparked my "Curiosity" and made me want to become an rover operator at NASA.

The manned part of the game is, well its just awsome! I once wanted to be the first human on Mars, but after finding out that its not a return trip, I gave up on that dream(I stillwant to work at NASA or be an astronaut). But Take on Mars Is like a taste of what the real missions might look like. I love just plying around with the manned section and the editor, but what really gets me is the experiance this game gives me. 

Another thing is that games like this are not common and so they are really awsome when someone does make them. 

Also, Devs, you are amazing. this game is amazing, the community is amazing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979722517', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 2341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2025, 'last_played': 1603534591}
review:
If you're interested in playing multiplayer as I was then you best think again about purchasing this, the multiplayer it's the most UNOPTIMIZED GARBAGE I've ever had the misfortune of attempting to play, unless you're playing over LAN or you have a very fast connection speed (upload speed in particular) you will get crazy amounts of lag that make it unplayable.
I'd understand this if it was still in early access but to release it like this completely unacceptable, they might as well remove the multiplayer it's so bad, they've been promising to fix it for over a year, yet not a single thing has been done to improve it, they're either incompetent or just plain lazy.
If you have any interest in MP do not buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046618409', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1699199862}
review:
Questo è uno di quei giochi che o piace tanto ed intriga, oppure non picae per nulla. Se siete degli amanti dell'esplorazione dello spazio(SP) e della colonizzazione di altri pianeti (MP) e avete voglia di imparare da soli come funziona il gioco (per ora che è in alpha mancacon i tutorial) allora avete trovato il simulatore che fa per voi. Se invece cercate azione e un gioco semplice allora pote anche uscire da questa pagina del negozio.

Le possibilità di espansione di questo gioco sono infinite, sia come possibili DLC (per esempio l'esplorazione del pianeta kepler 452b) sia come MOD, infatti pur essendo in alpha fornisce i mod tool e sono già presenti molte mod, che aggiungono sia oggeti per il multiplayer che pianeti e satelliti (lune) per il singleplayer.

Io ovviamente lo consiglio perchè appassionato di questo genere, ma la vostra decisione deve essere presa considerando i vostri gusti, se proprio siete indecisi provatelo e poi al massimo restituitelo ora che steam offre questa possibilità.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017066921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 46206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8352, 'last_played': 1671990753}
review:
Bueno, sigue pareciendome un simulador muy bueno ya que no existe en el mercado uno de las mismas caracteristicas que este.
Pero no lo recomiendo y menos al precio que lo estan ofertando. Es un juego que su ultima actualizacion es del 2017. Ha llovido. 
Si se le hubiera aplicado un servidor global mundo abierto y poder trabajar codo con codo con otros jugadores en la supervivencia y crecimiento de las colonias hubiera sido un gran juego.
Poca gente hay como nosotros de enferma que son capaces de tirarse horas y horas pegadas al ordenador consiguiendo recursos. Lo que ahora prima es la rapidez, el pim pam pum y volver a empezar.
Este juego me relajaba muchisimo porque podia estar dando un paseo por Marte con ese gusanillo de ¿Se me acabará el oxigeno? ¿Tendre un accidente y no podre volver a la base?
En fin, una lastima por parte de B.I. que lo hayan dejado tirado.

Casi sería mejor que dejaran el codigo abierto y que las comunidades trabajaran en el.
O igual desarrollar algo nuevo con esta idea. 
Igual hay que desempolvar unreal engine. ¿Que opinais?



Anterior reseña:
"Es uno de los mejores simuladores que he probado y el único de este estilo. Tengo que decir que de como empezó a esta parte de la versión, se ha mejorado muchisimo. Sobre todo el multiplayer y el poder simular bastante bien el entorno marciano.
Esperemos que siga creciendo igual de bien."

author: {'steamid': '76561198019262544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1458399121}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028417630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1434343174}
review: Im a noob. So take this with a grain of salt.  I bought this based on the description and some reviews. WOW. What a mistake. I tried hard to like it.. then i tried to endure it. It was just too much to bear (bare?)  Do you like point and click adventures ... where you have  to grind while pointing and clicking? Would you like something like space engineers or kerbal without the.. well you know ability to build things, do things you want that arent prescribed.. or you know.. do anything but click on point a youre supposed to click on then b then c? This is the game for you. I'm disappointed in myself for falling for hype. I thought at LEAST you would be able to really explore our solar system based on actual data or at least the creators take on those place. Nope. Well you can land probes at predestined spot and see pictures of red sand or  whatever. yay. DO not buy this game . Dont feed ripoff artists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013980703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1519923531}
review:
There's just something so calm and satisfying about driving on the surface of Mars for hours. You do some science stuff in the space program, building custom landers and rovers and researching new technologies to unlock new parts for your vehicles. There are plenty of locations available that are fairly big, so you won't run out of Mars surface to drive on anytime soon. There are also several scenarios in the game, some which enable you to play as an astronaut on Mars (and even on the Moon and in orbit!) and built bases and drive around in big cool rovers. 

I only played 6 hours as of this review, but I can already see that there's plenty more fun to be had here! So if you like things that have something to with space exploration, this is a must have game for you, in my opinion. Also, if you read The Martian by Andy Weir and liked it, you'll probably love this game too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046766046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1644924476}
review:
Here are a few things I've noticed while playing Take On Mars:

-Airlocks and other doors are broken.  Airlocks are intended to permit passage between exterior and interior spaces without depressurizing the interior, as opposed to depressurizing everything BUT the space between the two airlock doors.  And regular interior doors have a chance of depressurizng everything as well, even if the pressure on either side is safe.

-Damage to space suits is global, rather than on a per-instance basis.  In other words, if you damage the legs on your medium suit, then take it off and put on a completely unused heavy suit, the legs of the heavy suit are also damaged.

-It's insanely easy to get stuck in geometry.  Attempting to get unstuck is also risky, as the physics engine loves throwing players around at high velocities.

-Things that look like they should fit together don't.  For example, the corners of airlock corridors have the same radius as regular curved walls, but refuse to be attached to anything but airlock passageways.

-The editor is both difficult to use and completely undocumented.  There's no indication that snapping is even a thing in the editor, making it impossible to construct a base outside of the scenario itself.

-Mouse acceleration is ridiculous and impossible to disable, meaning that a movement of the mouse as small as a few centimeters can sometimes rotate the camera completely around three or four times.  (Keep in mind I'm not talking about mouse lag, which is thankfully nonexistent, mouse speed, which can be changed using the incorrectly-named "mouse resolution" setting, or the "fluid camera" setting, which can be disabled.)

I do understand that this is a beta, and thus a number of the things I mentioned will probably be addressed before the game is officially released, but for now I have to give it a thumbs-down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081658006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3695, 'last_played': 1518382786}
review: 4/10 Dont buy this game......I bought this game the day it came out on early access a while ago...I was amazed at the potential this game had. Good graphics... Doing the manned career mode in coop with friends , Launching from earth then the trip to mars or the moon, Landing on Mars building an outpost, DOING SCIENCE of some sort...wondering the planet in a buggy looking for whatever I need to find. complete the mission and coming back to earth..This is what I was expecting from this game....Nothing of this is in there....Instead they put you in a completely unrealistic lander with a 3d printer that magically spawns resources that allows you to do shitty useless bunkers...and by useless, I mean it. During the development of the game, the devs almost never updated the status of the development of the game...doing patches every 3-4 months that added almost nothing at all. I never gave up hope until today when I saw that they were releasing the beta version....Are you kidding me? This is not even half the game it should have been....Another early access game   that took us for idiots....

author: {'steamid': '76561198202449582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2131, 'last_played': 1436044156}
review:
Take On Mars. 

Very large learning curve for the younger population. Would recommend to anyone that enjoys the idea of space exploration and building. The "Career Mode" is nice, but seems like things are given to you. I would rather have a more interactive time with the tests and scans. If you can get in a go multiplayer server with some friends it is quite fun. When you are in space you will walk slow and drive slow. It will take time to do anything and everything. So if you are looking for a quick paced game look else where.

-Mietlinski

author: {'steamid': '76561198096329324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1549830339}
review:
My health is low so I go to the bed to heal. I wake up in the wall and die.

10/10

Actual Review ________________________________________________________________

There are many bugs (such as waking up in the wall) and it crashes a lot, but it is early access so it's not like I should expect a lot. I see a great future for this game. 

Bugs
________________________________________________________________

If you are near a ceiling, jump and you will go through it.
If you are in the Mars ready room, you can get onto the coffee dispencer by jumping. Then if you jump through the ceiling, you can walk around on there and even jump off and fall to Mars (you actually fall through the surface because its still part of the ready room and you aren't even supposed to see outside really).

author: {'steamid': '76561198026181605', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 13677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8549, 'last_played': 1527447003}
review:
THIS IS A REVISED REVIEW - Where I have changed my rating from a Must Avoid to now ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND - Must Buy & Try.  Bohemia has made great progress with all the updates, and I'm playing it again after almost a year away.

I liked the concept of this game from the moment that I came across it in Early Access and bought it.  It's the kind of game that I wanted to like so much, and have played for enough hours to give it an honest chance.  As others have said, It is NOT intuitive.  So, you have to find your own way through it most of the time - but I don't fault it for that, and in fact kinda like figuring stuff out.  I'm a 'don't help me - let me figure it out on my own' guy anyway.  So now, the rest of the story...  

I break TKOM down into two categories:

1) Multi-Player - Let's be fair: Pass!  I didn't buy it for the multiplayer, and haven't ever launched that part once, so I'd refer you to other reviews for pros and cons on this part. Moving on...

2) Solo Play is divided into two sections: 

- First, the "Space Program", where I was immediately bored silly by launching an endless string of probes around the various craters on Mars, and completing photo recon, atmosphere & soil testing, etc.  I'm not knocking it!  It just didn't do it for me, y'know?!  That said, I never had any issues with it, and it was stable - so, the "Space Program" just wasn't my kind of game, but you may like it fine.  Snore.....zzzzzzzzzzzz XD

- Second, the "Scenarios" option.  This is the place where I spend my time.  In this mode you are on the surface and can harvest resources, build a base, and have free rein, and I now find this part absolutely fantastic.  The modding community is active with all sorts of new add-ons and new scenarios to try.  When it comes to base building, you have the original Outpost style that is fairly user friendly to build and looks really good.  But now, you also have a different style base option called Modular, and it opens up the ability to have more complex, multi-level bases.  With the original Outpost style, when you build a wall, floor, window, ceiling, whatever, it just requires lining up the one, single block and your DONE.  But, with the Modular base, OMG, for a single section of wall, you have three layers to build, exterior, interior, and a final finished skin for the interior.  Two things - a) personally I like the simplicity of the Outpost style, and much prefer the looks; b) The Modular can take hours to build a single room, even with the 3D printer right next to you and running non-stop.  It might be worth it to me if it looked better, but I thought it looked like a building from some Gulag prison colony on Mars xD.  That said, I'm sure it would go together in a snap in multi-player with a team working on it.  It's really just a matter of taste.

(BTW - My earlier review detailed the frequency of crashes every 30 minutes during gameplay, and happily, that is a thing of the past - I now find the game quite stable.  Another annoying quirk of earlier version was that when your character exited a bunk, chair, anything, after resting, he would seem to bounce around the cabin as if Zero G, until he died of his injuries LOL - This issue has resolved in newer versions).  

Also, in my initial (negative) review I DID SAY  that TKOM had phenomenal potential... and it has completely lived up to that, with all the great updates.  Good work Bohemia.  I would still like to see an auto-save feature built into the game, but manual saves work fine for now.

I hope some of you found this helpful. Cheers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136178696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1434546641}
review:
I saw this at the PC Gaming e3 2015, it looked good enough, nice multiplayer and all.
The few minutes I got to play one single game mode (the demo game mode....) I had a bit of fun, when creating my own server with friends?? nope, crashes, bugs etc..   A real shame since this game can be a lot of fun I reckon.

Multiplayer:
Crammed with bugs that makes this game unplayable for me.

-multiple errors on joining games, loading and saving games. (happens everytime, not just once in a while.
-multiple crashes that seem to be directed to the games texture files, fix?  'play the game on low textures' effectively making this game look worse than KSP.

-movement bugs, in confined spaces you sometimes 'bump' into 'stuff' immediately killing or cripling you.
-jump bug, you can get stuck in a the jump animation, making you get stuck in the air, not movable for about 10 seconds. this happens quite frequently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040367881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1433794662}
review:
I really wanted to like this game, but found the game was lacking, even for early access. The career mode has lots of missions, but so many of them are recycled. I would recommend the game if there would actually be a point in building. 

PROS:
 - Good potential
 - Physics worked much better than expected
 - It is fun, for a limited time.

CONS:
 - Structure building is a pain. Even after getting used to the awkward rotation, constantly running back and forth from the "3D Printer" to the place where the part had to be was annoying. The parts are also very VERY specific in how they have to be placed together. 

 - Carrer mode is a horrible grind, so many of the missions are recyled, and many of them simply involve watching a static drone. And by that, I mean literally watching the drone's camera feed as it crashes to Mars. Mission complete. Now do that 15 times. 

- Many of the Scenarios are fun, and have interesting objectives. The issue is that there is no reward of any kind for completion, nothing at all. It just feels pointless.

- For trying to be serious about Mars exploration, some of the features are ridiculous (weird vehicles). The game goes from trying to be really serious about realism, to being more fantasy.

- There's just no point yet. I understand that it's early access, but there is no goal of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069521582', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1433360460}
review:
Take on Mars could easily become one of my favorite games if Bohemia takes it in the right direction. Currently, the singleplayer guidence is severly lacking. It teaches you about the different rooms within the faciliy, goes over the map, and finally gives you the option of using game time or real time. Thats it. I didn't get too far into the singleplayer experience but I would assume that theres no lessons on what to do once you land someone on the surface.

(I do get that this is still being made)

Multiplayer and scenarios (?) are super fun when they go well, but terrible when they dont. Singleplayer scenarios never crash (unlike their multiplayer counterparts) but lack the entertainment that another person brings. Multiplayer crashes often but can be so so so much fun. The physics engine seems a little wonk, so exploiting it in the mobile lab or on top of the flying lander is just plain goofy. Base building may need an update, right now you have to put every single panel in place by your self. There are no templates unless you are editing a world. 

Overall, this game is worth the money if:
a) you have someone to play with
b) you are willing to be patient and wait for the bugs to be hammered out

author: {'steamid': '76561197994134930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 1107, 'last_played': 1710707895}
review:
edit:  I understand that this game is in early access/beta and the timetable provided by Bohemia is an estimate but given that these 2 months were supposed to be about fixing and tweaking features, im kinda assuming that all the known bugs posted on the forums will be dealt with.

EDIT 2: Clearing most negative comments i made - when it was purely a settings fault, a dev helped me and now everything is running as it should. 

I'd like to add for this game that its not only the Space Program that will be the main thing you do, the scenarios offer a nice variety of settings (and story in some/objectives) that are really enjoyable. 

this game will beat many in terms of innovation and features, gonna jump back into the Lyot scenario, where you start with oxygen for 2min at a crashsite ! enjoy if you're buying it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054205419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5603, 'last_played': 1535904942}
review:
Take on Mars ...

Faszinierende und dennoch beklemmende Atmosphäre, die von der Mars Simulation nahezu Perfekt vermittelt wird.
Einsam oder Gemeinsam versuchen zu Überleben, abhängig von Technik und deren funktionieren. Überlebenskampf ohne das andere dich bedrohen müssen und ohne die Anderen wird es sehr schnell, sehr hart für dich. 
Allein? Nie hat man es so gespürt, allein mit seinem Atem, allein mit seinem eigenen Herzschlag.


Take on Mars setzt für mich auf ein Wunderbares und selten angewendetes Prinzip, Multiplayer mal nicht Destruktive. Aufbausimulation bei der man nur Gemeinsam etwas erreichen kann. 
Tolle Grafik, stimmige Soundatmosphäre und echt geile Lichteffekte. 
Es ist noch eine Alpha-Version und ich freue mich schon jetzt auf die Beta, die ja bald erscheinen soll. 
Wenn man diesen Weg weiterbeschreitet, die Modding-Option mit in betracht zieht, ergeben sich hier völlig neue Spiel- und Erlebnismöglichkeiten. 

Für mich eines der Innovativsten Games ( Simulation ) der nächsten Jahre. Verglichen mit anderen Spielen ( Egoshooter ) die immer wieder nur das Gleiche im Neuen Gewand bieten, oder anderen Survival Games, bei denen es sich um Getarnte Egoshooter handelt, ist das Erlebnispaket hier mit einer großen Spieltiefe gekoppelt. 

Für mich : Ein Must Have Game

author: {'steamid': '76561197970336158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1432834824}
review:
I can not recommend it. From all I've read I've expected somewhat a sandbox game in which I build up a base on Mars. But all I see are single missions with pre-built bases or a really slow and tedious (and buggy) career mode in which you basically only press buttons to send probes to mars, drive around for hours (literally hours) to go to point A to click a button, drive to point B, click a button.... just to find out after 45 minutes driving, that the mission is bugged and you can't take pictures of the last two objectives. 

Woahhh, so much frustration with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001576739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1495423875}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060559557', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1616348421}
review: When I first bought this game a long time ago, everything seemed to work fine. All the maps work both Mulitplayer and Single Player. I never had any bugs or trouble with the game on my part then. But within the past year after all these updates both major and minor, little to nothing works anymore. I cannot play any of the scenarios. Even career mode no longer works for me. The maps will not load other than the ground templates. Any and all objects that are supposed to be on the maps WILL NOT spawn. I have tried everything from starting new saves, to removing workshop addons. I've even uninstalled the whole game and reinstalled it a few times now. Nothing has fixed the issues I'm having. Not sure if it was an update or something in my PC, but I cannot recommend this game when it doesn't even work anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107358521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1477826956}
review:
Exellent game overall. On one hand, in singleplayer, you get an in-depth space program managment sim and rover sim in singleplayer.
On the other you get an almost completly different but epic multiplayer where you build your base and strugle to survive on the Moon or Mars.
Exellent combo and is extremly fun to play alone or with friends.
Oh, and the game uses a different, better optimized engine than Arma 3, so you'll be getting better framerates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129655689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1432576443}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125021589', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1514944107}
review:
I haven't gotten very far (it takes time!) but this is one is a jewel from the start. Let me explain why:

Pros:
+Real time mode for hard cores
+Survival mode with time skip for easy cores
+No 3rd person only first for realism
+Not only mars, also Deimos, one of Mars' moons
+ Lots of areas with planned content
+ Multiplayer (Haven't tried it yet)
+ Science researching (Uses money and time instead of science like in kerbal [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/220200/] Kerbal Store Page[/url]
+user friendly science tree
+Useful community guides  !!!Please read them if you are a new player! Very helpful!!! 
+in game editor for scenarios with steam workshop compatibility
*May be other good things that I haven't reached yet or forgot*

Cons:
-less content then I'd like
-sending people to mars comes later, much later(unsure how much later)
-bugs like sky crane landing on rover and getting it stuck
-worry that devs will drop it
-unable to send rovers to mars unless a mission is there
-no "science sandbox" like kerbal [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/220200/]Kerbal Store Page [/url]


Good game with plenty of room for improvement. If you have the money for it, then I'd suggest this game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066297874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 9299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1424, 'last_played': 1583393366}
review:
--EARLY ACCESS REVIEW--

This is one of the more user friendly Bohemia interactive titles that I have found on the market. I was going to buy this when it first came out but i listened to that inner voice saying to wait for a while and see what happens. I am glad I waited until after the Manned Exploration was added. There is so much potential with this game, imagine your first task is get air to breath....oh crap I only have 1 hour and 15 mins of oxygen. It takes a few hours to get used to which parts go with each other but satisfaction is a guarantee when you have built your very first air lock so that you can recharge your air. 

I am now experimenting with the survival aspect of Take On Mars using the hydroponics lab to grow potatoes in my really odd freestanding base. 

This game even had me dreaming I was on the Moon and Mars jumping around building a base and lots of exploring. 

Get this game 4/5 stars

author: {'steamid': '76561198139431253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4220, 'last_played': 1652804648}
review:
Bohemia Interactive – невероятно творческая студия, которая предлагает амбициозные идеи и делится фантастическими планами, но, к сожалению, этим планам не суждено воплотиться в жизнь, так как, ни сил, ни возможностей, на реализацию своих идей у студии нет, исходя из чего, мы имеем целую массу недоделанных проектов, в которые все мы верили все эти годы и с нетерпением ждали. Take on Mars – как раз один из таких проектов.

Когда-то, некоторые из этих отчаянных ребят взялись за разработку симулятора, действия которого происходят за пределами Земли, где игроку предстояло выживать на Луне, Марсе, Европе, и других небесных телах нашей необъятной звёздной системы. Сеттинг интересный, но он не снискал народной любви, как тот же DayZ или Arma, в связи с чем, над проектом работала довольно небольшая команда на чистом энтузиазме. Как мы видим, их энтузиазма хватило ненадолго. 
Игра мертва, также, как и советская космическая программа – амбициозно, но не сбыточно.

Примерная дата релиза: День колонизации Марса.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157548684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1947, 'last_played': 1657143385}
review:
There are many reasons that I like this particular game.  The first and most important for me is that it takes place on a planet that I had an obsession from my early days (Yeah just like Douglas Quaid! )
  Although I was never a fan of simulation games, there is something in this title that makes me getting back at several times of the day. As I'm playing more and more I actually can't really consider it a simulation, but a slow paced adventure-driving game. In my head simulations are crazy difficult and too much complicated. Here things are simple - Press up and there you go - but it also has the depth with additions like upgrades and some kind of fun missions like photographing specific locations or even scooping and drilling.
  The mood and graphics are more than excellent and generally almost every aspect of the game it seems that has been worked with much love (+1).
  To be honest sometimes I wished It had some little surprises - just a tiny evidence of alien life (just a scrap) or maybe some caves (!) but I guess that's what mods are for..
  I'm really happy that this game exists and it is a great companion when I'm not in the mood for fast action stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970293231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1500801189}

I jumped, bumped my head on the ceiling... and died.
I opened a door and was crushed behind it... and died.
I tried to jump onto the back of a truck, slipped, rolled sideways down a hill, hit a rock...and died.
I took my helmet off to store it on the wall but mistakenly dropped it on the floor, it flew around the room like a cannonball eventually smashing open the airlock.... Everyone died.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091362894', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1534, 'last_played': 1431868470}
review:
Early Access Review.

I've currently got 24hrs+ on record of having played this. I haven't touched multiplayer and I probably won't either. The trailer looks really cool and it was that, that drew me to the game. Unfortunately after 24 hours of play I have yet to walk on mars. I am sat behind a desk sending probes, landers and rovers on missions. I'm going to be honest it's becoming dull. I thought the rover would add a little something extra, it does boredom. It moves so slow and you tend to have to travel hundreds of meters to your first point. Why? I don't know. the landing process is fairly surgical, so if it knows where I need to be stop putting the cross hundreds of meters away or put the missions on the landing map so I can choose where to land. i'm presuming more is yet to come but I repeat I have been playing this game for 24 hours. 

Please don't get me wrong. This game/simulator is very detailed and I appreciate the content. Unfortunately it's also becoming really boring. The best way I can sum up my thoughts on "Take on Mars" is... there's a note to say saved games may not be compatible with future updates. If I started it up and my saved game was incompatible. I would delete it and never play it again. I'm currently persevering through to hopefully get to the parts of the trailer that looked fun. If I had to play through 24 hours of mind numbing trundling across Mars. I would have to delete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184049570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1456819961}
review:
英語がすごい悩みのたねになりますがわかってくると楽しい！流れとしては、
ミッションをこなす→報酬のお金をもらう→新たなテクノロジーを研究する→新たなミッション
こんな感じでどんどん火星を調査するゲームです。
はじめはプローブという映像を写すものしか飛ばせませんし、
ミッションもプローブを飛ばすというものしかありませんが、研究を進めていくと
車のようなものもつくれるし、環境の調査などさまざまなことができます！
自分が宇宙開発に携わっている気分になれるそんなゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198026282482', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1443993762}
review:
Planetary exploration sim for egg heads. For as long as I can remember I have had a fascination with earths red neighbour. Since a child I have watched and read all about the various probes and landers sent to Mars.  Heard all the stories, myths and theories surrounding that place. It won't be long now when we will see a real possibility of a human stepping onto mars for the first time even if it will be a one way trip.  Take on Mars has really surprised me. I was expecting some kind of open world Mars exploration game but oh it is so much, much more than that. So far I haven't even set foot on the place. I am playing the campaign which means I start my journey right at the beginning with simple probes and black / white pictures.
In this mode you literally live through the history of exploration on Mars. Each successful mission earns you money which you can then plough into research to create more advanced exploration vehicles. As you advance it opens up ever more complex missions for your landers to complete. The lander camera view and the rugged Martian landscape really make you feel like you are in mission control.  There are a ton of other things you can do in Take on Mars including scenarios and multiplayer. For less than £10 this early release is a real diamond in the rough. Its fairly stable and very playable. The sounds and visuals that accompany you on your adventure add to the atmosphere.

Take on Mars is not going to be for everybody. Its certainly not fast paced and the only action will come in the form of technical disasters or your astronaut suit running out of oxygen. For me though it gives me a chance to do something I will never experience. Its a wonderful journey about what has been, what is now and what is coming in the near future.

I hope the developers keep putting their love into this title because if they do it will be a superb finished product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019995913', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1436536161}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049748617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1487094989}
review: Несмотря на некоторые недостатки раннего доступа(еще нет русского языка, не все в игре реализовано) игра затянула меня своей неповторимой атмосферой. Здесь нет чекпоинтов, бластеров, лазеров, монсторов - эта игра не про это. Тут есть отлично прорисованный марсианский ландшафт, сложные погодные условия, интересная кампания. За 22 сыграных часа игра меня затянула поуши. Рекомендую всем тем кто  любит космос, знает английский и не требует для себя экшна :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977985993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1501365200}
review:

Arma 2, Arma 3 war ne scheiß Engine habter hier etwa nix dazugelernt ? Hier solls ja ne ENFORCE Engine sein scheinbar ne andere wie bei den anderen Games aber dennoch Bitte Bohemia bekommt das in den Griff oder das war mein Leztes Spiel von euch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981973115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1487843982}
review: Just another of Bohemia's playground with 3rd-party engine, paid from customer's pockets. Development activity looks mostly like defibrillator's discharges on dead body. If you want to know how active development looks like - look at Space Engineers, or Kerbal Space Program. This will be abandoned half-way without declared dead, as they did with Take on Helicopters, Carrier Command and Arma Tactics. And when Arma 4 is out, they charge you for space combat DLC or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040493498', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 7067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6829, 'last_played': 1696042812}

my new review out of early access, its not good the updates are slow going, being there are so meny bugs the movemint is poor and so on, other than it i still think it has a chance it looks perfect the physics are epic. im so just wish thay would get ontop of optimization. at the momint i can't recomend it but your wellcome to try it out but be warned it may be buggy in afew places. my notion is wate it out alittle bit more. thay will get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069945693', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 6373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6289, 'last_played': 1614718366}
review:
I really enjoyed the game when it was in active development, the human exploration multiplayer had a really fun survival/resource management/base building gameplay loop.

Unfortunately, the game is no longer supported, it is rough around the edges, and multiplayer is dead. I wish I could leave a neutral review: I would not recommend it to the average, casual gamer, but if you're a fan of Mars and space exploration, it could be worth checking out.

I leave a positive review for nostalgia's sake. Good times were had by all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993755512', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7895, 'last_played': 1629955291}
review: OK first off, I love this game.. yes there are bugs, missing content ect, it is in Alpha right now. but by far this is the best sim I have found with space (Mars) building things ( I totally enjoy building thing ). survival, mining, building, thinking, if this is you then I would give it a shot. the first time i built a rover and landed it and took a soil sample.. the feeling you get is worth the bugs and glitches. I would say this is not for everyone because there is no combat, weapon crafting, PVP, PVE ect. but i think this game is more of a relaxed type sim, well unless your running out of O2 and there is nothing neer you to refill haha. <-- happends to me alot. but on the plus side of that my brother plays also and he jumps in the Mobile Lab and hauls butt to me so i can get to the airlock. ( tip: dont let you brother drive the MML with the rear lift gate down.. when he gets to you and you have 20 secinds of Air but there is no airlock door, well you take his suit and get to watch him sufocate. :) anyways A+ from me for this game, The Devs are really working hard to pull this together. I hope you enjoy it also

author: {'steamid': '76561198091077673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6326, 'last_played': 1614192592}
review:
Take on Mars é um dos poucos simuladores no mercado que é de qualidade.
Ele é um pouco estratégico tbm, no modo single vc tem que saber usar seu dinheiro para as missões, se gastar fica sem e vc não consegue ir em outras missões, pq vc depende delas pra faturar.

Ótimos gráficos

author: {'steamid': '76561198112621879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1708482814}
review:
Been playing this game on and off for a couple of years now and every time i pick it up again i have a hard time putting back down.
* constant updates (they may take a bit but they are there)
*AMAZING visuals!! no seriously even with the settings on low load up the low earth orbit senario and tell me its not breathtaking!
*Replayablity - No matter how many times you play the game there is always a different way to do the same thing you have already done 50 times 
*Bohemia.....Ok so this last bit is a little bias i have had a love love love relationship with bohemia since arma 2 and as far as im concerned this dev could do no wrong ( im expecting the usual comments about how wrong i am but just remember this is MY opinion!)

Final Score 100/100 with the updates constantly repairing bugs and adding new features the game is only going to get better so sit back and enjoy the ride to full release!

P.S. in the interest of fairness about 2 months ago i was having a constant crash every time i loaded victoria crater but with one of the many updates this bug seems to have been exterminated.

Thanks for reading-
The Grubb

author: {'steamid': '76561197986370677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 9359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7869, 'last_played': 1588710576}
review:
This is a revised review, after many patches.

The good:

- Many diverse game modes. And I do mean very diverse. 

- Decent modding support and capabilities.

- One of the few games that does give you that old "hard-SF" space vibe. Its a nerdy game abotu space, which feels very refreshign after 100s of "flashy" fiction games on the topiuc of space exploration.

- A decent survival game with resource extracting and base building etc, somewhat minecraft-style, but more rigid and more serious.

The bad:

- The game's physics engine is rough around the edges. When it works its great (does  aphenomenal job of simulating very low gravity on the moon for example). But at times you find yourself tripping over a cable in earth or mars gravity and the physics engine glitches and sends you flying 10 meters into the sky. These sort of physics glitches are annoying.

- Its a "take it slow" game, not everyone's cup of tea. This might appeal more to pleople who play simulator games than to those who prefer action games. Both the manned and unmanned parts of the game 

- Shady and inconsistent OS support, something I really need to complain about. When I purchased the game, the Bohemia Interactive site listed "Windows XP / Windows 7 / Vista" in the Reccomended settings.  Now on steam its just Windows 7 and Vista. XP support seems to have been silently dropped and I feel somewhat cheated, as I was not able to play the game for a long time until I upgraded my PC and got a new Windows.

- Some of the textures look a bit dated, though it has to be said that nice lighting and post-processing does a great job at covering this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002563552', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4626, 'last_played': 1480683242}
review:
Ich liebe das Setting und die Ideen . Es könnte ein großartiges Spiel werden ,wenn alles gefixed ist.Leider gibt es immer noch den stuck overflow error, der schon behoben wurde laut Devs.Das ist leider nicht so.Auch die Veränderung der Physik Werte bringt mehr ärger als fun.Da hätte man besser die alten Physik Einstellungen gelassen .Jetzt wird der Spieler recht oft beim bauen durch die Luft befördert anstatt das Bauteil zu plazieren.Die Roadmap werden sie niemals einhalten können wie geplant.Hier wäre eine Roadmap ohne Zeitdruck besser gewesen  .Es fehlen noch funktionale Probs für die Base und die Devs haben noch gut zu tun.Die Animation des Spielers ist grottenschlecht und das kurz vor der Beta.Bleibt nur zu hoffen das Bohemia die Roadmap noch einmal korrigiert oder den Zeitplan ganz über Board wirft.Dayz Spieler können ein Lied singen von den tempo Bohemias.Ich bin gerne berreit meine momentane Meinung zu ändern, sollten die Devs das Spiel in eine fast Fehler freie Version bringen.Es fühlt sich leider noch an wie frühe Alpha und nicht wie kurz vor Betastatus.

Fazit:  Im momentanen Zustand nur für Hardcore Fans .Alle anderen sollten warten bis das Spiel  fertig gestellt ist und sich dann eine Meinung bilden .

author: {'steamid': '76561197994568257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4269, 'last_played': 1576694514}
review:
I recommend this game for anyone who loves a good simulation like myself. You're going to hobble around with a little rover at .5 m/s doing various scientific sub missions so you can slowly afford to build and launch larger landers and rovers with better instrumentation.

Development does face a lot of small delays at the moment. Though so far in my experience, the dev team is very up front about the reasons as to why, no behind the scenes stuff and that's something I appreciate. If they need extra time for a completely legit reason, that's fine by me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045774472', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 5022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1540142261}
review:
I have been playing this one on and off since the game first appeared on on early access. I really enjoyed the early stages but it there were a few bits that made it not quite right. But of course, it's early access. However I have to say that I have recently got back into the game and it has changed almost beyond recognition. The latest addition of multi player has added so much more to the game. I am sure other developers would have been tempted to release this as at the very least a paid for DLC.

It is still early access, the plan is full release in June, (I am writing this in Aril), and I think that all that needs to be done is a bit of polishing to make it a great game. That said, the way the game has developed in the recent months leads me to believe that there will be a lot more than just a bit of polish.

There are no aliens to try to kill or avoid, you need to eat, so you grow your own food; you can't do this till you have soil and water.; you can't get this till you have the right machines..... Oh, and your suit does not hold much oxygen. Run out at your peril!

One thing I would say, the controls are a bit hard to get to grips with. Rotating stuff to get it to line up has taken me ages!

I love the vehicles available and the workshop integration is great with some really interesting stuff appearing.

In the space program side of the game you can choose to run in real time or game time. Real time, as the name suggests, runs at the right rate and so when you are told 45 hours to research the next bit of kit you need you have to wait 45 hours. Perfect time to drop to multi player for a bit I think :-) With game time you can advance time so you can play as quickly as you want. You need to develop probes, landers and rovers to map Mars and test soil, rocks and atmosphere. 

I must find Beagle-2 and give it a nudge to see if I can get it to start up :-)

So, yes I do most definitely recommend the game, it is great value, the devs are fantastic and all in all this is what early access should be like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997856804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1430835580}
review:
With recent updates the developers have started to improve the game experience, which has increased playability considerably.

There's still a ways to go but given the recent trend I'm happily switching my recommendation to "definitely buy".

If you have any interest in Mars exploration and video games, you'll love this title. You'll love even more what it might someday be. Launching your first probe with it's crappy camera and knowing that there's a whole world ready to be explored is an amazing experience. As you build up your technology and start seeing the Martian world in all it's glory, exploring it's nooks and crannies with your rovers... you'll get lost in the ambiance of the game.

With that said, there's so much more that this game can be; it's my fond hope that over time the depth of exploration available in the game grows to match it's potential. Regardless, with the recent trend of updates focussing on making the game good (not just feature rich) I am sure it will be one that I come back to for years to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988105913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1483680578}
review:
Lots of potential but I can't recommend it yet. I know its early access, but I'll change this review as soon as it advances enough for me to recommend it.

It's clunky, and its boring. I love realistic space games (KSP, Orbiter) and I understand slow-paced methodical gameplay, but this is different - its boredom without any real satisfaction or feeling of reward. The system for managing resources is INCREDIBLY tedious, and topped off with controls that can best be described as "butterfingers". Also the design for the lander and some of the vehicles are very unergonomic and kill the 'realistic mars mission' vibe for me. However, the design of the 'truck' rover and the scout rover are excellent. The 'campaign' if you will is more polished, but the waypoint system is very confusing and it is still for the most part unrewarding and just not fun. The game is very atmoshperic though - especially the dust storms. The camera effects are a nice touch, it feels very real and is remarkably well done.

So overall, a lot of potential, but don't buy it yet. Its too clunky and boring, but hopefully that will change before its final release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049379247', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2929, 'last_played': 1578788642}
review:
Here's a slightly biased review by a space nerd:

Take on Mars is the most beautiful space simulation game I know. The available locations are created from real-life satellite data and look stunning from every perspective. 

In Take on Mars you can build and control everything from landers, to rovers and even the "Zero-G Probe" that you can fly around Deimos and the asteroid belt (great fun by the way!). 

Also, you can play the game in either "game time" mode which allows you to fast forward time when necessary (e.g. to speed up research or wait for better martian weather) or you play in "real time" mode where you will have to wait in real life. 

You also get a variety of realistic science instruments to put on your vehicles and after you are done with your main mission you can keep doing randomly generated side-missions that suit your vehicle.
The rovers are the center part of the game and your rovers progress similarly to the real rovers: Your small rover is similar to the "Pathfinder" or "Sojourner" rover, the medium rover looks more like the "Spirit" and "Opportunity" rovers and your king of all rovers, the large one is close to the "Curiosity" rover.

Also they are working on a multiplayer build that allows you to build bases on mars and moon with your friends!

All in all I am really happy I bought this game and especially people who are interested in space exploration and simulation will like this game. However, you will have to show some patience at times because especially rover missions can be time consuming.

In short here are the pros and cons I can think of:

Pros:
+really, really beautiful visuals and incredibly detailed landscape
+realistic terrain, real sites on mars
+procedurally and randomly generated side missions
+campaign mode including tech tree and budget
+editable scenario missions
+explore Mars' moon Deimos and the asteroid belt as well
+weather changes, you can get into dust storms
+multiplayer is in the works

Cons:
-You will need a lot of patience at times
-might experience bugs at this point


Early Access Note: The game can be played very well at this stage, bugs only occurr rarely. It is resource-intensive though so you need a good computer to run it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077500909', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 35685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4703, 'last_played': 1654518551}
review:
Take on Mars ([b]Achtung:*early access*[/b]) war ursprünglich ein reiner Simulator, 
der einem die Arbeit in einem Weltraum-Forschungszentrum ähnlich der NASA nahebringt.
Man konstruiert Raumsonden, die anfangs nur einfache Kameras an Bord haben und erforscht mit einem spärlichen Budget neue Techniken.
Trotz der nett gemeinten Hilfevideos(englisch) war mir die Steuerung zu kompliziert.
Die ferngesteuerten Rover-Fahrzeuge(im späteren Spielverlauf) haben sogar verschiedene Tasten für Bewegung, Roboterarm, .. 
Möglicherweise kann man die Steuerung auch auf Joysticks legen, ich habe mir aber nicht die Zeit genommen, das auszuprobieren und bin somit rein mit Tastatur/Maus unterwegs gewesen.

Grafisch wirkt das Spiel sehr ansprechend, die Simulation ist mir aber etwas ZU genau.
Man muss sich schon die Zeit nehmen um in das Spiel eintauchen zu können, denn es hat SEHR viel Potential.

[b]Der zweite "Teil"[/b] des Spieles(Manned Scenarios) erweitert das Spielerlebnis um die Steuerung eines Astronauten in Ego-Perspektive.
Momentan kann man den Mond, den Mars und irgendeinen kleinen Asteroiden besuchen.
Mit einem 3D-Drucker kann man sich Bauteile für Stationen und sogar Fahrzeuge herstellen.
TIPPs:
[i]"Q" wechselt von normal auf den Bau/Platzierungsmodus
"R" gedrückt halten und Mausbewegungen rotieren gehaltene Objekte
R+ALT gedrückt halten und Mausbewegungen rotieren gehaltene Objekte(andere Achse)[/i]

Während dieser "early access" benötigt der Drucker noch KEINE Rohstoffe.
Spezielle Vorrichtungen können bereits z.B. Gestein aus dem Boden holen bzw. Gase aus der Atmosphäre extrahieren(Mars). 
Bis man verstanden hat, das diese Geräte Kartuschen benötigen und wie man die richtig einsetzt vergeht schon einige Zeit -.-
Die Möglichkeiten Rohstoffe mit den Raffinerien auf molekularer Ebene zu trennen sind erstaunlich:
[list]
[*]eine Kartusche Marssand = Eisen, Wasser und Silizium
[*]eine Kartusche Wasser = 2xWasserstoff + Sauerstoff
[*]eine Kartusche Kohlendioxid = Kohlenstoff + 2xSauerstoff
[/list]
Die "Staubsaugerdinger" auf dem Mars können der Atmosphäre Kohlendioxid, Stickstoff, Argon?! und geringe Teile Sauerstoff entziehen .. aber nur, wenn man schnell genug ist, alle 5 "Zielkartuschen" einzusetzen.. bevor die ersten Kartuschen voll sind mit "nur" Kohlendioxid..

Manchmal treten seltsame [b]Bugs[/b] auf(development Version):
[list]
[*]Positionierungsraketen der Landekapsel zünden plötzlich und das Ding torkelt endlos über den Mondboden,
blöd wenn das Lazarett dadurch unerreichbar wird!
[*]Sauerstoffnachfüllung klappt einmal, dann wieder nicht. Erst durch Neuladen gehts dann wieder (oder auch nicht)
[*]Im Inventar klicken(M) kann das Spiel abstürzen lassen
[*]Einige Mods funktionieren nach Updates nicht richtig(Helme fallen plötzlich auf den Boden..)
[*]Fahrzeug/Raumanzuglichter können nicht mehr eingeschaltet werden
[*]In der dev-Version gibt es endlich auch Schalttafeln für den verd.. Aufzug
(Nicht dev-Version: Aufzug benutzen: "M" drücken. Natürlich poppt dann das Inventar auf -.-)
[*]Zu große (5x5) Basen können nicht zuende gebaut werden, da beim Platzieren eines Bauteils ein Pointer "überläuft"
Ist eine 3x3 Basis komplett "dicht" gebaut kann man durch Luftschleusen getrennt scheinbar weiter bauen.
[*]Spielstände können NICHT immer geladen werden..
[*]In einigen Szenarios fehlen sowohl der Forschungsrover(Lazarett!) als auch die Raumkapsel(Lazarett!)
[*]Selten traten Abstürze beim SPEICHERN auf. Blöd wenn man einen Spielstand überschreiben wollte..
[/list]

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Nochmals: Ich habe mich NUR mit den "manned missions" beschäftigt, also NICHT mit dem eigentlichen Zweck des Spieles(Forschung und Entwicklung von Raumsonden).

Das es sich eine "early access" Version handelt merkt man dem Spiel kaum an.
Das große Ganze funktioniert überraschend gut, wären da nicht die Ungereimtheiten bezüglich des Basenbaus und vor allem der häufig defekten Spielstände..
Für eine kleine Basis (3x3) braucht man schon gute 2 Stunden Spielzeit und wenn das dann alles weg ist, weil der Spielstand defekt ist..

Das Project schreitet laaangsam voran. Angekündigt wurden Neuerungen wie Pflanzenanbau und endlich auch die Notwendigkeit Rohstoffe in den 3D-Drucker "schütten" zu müssen.
Ich kann es kaum erwarten

author: {'steamid': '76561198025109788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1425764323}
review:
Initial thoughts/review are only after two hours of gameplay - but I will come back to comment more in-depth as I get deeper into the available content.

I never buy an Early Access title without following it for awhile first, to feel it out, and get some sense of dev/community interaction. This is no exception. 

Let's start here - for what they are charging for Early Access, I was pleasantly surprised.  It feels clean, well-executed, and rather than feeling overtly incomplete, rife with "ragged edges", it's actually pretty tidy in terms of how playable it is "right now", and how features that aren't yet ready are addressed, such as the presence of the blue "Early Access" icon that you'll occasionally see as you work thru the UI.

Granted - while that statement in and of itself doesn't speak to the quality of the final product, what it does speak to, for me, is that of a team that cares about the Early Access users' experience along the way; consideration of the ongoing relationship between developers and players -  equivalent of that waiter that stops by your table to acknowledge you - even if they can't take your order just in that moment.

In short - it's a nice touch that it would be addressed at all in this manner, and I hope this continues as the title matures and all features become available.  

Other thoughts:

This game won't be for everyone; it's methodical, a "quiet" game, a game for fans of astronomy/exploration, no doubt -and encompassing elements of building, strategy and simulation. Along the way, for those so inclined, there's plenty of science trivia. 

I see it as casual, but with purpose and intent, and good in that you can pick it up for hours, or minutes, with the option to "bend time" as needed if you want (or need) to move things along.  

I like how the UI manages to be fairly straightforward/intuitive - you can pretty much dive in and figure things out very quickly,  and yet what lies ahead clearly points to indepth gameplay/strategy; it's easy to get into it, but you immediately realise - this is not going to "stay" quite so easy as you progress through the research tree - and your available budget.

Speaking of that - the big budget your team have been granted isn't as much money as it may seem - don't spend too much, too soon.   The research-based "talent" trees cover everything from soil analysis and robotics to power management, but consider where you invest first, and how much, as you gradually build up funding for the various probes, instruments, protective elements and such that have to be added, tested, paid for, and successfully implemented - and once you do go for launch, don't assume everything will go to plan.   Fragile, precise, expensive instruments...limited budget - now let's throw in some insane Martian winds? Hey, what could go wrong?

 (...insert a little nod to Kerbal here).

From the initial rough probe that bobs around helplessly on the surface like a lost bowling pin, there's a long road ahead of you to get from aforementioned bowling pin to footprints on the surface of the Red Planet.

That's the ideal formula for me, anyway - in terms of time, and in terms of learning curves - accessible, but challenging - casual, but with clear directives.


I think it's one of the fairer-priced titles in Early Access - fair and modest for what I think is a promising title, especially when I consider what I've seen for far higher prices on Steam.

I hope to loop back to this review once I've logged more hours, and I hope to add equally positive comments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007268219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1578515350}

Obwohl es Early Access ist füllt es sich trotzdem wie ein AAA Game an und man kann jetzt schon erahnen was hier möglich ist und sein wird. SUPER / TOLL / EINZIGARTIG  
Bilde Dir Deine eigene Meinung ...  :D
