author: {'steamid': '76561198030746818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4970, 'last_played': 1606502038}
review:
Great game, if you ever wanted to send rovers and probes to Mars (and Deimos), do scientific experiments and exploration there.
Graphics are immersive, physics realistic and parts of your rovers/probes may get damaged ... not only if you mishandle them, but also due to the sometimes violent martian weather.
Likewise, the experiments featured are all experiments that also are part of the real Mars rovers (like Curiosity).

They just took some deviations from reality with regards to the voyage to Mars (which is immediately ... no long space travel required) and with regards to research times 8which is measured in hours instead of years).

Also, you are able to steer the rover in real time ... with no delay between sender and receiver (as it would be in reality) ... the latter one is taken care of however, as they are currently developing a game mode, where you have to give your rover a batch of commands (like, turn around 30 degs, move forward, use RAD-Sensor and so on) which the rover / probe then executes ... even if it may result in its damaging or destruction.

Definitely a game I would recommend ... it is good now and it is getting even better

author: {'steamid': '76561198074448959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1855, 'last_played': 1447167120}
review:
В игре вы управляете зондом или марсоходом в режиме реального времени (В отличие от реальной жизни, где спускаемые аппараты запрограммированы и в чрезвычайной ситуации они автоматически входят в безопасный режим). Игра не только об изучении Марса, но и его лун и астероидов. Вы также можете испытать ровер на Земле.

Цели разнообразием не отличаются (ездить там, фотографировать, анализировать воздух, почву, камни, брать образцы чтобы получить средства и разблокировать следующие уровни имеющегося оборудования для спускаемых аппаратов). На Марсе не полихачишь, можно с легкостью сломать оборудование или колеса (и потерять на этом кучу денег), а еще вас может сдуть, если погода не важная. 

Игра находится в активной разработке, так что могут кое что подправить, и должно выйти довольно не плохо.

В общем, если у вас есть куча свободного времени и любовь к космосу (или нечем заняться) то игра для вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041798828', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1406487491}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116786626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1388092388}
review:
Take on Mars: The Real Mars Simulator...
Yes the first thing that comes to mind when I play Take on Mars is Gran Turismo. The game is very realistic and beautifully presented. However just like Gran Turismo it does get a little repetitive after a while.
The game is very well made. It is highly informative and gives you a good sense of experience in controlling a unmanned mission to Mars.
When I played it for the first time I found it difficult to understand. But after couple of hours of clicking to find the right screens I began to understand the idea of the game. This does make the main game difficult to play. There is a tutorial which you will need to read. Also researching technology in the game is not clear and difficult to understand. I hope in time that they will fix this. In the mean time you will need to explore the game itself as well as the planet Mars to understand how it works. If you do lose patients with the main game there are many single missions which will keep you occupied. They are all great fun and very informative. If you enjoy exploring then this is the game for you. You will visit actual locations on Mars, using actual scientific equipment to unlock the knowledge and mysteries of the big red planet.
Depending on your graphics card the detail is amazing. When exploring Mars you do feel very alone on this vast world. The highly detailed graphics and sound effects create a atmosphere which leaves you very isolated in the game.
The controls are awkward but I believe that was on purpose to add to the realism of controlling a remote control vehicle across space.

I do recommend this game but you will need to be a little patient at times on how to play it. The game is still in it early stages and the potential for this game is vast. I am personally hoping they add sci-fi missions like a manned mission to Mars or first contact with martians. At time of this review being submitted the developers are currently very active in listening to the players and improving the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024995967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1451300246}
review:
Absolutely incredible game... but also not for everyone.

This is basically a highly realistic space simulator. The amount of detail and attention to realism is fantastic, making it really feel like you are controlling a rover on Mars. You visit actual locations on Mars, use actual scientific equipment to learn actual things about the geology of Mars. There is even an (optional) way to sync the game with the actual time on Mars, so you need to actually schedule your day around the 24.75 hour Martian day (like they do at JPL). Future versions will even include an (optional) light delay between sending and receiving commands.

No explosions, no aliens, no "story" other than building a successful Mars exploration program. There are countless games out there to provide your fix of those things. This game is different, and that is why i absolutly love it. 

The gameplay IS quite repetitive, but one again so is the real deal. Drive a bit, analyse some soil. Drive some more, analyze a rock. None the less I find this very relaxing and engrossing, a nice way to unwind. Also, with Modding, there's no reason you can't break from realism and begin a long cruise around martian sand dunes in a dune-buggy while blasting "Road Trip" music from iiTunes/WinAmp/whatever.

If you are fascinated by Mars, like to keep track of what Curiosity is up to, would like to visit mars, and think it would be fun to drive a rover really slowly and drill holes into rocks (aka the real deal)... then you will like this game.

Simply Put: The closest most of us will come to visiting Mars.

P.S. The game is in Beta/Early access as of this writing, so for all i know in the future they may give you more freedom on what you can do, or include sci-fi ideas like a manned mission.

P.P.S. Regarding some negative reviews here - keep in mind it is in Beta. Some of the things being complained about here are almost certainly going to be fixed or changed in time. If those reviews  scare you away from buying it, check back when it is completed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993661434', 'num_games_owned': 7096, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1453655465}
review:
Take on Mars is possibly one of the most unique concepts to hit the steam store in a while. It's a game, of sorts, but more than that, it's a tool for learning and understanding the challenges inherent in exploring a planet far removed from our own, as well as providing a toolbox to this end. A very well thought out toolbox at that, which includes a tech tree (recently added), Multiple survey sites, and even now includes Deimos. 

You are placed in charge of the Mars Space Exploration Agency, provided a budget to build, launch and research landers, and rovers, and tasked with exploring and analysing scitentific points of interest. Completing these objectives nets you further funding. The game part comes from balancing the needs of developing technology and launching appropriate craft to the right sites. 

Funding -is- tight here, so it's very easy to box yourself in on the first few tries whilst you get the hang of how it all works. For that reason I really, really advise that you read the tutorials, go and do a bit of research on the web, and study the tech tree. Work out what you need to build, and apply an objective based approach to proceedings. This is not a game for anyone who isn't extremely patient and willing to invest in a concept which as an open ended project, is very different from pretty much anything that's come before.

As a niche product though, it should be applauded, because Bohemia has created a genuinely unique experience, one that if you've the time, the will and the inclination, provides a richly rewarding and deep journey, digging into the historical background of the Red Planet, and mixing a subtle element of managing your technology whilst exploring and unearthing secrets as you go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976312757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1410275101}
review: This game has alot of promise and I'm enjoying it quite a bit. Some things need more accessible tutorials in it and more player control but it's great fun so far. (Early Access at time of writing this review). If you are in to unmanned space missions and wish that you could drive rovers around on the surface of Mars to perform science experiments, then this game does a great job of fulfilling your dreams of working for NASA. With the potential that I see in this game, I give it 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037890749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1399824554}
review:
This game is strange, if you love space, or more specifically, love Mars than you will love this game. You take on the role as a space organisation mission director, you choose which crafts are launched and assign them tasks which you have to do. (Atmospheric readings/ photographing crater rims/ taking surface samples.)

On the face of it this game is incredibly boring, driving a rover isn't the most fun, especially when it goes at around .2m/s! The game gets a lot more fun and satisfying with the pay-off, finally taking that photograph or completing the assigned objectives is such a nice feeling, I just can't put it in words.

You can also take control of the lander, controlling it's decent however this is incredibly difficult and best to do with a joystick which has had it's ratio of steering changed in the settings because turning how you think you would turn will almost certainly flip it over and smash it into the ground, often costing you 1000s of M$ from your space program, when I first done it it resulted in my space program's bankruptcy.


I can't give this game too low of a score as it is still in development so please take that into consideration before purchasing this game.


9/10, it does what it says on the tin and it does it well.


> I've noticed little to no bugs
> Great fun for someone who loves astronomy


The reason it is not a 10 is due to some minor issues which are not really worth mentioning.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983029161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1441739496}
review:
Mars luotaimia, mönkijöitä ja pelaajien tekemiä kulkuneuvoja mielenkiintoisessa simulaattoriympäristössä. Ne jotka hakevat vauhtia ja vaarallisia tilanteita, välttäkää tätä. Kun taas ne muut jotka jaksavat keskittyä verkkaiseen tekemiseen Marsin ympäristössä, pelatkaa.
Ideana on suorittaa aluksi pieniä luotaintehtäviä valokuvauksesta erilaisten ilmakehämittausten tekemiseen. Mitä enemmän tehtäviä tekee, sitä paremmin saa rahaa ja sitä kautta saa kehitettyä uutta teknologiaa uusien luotaimien ja mönkijöiden rakentamiseen. Kun teknologiaa on tarpeeksi, voi käyttää joko valmiiksi rakennettuja laitteita tai suunnitella oman Mars tutkimuslaitteen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050329361', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1484547595}
review:
Ein Spiel, dessen Realismus schon dem Gameplay schadet. Für den Preis, der bereits zu diesem Zeitpunkt des Spiels verlangt wird, kann ich es direkt erstmal niemanden empfehlen. Das Spiel hat viele sehr schwerwiegende Bugs. Auch die Entwicklung des Spiels scheint nicht mehr wirklich voran zu schreiten.
So gibt es offensichtliche Bugs, die schon seit Monaten vorhanden sind. Gemacht wird allerdings nichts.
Es gibt ein Tutorial-System, welches aus kleinen Videos besteht. Leider ist es zu vielen Zeitpunkten nicht möglich, den Start-Button eines Videos zu klicken. Das Spiel erklärt sich wenig von selbst. Man wird auch nicht in die Steuerung eingewiesen. Soll heißen, man muss sich vor Spielen die Controls einmal anschauen, um zu sehen, was man alles für Möglichkeiten der Steuerung besitzt. Bisher würde ich für das Spiel 6€ bezahlen und hoffe ich werde in Zukunft noch mit einigen Gameplay-Elementen und Bugfixes von den Entwicklern entlohnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992120085', 'num_games_owned': 5258, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3481, 'last_played': 1473098931}
review:
It's your own Mars (and asteroid belt) Exploration Program simulator.

In the game you control probes or rovers in real time (unlike in real life, where their control sequences are preprogrammed, and in emergency they are automatically put in a safe mode). It isn't only about exploring Mars, but also its moons and asteroids. You can also operate rover on Earth.

The objectives are quite repetitive (ride there, shoot photos, analyze air, soil, rocks, take a sample, all this to get funds and unlock next levels of available hardware which you will send to Mars next), but it isn't a boring game. You need to be careful to not break the equipment (or wheels), and watch out for strong wind, as small rovers and probes are quite light and fragile. It's currently in active development, so some things may still change and a new content (like sample analyze results currently having a placeholder) will be added.

It's a great game for space geeks, people who like realistic vehicle simulators, and other people who want to view Mars from rover's perspective.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970799285', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1464130448}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053879696', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1379162087}
review:
まさかの火星探査シミュレーション。
大気を採取したり、岩石を削り取ってみたり、写真を撮ったりする。
しかも割りと本気で作っていて、感心する。

ミッションをこなしていって科学技術の発展に貢献し、
探査機をちょっといいパーツに換装して火星での職務に殉じましょう。
広大なクレーターのほか、変わらない景色と孤独があなたを待っています。

シミュレーターが好きでなければお勧めはできないけれど、
一度は火星探査の雰囲気を体験してみてもらいたい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198021317470', 'num_games_owned': 1847, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1377182055}
review:
火星を探査機で、ミッションをこなしながら探索する
火星探索シュミレーションゲーム。

最大の難関はマニュアルでの探査機着陸。
何度挑戦しても軌道がずれ見事に探査機が木っ端微塵になります。
でも安心して下さい。オートメーション化された着陸モードに切り替えれば
誰でも簡単に着陸できます。
不親切・同じ景色・探査機が本気でとろくさい・ゲーム内の音楽は風の通る音のみ。
この4重奏で貴方も立派なサイエンティスト。

おじさんスコア　64/100
コスパ満足度　49/100

author: {'steamid': '76561197972439845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1445761807}
review: This is a hard game to recommend to everyone. If you are a fan of simulators, especially Kerbal Space Program, Orbiter, Lunar Flight, or Moonbase Alpha, then I would definately recommend this title. It is still in alpha and very rough around the edges, but for the price it will supply an adequate amount of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064477060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1440664126}
review: It's interesting :] I really like how they gave you the option to use real life time, which means even if you're not playing this game, it's still passing through time. The settings are detailed. You can use an editor and edit the planets (I think I haven't checked it out yet, but it looks like it's planned to be used that way). There is also an addon menu, so yes addons will be available :)! The game will be very confusing if you don't read the instructions..So..READ THEM!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965885735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1510516915}
review:
This is a great simulation game for all science/engineering enthusiasts. Don't expect it to be an action loaded, entertaining game like an FPS. It focuses more on exploration tasks and is based on real NASA rover missions which are currently in progress (e.g. "Curiosity" and "Opportunity").

Consider that this game is still in alpha/beta development and therefore you'll find bugs and unfinished stuff. A big advantage of this game is the moddability which offers a huge potential. Think about what can be done with this in future...

That's exactly the reason why I would also like to recommend this to all modders. You really should create some awesome mods with it! ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997410107', 'num_games_owned': 1680, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1554550348}
review:
Je pense que le jeu est déjà intéressant, je ne veux pas spoiler le début, mais on ne joue pas tranquilou dans un fauteuil.

 Le potentiel est à mon avis énorme.
 C'est pas pour tout le monde, enfin je ne sais pas.
 Pour apprécier, il faut aimer les jeux qui allient le contemplatif et les actions "techniques" précises : si vous aimez Kerbal SP ou Orbiter, allez-y les yeux fermés.
 
 Dans une moindre mesure, les jeux où on dirige un sous-marin ou un navire (ou un avion ! style FS) avec un minimum de sérieux sont une bonne indication de l'intérêt que vous y porterez : inertie, lecture des instruments et des vues, manoeuvre, précision, prise de risque minimisée.

 Je viens de monter une roue sur un caillou sans le vouloir : chaleur !
 Et puis voir dans la caméra que le rover laisse des traces sur le sol, ça fait des choses ..

author: {'steamid': '76561197972840341', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 8982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1510968430}
review: As early in the piece as it is, I have to say this game has lots of potential. I say game, as much as Farm Simulator is a game as well. They pretty much share the same mantle of sandbox exploration and techincal process to achieve simple goals. No shooting anything but rocks, and expansive, visually sutunning landscapes to drink in.  If you're a fanboi of space exploration (the real kind, without the frickin' laser beams -  strike that. It DOES have laser beams) then this is pobably what you've been missing in your life. And BIS do some good games. The Arma series is still very popular, due to their encouragment of the modding community. And ToM is no exception. It's early access, so you can still have some input, and it's cheap. If you like Kerbal Space Program and looking to release your inner Planetary Scientist, then I recommend you pick up this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076221250', 'num_games_owned': 1384, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1395879039}
review: Only 1 day after release (and 1 day since I bought it), I can say that this is a brilliant game, especially for us that are interested in this sort of thing :p. Now I wonder if they've hidden any Easter eggs in this...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972135446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1451093587}
review:
Literally every rover that this game has landed on Mars has had one broken wheel. One.

I was doing good with my space program too, having lots of spacebux and whatnot, until I flipped a rover due to one of the stupid fucking instruments needing to be in contact with a space rock, but really can't decide if it is REALLY touching said rock or not.

The next rover was on decent when the landing stage literally flipped over for 0 reason and cratered into the ground. The airbags didn't do dick.

Wait, who made this? Bohemia Interactive?! hahaahahah that explains everything

Play KSP instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978061641', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1392402258}
review: Small bit of play time so far. Seems like a slow paced game, not for people after quick action based games. Would like a bit more control over some things (on the rails landings feel a bit meh) I'm presuming that this could be a great educational game in the future. Only time will tell.
